Name: Antro Nightclub
Address: 4346 W Glendale Ave, Glendale, AZ 85301, USA
Address Components: 4346 (street_number); West Glendale Avenue (route); Glendale (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85301 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Not the biggest club out there, but the atmosphere is 🔥👍🏼. The music is good, the club is clean, the owner runs it well, and the women are gorgeous! I met the owner and he is so humble and nice. If u want to have a good time this is the place!🍾🍾; The place has serious potential! But it's coming up short still.

1- get an up to date web site with weekly updates.
2- commit to music nights. 2 different music genre's max per night(that compliment each other) . With updates on the website as to what night is what music.
3- turn the lights down more on the dance floor.

Those 3 are free. And will immediately impact business for the good. If you want more you need to hire me as a consultant. My resume is impeccable. I can turn your place into a multi million dollar establishment.

I've been there recently and I gotta say.... Your can do much much better. Contact me.; The club seems a little run down in some places but the vibe is definitely right. They had great music playing all night long and it was a variety of different genres. But the thing that really put them over the top to me and why I gave a 5 star rating is simply because of water bottles. I asked for water and got a bottle at no charge. The places I usually go to always want to charge for bottles and give cups out for free. So the fact that I got a water bottle truly had my mind blown. Definitely worth a trip or two.; Worst club I've ever been to! Way too many ugly people, too many lights it was bright inside on the dance floor making it uncomfortable and weird to dance near anyone. VIP didn't even come with a bottle
Nor did not cover entrance fee. You pay $100~$200 for a table only. Spilled drinks every where! Dirty floors! I agree they do have corrupt security staff. I Witnessed three different times when the security belittled three different customers. Even grabbing a female aggressively without any type of struggle on her side as they drag her outside. The music sucks, it was very humid and hot inside. I would not recommend this place to anyone.; Honestly it's a pretty lit place. Great music & drinks. Had a great time with my girls. The only bad thing I can say is that there was nothing but ugly ass guys, so ladies don't go expecting to find a prince charming. 😂😂😂 oh and also $10 CASH to get in....even ladies smhhhh.

Name: Club Luxx
Address: 136 E Washington St, Phoenix, AZ 85004, USA
Address Components: 136 (street_number); East Washington Street (route); Central City (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85004 (postal_code); 2341 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews: Shady ass bouncer. If you can't trust security, you can't trust your safety in a place. I asked for a VIP cover to skip the line. $20/person. Fine, done. He seemed surprised I agreed...  Then waited until after I gave him cash to mention there's an additional cover to get past the door. Seriously dude, why not do some basic math & be straight with me? Whatever... $5/person he says... No big deal. Get to the door cashier. $10/person she tells me. I explain. She says they're separate covers & it's $10/person. You know, separate charges are whatever... I was celebrating and budgeted at least a couple hundred... But to not be straight with me about something as simple as money...? Yea, I'm not having it. Done! Left and went to the place next door: $10 each, no line, & variety of fun music.; It’s a fun place to go and have drinks and fun with your friends on the weekend. Great DJ mixing up your favorite songs. Keep in mind this place is very small so I definitely recommend getting a table for yourself because it does get crowded very quickly. I’m talking elbow to elbow crowded with people squeezing by you and spilling their drink on your favorite shoes. A place like this you won’t even know which guy grabbed your butt; Two of my lady friends were physically assaulted by a male patron in this bar last night. Two security guards and the manager did nothing to stop the man - their response was to kick out my friends for "making a big deal out of nothing." It was far from nothing. Businesses have a responsibility to protect their patrons, especially when alcohol is involved. This place proved they are unwilling to do that, which means they do not deserve any business. Stay away from this place!; The service was terrible the music was ok. But the system is way to big for that tiny space. So some high pitch noises would come out the speakers! Horrible. I will never go there again! Also they said 8 of my guest were suppose to get in free. But they charged them anyways. I booked my birthday there. Big mistake; If I could give this place -1 I would.... I made reservations for my fiancé birthday a week in advance. They said we'll see you Friday!! Well when we got there Friday night at 11:30pm they had already gave our table away. If there was a certain time we had to be there they would've told us not just give our table away. Or at least give us a call it's not like they didn't have our number. Why ask for our name and number and not even us it. So worthless

If not buy only beer and or pregame because the cocktails were highly disappointing.; Absolutely nobody in the dance floor, and for a $10-15 cover charge, insane. A scam, there was maybe 4 booths each with a few people at them, the rest were completely empty. very dead, probably from location and marketing, has so much potential to be great, just can’t fire it out I guess 🤷🏼‍♀️; Best night ever if buy a bottle for 150 or 200 you  get a VIP table plus add 40 dollar hookah or for the low pay 50 you get a small table and comes with a bucket beer of choice… first time here definitely come back; Paid $60.00 cover charge, they didn't have seating for us since we didn't have reservations. Bottle service is $300.00 and recommended by the usher. We felt unwelcome and got out with our money back.

Name: Karamba Nightclub
Address: 1724 E McDowell Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85006, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Tuesday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Wednesday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Thursday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 9:00 PM – 4:00 AM; Saturday: 9:00 PM – 4:00 AM; Sunday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM
Address Components: 1724 (street_number); East McDowell Road (route); Encanto Village (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85006 (postal_code); 3034 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews: Went here because me and my friends had nothing else to do after our event and we wanted to dance for a little bit more and we stopped here after they stopped serving alcohol and they charged me $20 to get in. I’m never coming back here to charge me that amount.; They usually have lights on and too much of a restaurant vibes. The DJ sucks really bad. Doesn’t know how to transition to different musics. Just went your getting the good beat, they change to were it’s slow and quiet. Kinda kills the vibe; Postpandemic I arrived just before last call to a polite attractive male bouncer. He gave me a quick run down if how I was to proceed. There is no dancing, I was to remain wearing my mask until I was seated at my table I believe the rule is if you are not seated at your table you have to have your mask on. I was surprised by not seeing the dance floor packed with dancers, instead tables took their place. I was allowed to go out onto the patio smoking area without a mask and the small group of about 10 people out there unmasked. Final thoughts; depends on what your expectations might be. Personally it was nice to get out and even though the crowd was very minimal I enjoyed my $5 picther of beer and people watching. On observing other groups and how they were having fun. This pandemic has everything all messed up but this club has been around for a long time and I would hate to see it go away because of financial problems. We know it's potential I hope we can all try to keep it going while protecting ourselves and others. Bottom line I had a good time. Just be prepared for something a little different than what we're used to. Let's support our local businesses especially gay owned.; I’m not worth your time after time and time again your establishment had wrongfully accused of actions such as “throwing the fist sucking punch” or “causing a fight” when I tried to explain to your establishment that I came up to the party as an individual on my own asking what the issue was, yes I had my heels off and hair tied because it was hot but I asked what the issue was and left. “The party” that I was with who actually threw the first punch should be banned permanently because I am no longer affiliated with that party and tend to start issues for no reason. Moral of the story: THID CLUB IS SO UNPROFESSIONAL!!!; Tipped the dj for a Latino song and waited 20 minutes but they only played English music. False advertisement

Sub-par drag show that lasted 45mins. Name: Thundercat Lounge
Address: 747 W Van Buren St, Phoenix, AZ 85007, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 7:00 – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 7:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 7:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 747 (street_number); West Van Buren Street (route); Central City (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85007 (postal_code); 2547 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
First person there when doors opened so it was empty, but it filled up quickly.

I went because it was Old School Hip Hop night. I got to check out the bar, and meet the awesome DJ. I found the drinks to be expensive, but that's anywhere so if you can't afford it then don't drink or don't go out.

The place was very cool. It's only been opened about 2 months and they will be opening a karaoke night soon.

Bathrooms were very clean. Floors inside were clean, and the outside patio is clean.

The tables are not seating. They are reserve only so it's about $200 a table. Otherwise the inside is a dance floor. Seating on the patio is nice but scarce if it's a busy night.

I'll absolutely be back!; I was super excited to visit Thundercat Lounge for the first time a few weeks ago, but after a disappointing first experience I don't think I'll be back.

The security guard wouldn't let me bring in my nail clippers, which isn't an issue I've had at any other bar/venue. It was felt like such a hassle over something so small. It set the tone for the night.

The drinks were super small and weak for the price we paid, which was I think somewhere around $15 per drink. I also watched the bartender who made my drinks on the 2nd round sniff almost every metal shaker she picked up before using it, and it made me paranoid if they were properly cleaned or not.

I will admit the inside IS beautiful. The checkerboard dance floors, mirror ceiling, and pastel 80's themed restrooms made for a fun, visually pleasing space to be in. However, a lack of fans in the main space means the dance floor heats up quick. My friends and I found after a few songs we'd have to leave because it got too hot with the amount of people on the floor.

There's more I could add, but these were my main critiques of this venue and the reasons I won't be returning in the near future. I was excited for this place to open up, so I'd love for them to take this feedback to improve.; Free Form Thursdays at Thundercat have been a blast!! No cover, amazing music, and awesome festival art vendors on the patio!

Sound system is awesome inside and the security / staff are laid back and welcoming!; Absolutely love being here, such a unique and nostalgic atmosphere right off the bat with the neon themed room and awesome stage with all the works. Sound was really great, as well as the drinks! Love the variety of dance nights here, something for everyone. Definitely worth checking out, good vibes and good people.; We went to 80's Take on Me night for a friend's birthday.  We had an absolute blast! Danced the night away. We got a vip table, which is totally worth it if u want a place to leave your purse and drink while dancing. Our cocktail waitress was wonderful and the drinks and fun shots were yummy 😋  I highly recommend checking it out!

Name: Riot House
Address: 3411, 4425 N Saddlebag Trail #105, Scottsdale, AZ 85251, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 8:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 8:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 8:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 4:00 PM – 2:00 AM
Address Components: 105 (subpremise); 3411 (point_of_interest); 4425 (street_number); North Saddlebag Trail (route); South Scottsdale (neighborhood); Scottsdale (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85251 (postal_code)
Reviews:
It's definitely a vibe.

I stopped by with some old college buddies. This is definitely a younger crowd and a bit out of my age demographic, but this place really gets jumping at night.

If you're not hip to the club scene like us old timers. It's cool to have a couple of stiff drinks, jam out to the music, and just people watch.

If you are a club hopper and under the age of 35, the Riot Hose is the place to be.
The drinks are deliciously strong and served by sexy and scantily clad lady bartenders, which I certainly do not mind.

For a price, you can reserve a table, which I believe comes with bottle service.

Overall, we had a good experience. However, we did not dine here and have no clue what the food is like.; the promoter Antonio is the absolute best. Sundown Promotions really hooks it up at Riot House with great drinks and company!!! the bar was also really good and music was such a vibe; Visited in the middle of July on a Friday and it was busy but no wait to get in. No cover charge. Bottle service and booths available. Everyone is dancing, it's not awkward to be there. Even though it's open-air they do a good job of keeping the place cool (ish) on 100+ nights. It was tolerable. Plenty of drink options and hard seltzers.; The ambiance of Riot House was a vibe and the service was great! The DJ played a good variety of music and the crowd wasn’t too much. Definitely would recommend Riot House for your next night out!; Very poor management!!! As a business owner myself we have a responsibility to protect our customer and general public. I attended a bachelorette party with my girlfriend who had a section with her girls who kept getting bothered, approached and touched by the table next to them. My girlfriend and I ended up going to cake for a better crowd. Not long after we ended up getting a call from the remaining bachelorette party that one girl was on the ground bloody and the other was on the way to jail. What happened was once we left (and I being the only male) went to Cake the table of guys next to them moved in. We witnessed it while we were there but several times I kept them at bay. Once we left they again made contact with the girls and one girl defended the rest after he touched her and swung on the guy. Security ended up stopping the girl, blooding her face and told the police they (security) got assaulted. Never once did they mention the negligence of protecting their patrons. An innocent girl went to jail tonight. I spoke with police for over 30 minutes to even get a case number and they argued with me about the definition of assault which is the unwanted physical contact to another person. Non negotiable!! They refused to give any additional information or find the guys who assaulted the women to start the entire thing. If you’re a women and celebrating anything at all, DO NOT GO HERE!!! Case information is displayed below. Pretty women need protection while out and this club provides ZERO! Find another club!!

Name: Bar Smith
Address: 130 E Washington St, Phoenix, AZ 85004, USA

Reviews:
Way too loud. Just ungovernable loud. Shakes my entire apartment which is a full block away not even facing it or on the same street.

I’m calling the police every single night I can hear this place going forward. Every. Single. Night. I’m done. Good luck.; Drinks are watered down for sure they getting your money. A friend of mine doesn't drink an ordered ginger ale and was charged $15 the bartenders don't take orders very well or listen to customers needs. The dj downstairs played some old ass hip pop n r n b for the most part had a cool little mix but an old mix. Rooftop was coo with a house dj but was hot up there; We go here just for the food 😋... Unfortunately the chef had sold out of all the catfish😭😭, but the smoked buffalo wings made up for it! The meat was falling off the bones & the greens were very flavorful 😁 We will DEFINITELY return for the catfish when they open up again!!!! The club is great & the DJs are always amazing, but the food is fire 🔥🔥🔥🔥🙌😋😍!!!!!; I went this weekend for girls night and stepped to the side to allow the rest of my friend group to get ID’d because I was the first in line and one of the bouncers came up to me with the audacity to tell me to “step to the back of the line if I’m broke”. I stepped to the side to be respectful to everybody walking in and out and to have somebody who’s supposed to be there to keep me “safe” talk to me so disrespectful was absolutely crazy. Never again! If you wanna have a good time go next door to the other clubs. Worst experience ever. Forgot to mention the weirdo went on and on about not letting me in because I said something back to him. Power trippers fr!; This was an awesome experience. One of a kind, CAN NOT BE MISSED. The DJ was spinning some great tracks on the roof top dance floor. The bar staff is on top of it. Top notch service. There are DJ's spinning on both levels.

Name: TwentyThree01 Sports Bar
Address: 2301 S Stearman Dr, Chandler, AZ 85286, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM; Tuesday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM; Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM; Thursday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM; Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 9:30 PM
Address Components: 2301 (street_number); South Stearman Drive (route); Chandler (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85286 (postal_code); 2263 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Wow! This place is incredible! I was there for the Mercury game and wanted to watch UFC. Lily was my waitress and she was so kind and nice. She kept my table spotless, ensuring even a dropped fork wouldn't touch the floor. The food was absolutely amazing! I'm from San Diego, but now I just want to go to Arizona to eat at the Sports Lounge. I highly recommend Sport Lounge. I can't thank Lily enough for elevating my experience.; Found this place on TikTok. Came in to watch the NBA playoffs and the staff were very accommodating with putting the game on the big screen!  Food came out in less than 15 minutes. Q the manager and our waitor Trenton made our experience memorable. Happy hour dishes were ONLY $5 - we couldn't stop ordering the carnitas tacos.; We found this place just a block off the main road and we're glad we did.  The atmosphere is great.  Live music during the weekend nights and a great place to watch football or the UFC fights with the huge screens.  Will be back.; Lily was awesome! Food, drinks and huge tv’s were AMAZING!!! We are excited to come back to watch football!; Kelli is the absolute amazing server. She totally had everything handled. Checked on us constantly!  She made suggestions on unusual drinks and helped us pick menu items.  She is so freaking cute and has the most amazing personality. I live in a place where service is not the best so always want to give good servers a shout out!!  Thanks Kelli for making our night so fun.

Also this sports bar is lit. Love it!!

Name: The Forum Lounge
Address: 2301 S Stearman Dr, Chandler, AZ 85286, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 9:30 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 9:30 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 9:30 PM

Reviews: Very nice place - they offer a VIP lounge area, outdoor patio seating. Dance floor could be a little bigger. The band Splash was so good, loved the variety of songs played and everyone was dancing the night away.; Best sports bar and dance lounge in  Arizona hands down. They hold events, throw parties, have live bands and DJs, 2 full bars maybe even more outside when it is not so hot during summer. The sports bar is very impressive tons of massive tvs with all the games on, for every sport. It really is an unbelievable place. The lay out allows for the sports bar and the dance lounge to go on at the same time and not interfere with each other. The place is so clean and esthetically pleasing to. Also has an amazing rose wall for photo opps that look unreal its so awesome. The staff is the best part to. They are so nice and amazing and always accommodating to any needs. The food is priced very reasonably to so u can eat full meals with out hurting the bank and enjoy drinks guilt free. One of my favorite places in Arizona. I absolutely highly recommend.  It's a fabulous place to eat drink dance or view the game. It doesn't get any better.; If you're looking for a place in the Gilbert area to grab a drink and listen to live music then check this place out. It's truly a hidden gem right in our background which is a sports bar on one side and live music on the other side. The staff was amazing, atmosphere was really fun and nice selection of drinks. We also learned it's possible to rent the place to host a special event.; Tonight was so fun! The BackDoor Funk Band was playing. Saw them another time. We danced all night to their 80's Funk. Ezra, our waiter, was awesome! Go and say hello. We had a California Roll. Was delicious. I bring my friends 🧡 from a change up from Country Music.  My fun dance partner makes it fun for me when he shows up, of course I invite him. 💃🕺🤣 Great venue.; My employer uses this space often for monthly events. The room we use is  comfortable.  They just started in-house catering & we had the Mexican menu. Everything was well prepared & quite tasty. The only thing missing was a sweet treat to end the meal.

Cash Only bar.; Visited the bar for the first time on a Saturday night...beer was cold and they had a band playing good Mexican tunes.....Bartender wasn’t courteous and BEWARE of SHADY PRICING....Purchased a round of beers for a buddy of mine as well as two ladies who were having a beer at the bar chatting with my friend....$8.50 per 7oz bud light for the ladies...I questioned the price gouging on the beers....the up charge was explained “if you INVITE/PAY for a beer for a woman you didn’t enter with THE BAR CHARGES FOR FEMALE COMPANIONSHIP.... At that point It felt like some shady MEXICAN BROTHEL and exited....; Had a great time, I was greeted by the door people in a profesional manner and would revisit if out for the weekend and was bored. I dont know  if this would be my first stop of the night but I would revisit. Thank you guys

Name: La Boom Night Club
Address: 5400 N 59th Ave, Glendale, AZ 85301, USA
Address Components: 5400 (street_number); North 59th Avenue (route); Glendale (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85301 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Advertise ladies free until 11pm we get there 10:55pm and charged us at door $20. Then we go to the bar we should have just left! I asked her for 2…Bombay Sapphire & Cranberry, no Bombay Sapphire so we got rail vodka, $60 for 2 DRINKS?!!! and this was bottom shelf liquor! NEVER AGAIN! I’ve been to some of the most expensive places in this country and I’ve NEVER paid $30 for bottom shelf liquor. There was more juice in that glass than liquor!
We walk over near the dance floor to sit at a table. My friend orders hookah the waitress tells us it takes 45 minutes to warm up. WHAT?! I’m not new! It DOES NOT take almost an HOUR! This place wasn’t even crowded 🙄 We could not drink our watered down $60 drinks fast enough and left before the hookah warmed up 🤭🙄
As we walked out I tried speaking to one of Security guards at door, don’t waste your time. He couldn’t speak English or seemed to not understand me.; Angel is the best. Really enjoyed his service he really gives you a good vibe and hypes you up. He’s always around to make sure your cup is never empty. 100% recommend him. Ask for Angel 😊; Very disappointed they said doors open at 9 they opened at 9:30 100 for a table??? Apache is not coming out till 12 and that’s if is the original guys at the door very rude never coming back; I'm definitely not coming here again, they have a very bad organization, we made a reservation of weeks to come and see T3R ELEMENTO and the worst thing is that we arrived early to get our table reserved for the same reason that they do not respect our reservation and it is not the first time apart the sound of the music is of terrible quality, so much money that they steal that they do not complex to buy professional equipment, I have a bad experience, if I could I would give them 0 stars! NO RECOMENDÓ ESTE COCHINERO DE ANTRO!!; If I could I would give 0 stars, I had a very bad experience in this night club,we reserved a table to see T3r elemento and when we arrived the table they had already given it to other people and they gave us a table where all the people passed by and they even throw our alcohol because we were in the way, it doesn't seem fair to me that we came to have fun and they ruined us are night, I’ll definitely never come back here

Name: Dwntwn
Address: 702 N Central Ave, Phoenix, AZ 85004, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: Closed; Friday: 9:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Saturday: 9:00 PM – 4:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 702 (street_number); North Central Avenue (route); Central City (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85004 (postal_code); 2001 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
This place is fun if you're 25 and younger. Or if there's nothing else in Arizona to do.  The waitress in our ViP area was awesome. But the place gets so packed, and there were a few fights brewing. The dj really really sucked. In both the hip hop and Spanish side. They kept talking. The whole time  and wouldn't shut up!! The hip-hop side kept playing the same songs. I heard scooby doo Papa like 3 times! I've been here a few times and I think this last time will be my last time.; This was my first time here for the Mi Vida Loca meet & greet and I was amazed with this establishment it's so lively and fun.; Club Dwntwn is always a fun time. They play decent music and have multiple rooms. I come here fairly often and always have a good time. I would recommend going with the VIP entrance because it is a better experience. If you do not, you have to hang in crowded areas and it is difficult to get a bartenders attention. In the VIP section there is walking room and a more private bar. Security is on point at this club, they try their best to make sure everyone is behaving. There are a few things I would say could use some work. The bathrooms are straight out of a horror movie, super small and congested. Last night there there was a toilet cover on one of the seats, just dangerous to have around drunk people. I would also say maybe upgrade to their other rooms, I checked one out for the first time and it was scary back alley vibes. I will be sticking to the main room.; I’ve been curious about this place, simply because there really isn’t much out there with Latin/Hisp music—it’s scarce. It caught my attention also because on the website it stated there was a dress code and to “dress to impress.”  We went a bit early but were a bit surprised to see that the cover charge was cash only (doesn’t state on website).  We had to walk over to the ATM at the Grand. Walking in, there weren’t that many people but we did come early, which gave us the chance to get accommodated. We went to the dance floor on the back and the bar there, only took cash. Let me say, for a simple vodka soda, it was $12. A little steep.

We started dancing and went between the dance floors. Fairly good music but it got so packed, it was no longer fun. The DJ spoke to much—felt I was at a Mexican wedding or quinceñera.

And that dress code?  Laughable. Men walking in with Nike tshirts, sneakers and a few with baseball hats. It was ridiculous to see that their website says one thing but they don’t honor it at the door. Certainly didn’t have the feel I was going for, when an establishment says “dress code or dress to impress.”  Impress who?

Can’t really say anything negative about the staff tho. All of the ones I came across were nice and respectful. I may or may not return. Not sure. I can drive a little extra to Scottsdale and not have a cover charge, where they’s actually a dress code and drinks cost the same.; Visited this club last Saturday or I say clubs and in more than one. We were hanging out having drinks and heard more music we looked behind us there was another room with another set of music playing. We dance a little and had another drink and a door slid open and you guessed it another room with a different tone playing. Definitely a great Spanish club. There were different types of dancing going on in the different rooms. You should definitely check it out, different vibez.

Waitreses were great! Definitely recommend checking this place out.; Love the service , place very clean, delicious drinks. Would defensively visit again!; If you want to have fun, Santa fe have different activities during the week for you also they allow to resnt the club for private events, yo can celebrate you birthday party, bachelor or business closing deals there, they DJ is amazing.; Great place with great music and atmosphere! They always have live performances with great bands and their staff is friendly. Definitely would recommend!; Good music; bandas,  big dance floor, AC was blasting, clean restrooms, servers were dressed decently. Plan to return.

Name: Club 54 Lounge
Address: 54 E Colorado Blvd, Pasadena, CA 91105, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 8:00 PM – 1:30 AM; Friday: 8:00 PM – 1:30 AM; Saturday: 8:00 PM – 1:30 AM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 54 (street_number); East Colorado Boulevard (route); Old Pasadena (neighborhood); Pasadena (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 91105 (postal_code); 1902 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
I visited this club with low expectations, given the numerous bad reviews, but it ended up being a great night! The bartenders were extremely friendly and efficient, serving drinks quickly. The air-conditioned space was a welcome plus. The music selection was diverse, featuring Latin, hip hop, reggaeton, pop, and rock genres. The crowd was varied, with most patrons ranging from their early 20s to 30s, creating a very safe and enjoyable environment. With three dance floors and reasonably priced drinks, I will definitely be returning!; Pretty cool club. Went with friends.

There are 3 dance floors. From my experience there;
-top floor is house music/ Edm
-middle floor is a mix of everything
- bottom floor is Latin music.

Service is cool. Only issue is the music switch on the middle floor didn’t make sense at times and was a turn off.

Definitely coming back though; Absolutely love Club 54!! Best party in town, drinks are always good and the music keeps you dancing all night long!! 3 floors of non stop music! If you come here, you’re in for an absolute awesome time!; Love love love Club 54! Beautiful club with 3 stories of non stop music with great vibes. We had the best time. We will definitely be back! 💕; Dress code is up to the discretion of the bouncer. Inconsistent and unfortunately they discriminate. I’d save money and go somewhere else. Girls can wear sandals but if a guy wears sandals, they cannot. Go somewhere else. Their sign doesn’t even mention open toed shoes. I mean it’s California…

Name: Club 80's Bar and Grill
Address: 9022 Pulsar Ct, Corona, CA 92883, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 8:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 8:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 8:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 9022 (street_number); Pulsar Court (route); Corona (locality); Riverside County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 92883 (postal_code); 7348 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Visited from AZ and recommended from locals! Very cool wall paintings and DJ music 🎶! We had a blast dancing 💃 BUT the waitress (bartender) lacked solid customer service skills and tact.

Go for the music and dancing. I do NOT recommend ordering food because of the challenge with waitress service. Hopefully, this was just an off day…because I’m used to experiencing outstanding customer service!

Protect your JOY even when there is nonsense!; Great place to come.dance and have a good time. Drinks were cool.service was great. I do recommend if your local..; I didn't have anything to eat and I drank only water... But I had a blast!!! They had a DJ that played myriad of 70's, 80's and some 90's hits! A live band from 11pm-12am. This time they had a Maná tribute band that played very well and, in my opinion, very similar to the real band. It has a $15 cover charge which I think was a great deal since you get to dance and listen to a real band in between. You may dress however you like but to me, it looked very casual and casual dressy.. some went too dressy. Many were wearing converse or flats, jeans and t-shirt. We had a lot of fun and will definitely be going there again! I suggest you check what tribute bands will be playing and getting there early to get some seats. There's VERY limited seating space and tables. I'm not sure about the food because we didn't get there early enough.🤔 I thought I saw some plates with finger foods but I'm not sure. 🤷🏻‍♀️ One thing I know for sure, you'll have great fun and you'll enjoy yourself.; Everything was great except for the live band that we had that night. I couldn’t understand anything they were saying. He was mumbling and his mouth was literally over the mic so you couldn’t hear anything.; Great spot for a drink and some dancing. Love the live tribute bands. They serve Space Dust 🌌🚀 so I was cool with showing up. Music is great and the dance floor was live and happening. I've seen Green Day and a Social Distortion Tribute bands already and I will be there for many more. Always have fun here.

Name: CLUB db LOUNGE
Address: 8206 Firestone Blvd, Downey, CA 90241, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: Closed; Friday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 8206 (street_number); Firestone Boulevard (route); Downey (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 90241 (postal_code)
Reviews: Im always down to go to DB Lounge. Unfortunately yesterday there was an incident that occurred that left me , as a customer , disappointed. I don’t mind spending money for drinks , as long as the drinks are GOOD! To start of the night, I ordered a margarita. Unfortunately, I wasn’t able to reach my go to bartender because he was busy. Since there was others, I decided to order. The drink was NOT GOOD. The margarita, was peer lemon.. I couldn’t swallow because of how acidic it tasted, I  even asked my friends, if they tasted the same thing. They all agreed. I kindly asked the bartender, if he could re make it or add more alcohol because it was peer lemon. He told me, to add more alcohol, I’d have to pay. I said no, then remake it. He declined. How are you going to make me pay, for a drink that I can’t swallow? I was very upset and made it clear how upset I was. I didn’t consume the drink at all. I kindly requested another bartender, he was very attentive and asked what was wrong with my drink, he understood. I asked him to please throw away the drink and make me a new drink. (I still paid for the new drink). DB Lounge was my go to spot, definitely there is some bartenders that do not care about customer service. Customer service is super important, especially in a night life establishment. Management , please train the bartenders to be more customer friendly. Now , I’d have to pick another go to club from now on.; When I turned 21, this was the club I wanted to attend because I love dancing and socializing with my dancing, and now since I first attending, there are only two clubs I regularly attend now: La Mirage and Club DB Lounge. I know some people have their issues or problems when it comes to clubs, but in my experience, it’s always added to some of my best experiences, going out, dancing and just loving it so much! I highly recommend coming here when you first turn 21 and want to experience clubbing on a different scale!; Very pleasant place to relax, drink and dance the night away. Security and bartenders were very profesional and friendly.; I want to speak to the owner . I want a real reason why am I banned for ever ? Adam descriminate people ! He’s rude . No reason what’s so ever .  The place is nice , is just the manager. First we were told we weren’t allow for a year and now they said never . I need some explanation. It’s unfair .; Had a bachelorette party there don't recommend.  Security really meses things up I didn't think that would be an issue for us but they just meddle to the point where it gets intrusive.  Would never go back.

Reviews:
Thank you for inviting me n my friends yesterday night!!! We loved it
We all had a great time will definitely come again in cosplays; Food was amazing. Service was lacking a bit, server would disappear a lot, would hardly come around. Also took long to get our plates cleared from our table. We sang Happy Birthday to our friend with all the dirty dinner plates in our table.

The atmosphere in the other hand was great! Loved that they had a live band playing and a DJ. We danced the night away. Overall we had a great
time.; I thought it was great. Kinda pissed they didn’t play more salsa on salsa night; Great Atmosphere for any couple! Fantastic interior, wonderful LIVE music 🎶, their tapas are the best! We had a great time ❤️just stopping by for the drinks 🍷 and it was hard to leave just a welcoming place!; It was not expensive but I didn't lile thw music and the people. It is not original latino club and atmosphere. I preefer the one that is crossing the street Alegria club

Name: Totally 80's Bar and Grille
Address: 2512 W Orangethorpe Ave, Fullerton, CA 92833, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 8:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 8:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 8:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 2512 (street_number); West Orangethorpe Avenue (route); Fullerton (locality); Orange County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 92833 (postal_code)
Reviews:
My wife and I have been to the Totally 80's Bar several times over the years and we have really enjoyed it. I would recommend getting a VIP table so you can avoid standing the whole evening. The drinks are priced fine, and the DJ always plays great 80's. I recommend going to see cover bands like, Selena, Bruno Mars and Madonna.

Parking is a bit of an issue, I would recommend parking across the street, Ubering or arriving at 9 pm or sooner to get parking.

My Wife and I are looking in returning sometime this year. If you have not been to here, give it a shot if you love 80's music.; This place has a good vibe but totally not worth it.
First the parking is small you have to get there early & I mean super early to get parking. Once you find a parking space you have to get in line to get in. Once you’re in & ready to pay the cover charge is cash only. They do have a ATM machine inside but their is also a huge line to use it. Don't forget to bring your ID otherwise you won't be able to get in. The security guard was nice & let me go get in from my car. He made sure I did not loose my place in line.

The way I took it, They let the VIPs go in first. Others wait in line. Once you get in, if you did not reserve a vip table you will be seated on the worst part of the club. I will call it the boring section. There are only a few small TVs and I mean small TVs, tables & chairs you would not be able to see the stage. There is this huge wall covering the stage. The club is shape like a J. I’m my opinion it’s the worst shape for a club.  Once you get out to the dance floor it’s a really good vibe the music is nice the people are drinking having a good time.

The drinks are good reasonably priced. I recommend the big fish bowl. It’s comes with a flashing ice cube making it look really nice. It’s big enough to last you the whole night. I did not try the food so I can’t review the food. I also did not like that the waitress keeps your credit card to run a tap, I get it, but that made me a little uncomfortable. The waitress was super nice very attentive to us.

Would I recommend this place only if you reserved a VIP table otherwise no I don’t, save your money there are better places out here.; This is a great spot.  We came here on Thursday and the DJ (DJ Whiskey) was mixing great songs from the 80s & 90s.  Plenty of seating area, very big dance floor.  The drinks are very generous and well made, best part there was no cover charge.

The only drawback is there are only 20 or so parking spaces and there is nowhere else to park.; Some good friends surprised me and took me out to the Total 80's Bar and Grille to see The Doors cover band, Strange Days Tribute. Had a blast.  It felt like I went back in time and experienced the 70's that night. Thanks gang.; The parking lot is so tiny, the security is so strict and its cash only to enter. The vibe is definitely off the music wasn’t so great either, we arrived af 8:30 and left around 10. The place is small as-well and you cant find anywhere to sit. You def cant enjoy yourself even on the dance floor you’re constantly being watched by security its so awkward 😭 they had like 7+ just watching you constantly. The only good thing were the drinks and the bartenders. Not worth it.

Name: Rumba Room Live
Address: 400 Disney Way #201, Anaheim, CA 92802, USA
Address Components: 201 (subpremise); 400 (street_number); Disney Way (route); Anaheim Resort (neighborhood); Anaheim (locality); Orange County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 92802 (postal_code)
Reviews:
The atmosphere here is amazing! I love the decor and displays of famous outfits. Furniture is plush and comfy. This is the perfect place for a night out or as a venue for your own private event in Orange County.; Had such a great time here at Rumba Room Live last Saturday (June 11th) I had to write a review. For having been my first time here, by far it exceeded my expectations. One thing I can say some of the nicest and friendly staff here (Shout out to John the bartender).

Primarily came here to take my friend to his first night club and we gave him a night to remember. The combination of great music (Latin Urban, Reggeaton, and some EDM), the wide dance floor (The photos added were taken near opening), and great bartending service (drinks averaging around $15-$18) helped make it a perfect night. John who was our bartender was funny, a great host, and talker. Can't wait to come back in the near future.

2 suggestions I'd have are the following.
1) Having a Cumbas or Dance night or even having some songs mixs into the music set.
2) I'm not sure when the website has been updated but just some food for thought. Thanks again!; Love to go dancing here. I like the music. They close at 2. We usually Uber there. You can go to dinner first there are lots of spots at the Garden Walk and then you can go burn it off on the dance floor.  💃; Drove an hour to get here for my friends birthday. Took a patty bus to get here just to see they are temporarily closed. Very disappointed. Stuck at the cantina.; It was my first time going to this club and it was great. Everything was going well until I noticed a few guys trying to take advantage of random drunk girls. I actually told 1 guy off and tried helping the girl sober up. I saw him gran her and started making out with her, then started griping her as she was completely out of it. It took a few minutes before the sober friend pulled her away from the guy. She was apparently 21 even though she looked like my 16 year old daughter. I would’ve gave it 5 stars but the lack of security made me very uncomfortable for young girls that don’t know how to handle alcohol yet. That same guy grabbed another young girl by the waist luckily I told the boyfriend and he pulled her away before he could do the same thing. I heard him bragging to his friend that that’s why he likes coming here. My goal was to get buzzed and have fun with my friends but after what I saw I asked for water instead of alcohol and I completely sobered up. This situation left a really bad taste in my mouth and I left home worried about other girls becoming victims. I would suggest more security checking to make sure that doesn’t happen. Lol it made me feel like applying for the sexy security position.😜

Name: That 80's Bar
Address: 10555 S Mills Ave, Montclair, CA 91763, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 8:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 8:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 8:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 10555 (street_number); South Mills Avenue (route); Montclair (locality); San Bernardino County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 91763 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Hidden Speak Easy....."Matterhorn Lodge inside The 80's bar.

**Only there until March 16, 2024

Only open Fri - Sat
7pm - 1am
You must call to make reservations
$20 per person for a no show
2 drink minimum
A blue  band is placed on your right wrist for entrance

No street parking but you are allowed to park across the street in a parking lot... Even though signs state "No Parking" at the entrance gate of the parking lot.  When we called to make reservations, we were told to park across the street. We asked again when we arrived (no cars were parked there) They reiterated to park across the street in the parking lot. I needed to make sure, I did not want to end my evening with a parking ticket or towed.

No cost for parking or entrance into the Speak Easy!

You scan a bar code from your table or go to the bar and order.  They recommend ordering using the bar code for faster service.

They accept cc and if you pay with cash there is a discount.

We paid with cc, easy to scan the bar code, order then pay all in one transaction. I started to leave a cash tip when my friend directed me to look at the  receipt from when I scanned and ordered, the tip was included as well as tax on the tip.
It was confusing because when I was directed to pay using the scan, there was an option to tip, for ex... 18%...20% as well as a tip that was already included plus tax on the included tip. The already included tip was what I was going to tip in cash so no biggie there. Just need to know beforehand.

Drinks were fast and delicious!

The atmosphere was superior! The immersive surroundings, excellent. Yeti was AWESOME! He came around several times, adding something different each time. Stopping to take selfies with everyone. The waitress....Great

Definitely arrive as early as possible to get a table, somewhere to sit.

Drinks only, no food. There is a Taco person outside. Grabbed a delicious burrito afterwards.; I'll start off by saying this is for sure more of a dive bar scene than anything and the area is less that stellar, so safety first when visiting the area. Now onto the better. The DJ was fantastic! The service at the tall tables was friendly and fast. They are a cash only place for the door charge of $15. The parking is across the street in a fairly dark and unsecured lot( free). The place looks like it needs fresh paint, carpet , and a deep clean. The cover band was ok at best. Glad we stopped by as we were in the area for a wedding but would not go out of my way to come here. There are cleaner and larger 80s clubs in neighboring cities.  Lastly, security is very serious here, which is a good thing in my opinion.; Bought out the VIP section, talked to the manager several times about a family gathering and because my brackets fell off when dancing they wouldn't let me out to the parking lot where their food truck is located. The cocktail server was great but the manager and security are horrible! Maybe Corona is better but me and my party of 40 will never return. BOOO to this location!!; Super Fun!  Definitely have to check out "THE SET"  THEMED SPEAK EASY; This car had great music, a great dj, and excellent service the atmosphere and the people we're so fun. I'm a dance floor and Light it was awesome. I would definitely bring friends and family here again

Name: Hollywood Club Crawl
Address: 1602 N Cahuenga Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90028, USA
Address Components: 1602 (street_number); North Cahuenga Boulevard (route); Central LA (neighborhood); Los Angeles (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 90028 (postal_code)
Reviews: I hardly go out,luckily a good friend invited to me to go and it was a blast! Right when I got to the to first club it was like the opening event and club after club it just got better. The clubs were themed and very nice with a ready to dance environment. It was really cool because I got to go in a group so I got to talk and meet with everyone in my group plus the people at the club. It was a terrific first experience thanks to the hosts Melody and Angel! Definitely an experience to try again!; This was my first time in California along with my husband. We were clueless as to where we wanted to go downtown but planned a Hollywood clubbing night now. It was AMAZING! The hosts are sooo friendly and lots of fun! They know how to keep your night entertaining. Prepare for some walking. Not very far. Loved the group atmosphere. This club crawl made you feel VIP. The clubs were also amazing. You spend just enough time at each one and the hosts do a good job at rounding you up to get to the next club. Shout out to our host Angel! He was awesome! Drinks are pricey but hey it's Hollywood. Prepare for $10+ per drink. This club crawl takes care of your cover for each club and gives you reasonable drink specials and there's no wait to get in! Will absolutely do this again!; An awesome way to walk down the Walk of Fame and have a great time! The hosts are incredibly nice and make you feel really welcome. The club selection and music was wonderful! It was a fun time and I met some really cool people! Highly recommend and I will definitely go on the club crawl again.; The Hollywood Pub Crawl wouldn’t have been amazing without the host Alyssa! She is one of the most fun and energizing hosts I’ve come in contact with. She made the entire experience fantastic! I hope she will be hosting more events like these in the future. Rock on Alyssa 🤟🏽!!!; If you are going to nightclubs, you NEED to go with the club crawl!!!!! If you want a more relaxed scene, this is not the event for you. We had a ladies night out and it was a blast. Our host Mike went above and beyond for us. We already are planning our next night out with you guys! Thank you so much for the hospitality, next ladies night we are going to try the Downtown Los Angeles club crawl.

Name: Station1640
Address: 1640 N Cahuenga Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90028, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Thursday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM
Address Components: 1640 (street_number); North Cahuenga Boulevard (route); Central LA (neighborhood); Los Angeles (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 90028 (postal_code); 6202 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Monday night vibes! The crowd, the energy, the live karaoke sessions! Drinks are so so. $$$ my friend paid $23 for a drink in a small plastic cup. I don't think it's worth $23.

Entry was $20 even on a guest list. Male or female. My roomie was a regular, so I finally gave it a try.

It was full to me but the roomie said, its usually more crowded. There were a lot of beautiful black woman. I noticed the woman more than the men. 😅

I'd recommend it for a fun Monday night. :); These people made me handicapped. On March 31, 2023 they dropped a couch from stage and fell off the stage trampling people, one of which was me. I haven't received a dime. These people have cost me upwards of 10000 dollars in medical bills.; Horrible bouncers. Tried to charge me $20 at the door. i easily would have spent $1000+ at your bar 😂😂😂😂 good luck staying in business/gaining profits with bouncers that rob their customers. Well go to “ good times at davey waynes instead”; This place has good music and a great vibe! I’m writing this on my third visit; yes, it will cost you to get in and it will cost you to get drinks, but good things don’t come free!

They do open their doors later than the time mentioned on the flyer, but the wait is worth it!

There was some confusion about the tickets I purchased online, but the staff was polite and quick to resolve the issue. We do make minor errors as we are all human, but I have always been treated with respect and that’s what really counts! Would definitely recommend this place.; Went to this venue today and feel like this place is a scam for wanting to charge people entry fees and reservations fees for the tables, and you do need to have rsvp, all for a place that is literally a bar with some dj setup. The photos shown are very deceiving because this place not what you would call a music venue, it is simply a tiny bar with very little space to walk around. There are other bars and restuarants nearby that you can simply walk in to grab some food and drinks and no need to go through all that hassle

Name: Pretty Please Lounge
Address: 4426 N Saddlebag Trail, Scottsdale, AZ 85251, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: Closed; Friday: 10:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 10:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 9:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Address Components: 4426 (street_number); North Saddlebag Trail (route); South Scottsdale (neighborhood); Scottsdale (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85251 (postal_code); 3412 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Where to start.

$300 to reserve the table. Only because we were from out of town lol I asked the other tables and they were like no. Just come in and get a section. Anyway paid for $100 for waters and red bull to make $600 tab. 120 added for gratuity a joke. the money isn’t important it’s the simple fact that they said $600 minimum. Ended up being $820. Then $210 for 3 hopkahs which were horffic and they hookah “girl” was like no it’s fine. When it was literally burning everyone’s throat. Sigh lol crowed is ghetto music is mid. Please  go across to riot house.; Came on a Sunday night with my friend. If you are looking for the wow factor, then the $10 cover charge will probably be worth it. Saw Ja Morant and Derrick Rose (NBA). The decor is nice. Sorta emo Victorian. However, I wasn’t a fan of the club as a whole. Girl at the door had an attitude and the bartenders seemed very disengaged. It was busy for a Sunday but there wasn’t a lot of singing along or dancing from the club goers. (Mostly trap/rap music that night). It seemed like some people were there just to flex in their sections or celebrity watch maybe. Especially the men lol. Honestly, as a lady, I felt a little uncomfortable here. Mostly standing room only but that’s to be expected.; I work in scottsdale and bring buyers to Pretty Please. They act like they the hottest club in Old Town when they not. To cut off someone bringing 20 girls and one guy to club is stupid at 1am when every other place lets them in until 140am. I tell my athletes to stay away because they act like they top notch. It’s not about price but about how they treat people. Tried to bring three Knick’s players in and they said no after seeing their IGs lmao; I went on a Sunday night and it was packed. The crowd was wild. And the Dj was great. I would absolutely suggest getting a table for comfort and standing room. However, good luck getting ahold of then because I haven't been able to reach anyone in the past two (2) weeks. Via social media or otherwise. I would go again, but depending on the night and how the crowd is. I would definitely consider a table area. Go see for yourself and enjoy.; This establishment was an overall horrible experience with poor service from the time I stepped in front of the building.

There is absolutely no order in place in regards to gaining access into the entrance of the building. I was standing outside for 2 hours before visibility seeing the main door.

After that I was yelled at by staff to move further back or o wouldn’t be allowed in. There was extremely no where to move and no once was being directed by any “Pretty please representative at the time of the yelling.

Then the entrance fee was extremely expensive and it was not something I want to experience ever again.

Name: Blue Martini
Address: 5455 E High St Suite 101, Phoenix, AZ 85054, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 4:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 4:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 4:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 4:00 PM – 2:00 AM
Address Components: Suite 101 (subpremise); 5455 (street_number); East High Street (route); Desert View Village (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85054 (postal_code)
Reviews: This could have been a great night out. Labor day weekend we got there at 6:30pm they were not yet open but website says they open at 4pm. so we stood outside until 7pm. Once we got in we were told that there is no seating all tables and chairs had been reserved. They had roped off all tables and booths, & removed the chairs from all of the bars accept from the bar around the stage, mind you those seats were reserved also. Since we got there early there was hardly any patrons so I sat at the seat at the bar table and every 5 minutes the staff reminded me that that was a-reserved seat and that the party would be arriving around 9pm (2hrs from then). I had already bought 3 drinks while sitting there for me and the guests that I came with so I was a paying customer, but obviously the staff would prefer to only serve the guests that made the reservations because the waitress (brunette Caucasian straight hair half up half down not very attractive young lady) asked me to get up because she didn’t want to continue cleaning the table from me buying more drinks… Cool say no more. In an economy where it is almost a luxury for the working class to come out to enjoy a nice evening its crazy to be treated like your patronage is not welcomed. I will not return nor will I recommend… tiktok video coming soon; Typically, the place is crowded on Sunday nights after 9:00 p.m. for the amazing band, Reminisce. Luckily, I found a table on the second level towards the back. The wait staff located me right away, taking my order. The food and wine were on point, as was the music and overall vibe. Overall, it was a great way to end my birthday week.; We'd been to Blue Martini before, about 7 years ago, pretty late at night, so this review doesn't cover that but the most recent experience when we visited for a Saturday happy hour.  Although it was pretty fun the last time, from what we remember...?  This time, for a more sedate experience, we ordered a discounted app for happy hour, as well as a couple of the signature blue martinis.  The food was good, but the martinis were sublime.  And fun to look at as well!  Needless to say we exceeded the preset limit of one each.  Not to mention our bartender was terrific- friendly, not pushy, and perfectly attentive.  It wasn't super busy, but in our experience this doesn't necessarily affect the level of service, so we appreciated how awesome she was.  All around amazing experience!  We will be back, for happy hour, and who knows what else after a few of those blue martinis!; Colleagues and I commemorated my 40th birthday and engagement celebration. I thoroughly enjoyed dancing and partaking in beverages. While the drinks were of high quality, they were somewhat costly. The server demonstrated exceptional attentiveness. It proved to be an ideal venue for group gatherings, although regrettably, a few of my colleagues were unable to attend. Nevertheless, the event was a resounding success.; My wife and I visited Blue Martini on a Friday evening in August for happy hour and we had a great experience. The happy hour specials were better than most in the Scottsdale area and the atmosphere was high energy and very fun. What really made our experience exceptional was the wonderful service provided by Natalie. She was a superb server, with high energy, a very positive and fun personality, and she was extremely attentive to all her customers. She made the visit so enjoyable that we returned the following Friday evening. And when we're back in Scottsdale we'll definitely continue to frequent the Blue Martini.   B and L.

Name: Boycott Bar
Address: 4301 N 7th Ave, Phoenix, AZ 85013, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Thursday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 1:00 PM – 2:00 AM
Address Components: 4301 (street_number); North 7th Avenue (route); Melrose Manor (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85013 (postal_code); 2901 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
For my first bar to ever be in it was incredibly nice and welcoming! Even though I wasn't a huge fan of what the DJ was playing it was still a vibe. I really enjoyed how there's a separate outdoor area that's much quieter than the inside, it's super helpful for when the noise becomes a bit much for me to handle. I will definitely be coming here as my primary bar!; Absolutely LOVE this place. I'm a pretty anxious person, but they always make me feel super welcome. Staff is lovely and hilarious, drinks are tasty. Been for a karaoke night and a UHaul singles event, and both times it was lively and I had an absolute blast. If you're looking for a safe environment for any type of person, this is where to go. Chill but not dead when I went from about 7-9, the party really starts picking up 10-12 (I haven't stayed longer than that due to my work hours, but I fully intend to). Bring your cishet friends and they can still have a wonderful time. I not only feel safe on a literal level, with staff I feel I can go to if something is wrong and weapons checked at the door, but mentally safe to put my reservations aside - everyone puts themselves out there and you can be yourself, and there's areas you can go to chill out when it's more packed. Parking is a bit tight if you're bringing a DD but nothing impossible. Seriously cannot recommend enough! Come through!; Lesbian bar. Dancing area and patio. They have a NA beer, and of course sodas. Wish there was an actual mocktail menu but you could ask the bartender to mix something up. Came during the day. Love that they opened at 2pm since we are old ladies that don't stay up late anymore 🤣
Street parking is kind of limited so be prepared to walk a couple blocks. Not bad. Will be back.; In a state that’s hit or miss when it comes to queer safety, Boycott is a true oasis of acceptance and support. Your identity doesn’t matter - if you’re human, you’re welcomed and loved. Very few places can boast of that. Audrey and her bartenders make EVERYONE feel like they belong, and in a world like the one we live in, that matters.; Went for the first time last night and it was good. I think a $10 cover charge when the place is half empty on a Friday is a little expensive; I think they would have a huge turnout if they didn’t charge a cover! I think it would also help with the diversity because there wasn’t a lot of POC; it’s only one kind of LGBTQ+ crowd if you get what I mean. The drinks are great, my girlfriend and I had fun. I would come back on a night that’s free 😊

Name: Bikini Lounge
Address: 1502 Grand Ave, Phoenix, AZ 85007, USA

Reviews:
Sniffed out this dive on my first day in Phoenix. What a gem and incredible piece of living history! Increíble original decor from 1947. Best bartender. Pool table.    It’s my new home.; Great dive bar still going strong is sleazy is your desire this place is a must. A pint and a shot of Johnnie Walker Black for less than $10; Place was absolutely ridiculous I understand it’s a bar and you go to drink but when going with a large group not everyone is gonna be drinking ever heard of a designated driver ?? What kinda place kicks you out for not having a drink if there was a sign saying a minimum amount of drinks per person I’d understand but no warning whatsoever anywhere on top of that how you gonna come up to me and say “yo you gotta split” ever heard of being a decent person and politely asking someone to leave no one was drunk or belligerent so there was no reason to kick us out. Absolute joke of an establishment; Cash only! They do have an ATM inside. The bartenders are nice. The prices are good. This is more of a local hole-in-the-wall dive.; Terrific drinks.
Bartender was flexible with options for what you like.
Sunday , Funday!!
AMI juke box for all your amateur D.J. delight.
Ask for that extra Hendricks gin.
🤫

Reviews: Had an awesome experience... The environment the ambiance, music, crowd all top notch and especially the bartender "JORDAN", she was the most awesome to tend the bar, drinks and behavior. Shout out to you all, you guys made our night. Keep it up and keep rocking; Cake is always a blast for cocktails and dancing. Excellent EDM music tonight and air conditioning was going. Really awesome experience and will be back. Magical moments!; We went to Cake off a suggestion from an Uber driver. It did not disappoint! Drinks were reasonably priced and the music was great. Worth every penny.; I visited this club for a bachelorette party and I was blown away. I had never been to anything this fancy. It’s a party in here. Staff is attentive, helpful and friendly. I feel like I was a bit older. I’m guessing most of the people in this club was in their 20s and was more their scene. Even tho it wasn’t mine they played good music and the drinks were great. Security is at every corner and made their presence known so that make me feel safe. I love the entertainment this club does for all the parties around the club.; They let way to many people in at one time. If you didn’t pay for a table, expect long waits to order anything and have no room to walk at all. Both drinks and shots were $13 each.

Name: Dierks Bentley's Whiskey Row
Address: 4420 N Saddlebag Trail, Scottsdale, AZ 85251, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Thursday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 4:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Address Components: 4420 (street_number); North Saddlebag Trail (route); South Scottsdale (neighborhood); Scottsdale (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85251 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Cool stop to go for a drink or two. They have indoor and outdoor patio seating, all the sports on big screen TVs, and a massive screen showing the biggest game at the moment. Staff were very friendly, and the DJ was very good. My wife had the buffalo wings and thought they were delicious!  Would recommend especially if you are a country music fan.; The food was tasty and I had a great time! It was a little slow, but I had great service. I’ll be back 😀; Not the best service. Initially took about 15-20 minutes to get beer after we ordered. She hardly came around much. Ordered the Cajun Caesar salad which was a head a Romain, not entirely sure if there was dressing on it but whatever my bad. There were 2 sun dried tomatoes in the salad so that's probably what made it Cajun I guess. All good though I've had my fair share a brutal meals. The waitress couldn't split the meals up because we were a group of 10, which is fine. I don't understand that rule in the states but I'm assuming it's because it'll take the waitress an extra 3 minutes out of her work day standing at the bar. And since we were a group of ten, there was an automatic 22% gratuity added onto the bill. Which she clearly deserved. Plus a 4% venue fee because they're that great. Probably won't be going back.; I stopped in to watch sports while on vacation, not knowing anything about the place.  The food I got wasn't quite what I ordered, but it was excellent regardless.  The bartenders were so gracious and kind that I felt like I was the most important customer in the building.  I have worked in restaurants/bars for over 10 years and understand mistakes happen with food, but Amy and Kae went so far above and beyond to make sure I was ok with it that I will definitely be back the next time I'm in town.; Ok Dierks Bentley! I see you!

We stopped at this place on a whim and it literally was the best decision of the day! We got there super early thinking they opened at 4 for happy hour but they open at 5 so beware! We went and took a walk and came back.

We literally were the first ones in the door and they didn't have a bartender yet but the hostess seated us and our waitress Brielle came right away. She helped us make decisions, told us what was on the happy hour menu and recommended drinks too. She told us it might be a minute on the drinks but kept us posted about everything that was going on. She even went to try and get the bartender for us which it wasn't a long wait, maybe 10 minutes.

She brought our drink which was the JIMBO. It was strawberry with a little spritzer, very flavorful and they didn't skimp on alcohol. We ordered the southern fries which were half price for half the size which was perfect for 2 people. The fries were amaaaazing!! You could get them with ranch or bleu cheese but we got ranch! Great combo with the BBQ sauce and ranch!

I ordered the Mac and cheese with blackened chicken. Before I ordered, I asked if it was good and she said yes but I asked if she was just saying that and she said no they use lots of different cheeses, definitely not Kraft and it wasn't!! I really enjoyed it. My husband ordered the burger with garlic sweet potato fries which were out of this world!!!

Brielle was really good about checking on us, refilling our waters without us asking, and checking to see if we needed anything. Great place to watch the game with a huge screen and of course country music! I didn't experience the club or party aspect but would definitely go back for happy hour and the bar scene!

Highly recommend a cactus cooler shot with a group of friends.; Amazing atmosphere, great drinks for the right price! Fun is always had when coming here! Zack and Miley are always welcoming and up beat! If you’re looking for a fun night out this most definitely the place!; Absolutely love this place, I truly hope this place is on everyone’s bucket list. Probably the best thing besides the snow up here in Big Bear. Once again I’d like to thank the friendly staff the locals and of course that awesome guy behind the bar aka  Zachary he kept our party laughing all night long.  Keep up the great work guys and thank you all; My brother and I went here last night and had a blast. The bartender (whose name I wish I could remember) was super cool and we chatted with him a bit and then played a few rounds of pool. The drinks weren’t that expensive which was a huge plus since everything in Big Bear is so pricey. I highly recommend this stop if you want a little night time fun!; This is probably one of the best places to go in big bear and get a drink.  The bartender Zack is the best bartenders I have ever dealt with.  I highly recommend going here and asking for Zack you won’t be disappointed

Name: 340 Restaurant & Nightclub
Address: 340 S Thomas St, Pomona, CA 91766, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 8:30 PM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 8:30 PM – 3:00 AM; Saturday: 8:30 PM – 3:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 340 (street_number); South Thomas Street (route); Pomona (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 91766 (postal_code); 1735 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
I have been here twice, the shows are fun and the staff is friendly and welcoming. The biggest issue I have with this place is the music. They played the same remix of not like us by Kendrick Lamar and another Spanish song. The mix was really bad and did not make me want to dance and it got to the point where I was holding back laughter the second time I went because i couldn’t believe they played the same remix twice. Please!!! Play some good tracks :); I went here this past thursday for the first time, the opener did a phenomenal job! the music did cut out from time to time but the dj was quick to fix the technical issue. Look forwarding to coming back, looking forward to their next set.; My friend and I (both of us are 21) went to go to this club. She paid first and when waiting for me the security guard told her she could wait and said she needed to enter the club. She did. I paid 20 dollars because 21+ gets charged that. Today the next day we were talking about yesterday and she said "wow 30 dollars was a lot for a cover fee" that's when I told her I got charged 20. She calls to ask for the difference because she is 21 so she should've been charged 20. The person speaking to her, several times, tried blaming my friend saying she should have noticed the difference immediately when we both paid at the front. But how when she was told to enter the club? Which she explained to the person on the phone. But instead of trying to make things right he insinuated she was lying and that it was not a mistake done by the employee. Basically it's her fault for a mistake someone that works there did 🤷‍♀️.; this security along the others are the absolute worst!! very very rude .
i asked him for his name and he slammed the door right in my face and hit my elbow .; DO NOT GO HERE !! came here last night with 2 of my friends and the security was EXTREMELY rude. they had kicked me out because i held a drink for one of my friends for not even a minute and they kicked me out?? I was not drinking or anything (just simply holding a drink for a friend that was buying a girl a drink). The security approached me very rudely and told me i had to leave. He was YELLING AT ME when i was clearly walking to the exit and he even pushed me. Once I got out of the club we saw the same security and we asked for his name and he responded very rudely and quickly and slammed the door on our faces and even hit my friend with it (even told them to pull up the cameras) Never coming back here. There was 2 securities they were both Big guys with glasses. I had told some other people outside of the club about my experience and they said they had the same problem with the SAME security.

I spent wonderful nights there during my stay at the DoubleTree Hilton.The atmosphere and music were very beautiful.; Great music, but their A/C was horrible! I mentioned it to their manager immediately before the place got packed. It was warm and stuffy at 6pm. He said he was aware of the A/C situation.

Looks like a common thing because several women and even some men had their own hand held fans. I asked them about the A/C and they said it's always hot so they go prepared.
If you want a seat by the dance floor, you have to arrive early. The food is better from the restaurant next door. You have 2 menu options.  The club food is ok if you don't mind nachos and other fried foods. Cocktails were good and service was great!
The only way I will return is if the A/C gets fixed.; Very great atmosphere! They had live music which was awesome and they also had a DJ who was on a roll with a great variety of music selection. Cat the waitress was friendly and attentive. Will definitely return!!; We had a fantastic Friday night, they had a live band and a DJ, there's an entrance fee, requires a minimum of 2 drinks consumption within the first two hrs, cocktails were decent, great ambiance, great service, pretty good vibe, mature audience.; Nice lounge bar and dance floor.
