Name: The Cash Nightclub & Lounge
Address: 1730 E McDowell Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85006, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: Closed; Friday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 1730 (street_number); East McDowell Road (route); Encanto Village (neighborhood); Phoenix (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85006 (postal_code)
Reviews:
What a disappointment. I visited for the first time last night with a group of four friends.

Security harassed my friend from California, threatening to take his ID, which was vertical but valid until 2028. They let us in, we paid the $15 cover charge and entered the venue which only had about five people inside.

After leaving and returning an hour later, we were allowed back in without paying again. Security patted us down, and we went inside. While ordering a drink at the bar, the same security guard from the front door came over, put his hand on me, and escorted me out without explanation. Once we reached the front, he finally said they’d thought they felt something in my pocket and patted me down again. Why let someone in if you’re not sure they have weapon or anything else? Does that sound that safe?

To add, the bartender initially told us that the tickets we received could be redeemed at 12:00 PM for a vodka drink or a beer. When we had returned, he changed his story and said they were for a raffle. Overall frustrating, especially since he had told all four of us the same thing initially.

I would never recommend this place to anyone. The staff were unprofessional and rude.; Great atmosphere, bartender always tentative, music is always good, have wine coolers for people who don’t like beer and top two drinks i recommend is Bye (rum instead of tequila) and pineapple with malibu; It’s a nice place good music bartenders are nice as well, but security guard are worthless. I went outside to get some fresh air and they didn’t even let me in back because supposedly I was too drunk already.
(1:00-> ) so I had a big argument with them talking about the stamp system, and that there is no balcony so I can get fresh air and then go back inside. They need to apply that rule somewhere by the door or something like that, you can back inside you look like 😋 it’s almost got in a fight with the security guard. He look like 5’7 or 5’9 white almost bald, but yah not coming back sadly.; I've only been here once which was recently. I attended the All White theme party which was pretty cool. I liked the grass wall, white couches and big chandeliers but the dance floor was tiny and the bathroom is small/kind of dirty. Overall it was a good time!; This Cash Inn isn’t anything close to the old Cash Inn Country at all. The new place wasn’t crowded like the old place, drinks seem to be water down, to much country music, not a variety of music like the old place. To many guys this isn’t a lesbian bar like the old place. I don’t see this place surviving at all.
It’s ashamed that these owners have no idea.
The old location even though there wasn’t hardly much parking the owners back than knew what worked in the club and the owners were highly respected.
I will not be returning to this Cash Inn this club which in my opinion isn’t a lesbian at all.

Reviews: We came in on a Friday night to get a couple of pastries since this is the place I've been coming to my entire life. I always get the cheesecake because I'm a big fan of cheesecake. I remember it tasting different, it wasnt as good this time. Not as creamy as I remember. I got 3 slices to share, some bread, and a cake roll. Unfortunately the cake roll was rather dry. I want to say it was an off day for them because usually their pastries are very good. They also sell meats and cheeses as well as some groceries. I spent about $5 for everything. Everyone was rather friendly, not as friendly as other places I've visited though. It's one of the few bakeries in town and its right at the entrance so it's quite popular. It still has hurricane damage so the sign is very small, so you have to pay attention when looking for it. Like I said, I'm going to guess it was am off day because the product was not as good as I've had before. The place does have decent food and pastries.; We came from Atlanta, Ga. Our family comes here all the time. They wanted to share with me; Edit: They raised their prices. I think some is to much for what it is, so I don’t think I’ll come again. Also the coffee was awful. If u have a sweet tooth, you'll enjoy their pastries and they make really good calzones.; Today we went on an adventure to Lares, Puerto Rico. Our quest was good chocolate cake. We found that but also found the best vanilla flan and the best chicken quesadillas we have ever had. Edgar, the owner, was extremely personable and interesting. Their homemade bread was fresh and warm. We took it home and had it for dinner. It was definitely worth the drive over from Rincon.; Great price. Good bread 🍞 and delicious cake .

Reviews:
Pros: Quality Predator pool tables and equipment. Good appetizer selection. Good drinks variety. Safe and clean environment. Lively atmosphere. Ample, good-looking space, air conditioned. Attentive service.

Cons: Confusing receipt charges.

My husband paid about $20.00 per drink. His go to drink is a special mix. But this is the first time we pay this much for it. He is very trusting so he pays and walks off but when I revised the receipt at home I noticed the way they charged it was very confusing so I think they just charged it wrong. Also, the bartender that cashed us out was not happy with a 15% tip.

Advice: Check your receipt! Ask questions before you order or pay. Stick to common drinks or beer. Have a good time!

We will probably be back, be mindful of our orders, check our receipt before we go and maybe tip a bit more.; Very clean, positive atmosphere, great service and cold drinks; Excellent place to play billiards, excellent food, the attention of the servers is excellent!; Best complete billiard spot ive been in PR. tables are great!; Great food 😋 clean and safe investment grat for family-friendly hang out

Name: Tulum La Placita
Address: 215 C. Canals, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 9:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Thursday: 9:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Friday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 9:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Address Components: 215 (street_number); Calle Canals (route); Santurce (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Pozo del Hato (administrative_area_level_3); Santurce (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00907 (postal_code)
Reviews:
The place is packed with people. A lot of bars a few eateries/ restaurants. The food was great! We went to a little place, can’t remember the name, just that they had a statue in the corner with a man with 2 left arms smoking and a kid in a weird position. But the red snapper tasted wonderful.  I watched videos online about this place but didn’t get the same vibe when present.  I guess everyone working was on vacation in another location.; This place felt like I time traveled back to the Lamba Chi Alpha house at USC ahahahaa. Lawless and godless.
I had a front row seat to witness a couple guys from our hostel who were on a mission to meet some Puerto Rican mamacitas. I stood in the corner because I’m really shy and introverted and I’m okay with that 🙈
They returned from Tulum bruised and battered 2 nights in a row when they were showed not an ounce of love by the mamacitas. A bitter pill to swallow indeed. But fairplay to them as they are the ones actually in the arena, faces marred by dust and sweat and blood.
Overall this is the crown jewel of La Placita.; Bartenders charge you whatever they want. I was charged three different prices for the same drink: a rhum and coke (house rhum, big one), and the highest was $17 before tips, it feels like they’re just taking advantage of you when you’re a tourist.; Tons of bars in the area that are literally  walking distance. Drinks were decently  priced more hip hop vibes . Loved it !!; My wife ordered a mixed drink with Don Julio and it was adulterated, very dangerous practice and completely illegal. Thankfully we only took one sip and threw it out. If you do go stick to beer.

Nice cashiers, great customer service. The entire staff is just incredibly helpful and kind.

Will continue to buy there moving forward.; Very clean and organized in the supermarket. Some items priced pretty high. Employees are very helpful for people who aren't from around there.

Name: Rincon Surf Club
Address: 9P7P+2GG, Rincón 00677, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 9P7P+2GG (plus_code); Puntas (administrative_area_level_2); Rincón (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00677 (postal_code)
Reviews: We had booked this reservation over a month ago. The owner cancelled our reservation 4 days prior to our stay. Owner requested that we rebook through a different platform. Owner was unwilling to honor our initial agreement and disregarded the impact the cancellation would have on our group. Very disappointed at the last minute cancellation.; This was my first time coming to Puerto Rico and this place was recommended to us by a friend living in Rincón. The apartments are stunning and the pool area is nice. However, for anyone reading this it’s very important for you to know that they have a lot of rules, which can definitely come across as overwhelming, we were constantly worried about not breaking them and not having 200 taken from us, which took away from the relaxation. Secondly, the owners live there, I personally do not like staying at the same place as the owners as it feels as if we’re  being monitored, so just a heads up for anyone that might have an issue with this! In conclusion, I thought the price was more than fair for the beautiful room we got, and I think this place has a lot of potential and is good for families vacationing together!; Great music and vibe.  Food was good as well.; We had an absolutely amazing time staying at Rincon Surf Club, I cannot recommend this place enough. Really clean and cosy rooms, a beautiful pool with stunning views. Beth and Sooz are so welcoming, friendly and extremely accommodating during your stay. I can't wait to go back, was so sad to leave.; GREAT PLACE! Rincon Surf Club has a nice relaxing and/or refreshing pool deck with chairs and hammocks (they have a couple toys for it as well for the kids). Nice meditative walk to the nearby beach! Comfortable beds, blankets, and things you can sit on like a couch and big beanbags. Wifi for EACH room, with a tv connected to a roku streaming system for watching tv on netflix, Hulu, and Etc! Nice interior with decorations! Not excited yet? Well, they have an outdoor resteraunt called Shipwreck to eat and drink the best mofongos and mojitos in the city! The people there are very nice, and the area is very peaceful and quiet. I am glad to say that the rincon surf club was a great experience and was one of my BEST experiences at an airbnb property. Worth it!

Name: Lazy Parrot Inn
Address: km 4.1, PR-413, Rincón, 00677, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Address Components: Puerto Rico 413 (route); Rincón (locality); Puntas (administrative_area_level_2); Rincón (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00677 (postal_code)
Reviews: Overall, my wife and I enjoyed our stay. Great location, very clean rooms, amazing views, plenty of parking, and delicious breakfast. The following is why I would give this place a 4/5 instead of 5/5. The overnight manager did not respond to my request for additional towels, we didn’t get to enjoy breakfast the last morning because the chef didn’t show up, and the hours of operation for the front desk are not accurate (truly opens at 10am not 9am). Nonetheless, we would consider staying here again.; We really enjoyed our second stay at the Lazy Parrot Inn. The staff is super friendly, professional and welcoming. The complimentary breakfast is amazing; best omelet we have tasted on the island and Ash was an attentive and knowledgeable bartender. The Thai restaurant was heavenly with perfectly spiced dishes and fresh, unique cocktails we loved- such a delightful surprise! As always, the grounds are gorgeously maintained and showcase the beauty of the tropical flora and the pool area is relaxing and beautiful. Our room had an enormous balcony with an enchanting view of the ocean and forest.It felt like we were nestled in a tropical treehouse in paradise. 5/5 on all counts. Cannot recommend enough 💗🏝💗; What a great surprise!! The pictures don't do it justice. Our room (#3) had a huge balconiy looking north over the water. The location is within 5-10 minutes of everything. The staff was very friendly & very professional. The breakfast food options/happy hour selections and prices were amazing!! I will definitely be coming back!!; Had an absolutely incredible time here.  The resort was beautiful and so peaceful.  Loved the vibe, the restaurants and how helpful the staff was.  I will definitely be going back there.; I’m back home now and really missing the Lazy Parrot. It was a great experience from beginning to end. Complimentary breakfast, great parking, great restaurants, clean, spacious rooms, great location, great pool…..the list goes on. I will 100% stay here again.

Name: Casa Verde Hotel
Address: Carretera 413 Ramal, Rincón, 00677, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Open 24 hours; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours
Address Components: Carretera 413 Ramal (route); Rincón (locality); Puntas (administrative_area_level_2); Rincón (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00677 (postal_code)
Reviews: I had the best time at Casa Verde. Room was Spacious and clean. Bed was comfortable, pool is small but it was low season, so I mostly used it by myself. Everyone is so nice. Really nice, family oriented place. Loved it; Little beetles in our room the first day and in the room we were going to be relocated to, stains and debris on sheets after room service. Owner is nice I’m grateful he showed us around and where to go very knowledgeable. Security guards are nice. Hotel was empty and pool area was rusty and dirty. Overall uncomfortable experience would not recommend regretted it right away; Amazing experience overall!! Travis and Angel were super helpful. Travis upgraded our room and helped fill air in our tire. Everyone was super helpful and the food was also very yummy. Recommend!!; Our family of six stayed at this fantastic little resort right off the beach in Rincon. We had a whole 2-story house they rent to large groups. The accommodations were perfect, even overly spacious for our group size. There is a fully stocked kitchen and private pool just for the house. Travis and his team were welcoming and we found out they run a surf school as well, so the kids took a lesson from Uoco and Este. They were awesome! All the kids were able to surf on their first day. Also on site is the Big Kahuna Bar. Such a fun place. All the best music from the 90s and then some local stuff as well. Big drinks, good tacos and burgers, and live music on Friday nights (although we missed it unfortunately) Anyway, great place. Highly recommend.; Nice hotel with clean and confortable rooms. Although not on the beach, it's only a few minutes walk away.  Only complain was the hot water on the shower, regardless of how long waited to warm up it didn't.

Name: Rincon Ocean Club
Address: Rico, 8Q93+9QW, Stella, Rincón 00677, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 8Q93+9QW (plus_code); Stella (locality); Calvache (administrative_area_level_2); Rincón (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00677 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Quite, Clean, Peaceful and close to everything.
Loved my say at Rincon Ocean Club. It's about a 5 min drive or 20 walk to downtown central area. Tons of restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores nearby.. 5 min walk to the beach which was never busy. Very Central to everything.; It’s all about the beach and the sunsets. They are both amazing!  The unit was modern, super clean and tastefully decorated.  The convenience and proximity to everything was such a bonus.  Truly a paradise.; Administration sucks. I own a unit here. It was impacted by Hurricane Maria. Ever since then it has been unusable. HOA has not taken any affirmative steps to make my unit (or the others in same state or worse) usable.
There's no beach. Building looks horrible. And the only unit being used are the ones whose owners are on the board of directors. Yet, despite my repeated demands and complaints to have my unit back to a usable state... it has fallen on deaf ears, but they continue to charge the monthly maintenance fee.; We own one unit @ the condo; Umforgetable l sunsets , waking distance to the beach & warm yet crashing  tides  & also close by stores & restaurants.  Friendly & helpful locals.  Definetly recommend.
Ps if u must drive watch for many potholes on the road

Reviews: Great bar that has everything. It has a fishing and tackle shop inside they sell local 50/50 t-shirts, make a great Margarita and there is an amazing Taco bar called Taco Love Land attached. What more could you ask for? This is a Rincón staple.; Chill laid back bar! Manuel, the owner/bartender is very nice. Def stop by if you’re in the area. Cash only FYI.; Great bar with great staff. They have a huge selection of liquor and beer. It is close to the beach and all the nightlife. The beer is cold and the music is great. If you are into Metal and punk rock this is the spot!; Such a fun place. Love the vibe and energy here; A nice bar to visit. Knowing my uncle who is the owner of the place he is a very nice guy and during open hours of his bar he has nice talks to some people who visit. Pretty solid events too and it’s history of it is pretty cool since the bar used to be a station for the only traveling train in puerto rico thous being called “la estacion” (means station in spanish). One time someone from the American Pickers cast came over to visit and it was pretty awesome. As this being a bar alone if it did not have events or history its still pretty good to go for a better mood. Would recommend visiting when given a chance.

Reviews: Nice place very nice an friendly people; The service was really good, the bartender Neysha was excellent, and super attentive. The place is what Puerto Rican’s consider a “Chinchorro,” however I found the prices to be really high for drinks, not beers. In the same town of Aguadilla, I’ve paid less for whisky and coconut water… I live in the area and I’m not sure I’m going back. The vibe is great and if you’re into playing dominoes this is your spot.; This place is great to play Domino. Love you Tiburon; This place is good, cold beer. People are very humble. Service is good.; You perfect please to pacific drink and play Domino

Reviews:
This place has great vibes. It has open seating, patio, lounge, bar area and you can smoke inside. They also sell cigars if that's your thing. The bartenders are well knowledgeable on making drinks and the variety of liquor and beer is outstanding. 10/10.
Feels like a fancy bar or normal bar but you still get the Caribbean vibe of our Island 🏝️ and Aguadilla.; Stopped by Tuesday around 7:30. Closed. Google maps said open 3 to 11:30. I'm beginning to realize it's a good idea to call first before making the trip for most places that aren't big chain stores and restaurants around here.; Place is nice - Air conditioning, good cigar selection and good drinks. However, I have never been more mistreated in customer service in my life. Bartender was making faces, and hurrying us up in the cigar room and to order. Very uncomfortable experience. The place was completely empty by the way. Will never visit again...; This venue is the perfect spot to bring friends for a laid-back, enjoyable evening. The staff couldn’t be more friendly, always ready to make your experience special. The drink menu is impressive, with options that cater to all tastes, and if you’re a cigar aficionado, you’re in for a treat—their selection is top-notch. Overall, it’s a great environment for catching up, celebrating, or just winding down with friends over some quality drinks and cigars. Highly recommended!; Arrived as they were opening, the bartender was not friendly at all. You cant smoke inside and once you sit outside they dont even give you an ashtray, chairs were dirt and wobbly. This place may better during peak hours from what I have heard but unfortunately it was not my experience

Update: Service got better, definitely go at least an hour after their opening time to ensure they are properly set.

Name: Beerloteca
Address: CR7Q+CC, Aguada, Aguadilla 00602, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: Closed; Friday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 7:00 – 11:30 PM
Address Components: CR7Q+CC (plus_code); Aguadilla Pueblo (sublocality_level_1); Aguada (locality); Santa Bárbara (administrative_area_level_3); Aguadilla (administrative_area_level_2); Aguadilla (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00602 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Google maps also refers to this location as Aguadilla Rooftop Experience which is a different location than having been to that non-beachside location. I stumbled onto this location wondering how did I miss this in my previous 3 years in Puerto Rico and now moving back stateside sadly.  The location is awesome
and easy to get to.  I had lunch on their boardwalk across from main restaurant on the water.  Service was great and the fish tacos with spicy crab amazing.  I almost finished but it took me awhile pacing myself with cold Medallas.  The views are great and typical of Puerto Rico even on a Saturday, the beautiful beach was quiet.  If you read this you need to experience this place!  If you come for lunch bring a swimsuit 😁. You will thank me later for that advice.; This spot has a decent local draft beer selection. Service was average. Parking space was challenging but there was an event going on. Food was average - could use some improvements. Overall we had a great time. Views on the rooftop are great. Place downstairs is small.; Came with a group of friends on a Saturday night looking for good music and small club. We arrived around 9pm, place didn’t get packed until 11pm. Overall great music (Reggaeton/Remixes) and crowd.; Only good club in aguadilla 👍; Needs security at night 🌙 broken car  window and items stolen.

Name: Timber & Blues
Address: #34 C. Ramón E. Betances, Aguadilla, 00603, Puerto Rico

Address Components: #34 (street_number); Calle Ramón E. Betances (route); Aguadilla Pueblo (sublocality_level_1); Aguadilla (locality); Nuevo (administrative_area_level_3); Aguadilla (administrative_area_level_2); Aguadilla (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00603 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I love this place. The vibes are great. Decorations are giving prohibition. It has a cigar lounge, outside sitting area and more bars inside. Drinks are so good; We stopped in fairly late on a Wednesday night so it had only a handful of other patrons but it had a cool speakeasy-ish vibe of a place that’s probably packed during dinner and weekends. And the drinks, food and service were all top-notch.

For drinks we had a spicy La Muerte and a fruity Passionfruit marg. We ordered Rosemary Parmesan Truffled Fries that smelled and tasted so good we forgot to take a picture. Then we had a pizza with Feta, Prosciutto, Caramelized Onions and. Balsamic Reducion Drizzle on a crispy thin crust that was delicious. We ordered side salads not on the menu that are normally served as part of the pasta dishes and our friendly and inventive server figured out how to add to our order using a different charge.

We sat on out on the creatively decorated covered patio with antique chandeliers, very effective ventilating fans and reallly cool ambient music. All in all a great meal!; Pedro took us on an amazing journey. From an educated lesson in spirits mixology and cigars. Carlos was the best and pointing out what cigars paired well. And the food was amazing. Thank you Pedro and Carlos for an amazing experience. We're definitely coming back.; Best night in our entire week of Puerto Rico! Is impeccable service and exceptional drinks. All the food we tried was delicious and five star.
Of course, we had to get a couple of tattoos to top the night off!
Is loved the vibe!; Drinks were pretty good but not really anyone there when we went besides our bigger group. Decorations are cool and staff was nice.

Reviews:
During my stay in Aguadilla I had the opportunity to visit this amazing place. I could honestly say this is one if not the most modern spots in the area with an amazing view.
Food was amazing, drinks were incredible and most importantly the service was a 10/10. Thank you Lorenzo and his staff for making my visit an unforgettable experience. I definitely would recommend this place for foreigners and locals.; The host was very polite and attentive. Food was excellent.; I recently went to Aguadilla with my sister, from NYC. I could honestly said that Manta Beach Bar is one of the best places in the area. We had the opportunity to have dinner ( empanadas, churrasco y arroz mamposteao; delicious!) and we stay after for a few drinks ( the are very creative with the presentation of them, especially the "pipi" shot's lol). Manta not only has a great vibe, but is also located in the downtown of aguadilla, a place that you can feel safe when you are away from home.  If you have the chance to visit this place I would suggest you to do it.; Possibly the worst bar in all of Aguadilla. The employees don't know their cocktails (I swear both mines and my friend's drinks tasted terrible). Plus they make up expensive prices on the spot. If I could give this a negative out of 5 I would.; If I could give this place a 100/100 I would :). I had the opportunity to spend a Sunday evening with my daughters at Manta Beach Bar and we fell in love. The view from this place is out of this world, music was great, food was delicious and the portions were sustainable. The employees were friendly and made sure were having a great time. This was our first time in Puerto Rico, we were visiting from Colombia and I would say this was one of the highlights of our trip to the west.
THANK YOU MANTA for everything !!!

Reviews:
Such a beautiful, cozy coffee shop!
The staff were so kind and inviting, the location is convenient, and the menu is amazing! I ordered the Lavender Love, a great blend of espresso and sweet. The waitresses are attentive to ensuring I was satisfied with my coffee. You can tell they really care for and love their customers, looking forward to visiting again! Oh and they have lots of local artisans work available for purchase!; Finca & Fern Coffee is a delightful haven for coffee enthusiasts. The charming decorations and cozy atmosphere create the perfect setting for enjoying a cup of their expertly crafted coffee. It's a must-visit spot for anyone seeking a serene escape with top-notch brews.; Finca & Fern is such a beautiful concept… a gorgeous space bringing together the community for learning and celebrating life. The workshops I’ve attended have been amazing… sound bowls, breath work, mind body and spirit transformation… and Andrea is an amazing teacher and mentor. Her beautiful family is such an integral part of bringing people together. Stay informed on social media about what’s happening next and GO!! You don’t want to miss it!!
Just enjoyed a Finca & Fern latte on opening day! So so good! Delicious coffee, beautiful smiles, and such a cool comfy vibe to sit and relax and write this review. Doing some shopping here too… many local artists and crafters- making it the best place to shop for a unique and special gift. Will be a regular here for sure! Prices are awesome too!; Just went to grab a cup of coffee and ended up having a pleasant conversation with the owner. Lovely place to work, shop or just to  go with friends to relax and have nice conversations while having such good coffee.; Unique and charming coffee shop on the West Coast of Puerto Rico. It’s like you are stepping into a different world in there. Yummy coffee and lots of fun events for the community! Love that place

Reviews: We drove from Dorado to play at this course and absolutely loved it! The course has magnificent views and is well maintained. Staff are equally as awesome. The cherry on top was the wild tropical birds we saw while playing! 5 stars; For context, I'm a 16 handicap who golfs every other week at a nice public course on the east coast.  My wife is Puerto Rican and we vacation in Isabela every year.  You have to think about this course from a local perspective.  Conditions on the island are rough, from both weather and economy perspectives.  This is a public course in Puerto Rico.  It is not sustainable to keep a public course in pristine condition that only costs $25 to walk.  A few of the greens are in rough shape.  The fairways are not exactly carpet.  But the course is very playable, and the staff works hard to keep it that way.  Today I had a great time golfing here. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and accommodating.  The views along the coast are gorgeous.  The horses and iguanas and the odd item you didn't expect to see is just Puerto Rico and is part of the charm.  I don't know where else in the world you can golf on such a beautiful course right on the ocean for such a reasonable price. If you are expecting a U.S. private club-like experience, then you would be better off paying $250 a round to golf somewhere else on the island.; I love this lay out, buts its a bit beatup right now, the views are beutiful and when the wind blows its a very tough course, the only thing I didn't like was a 2 some in front of me I was walking and they were in a cart and I was on there tails the entire 9, they didn't have the decency to let me play threw.; Some of the best views golfing in Puerto Rico. There could be potholes on the greens and you'll still enjoy your round!; Played this course many times. Played it at times when you could barely call it a golf course and still enjoyed it! The staff is PROUD of this course and it's history and they try the best they can to keep it as good as they can with the money that they have... beautiful views!

Reviews: Nice Drinks!!!; My husband and I went for a promo for an apparent "Dredge Show."  We ordered an assortment as the activity began. They gave us The Most Disgusting Assortment on the Planet. And I wondered why there was no one eating. And I understood when they gave us the food. The surullitos looked like alcapurrias, Everything tasted like old oil, The mayo ketchup was damaged and the quantities were not uniform. It's like they've made us leftovers. I kindly went and handed it to him. The girl at the bar apologized a thousand times, but the girl in the kitchen, escorted by another girl, told me that Mayoketchup had frozen mayonnaise, that the surullitos were cinnamon and that the oil was from today. There are many businesses that fail but it is because of these types of situations where they disrespect them so blatantly that they make many from other towns not return. After almost 1 hour I asked for my receipt, but a girl told me she would give me the money back. It's a shame that you have to go through these types of situations.; ; ;

Reviews: Stevie looks absolutely fabulous after her appointment, I 100% recommend the Groom Club, Gabby is the sweetest & I felt so comfortable leaving my puppy with her. Thank you!!; My first time here was an amazing experience.  I took my very inquisitive dog Yoshi for a very overdue wash and cut, he looked wonderful!  The service here is out of this world. I definitely felt happy leaving him there. Thanks for all you do!; The service is excellent from the moment you call for orientation and booking. Gabi is very friendly and explains everything in detail, you can tell how much she loves what she does. She did a wonderful job and Coco turned out beautiful, just as I imagined! Definitely, Coco will be back!; We walked in without an appointment needing help with a dog we were rescuing. He needed a bath,  badly, as we were leaving the next morning back to the states.  Even though they were fully booked for the day,  they took in Tuco and did a fabulous job!! Thank you so much for your services! You all were so nice and accommodating for our situation!! Thank you again! The passion for what you do truly shines!!; I just moved back to the island and was looking for a place to take my 5 year old sheepadoodle,  Cora. I needed a place that could work with a dog that had previously been abused by a groomer. When we made the appointment I was very up front with my concerns and explained that though I've worked very hard for years to help Cora get past her fears and anxiety,  I was afraid that a new experience would be triggering and all our progress would go out the window. Gabby immediately assured me they would do everything they could to help, and explained they have experience working with difficult cases. She then went above and beyond by calling back to suggest we change the appointment to a day that the business is closed so there would be no rush or the stress of other people, dogs and noise.  Wow. Today was our appointment. She got the haircut exactly how I wanted on the first try, and most importantly, made sure that Cora felt at ease with her, taking the time to show her around and bond with her before getting to work. I am so grateful to have found this wonderful business that are experts in their craft and truly care about the animals they care for.  We found our groomer, for sure.  🧡

Oh, and fyi dennys restaurant on premise is good if you’re desperate, (a lot of deep fried in old oil options) you should  leave the property for better options.; I had a pleasant time here. The room was clean, and the AC was extremely cold, just how I liked it.  The service was awesome, and the front desk staff was very friendly. Good amount of parking and close to the front lobby and rooms. There's a great little casino inside, fun times! There's even a 24-hour Dennys restaurant inside the location.; Good location, very clean, good service. Has a Denny's in place. Some pool items like seats needs some fix or buy new ones. Also it was saturday in a very sunny day and the pool bar did not open. Apart from that is was a nice experience i will come back again.; When I turn on the hot water in the shower, I noticed an unusual noise coming from the toilet pipes (like as if pipes wanted to burst). Additionally, the toilet's flushing mechanism seemed to be malfunctioning, taking an unusually long time to complete the flush. I then noticed that the water in the tank was not filling properly and was potentially leaking into the toilet bowl, causing the continuous running of water.
The only thing they have to eat at the hotel is Dennys, and its not the greatest service nor food.

Reviews:
The cocktails were incredible, the atmosphere was amazing, and the owner was really cool. My friends and I went here on vacation and we all loved it here, the bartenders are fast & there wasn’t a drink we didn’t like. The theme was on point throughout the cocktail menu and decor, we will definitely be back!!; Charming and cozy speak-easy that is locally- owned and run. Creative, yummy drinks from a top-notch mixologist and fun, friendly service. And, I'm not just saying that because I'm related to them, I actually do mean it. Great little spot.; We had such a great time here today. Our plan was to stop on the way to the beach but the drinks, bartender, and company were so good we just stayed until dark. A must visit if you are anywhere near the area! (I was wondering what garnish is a unicorn. Turns out it's an actual cute plastic unicorn!); El Taller Speak Essay is more than just a bar; it’s a haven for cocktail enthusiasts and those seeking a unique culinary experience. The atmosphere is both chic and cozy, making it an ideal spot for both intimate gatherings and lively nights out.

The star of El Taller is undoubtedly Sylvia, the head bartender whose dedication to crafting exceptional cocktails is evident in every drink served. Sylvia's commitment to exploring new flavors and perfecting classic recipes sets her apart as the best mixologist in the area. Each cocktail is a testament to her skill and creativity, featuring a perfect balance of ingredients that delight the palate.

From the moment you take your first sip, it’s clear that Sylvia pours her heart into every creation. Her ability to blend unexpected flavors into harmonious, refreshing drinks is truly remarkable. Whether you're in the mood for a traditional cocktail or something entirely new, Sylvia’s menu offers a diverse range that caters to all preferences.

El Taller Speak Essay also excels in its culinary offerings. The menu is thoughtfully curated, featuring dishes that complement the outstanding drinks. The combination of expertly crafted cocktails and delicious food creates a dining experience that is both satisfying and memorable.

In conclusion, El Taller Speak Essay is a must-visit for anyone who appreciates great cocktails and innovative flavors. Sylvia’s dedication and expertise make her the best mixologist around, ensuring that every visit is a delightful adventure in taste.; I briefly saw someone mention this spot while doing my “what to do in PR” research. Their review didn’t do this place justice! & if I was a local, I’d gatekeep this gem too!!!

But no, everyone needs to meet Jean (the owner’s cousin) & experience his wonderful service, spot-on recommendations & great conversation.

They serve strong, smooth, carefully crafted cocktails. Best I’ve ever tasted in my 28 years of living!!! I’m a whiskey girly so the Pistón Roto was the star of the show for me!!! We also ordered Pink Cadillac & El Vocho (both veryyy delicious)

BONUS POINTS FOR HAVING UNA FRÍA VESTIDA DE NOVIA, made my Dominican Presidente-loving heart flutter ❤️

The host and hostess went above and beyond to be sure we enjoyed our time in Puerto Rico from their peaceful lovely home, to the spectacular views and wonderful food as well as plenty of entertainment. It was more than we could haves Imagined!
If you are looking for a relaxing and fun place all wrapped in one vacation, this is the place for you! You will not be disappointed!; This resort is amazing! The view is breathtaking and absolutely mesmerizing. From the time that you get there until the time that you leave, your soul, heart & mind are filled with the most memorable moments that you could ever have on a vacation. My husband, myself, and 2 other couples brought in New Year's 2023 at the PRX Club, and the owners Mike & Marisol treated us like kings & queens. The resort itself, both inside and out, is absolutely gorgeous. Every room is clean and decorated so beautifully. The food was also so delicious and plentiful. So, if you want a vacation in paradise, stay at the PRX Club with Mike & Marisol, and have the time of your life. You will be glad that you did!; WOW! We were treated like rock stars. From the moment we arrived, it felt like we were part of their family. Communication was amazing from the time we booked until we left. The big attraction was the peace and tranquillity this location offers. Although only an hour to the more populated San Juan, we never left the area - beaches, hiking, waterfalls, restaurants and more were minutes away. The porches, pool and 8 person hammock were some of the areas where we recharged. We will definitely be back. Hugs Mike and Marisol for an unforgettable, world-class experience😎💕🌴

Name: Parador Maunacaribe
Address: PR-901, Maunabo, 00707, Puerto Rico
Address Components: Puerto Rico 901 (route); Maunabo (locality); Emajagua (administrative_area_level_2); Maunabo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00707 (postal_code)
Reviews: Got a package deal for 3 days all inclusive, paid a little extra for front beach view. Place is nice but our room's A/C was not cooling, it was blocked off at 72 and in order to lower it the maintenance person has to come by and lower it, once lowered it can't be touched. Even at 65 we barely felt the difference. The beds are full size, luckly we had a twin airbed, because my 2 sons could not fit on one bed. The rooms only have 2 beds for 4 people. There is an ice bucket in the room, you need to pay 50 cents for that small bucket. Your not allowed to bring coolers to the site. The service is good, certain items on the menu are better than others, and the portions of some, mostly breakfast, are small. The location is ok but the beach other than to enter the water has nothing to offer. The pool is very nice and warm, its location is perfect, having the restaurant right next to it. They have pool tables that you have to pay to use. And what really bothered me was at the service desk they have a sign with the wifi name and password, when I was in my room, I could not find the wifi name, my son went to verify, and they told him wifi was only for the lobby and pool area, not for the rooms. These details made a great vacation into an average one.; Excellent weekend escape. No luxurious but it has all of what you need. They have and offer with all meals included but some web sites have other offers with only breakfast for less. The restaurant have a kind of basic menu but enough choices to satisfy anyone, good prices.; Great casual local vibe  place.  Very friendly staff.  Reasonable food...nothing fancy or specifically Puerto Rican.  But  if you want a nice-ish beach, great pool and  a  very relaxed place to stay this  is  it.  It has a very local vibe.....no Spas, no mainland attitude, and  no frills.  Clean rooms, decent  food on site ( but local options  around), great pool and fantastic staff.   I would  stay here again anytime  in the future.; One of the most beautiful places. It was in such a quiet and safe neighborhood. Local traditional restaurants were across the street as well as a convenience store. It felt like living in the community without the fast pace city and fancy hotels. Waves were a bit high though with boogie boards (from Walmart) my kids were out there for hours. Within a short distance is Carbilana Adventures. We rented ATV’s and Four wheelers. Our tour guard was well knowledgeable about the Rain Forest. We stopped for pic oops with amazing views, went swimming in a natural water spring and learned about various trees/plants. A restaurant/bar was on the premises which may it great place to chill with a frozen piinacolda or ice cold beer.  Back at at the resort I truly was blown away by the hospitality of staff especially Stebasion and the management. It was a great place to wind down without the hustle and bustle of being around other tourists. May not be for everyone but staying here allowed me and my family to just enough being with one another. ❤️🌴🍍; Great place! It’s a small but friendly city. It’s a good place to relax and share with friends or family not a lit to do around but beautiful landscapes

Name: El Patio Fusion Lounge
Address: Paseo del Plata Shopping Village Ave. Jose Efron Esquina, PR-696, Dorado, 00646, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours
Vicinity: Paseo del Plata Shopping Village Ave. Jose Efron Esquina, Puerto Rico 696, Dorado
Address Components: Puerto Rico 696 (route); Higuillar (sublocality_level_1); Dorado (locality); Higuillar (administrative_area_level_2); Dorado (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00646 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I hate posting negative reviews, but unless you already live in Dorado, this venue simply isn’t worth the drive.

This venue is merely a large tent set up inside a shopping center’s parking lot. That’s it. The sound is TERRIBLE unless you’re listening to electronic music. The heat is almost unbearable. If you pay for general entrance, be prepared to use a portable restroom with NO running water to wash your hands upon exiting (their “sinks” didn’t work despite ferociously pumping them with our feet). Their VIP bathroom was overflowing and the guests then had to turn to the general portable toilets to relieve themselves.

Also, this venue is divided several sections (some are very small, so beware of that). It was taking some guests longer to order a beer in the VIP bar compared to the general admission bar.

If this place has any intention of being permanent, here’s what I would recommend:
1. Improve the sound system.
2. Install proper bathrooms and sinks.
3. Install some ceiling fan underneath the large tent, to help with the ventilation.
4. Set up some ice-filled stands selling beer throughout the venue- a lot of people wanted to order a beer but had to stand in line half an hour behind guests ordering an array of mixed drinks. This makes the lines longer when you can have a simple beer stand that’ll solve that problem.
5. Create outside pathways that connect to the bars, so that your employees can transport ice and merchandise. It was very annoying (and can end up injuring someone) to have a supermarket carts full of stuff ramming between the crowds trying to get the ice/supplies to the bar. Incredibly, the carts were running through the crowds every ten minutes. There’s gotta be a better way to do this! 🤦🏼‍♀️

As a born and raised local, I’ll terribly miss venues like Vivo Beach Club because this simply isn’t it. It can keep its Dorado residents as customers, but we won’t be making the drive to this place again. Best of luck.; Great venue! Sound quality is amazing (brand new equipment) and lasers are super fun. I'd recommend bring earplugs tho...it's much louder than a lot of other venues I go to for edm.; New spot in Dorado, just opened. Opening night was an epic edm DJ show with Fisher. Great vibe. Great energy. Needed a place like this in Dorado. Has an indoor/ outdoor construct. Serves food and alcohol. Weird setup/ layout for VIP area and for the VIP Tables w/ bottle service- making it difficult to see lasers/ light show, is away from the speakers/bass, and a little challenging to be able to view the DJ. Also a little crowded in those areas due to allowing vip ticket holders to enter the bottle service areas. Feel like those issues are easy fixes and easily addressed. But overall, AMAZING to have a venue like this in Dorado, the concept itself is excellent. Opening night was incredible. A++; What can I say. I went to see Fisher and had the time of my life. The vibe was electrifying and friendly, strong drinks as well. Can't wait to go back!; Went for an event, Great place

Address Components: 301 (street_number); Puerto Rico 693 (route); Dorado Beach Resort & Club (neighborhood); Dorado (locality); Sabana (administrative_area_level_2); Vega Alta (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00646 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Everything looks good but there are small flaws. People drink by the pool and are loud. No one pays attention to it and the hotel regulations say otherwise. If you are with children I do not recommend. There one restaurant with eight tables is definitely not enough for this big resort. I waited for a chair for an hour and no one was interested in me waiting. Here the rule is whoever is faster is better. I will definitely not recommend this place to my friends and I will not come back here myself.; I've stood here in the past so I believe this is my 10th stay. The staff is excellent and very polite. There is a nice restaurant on the premise which is private not part of resort. A nice menu variety with reasonable prices.

The only draw back was a power outage on last night but this was not the resort
fault. There are occasional power outages throughout the Island. This resort has a generator but only to power reception desk. They are working on getting generators to power whole resort.; My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 days. The resort was beautiful as well as the beach. Drinks were yummy. The food was 5/10 for me. Not the best, I’d suggest driving elsewhere for food.

Our room was gorgeous and spotless! When you first drive into the resort, the hotel looks worn down but the inside will amaze you. Definitely going back with our kids next time.

The views are amazing when you’re on the top floors. We were on floor #6. We even saw horses wandering around at night. Beautiful stay.; This place is great!  Great pool, clean rooms, nice 🏖️ beach. Maybe I am little but spoiled of traveling but it would be great if the hotel had someone at the front door to welcome you when you arrive and help with your language. This is little extra service would make the entire experience top notch. Also the restaurant is nice and convenient serving local favorites and good drinks.; We stayed there for a couple nights on last minute notice, The hotel staff was exceptional some of the best I have ever seen. Sorry I am forgetful with names but the pool security guard who worked the night on the 10/8 and both the male Bartender's who worked the evenings on the 10/8 and 10/9 went all above and beyond expected of them in terms of customer service.

The whole resort is so amazingly beautiful! I was truly in heaven! Thank you for allowing us to extend our stay, I was truly impressed! Will definitely be back.; I didn’t stay at the hotel but I had a meal and a spa treatment. It’s the most beautiful spa I’ve seen in my life. It’s divided by genders so you can feel comfortable if you don’t want to wear any clothes. The masseuse was great and I had a great time.; We had the most spectacular time enjoying our honeymoon at the Ritz. Prior to our trip, the team helped us organize flowers and chocolate strawberries in the room, as well as a breathtakingly special meal under the spa Banyan tree. One manager, Glory, was so special and gifted us the most beautiful artwork to commemorate our time. The attention to detail is special and so is the team, across the house.

Reviews:
Amazing playground, basketball court, pickleball courts, and much more including an area to play in sand and a small waterpark.

They have recently revamped the Hangar, improving playground equipment, adding a lot of fun games and toys upstairs, but sadly taking down all the information about Livingston Park.

I highly recommend Hangar Park to kids up to 12 years old. Even after then there still is lots of fun to be had at the Hangar.; I had a great time here there is a large pool with a zip line into it and there is also a Pickleball court. There is also a playground for little kids and some fun slides into the pool. There are also basketball courts. This is a great place to go for sports if you don’t want to go to bed there on our beach sports hub; Fun playground and pool for the kiddos, and interesting history lesson for the adults too (see attached photo with information about Amelia Earhart's visit to Dorado right before her disappearance!); A great spot for kids to hang out including a swing set, pool, beach area, basketball hoop, and a mini museum about aviation and the history of flying.; Awesome place to take the kids if you live at Dorado Beach East. Very peaceful, kids are well behaved... it looks like a vacation place for kiddos but in your own community.

Name: Embassy Suites by Hilton Dorado del Mar Beach Resort
Address: 201 Dorado Del Mar Blvd, Dorado, 00646, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 201 (street_number); Dorado Del Mar Boulevard (route); Higuillar (sublocality_level_1); Dorado (locality); Higuillar (administrative_area_level_2); Dorado (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00646 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Overall it is okay, the rooms are pretty dated and hasn't been updated in a while. It's similar to other hiltons I've stayed at on the island. The location I don't feel is ideal as it's pretty far off the highway. I'd prefer to stay in San Juan. They have a nice happy hour where they offer free drinks and snacks. Pool was pretty big and cool looking. Not much of a beach.; A bunch of hidden fees. Be prepared to pay a lot more than expected once arriving. For example a $155 resort fee $200 deposit $14 a day to park and a bunch of other fees. Food is expensive so bring your own. Your better off going to an all inclusive. Room was muggy and hot. The AC was broken. I called down multiple time requesting someone looks at it. Someone came up once and left and never came back. We had to sleep with our neck fans. We made the best of our 5 day stay but I don’t not recommend.; Really liked staying here, but the hotel needs a MAJOR update. You can smell that it's old if that makes any sense. The rooms are so out of date, bathrooms need to be redone, & carpets need replacing as well. The view is amazing, though. I loved being able to walk right to the beach. Staff overall were super friendly 10/10.; We had a great time at this hotel. The staff  was  very friendly and very accommodating to our needs.
Breakfast every day was excellent and very delicious. We highly recommend this hotel.; The scenery and view was great! My kids enjoyed the pool mainly, wish they had more kid friendly activities but I guess that would be asking for too much. I wouldn't mind staying at this hotel again. I didn't expect much for the rooms for the most part, in the end, had a good stay and nobody complained about much.

Reviews:
Visited the Casino on a Sunday close to 2pm. Went to the bar and asked for a bottle of sparkling wine. A very courteous waitress told me there was no bartender that I needed to wait until 4pm for the purchase. When she asked the Manager in turn, they rather not make the sale instead of finding a way. Glad I’m visiting, cause I couldn’t be a regular customer with this type of attention.; I’ve been to most casinos on the island, and usually I come out even or down a little because the payoff percentages seem to be better, at blue dolphin, I never got any good hits, or even got into the bonuses. The machines seemed extremely tight, all high volatility machines, the place itself was extremely clean, and a very pleasant environment. Just don’t expect to win.there.
I only played the slot machines. They also have card tables and roulette.; Great Casino, there you have a great time. The employees are really Awesome.🔥🔥; SMALL BUT FUN WITH MUSIC & NEWER MACHINES & NOT CROWDED. PEOPLE WERE VERY KIND & WE FELT SAFE!; What a fun night at the casino! The staff are truly friendly and accommodating. Huge shout out to Danelys, who coordinated our event so smoothly! Our group had an amazing time, and we all agree that Blue Dolphin is an amazing addition to entertainment in Dorado!

Name: The Ritz Carlton Reserve SPA Botánico
Address: 100 Dorado Beach Drive, Dorado, 00646, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 100 (street_number); Dorado Beach Drive (route); Higuillar (sublocality_level_1); Dorado (locality); Higuillar (administrative_area_level_2); Dorado (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00646 (postal_code)
Reviews:
The grounds are absolutely beautiful and our massages were wonderful. Javier has great hands and he delivered a much needed deep tissue massage. Lucy gave my husband one of the best massages he has ever had! I like the foot scrub before the massage too. Nice touch. I wanted to give Botánico five stars but there were some issues. It’s hard to find. Waze guided us to the wrong entrance. We were able to find the correct entrance and there were few signs guide us to the spa. The signs were also very small. Once we were in the vicinity, it was unclear where to park. We asked a guard who told us where to park and said to come back to him and he would direct us. He directed us to a ballroom, not the spa! Despite the detour we arrived. The spa has a beautiful entrance with a gigantic ancestral-looking tree shading the stairway and entrance. The staff was gracious and served a yummy herbal iced tea while we waited to be taken to our massage room. The showers, relaxation room and locker room have everything you could need. The biggest fail, however,  is the lack of people when you need them. It’s difficult to find staff if you want something or have an issue. When the cool dip pool step broke when I stepped on it, there was no one around to tell. Luckily, I was holding on to the rail otherwise I would have fallen and hit my head on a rock like surface! The staff person I told asked if I was okay and I told her I was, however, no management came to check on me. I will have a bruise on my foot from the impact but overall I am okay. The service people we interacted with were great, however, for a large resort it’s staffed as if it’s a small resort. The food took an hour and 15 minutes to arrive. We were told 45-60 minutes. If we go again, we will know how to get there and what to expect. I think we had high expectations because it is the Ritz Carlton but the overall experience was mediocre at best, unsafe at worst.; The Ritz is the ritz. Here’s my opinion:

- You can’t beat the ritz. It’s a 10/10 every time you go
- Service is always top notch
- amenities are always great quality and plentiful
- The property is beautiful

Here are my considerations, for folks who frequent Marriott properties:

For context, during my 3 night stay in Puerto Rico, I did one night at the Marriott Casino, one night at the St Regis, and our last night at the Ritz Reserve.

By and large, if I came again, I’d probably lean towards the St. Regis. As the name suggests, the service / hospitality / amenities / etc. are 12/10, which should come as no surprise.

Where it edges out over the reserve, is that if you have status with Marriott (we have Ambassador), you get a better bang for your buck with the St Regis in the way of upgrades

The ritz reserve being somewhat of a hot commodity, it’s a little more difficult to flex or get any recognition for your status (given they are 1 of 7)

Here’s my advice:
If you’ve never spent the night at the ritz reserve, do it. It’s worth the experience for certain. But don’t sleep on the St. Regis either

Both have exceptional resorts that are perfect for relaxation.; Visit this spa everything I'm in PR. It is worth the drive and worth the prices. The facilities are outstanding, staff are discreet and professional and the service providers are excellent. Body treatment, facial, you really can't go wrong. Attaching a pic of the reflecting pool in the public part of the spa.; I don’t have the vocabulary to describe our exceptional experience at this spa. I am back home now googling for a comparable spa for our next vacation because we can’t keep coming back to Dorado beach from Canada for the Spa right? Not that the resort wasn’t great but we would like to try different destinations. Anyway about the Spa, from the massive tree before the entrance through to the open relaxation area, then the private male or female area with pool, cold plunge, sauna, indoor relaxation area & dressing rooms to the private oasis were we experienced our couples tamarind bodyscrub and massage….everything felt like a world class experience. I’ll never see a spa the same way again!
Tips:
If you have a service booked get there an hour early then plan to stay later. I should have planned to spend about 4 hours total but we had other thing booked which we almost canceled.
You don’t need to have a service booked to use the spa, you can pay to enjoy the facility.; An experience like no other! Yes I have been to beautiful luxury spas but nothing like this. I love how you are completely immersed in the outdoors. Very grounding, beautiful experience. I will probably go back to Puerto Rico just to visit this spa.

Reviews: This is by far the best hostel I have ever stayed at. It’s quiet, well kept and clean. The beds are soft and the sheets smell amazing. I told them I was gluten free and they made special pancakes just for me. If I’m ever in the area again I will absolutely stay here.; I was broken down on the road one night, called this place and the owner picked me up.  Who has ever heard of this, Seriously?  The place was Super clean, in a nice area, quiet.  The beds and pillows were super comfortable, and by the way, did i mention it was cheap?  What about the  hot and freshly cooked Breakfast in the morning?  I was just Amazed at how i was treated.  I highly recommend this place and would stay here in a heartbeat.  Thank you for the Awesome experience, i will never forget it.; First time sleeping in a hostel and I absolutely loved it. Hansel makes you feel like you're among friends. The rooftop is nice to eat dinner, there is free breakfast, and cute decor. Wonderful experience. Name: RP TACTICAL TRAINING CENTER
Address: Arecibo Gun Club, Barrio Juncos, Arecibo, 00612, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 2:00 – 6:00 PM; Thursday: 2:00 – 6:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 PM
Vicinity: Arecibo Gun Club, Barrio Juncos, Arecibo
Address Components: Arecibo Gun Club (point_of_interest); Barrio Juncos (route); Marcos Soto (neighborhood); Arecibo (locality); Hato Arriba (administrative_area_level_2); Arecibo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00612 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I visit this place frequently. Ample field with many stages to train. So far this is the only place were you can take various training methods. Ranging from simple firearm handling and movement to more advanced scenarios such as night time shooting. The trainer, Rolando makes his priority to ensure that you perform the necessary tasks, regardless of expertise and feel safe while executing them. His assistants are also very kind, full of knowledge and willing to help. Range is always clean and well kept. Basically, the perfect place!; A shooting range with everything you need for practice very clean and organized ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️; I have taken several trainings with these instructors and each time they are more excellent, more professional and more informative.  As I said in other comments...you are tired of the normal shooting range, shooting at static cards and you are looking for something different; contact them.  They are true professionals, always with security present at all times and you learn in "real life". They are something very different from what you see out there and best of all they are accessible at all times since the field is located in the Arecibo area...which is close to people with weapons in the nearby towns.  Come train with real situations and with real professionals; They won't regret it.

Grateful for the knowledge they give me in each training...

Mr. August; I have taken courses with my 12-year-old son with RP Security & NRA Firearms and they are excellent. Instructor Rolando is a professional and dedicated to what he does. It instructs you correctly how to use a firearm and how to use it in different situations and scenarios that you could face in real life.💯💯💯💪💪💪👍👍👍⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐; Thank you for the experience where I learned many things that I did not know about firearms and I hope to have more when I continue taking the classes and practices with you, thank you DLB
Angel J. Ocasio

Address Components: Calle Jose Adorno (route); Arecibo Pueblo (sublocality_level_1); Arecibo (locality); San Luis (administrative_area_level_3); Arecibo (administrative_area_level_2); Arecibo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00612 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This small café offers a wonderfully chill vibe and a clean environment, making it a delightful spot to relax. We were pleasantly surprised by the exceptional chai—it’s perfectly balanced, blending seamlessly with the milk for a smooth taste that isn’t overly sweet. My husband’s cortado was also excellent. We’re impressed by the quality of their drinks and the friendly service. We’ll definitely be returning!; You will not be disappointed! Fresh, delicious, healthy, and personable. We came here almost every day. The food will bring you back again and again! The people here will make you a patron for life!; We got a cortado and a chai latte. Both were delicious. The chai is probably the best chai i’ve ever had. The vibe is really nice, the decorations are cute and the place is clean. Really nice small cafe to sit down and eat with family and friends.; You have to get the dirty chai!! But all the coffee is amazing. We actually came twice, once for an afternoon coffee and a second time for breakfast. All the food was amazing and the carrot cake was 10/10.; One of the best services, atmosphere, quality of food we’ve ever had. Hidden gem in Arecibo. We were lucky to have Gaby or Gabriel as our server. Beyond expectations. Sweet, smart, impeccable service.

We had the omelette with vegetables and potatoes and revoltillo with vegetables and bagette. (I didn’t take pics of that)  Latte with oatmeal was superb.

Thanks so much for providing such an excellent experience.

Name: Arecibo Inn
Address: PR-2, Santana, Arecibo 00612, Puerto Rico
Address Components: Puerto Rico 2 (route); Santana (locality); Santana (administrative_area_level_2); Arecibo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00612 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Hotel is clean.
Nice pool, plus they have a kids pool
Have a pizza restaurant in the hotel.
Plenty of parking spots
Ice machine
Breakfast include
Beautiful lobby
Laundry room..Washer and dryers
Relaxing seat to have a peaceful moments
Front desk clerks super nice
Safe to travel solo.; Things I wish people would outline straight up so here it is:

Our deluxe two queen bed room did not have a coffee maker and microwave.

The main lobby had the microwave and coffee vending machine. Coffee is NOT complimentary as it cost $2. Free tea but no water in the kettle.

NO ELEVATORS and all the rooms are on the second floor so be mindful of your baggage. Steep stairs so be careful on the way up.

Shower: no door. So place the towels so the water doesn’t get out.

Some good channel options on the TV

Good working AC

Vanity/hand sink has no counter space room to place anything so limit items in top of the sink.

Free parking but limited at the front of the building but they have parking in the back.

No gym of course.

Location is convenient. A pharmacy right across the street pretty much.

Breakfast is next door at the Marcos pizza building which you can access through the inside of the main lobby.

One outlet in the entire room hiding behind the night stand between both beds.

Bed sheets: pretty old and stained and who knows. I just hope they are clean. It’s the mattress a bed sheet, another bed sheet to cover yourself with so there are not too many layers.

Pillows stained as well. Just one pillow cover and again feels naked.

They do provide a small conditioner, shampoo and lotion and hand soap.

Four large towels, one for the floor, two small hand towels and two pool towels.

Two rolls of toilet paper and two small trash cans.

Of course NO key fob. Plain normal door key.

They provided us with three pillows for each bed and one “comforter”.; I rented the villa for a five day stay to spend some time with my mother for her birthday. The staff was very polite and welcoming the entire place was clean it may not be modern but that’s not what we came for. I loved the villa and the friendly staff (I’m from New York City so you know morning and afternoon greetings are not common to me) overall everything was perfect I will definitely come again this place is very nice .; People being harsh on the place need to set their expectations realistically. This isn't a high end Hyatt or Marriott property. This is a private owned local hotel that is better than many cheap hotels in the states.

Really enjoyed my work stay for 2 nights while in town for a work seminar. Staff was super helpful and friendly overall, and I actually enjoyed my recently updated Ground floor room.

Not all rooms have outside windows, and mine didn't, however it was QUIET, had plenty of space, great modern furnishings, and ice cold AC.

Looking forward to my next trip. For those concerned,  ask for an updated room and for ground floor to take advantage of the cooling advantages!; Needed a hotel that accepts dogs...they were perfect! Rooms were clean, shower was amazing and the dogs were happy with the king size bed

Much success and prosper to the entire staff!; Super convenient and amazing breakfasts for on the go. Staff is so friendly and chat with you as if you’re long time friends. We tried their tres leches which was super sweet and hit the spot. Definitely a stop to add to your list.; Delicious Place!  We found it when staying in Arecibo and had dessert there every evening and breakfast every morning!  We would call in a breakfast sandwich order in the morning before heading out to explore the area.  Their sandwiches are scrumptious.  And their sweets are to die for!

Name: Club Brava
Address: Fairmont Hotel, 6063 Av. Isla Verde, Carolina, 00979, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 10:00 PM – 5:00 AM; Friday: 11:00 PM – 5:00 AM; Saturday: 11:00 PM – 5:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Vicinity: Fairmont Hotel, 6063 Avenida Isla Verde, Carolina
Address Components: Fairmont Hotel (point_of_interest); 6063 (street_number); Avenida Isla Verde (route); Cangrejo Arriba (sublocality_level_1); Carolina (locality); Cangrejo Arriba (administrative_area_level_2); Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00979 (postal_code)
Reviews: Brava is hands down one of the best clubs I’ve been to! From the moment you walk in, the energy is electric, and the atmosphere is top-notch. The service is exceptional—the staff is friendly, attentive, and always making sure you have a great time. We booked a table, and I have to say, it was one of the most comfortable setups I’ve experienced in a club. The seating was spacious, and the perfect height to enjoy the music and vibe without feeling cramped. Whether you’re dancing or just chilling with your friends, the setup makes the whole experience even better. Can’t wait to come back!; Club Brava is definitely a place where you want to dress to impress. While it’s okay to go for a more casual look, just be aware that they don’t allow shorts or flip-flops—luckily, I checked their website ahead of time, so I knew what to expect. The locals really bring their A-game when it comes to style, and the vibe of the club reflects that. I had a nice time, and it was great knowing I was dressed appropriately for the occasion. Make sure to check the dress code before you go so you can enjoy the night without any surprises!; I had a fun time at Club Brava, especially with their VIP service. The staff was super attentive, and the experience felt really special. One tip, though—make sure to talk to the VIP managers beforehand to confirm that the area you’re getting has enough space for your group. It can get crowded, so you’ll want to ensure everyone’s comfortable. Overall, the night was fantastic, and I’ll definitely be coming back for more VIP nights!; I hit up 3 clubs while in Puerto Rico, and Club Brava was hands down the best. The vibes were unmatched, and it wasn’t super expensive either. The whole experience was amazing—definitely coming back!; this is probably one of my favorite places to visit in PR for dancing and being around Boricuas... they know how to party! very important, do your diligence in researching their rules of dress code and what days are best for us 21+ people. I went friday and saturday and had a blast... thursdays are for younger crowds 18+ every day is a different vibe. I love reggaeton so saturday was everything :). I called and asked the vip managers for all the info i needed and they were very helpful in making sure I got exactly what i was looking for in my experience. I enjoyed being around the local crowds and loved the fact they actually dance here!

Address: PR-2 Km 84.2, Hatillo, 00659, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: Km 84.2 (subpremise); Puerto Rico 2 (route); Hatillo (locality); Carrizales (administrative_area_level_2); Hatillo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00659 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Never stocked with the products that are readily available at other local stores. Ridiculous floor management. Lines are never monitored for common sense traffic, flow and customer experience. The company in general does not give PR members equal service to the mainland members. Online merchandise and shipping not available either.; I did not renew my membership due to the store not having enough parking and the lines 3 to 4 of them always reaching halfway to the back of the store. I went several times at different hours and days and still long lines, I didn’t even dare to shop on Friday and Saturday knowing how many people show up Sunday to Thursday. Maybe you need more employees to address this problem so the clientele don’t have to stand in line for an hour or more.; I bought cellphone charging cables last night but somehow forgot them in the cart or in the store. I was there at the very end of closing. It sucks bc they are $22. They have very limited organic options. I was disappointed by that. Anyways, I have been trying to call the store but their number doesn’t pick up. I am not surprised. Why have a telephone number that just beeps all the time? Answer your phones please.; Sams at this location is advertising fries and chicken tenders and I ordered fries at the Cafe app!

Guess what! They did not had fries and wanted me to go to customer service made the long line. So I asked for a different item of equal value since it was not worth make the line at customer service, and had cold food on my return to the table.

The lady at the cafe had an attitude and said she could not do that and call a manager. After explaining what we wanted we did not needed the money back, we could have had a soda or something equal value they said NO and wanted me to do a line.

Customer service provided by the manager and employee was deficient and not to the standard of care as other Sam's in USA main land.

There needs to be options if I purchase something and is not available it should said so in the app. They are not doing the job properly and are managing customer care poorly.

I do not recommend this store and won't be shopping here never again.

This would not had happened in USA or Costco!; Temperatures are checked on the way in. Shelves are stocked but the crazy check out lines were a problem. Lines passed the isles into the clothing section. Not enough cashiers open and the flow was not efficient. We spent nearly an hour in the store most of which was waiting in line...to buy water... that's it. Oh then you have to wait in a line to check out pass security to exit as they rescan pretty much everything again and verify it against your receipt. I understand they're controlling theft but there has to be a more efficient. Maybe more than two people can do the job at the same time.

Address Components: 1st Street (route); Hatillo (locality); Hatillo (administrative_area_level_2); Hatillo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00659 (postal_code)
Reviews: I've been a customer for years of planet fitness. Finally came the time I could come with my son but sadly I started a new job that didn't let me workout as I wanted. I started to bring my son but they didn't let him workout alone. So they told me that he was able to come alone when he turn 16 y/o. I had paid the annual fee previous month, and asked for a refund. The person told me they don't do refunds but if I come next year (August 2024) they could honor the payment for the year. I wrote so some administrator call me but that didn't happened. I came as were told and now they say they are not going to honor that that I need to pay again. This company doesn't appreciate their customers. They can see all this in their system and can see I pay for no service last year. You doesn't supposed to treat your customers like that. I pay the monthly payments the yearly payment, the gas for a 30 mins trip to my nearest planet fitness and you are not able to honor something you see I paid. That's ashamed. This was Arecibo, PR. And I came from using your clubs since I was living in NC.; I came to P.R. for vacactions and decided to stop at this PF Hatillo. I wishhhh this was the standard accross planet fitness in Colorado. Specifically Colorado Springs. The staff the music. everything was enjoyable and makes you wanna go back to the gym. I think corporate PF should look into this.; Clean and well cared for ….. The best in PR ..; Very neat and clean. Employees awesome; Little overseeing of the proper use of the facilities by staff. There's a 30 min workout area which some people are not using as instructed and are hogging the machines. Most discouraging.

-Cubano
-Breakfast sandwich
-Montecristo
-Bori Ham Grilled Cheese
-Cappuccino
-Latte

Everything was amazing! The mallorca bread was so soft and the sourdough was on point.
They have tables on the side if you want to eat there.; Do not miss this unassuming food trailer on the side of PR-2 in Hatillo. Their amazing artisan bread and baked goods are freshly made with love each day. Excellent coffee. Large portion sizes for the price. I suggest trying the Bori ham and grilled cheese, the breakfast sandwich and make sure you go early so you can grab one (or, in my case-two) of their giant chocolate chip cookies-they are legendary.; Super yummy, small batch baked goods! Their bread is the best tasting artisan bread I've ever had. And their prices are great (specially if you compare them to similar shops in the metropolitan area); Delicious food, bread, and danish.  You have to get there early, they sell out fast!
