Reviews:
Review In English & Review in Spanish

This is truly a great place to eat healthy with great flavor!
Never before, eating healthy was so tasty!!! They serve a variety of healthy choices from "shakes", Waffles, "Bolydonuts" (this is so incredible as it is difficult for me to describe how great it is!!!), The curious thing is, even there are many Herbal Life franchise stores, each of them has their own touch. For example, this store, has what I call the small Nutribowl size, which is great for those like my girlfriend who doesn't need More than 24 onces to eat. Also, it's sooo good!!! Theirs is very thick!!
Living and eating healthy has never been so tasty! Practically my daily dinner is a Nutri Bowl in the afternoons. They have more than 30 flavors and I think I've tried them all. Take advantage of the seasonal flavor: Pumpkin Flavor with Cinnamon.
They will remember me.
All of these Herbal Life stores have great quality and flavor. However, each of them is distinguished by the special touch of those who prepare the products, drinks and meals. They have Waffles, bolydonuts, smoothies, Nutribowls, Mega tea, detox, among others.

In this particular store, the Nutribowl stands out. It is the location with the smallest Nutribowl version (approximately 24 ounces); which is perfect for those who are satisfied with less quantity. It is very thick and tasty.

If you want to feel like VIP definitely purchase the shared table tickets. You get all you can drink vodka and tequila. Its definitely worth to get there early so you can grab a seat. There might be 20 other people in the area. The dance floor looks small but definitely was jumping. Can't wait to go back.; Club V!!! The notorious end to Travel Week concluded with a real big bang. The club was filled with hundreds of eclectic suppliers and advisors, and the open bar was a true sensation. I’m not sure how the club operates normally or what the usual vibe is like, but the private event truly elevated the experience.; This was my first time here. We were celebrating my birthday. The DJ was great. The music was great. The customer service was good. The dance floor is small. We danced the night away. I recommend this nightclub.; Bartenders and the promoters are cool. DJ is good some nights when they know how to mix and not replay songs. Don’t celebrate your birthday or any event here. Club is mostly empty.  If you’re in your 20s don’t come here. Mostly older people in their late 30s and 40s. Barely anybody reserves tables bc it’s so empty. Around 12 the dance floor will be packed but nobody in sections. Which is weird only like some girls who get promoter sections. Party somewhere else seriously. It’s not worth it otherwise.

I have a BIG problem with security. They are liars and incompetent. You’ve been warned. Good luck partying here; I recently stayed at Aria and everyone at hotel told me to go check out the night club. So me and my friend but we were treated so bad by this woman who was a security person, she called us
Thieves because of a piece of paper someone offered us that we didn't know we were supposed to have and to make it worse it was my birthday. I didn't get her name but she is white, works with security and very rude. This happened on Saturday night October 5th, 2024. You really don't have to be rude to people, you just have to let them the procedures.

Name: Exótico Nightclub
Address: 1255 W Ave I, Lancaster, CA 93534, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: Closed; Friday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 1255 (street_number); West Avenue I (route); Lancaster (locality); Los Angeles County (administrative_area_level_2); California (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 93534 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I love Exotico , I love the people , I love the music . Everyone is so friendly and make you feel welcome it’s hands down the best night club in Lancaster if you’re around in the area I recommend you swing by and have a couple drinks , enjoy the drag show on Saturdays .; Best of the Bestest, great music , The DJ is awesome. great service,  You will have a good time.  Lots of fun. I recommend 💯; Looking for a fun and entertainment? Exotico has you covered.
Upon arrival on Saturday evenings expect to pay a $15 cover charge pre person. One may think this maybe steep for Lancaster, but keep in mind on Saturdays you will have several drag queen performances. This is not a free show and performers need to be paid as they should be.
You can however get on their guest list by signing up on website. Entry will be free before 10pm if you do so.
Our Saturday night had 4 amazing drag performances. Please remember to tip your queens they work hard. That night there was also a special guest that performed, a up and coming new rap artist. She was also amazing.
They have a fully stocked bar, and let me tell you their mix drinks are nothing to play with. Holy hell our go to bartender of choice (btw they are all great bartenders) was Edwin. The drinks run on average $10 but they are not weak and worth it. Buyers beware lol. If you want something more tame order a Pina colada, and stay away from the AMF. To soak up all your drinks they have tacos $2 each, quesadillas I believe $5, and hot dogs I believe $5 in the outdoor area. Plenty of seating inside and out. Along with 1 pool table outside. The club has been drama free all the times we have attended. You have a mix crowd of all. All are welcomed no matter what your into. They have security which are strapped, a nice feel just in case some psycho wants to start anything.
The establishment looks to be well kept and clean, no trash or butt smell of sewer to be found. They have 2 bathrooms that always seemed to be fully stocked each time I had to release my toxic drinks.
The dj played a variety of music. Music was at a perfect vol. Music quality was great, meaning all equipment sound as it was working properly, no blown out speakers or about to blow out sounds.
They have a vip section/ bottle service. Bartender told use it runs $160, if that is something your into.
The gogo dancer are friendly and entertaining. They will perform for all. You can also tip them if you want a better feel/view.
Another bonus they had was gum to buy! Thank God! A pack runs $2 for orbit gum. Best buy of the night. I had major cotton mouth and the last thing I want is to be associating with people while having dragon's breath.
The only Con I can give are the shot/jello shooters that one may find when a server/ cocktail waitress walks around with. They run $3 each, about a 1 oz. chemistry tube vile. Mine tasted like pure 7up. I bought 4 and my other party members said the same about their. I would not purchase again.

Recommendation (if allowed): not to sure if sold but I did not see any for sale are condoms. Yes maybe we should bring our own however one doesn't always get lucky and I don't want to carry a box of rubbers, when I have a phone, credit card, a wad of ones for tipping and the list goes on. Just a suggestion as other LGBT clubs I have been to had them. Some for free at that but I would not mind paying.

Overall, Exotico is our local go to. I would recommend to all friends. Even my straight friends! as long as one is open minded and comfortable step on into Exotico I guarantee you will have a great night. The vibes are always positive, friendly and welcoming.
Fyi we always take ubers to and from, never had a issue not getting one. On average it cost us $12 each way for us.

Till next time.... and ready to always play safe ;); Drove up to Lancaster to check this spot out … Especially because the owner is a dj who used to play in Bakersfield &  when we can gotta show support  to the Latinos leveling up. Just sharing my my first time there . -.- The place has a 15$ cover which in my opinion Isn’t too crazy. I get it we all gotta make a coin. But according to the signs I did read 10$ for re-entry?  The Parking lot is directly in the back of the club which seems to be part of a shopping plaza . The parking lot isn’t well lit & that falls on the entire plaza but now that exótico opened :) the parking lot on the club side should sorta match the energy inside ? Could use more lighting and clean up. Once inside the club looks nice and the setup looks very modern and I would even compare it to those big popular clubs  on a smaller scale of course . Especially the lighting on the dance floor is very well executed. The drinks are not overpriced and staff was attentive & over all the ambient is very welcoming . Music wise . Top tier . All types of Music with a special touch from owner/dj. . Outside they have a patio where they sell food and have a pool table and the patio looks very well kept.  Restrooms are clean. Very private .  One thing to note they don’t allow alcoholic drinks outside . I was geeked to be in a new spot and I failed to read the sign … security guard came up to us  in a very serious tone . We couldn’t have them outside & there was a table by the door for us to leave them at. I apologized and explained it was my first time . Won’t happen again… as he leaves he comments something under his breathe . Earlier  I just had finished ordering a drink and stepped to the side to wait for my party and apparently a rough 3 taps on the elbow and a mean mug is the way to move patrons out of his way.  I figured it’s his job to be vigilant but when it came to the ladies he was all smiles and chuckles and his hospitality was top tier  .  I don’t need to u have conversation with me but hey don’t make feel unwelcome especially when your the authority of the night . Through out the night i noticed he was mean mugging at some and with others no.  Which I’m sure he can care less … since I  over heard him say these jobs are just temp till he gets a call back from where he actually wants to work.  Drag show was great ! Best part ! Some say shows run long but hey an lgbt friendly spot isn’t true if they don’t have these amazing queens.  Over all I’ll definitely be back. I recommend checking it out .; I like the vibe and the people.  The only gripe I have is that the dj doesn't pay whole songs (kinda important when you're line dancing), and the music is so loud you can't even talk to the bartenders.  People are going to end up with hearing damage.

Reviews: I would give this place 0 stars if I could. I called to put an order in and the person on the phone said “no” And hung up. So I decided to go in person and when I got there I was met by a sad looking cook that should not be in the hospitality business. 0 manners and a strong will to be irascible. “Look it up” I’m telling everyone I know to stay away from here. I heard this was a good place to come to but sadly it’s not. Stay away… don’t come here.; Very nice place . Great music and great people,. Very friendly place and great food. The Red Snapper is also very big and tasty, arguably the best value item on the menu; Delicious food. Nice and breezy dining area ( in December). Fairly priced. Super nice staff.

The food was really good but I'm not gonna lie, that piña colada was the highlight. Great job.; Stopped in for lunch.  Excellent staff and good food and prices. Great fish tacos. But this is not the first time there. I gotta say if you’re in the area definitely need to check out this place.

My favorite was the coconut old fashioned, made with homemade bourbon aged in a coconut by the owner, as well at the In the Pink spicy watermelon drink. Vibe was great and owner was so great to us. Not a gentleman's club, more like a mad max cyber punk vibe. So if your looking for a wild ride, go for it. The girls are average so don't get too excited, but then again, they make up for it with zero discretion.; I got to this place after 930pm. Lights everywhere were on. Some cars in the parking lot. It's apparently open later at night. Pumping after 11pm.

Girls are nice but not a very ample selection. Barbie bartender is great. Very friendly and professional. She's awesome. I appreciate the time I spent there.; This place is a joke!! It’s like being in a fast food place for a strip club.  Understandably the girls are there to make money.  But the way they go about it. They are vultures!! No class no style. Real bad vibes in there!   Almost life threatening vibes; For What It is 4.5 should be fair.  Girls are cool some think they are the bomb which money will tell otherwise...  Good Many many time there in the old days now good boy for good.  Old days would come back if otherwise.  Try it out  you tell me..

The food was excellent and they gave us on the house a really delicious soup of " pollo, salchichon, jamon y sausage". I really recommend this place, the owner which are the attendants are very friendly and attentive. #10rate; The chicken wings are awesome! Also, the Kan Kan pork chops are delicious. Karaoke nights are good and happy hour is from 8pm to 6am on weekends. It can get crowded. Only 2 pool tables.; It is a very nice quiet place with a view. They make the best Mojito’s  and pina colada’s on the island. this is my fifth visit to Puerto Rico and I have not found a better Mojito anywhere. Staff is very friendly.. The Drinks prices are half of what you will find in town at local tourist spots. I highly recommend this place! Drink up and enjoy!; The best and my favorite spot to go to, the food is awesome the drinks are awesome and atmosphere is awesome also the service is perfect 👍; Great drinks and great people, love the karaoke, great time; Nice place for some cool beers and home made shots..

Name: Aqua Marina Beach Club, Inc
Address: 556 Black Eagle Rd, Rincón, 00677, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM

Reviews:
Great service, scenery, and staff here! Had a big group with variety of drinks (shots, frozen, mixed). My Caribbean guilty pleasure drink, a Mudslide, was phenomenal. Especially for not having ice cream in it. Grace was an excellent bartender!! Top notch h and knows her stuff and way around a bar. Swim up pool bar was perfection!! Music was upbeat and not too loud. Food was delish. Great spot after the beach.; Grace is the best bartender ever. This is a really great spot. Hidden gem.  Check it out but only if you want to have a SUPER good time! The pool and swim up bar is the absolute best.; Had a great weekend here with a group of friends in June 2024.  The place is a 1 min walk to a beautifully calm beach with great swimming, paddleboarding and any other watersports you want.  I think there was even snorkeling trips right off the beach.

The place is totally remodeled and a great environment.
The rooms are cleaner than most 5 star hotels in the states!  I am a bit of a clean freak and I was totally comfortable in the room...not even dust bunnies in the corners!
The staff was amazing and 100% committed to the guests.

Great pool with a swim up bar.

If you are looking for a getaway, this is definitely the place!; What a great spot! We stopped in to have a few drinks and the drunken muscles, both of which were super yummy 😊
If you can, try to get there when Grace is working. She is so great, and I can see why she was “Employee of the Month” 😉
Didn’t get a chance to check out the rooftop pool, but heard it’s a cool spot haha; We came here for a late lunch and it was outstanding. The food and drinks were delicious, Justin was our server/bartender and he is amazing. The paella, crab dinner, mussels appetizer phenomenal!

Name: Aqua Pool Bar Rincon
Address: 560 Black Eagle Rd, Rincón, 00677, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM; Friday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: 560 (street_number); Black Eagle Road (route); Rincón (locality); Ensenada (administrative_area_level_2); Rincón (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00677 (postal_code)
Reviews:
My friends and I had an amazing time! We got hungry but were having too much fun in the pool to get out. We ordered pizza from the bar, and Robert kindly delivered it right to us in the pool—with a big smile! Great service and great vibes.; The owners of the place are the nicest people! I went snorkeling at Black Eagle Beach, then changed in the bathroom at the aqua pool bar. I proceeded to leave my backpack in the stall and drove all the way back to San Juan. When I arrived in San Juan, I realized I didn’t have my backpack and called the pool bar. Sure enough, they had it. I asked if I could come by at 7:30am the next day to retrieve my backpack before flying out of San Juan. They were accommodating and hand delivered the backpack to me when I got there. I even tried offering them money for it but they refused. Super great people and location!; Full disclosure, we were spending a day at the beach and were approached by the bartender regarding free pool pass for the day. We had a long day already and it is in the same parking lot as the reserve so we decided to try it out. From the very moment we came to this place, we were met with excellent customer service to the point that it made our experience. The drinks were on point and very well made and the food was just perfect. It was a nice casual environment and we were able to lounge at the pool and relax. Highly recommend the place if you are at the reserve beach or in the vicinity.; We had a great time here! Staff and owners are very friendly, food was delicious, and Wesley and Alex worked very hard to take great care of us.
The place is clean and newly remodeled to look like a cruise ship. Some areas are not finished yet, and the back pool bar was not open on our Sunday evening visit. The place is great now, cannot wait to see it when it is fully finished!; After some miscommunication my group came and had a great time! We would have enjoyed it better if we were able to form a plan before arriving with 13 people but it all turned out to be a great day at the pool.

Reviews: The absolute best Mojito I have ever had!!! I chose the orange juice mojito and it was so delicious I don't think I will ever be the same! Life changing!! It was HUGE, like 32oz or something, and cost $12. I will have to rerurn to PR just to have this drink again!; Awesome casual beachfront place to grab snacks and a drink. We tried every flavor of empanadita (beef, chicken, mahi mahi, and shark) and they were delicious. Good selection of beer and cocktails! Seems like a great place to bring the family, too.; Ola Sunset Cafe was hands down the best meal of our trip to Puerto Rico. We visited Rincon for an afternoon and got the suggestion to visit the lighthouse and Cafe from Desecheo Surf Shop. The service was fantastic, food amazing and the local cherry mojito was top notch! The breeze and views from the cafe were amazing. My family could have stayed all day.; The mojitos were amazing! $10 for a 32oz and amazing views. Even the appetizers/food were good. Must do for mojitos and amazing sunset/views.; The food is nothing spectacular. I don't drink , so I asked my family how they were and they said the drinks were fine. Again, nothing wow. What brings this place to a 3 star is the SCENERY. It's on the coast. You can see the beach.

Name: D’moroz Bar & Tapas
Address: 9RH5+7JG, Av. Nativo Alers, Aguada, 00602, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 9RH5+7JG (plus_code); Avenida Nativo Alers (route); Aguada (locality); Piedras Blancas (administrative_area_level_2); Aguada (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00602 (postal_code)
Reviews: Good food good service Good price. Nice place great Ac; A must; I visited D'Moroz Bar recently and it was a fantastic experience. This place combines a modern and vibrant atmosphere with a cozy touch that makes it perfect for both a night with friends or a more intimate outing. The cocktail selection is impressive; Each one I tried was perfectly prepared and featured balanced and original flavors. The bartenders clearly know what they're doing and are passionate about their craft, which shows in every drink they make. If you like unique cocktails, you can't miss their special creations. Additionally, the music and lighting create a lively but relaxing atmosphere at the same time, allowing you to enjoy the night without feeling overwhelmed. The service was also top notch, with attentive and friendly staff who made sure everything was to our liking. D'Moroz Bar is definitely a place I will return to. It is ideal to enjoy an excellent drink in an environment that makes you feel welcome and comfortable from the first moment.; Excellent service 🍽; Very good exquisite pleasant atmosphere

Reviews: We fell in love right away with this beautiful property. Everyone who works here is lovely and has great communication with you. The decoration and everything exceeded our expectations. We had a destination wedding, and everyone who attended was breath taken by the venue. The food was tasteful. The portions were not limited. I highly recommend checking this beautiful place for your wedding or any activity. Thank you, guys for bringing my ideas to life!; We do not live in PR and we’re looking for a venue for my husband’s 50th bday party.  Sister in law recommended Salon Bungolow.  I can’t not begin to express how happy we were with the outcome and overall planning process.  They were able to create a picture perfect vision with just some inspiration photos that we shared.  The level of professional and communication was truly top notch.  The quality of the food and service was amazing.  Number 1 comment from ALL our guest was how delicious the food was.  We had over 70 people flying into this area for the event and they were extremely pleased.  Thank you creating the perfect night to celebrate my husband.  Geraldine and Nelly are truly wonderful to work with.  HIGHLY HIGHLY Recommend !; El Bungalow it's known by locals of the westside area, but almost a hidden treasure for everyone else, including destination couples. It's a gorgeous villa with an outdoor ceremony area, an indoor reception space (A/C anyone?), and a river flows right through it, so there's also an outdoor forest nature vibe very particular of this venue.; My nephews wedding was magical. The owner took care of all the details and it was absolutely gorgeous!; Great place for any party event, beautiful place, very safe with the covid protocol.

Name: Dancers Club
Address: 28GR+9WX, PR-132, Ponce, 00728, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 9:30 PM – 5:00 AM; Thursday: 9:30 PM – 5:00 AM; Friday: 9:30 PM – 5:00 AM; Saturday: 9:30 PM – 5:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 28GR+9WX (plus_code); Puerto Rico 132 (route); Ponce (locality); Canas (administrative_area_level_2); Ponce (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00728 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Better than expected!  We visited Ponce, PR did the Don Q rum tour.  On a Wednesday, I decided to stay and explore.  I got to the club, spacious parking,  nice gentlemen check me at the door.  The club was big inside only a few girl at first. The beautiful bar tender Mia spoke English (from Brooklyn) was super attentive, please tip your bartender!.  We played coin operated pool tables as more ladies came in.  Since I don’t speak Spanish I missed out on getting to know some of the ladies.  Jinx,   and Lavender :-) spoke perfect english and kept me company.
I didn’t put any photos because it’s not allowed in the club.  I didn’t have any food or see anyone eating, so eat first.

A must if you need to unwind in Ponce.

Hours are 10:00 to 5:00 am.; By far the worst trip club in the world, they open at 9:30pm and the dancers show up when they want. I got there about 10:00pm and the so called dancers showed up around 10:30, at of all the dancers their was one that could be considered a 5, or less…the rest were sooo physically unattractive. Any way the place was moldy, dirty and the top shelf bottles had spiders webs. I’ve seen better clubs in Afghanistan, Seria , Mogadishu or Haiti. WOW! by far the WORSE!; I have been there a couple of times and as of these past months that place aint the same anymore, most private lap dances are awful no motivation what so ever from the girls… And dont get me started on the VIP Private lap dances 40 minutes listening to the Girl ranting about herself and not even DANCING just sitting next to me and it not only happen to me but to some colleagues I went with as well. It USED to be a grade A+ Gentlemen club not anymore apparently.; Its the biggest strip club in the southern part of the island. Free admissions from 9:30PM to12:00AM and the Happy Hour is from 9:30PM to 1:00AM The place was clean and the have hot looking girls even the bartender was cute. Lots of TVs around with various sports playing. Great food, they makes seriously tasty burgers and homemade fries for $9.99 and the hot wings $4.69 Safe place to hangout whit Armed security inside and out.; It was awesome, went there today, second time there, met a dancer there by the name Jade, and she’s just gorgeous.

Drinks were good, would’ve loved to have food but the kitchen was closed, other than that I had a great time with the boys, enjoying the girls lol

Name: El 69
Address: 1061 Avenida Hostos, Ponce, 00716, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 2:30 PM – 12:00 AM; Tuesday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Wednesday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Thursday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 3:00 PM – 1:30 AM; Saturday: 3:00 PM – 1:30 AM; Sunday: 3:00 PM – 12:00 AM

Reviews: Avenida Hostos is great to spend sometime with the locals, enjoy amazing music, and refreshing drinks. But I think El 69 has to be by far the most fun chinchorro I've been to! DJ and Karaoke on the night I visited, which on a weekday can be pretty slow, it was still buzzing with great island vibes. Their mojitos ought to be the best I tried in the island! The service is excellent. I assume that on weekends this must be one of the most fun places to go as they appear to have games and things to do next door/backyard. You'll have fun reading the different signs throughout this lovely chinchorro.  (by the way, we didn't eat here. Only  had their drinks. Not sure if food is served, hence 3 stars).; Their food will not disappoint! Highlight of the trip! I ordered the burria tacos and my youngest daughter ordered chicken and bacon quesadillas. 🤤🤤🤤; Bad service 4 bartenders still you have to wait atleast 20 minutes for a drink. Good ambiance and music. New are is very spacey and welcoming. The sound system should be a bit more out there. There were many spots where you could barely hear the DJ. Overall i would say good for begining the night not ending it.; Great Place for cool Beers 🍻; You will need to bug spray to eat here :( they need to plant a bunch of citronella plants lol. Cool looking place though.

Name: Venus
Address: 10 P.º Atocha, Ponce, 00730, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 2:30 AM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 2:30 AM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 2:30 AM; Sunday: Closed

Reviews: Says it opens at 8:30pm...no music until almost 10:30pm. Thought it would be an open format "club", turned out to just be reggaeton from the start. Bars don't offer the same mixology. If you want higher quality drinks, better go to the front of the place to get them. "Venus itself is not written anywhere, had to ask where the place was. Back bars are for simple drinks or beers. Thankfully they don't do cover charges or I would of asked for the refund. Gave it 2 starts because the front bar tender knew what she was going and the space itself is impressive. Apart from that, not worth going. If you in your 20s, this is your spot. Otherwise, head to The Fox for a better experience; Amazing new night club with two levels and two bars.; Dope night club with a lot of security, that i visit couple of days ago and i can't wait to comeback 💪 🔥 and yes im the one with the camera 📸 so be thete and you will be part of it.; Good atmosphere and good drinks;

Name: Spot 2.0

Reviews:
This place is huge! They are 2 entrances a few feet apart. The one on the left leads to the main bar. The one on the right takes you several tables and beyond that a large open air courtyard. It's very pretty. The party lighting makes you wanna hang there. Now the music was loud. If you want to sit and chat maybe stay by the bar. If you wanna dance or sing karaoke go to the back. I'd definitely hang here again.; This place is great !!! The layout is awesome, lots of room, drinks are super cold, service was awsome !! Talk about a happy hour!! .50 cent medalla beer !!! .25 cent wings!!! Wings were delicious. There is also several other drink specials. A must stop if you are in Ponce!!!; First place we found when we settled in Ponce. Good place for a last-minute drink and to get something to .; Love the cheap food prices here but they try to get you on drinks here especially if the workers know you're American. But lovely love music and I had one of the best waiters. Bartender was rude about adding beer on my tab and I don't drink beer 😁 lol I'm a whisky 🥃 girl.; Great for a big lunch for a cheap price.

The portions are pretty big, the meat is crispy, and the tostones are fresh. If you want to be satisfied on the flavor department, you'll love it here.

The menu may be a little limited, but if you want rice, beans, and some meat, you'll find all you need here.

The service was also pretty fast: we were a group of six people, and in less than 30 minutes we all had our food.

Overall, a good place for lunchtime. Visit during the evening for a great bar experience too.

I enjoyed listening to the music from the Jukebox that had some very memorable classic tracks.  Both English and Spanish music. They were also making sure that everybody entering was fully vaccinated.; Great food, great music, great service. Bar has been open for 29 years. 28 in its 1st establishedment and a couple of months in the new one. The atmosphere still feels the same as the old bar. Highly recommend the spot. It's right next to the airport, so a great plus.; its a good place. but they need the change the music its to boring; It’s a nice and open space to hangout with friends. A couple of features makes this place less than. First, it’s cash or ATHMovil ONLY. If live artists are playing the sound is not under control which means you WILL have to scream to communicate. Service is subpar to say the least, only one cash register and 10 waitresses all standing at the bar looking at each other’s faces. I did not have a great experience and I don’t think I’ll be going back anytime soon. Disappointing.

Name: Velada jazz bar
Address: 84 Plaza Muñoz Rivera, Ponce, 00730, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 84 (street_number); Plaza Muñoz Rivera (route); Ponce Pueblo (sublocality_level_1); Ponce (locality); Segundo (administrative_area_level_2); Ponce (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00730 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Nice restaurant with a good variety of original cocktails. The appetizers were very good, but my entrée was so so. I had the mushroom risotto (very good) with a chicken capresse that was terribly bland. Maybe it was a bad selection on my part. I would give it a second try.; Was there about two months ago and fell in love with the place and the chicken Capresse. Then, my dish was beautifully plated, and the chicken breast was juicy and delicious. I went there last night July 31,  and ordered the same, with high expectations. Total disappointment.  The plating was different. The chicken breast was dry, tough and rubbery chewy, cut in two with the cheese, pesto and tomatoes laid on top. It was like a different, lower quality portion was used. It was difficult to cut, and I started with the thinner side. It was a disappointment but I went on. Then came the worst part, which as a restaurant patron I find unacceptable. The thicker side of the breast tasted like salmon, which is what another person at my table ordered. We were the first table to be seated and later 2 more tables were occupied. The grill was not cleaned or they were cooked too close to each other. A total turn off.  Lazy chef?
The waitress was very pleasant but obviously new on the job. It will be a while before I go back. If.; The place is beautiful, on the center of the plaza. Cocktails are on point, great prices and presentation, only had a couple of tapas and therms were good, but not on par with the cocktails, maybe 2 steps below the cocktails in terms of originality, and what you get for the price. Will be back for the cocktails and great service.; nice upscale bar. full assortment and they know how to prepare all the classics unlike most others. try to go early as they switch their jazz playlist for more popular songs late at night.; Fantastic environment, style and great cocktails. This place have a old, jazz style, with friendly staff in a beautiful Spanish style downtown Ponce.

Name: Asturias Lounge Bar
Address: Asturias, 7045 Cll Mendez Vigo, Ponce, 00717, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 7045 (street_number); Calle Mendez Vigo (route); Segundo, Ponce, Puerto Rico (sublocality_level_1); Ponce (locality); Primero (administrative_area_level_2); Ponce (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00717 (postal_code)
Reviews: The pictures I've taken don't even do this place justice! The vibe is everything here. I didn't stay long bc they didn't have wine at the moment and don't serve bacardi 🥺 but what they lack in my favorite drinks they make up for in charm. The place is super appealing and has this moody edgy vibe that is everything! It's definitely a must of you're in Ponce!; Stop by. The bartender is phenomenal. it's very unsuspecting from the outside, but cozy and inviting on the inside. Told the bartender to make me something fruity and he gave me the best drink I've had in years! Highly recommend!!!; Excellent & Exquisite food and a great variety of high quality wines at great prices. Their cocktails with natural and instantly squeezed  fresh fruits like  oranges and pink grapefruit with Tito's vodka! Delicious food, wine and tapas. High quality products! first class service with great and sweet hospitality. You feel like  being attended by a family members or a friend. Pleasurable atmosphere.; Incredibly kind owner and bartender, and very unique. They make their drinks with fresh squeezed juices. This place is a must go for tourists and locals; Good place to grab some cocktails. The bar is kinda hidden, from the street it’s not easily spotted, but if you see some chairs and table on the street, you made it. From when you walk through the  door is an experience, the decoration, the bartender and the people. Don’t forget yo try their food! Incredible, ask for the jamón Serrano empanadillas.

Reviews: I loved this place right in the Plaza de Ponce. The atmosphere is very artsy. It has a decorated warehouse feel, complete with beautiful chandeliers hanging from the ceiling, and colored chalk murals. We ordered a passion fruit mojito not expecting much. Boy, were we pleasantly surprised...! Made from scratch, with real crushed yerbabuena and lemon, it tasted glorious!!! And it was a generous size. We ordered more and had a great time. The bartender, a student of forensics and criminology was such a sweet girl. I wish her the best!; Nice place to have a drink/cocktail at night. Not very crowed during the week, I believe it is different in the weekend. The cocktails are good and affordable. The DJ play music that makes this place alive. The waiters are efficients. If you found the music too loud you can seat on the tables outside or on a bench in parc just in the front.; Awesome place to go and party. They have this wall where they have sticky notes with challenges that if you do it you will get something for free. They also have inside the bar a place called El Almacén is like this kinda "secrete" place where they often invite local reguetón artist. Is a great place to hang out with you girl or friends. I really recommend it.; Super cheap drinks and dozens of specialty shots. Touch Tunes and outdoor seating overlooking the Plaza Las Delicias. Probably the most hopping place on the plaza. A pizza truck is on the plaza nearby.; It’s okay. Not very inviting. Expensive drinks. Some seats outside to sit and it’s fine enough if you’re staying in a hotel close by.

The location isn't ideal for solo travelers. Unfortunately, I had to check out earlier than expected. Also, was charged a Cleaning Fee FOR dirty sheets upon. Will not be staying here again, thank you anyway.; everything is great and beautiful. It looks as expected. although we had our water completely off for over 12 hours without any communication over the phone just texts giving minimal information. I asked for a refund for a night and they said no. I was very upset that i was without water . without running water ( i couldn't flush my toilet) it was disgusting no bathrooms or water worked throughout the whole building . No water was offered . Nothing was offered as a solution except for a text at 11 at night telling me my water is back on .
it was just super frustrating because i was relying on the water for cooking , drinking , and showering and it was definitely an inconvenience.; El Flamingo Beach Club is hands down the best place to stay in Puerto Rico. With its close proximity to the beach and an array of top-notch amenities, it’s the perfect destination for a memorable and enjoyable getaway. Highly recommended!; Came to the room and was very clean also the maintenance there seems to be good overall I had nothing to complain abt I really enjoyed it; Great place to stay with modern comfortable rooms and a nice outside area with hammocks to hang out near the pool.
Near a really nice beach and a short drive to a food truck park area where you can find coffee, breakfast, and more! Highly recommended staying here for a relaxing getaway!

Name: La Uve
Address: Vega Baja, 00693, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 7:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 9:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: Closed

Reviews:
The best night club in Puerto Rico!

honestly the service is nice, understanding and friendly

been here 2 nights already and I’m gonna bring everyone here I love it!

They have 2 private/VIP sections that if your a wealthy person or it’s a special occasion, I’m going to do it next week with some friends or strangers I invite haha

Also the music varies I personally like the bounce music to dance and the dj makes everyone happy!

The bartenders are stunning and professional! The drinks are perfect and cheap how they should be! 3$ beers all night baby! They have a great selection of drinks on the menu you just gotta scan it or ask them to show you! Btw they have all brand names in liquors and their taps are spotless honestly it’s like they have a doctor their spot cleaning it…..👀

(I don’t normally do reviews so this is rare forgive the long review)

security is very professional and TIGHT I’m telling you I never felt safer their is atleast 9 at all times and a few you don’t see 🥸😉

the parking lot is gated so you feel secure to pay for parking!

We need to see things like this at all clubs!

I personally recommend this place because of atmosphere and decorations are great plus the games in the back corner of the club outside are fun you can chill there smoke and play beer pong or tic tac toe

The bathrooms were very clean! And didn’t smell and honestly bro I can’t tell you how many bathrooms I held my breath in….🤢😷I’m glad they got some caring staff that cares about every detail

Btw it’s not very packed because it’s NEW so get in before it gets known haha!

Also if you see me in the guy in the island shirts or button ups haha with friends or by himself dancing so say hi Josh! Btw order a Long Island; Excellent service, food, atmosphere and music equipment. There are a variety of activities to do inside the premises and it is very spacious. The staff are also very friendly.; ;

Good lord. By far some of the WORST cannabis I have ever seen. The store itself is truly revolting and feels like you're going to get robbed leaving.

The menu is filled with errors and incorrect information. They don't properly advertise their products. If you're selling it trim or popcorn nugs you're SUPPOSED to mention it. They didn't. Now I'm stuck with 7 grams of literally trash bud that isn't even good for CBD edibles for a dog.

Nothing but tiny nugs with huge stems and the smell comes off as they left it laying around in the open. It smells nothing of cannabis and just wet moldy grass.

Avoid this place and lets Hope they go out of business. WAAAAYYY too many dispensaries making quality shoot way down.; Great prices friendly buttenders and ample selection of products .; Great People in there; nice place!; Very good product and the treatment of the employees is excellent

Address Components: E26 (street_number); Calle Hernandez Carrion (route); Manatí (locality); Pueblo Saliente (administrative_area_level_3); Manatí (administrative_area_level_2); Manatí (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00674 (postal_code)
Reviews:
What a cute little spot to grab a coffee and brunch! The lattes were great ☕️, and the waffles and French toast were yuuuuum!!
Juan Carlos was super hospitable and was patient while I was trying to practice my español 🤓
We plan to go back again before we leave PR 🇵🇷; Pleasant, small coffee and breakfast spot across the street from the hospital. Some parking out front. Very clean and comfortably air conditioned, with music playing at just the right volume. One very hard working, pleasant young woman behind the counter. Order, then pick up your food; no table service. Food was good, coffee was hot. Nice place.; For some reason i didn’t feel welcomed, maybe because i was the first client on a holiday, but really i don’t know. Nothing bad but nothing special about the breakfast, just average. Small parking on front, credit cards accepted.; What an amazing coffee place. Small & cozy with the best service in town. Both coffee and matcha latte where delicious!!! So worth it ☕️🤍🤎; Love this little coffee shop. The latte I ordered was so delicious. Also ordered the Mitaza Monte Cristo which came with chips, my son had a turkey and cheese sandwich and Husband ordered an omelet. His omelet came with whole wheat toast. This was literally the best thing out of everything we ordered. It was so soft and tasted so fresh. Would recommend anyone driving thru or staying in Manati to get their coffee and brunch here. The person at the front was very nice and prices are reasonable.

Reviews: My overall experience was very good, however I did ask one of the employees if they had barbecue sauce and he said no and I found it within a minute later and they had a whole few pallets of it so it's aggravating that the employees do not really take care and do what they're paid to do; They continue violating customers rights.  The Supreme Court clearly stated that they cannot search or touch any of the articles you've paid for to "check if you are stealing" or hold your hostage or ask you for a receipt while the re-scan your stuff.; Horrible! The place is packed from open to close. The parking lot is a free for all, carts everywhere, from each corner to the middle of the street. Cash registers are packed. If you try to use the scan and go app you have to scan each barcode on each item individually and do not trust the barcodes placed on the racks because some are not up to date,  wrong prices with wrong product underneath. Overall experience, never going back.; Check well the fruits they sell them in rotten states. Frozen lasagna and cold cuts are not well refrigerated you can see the melting cheese.....A the barbecue rips OVER COOK AND THEY PUT LOTS OF BARBECUE SAUSE to cover up the disaster.; The store was fairly clean and stocked. Lines are crazy long and you cannot go to customer service if you walk in only to pay on your Sam’s card. You must wait in the long line to pay on your card.

Reviews:
This place is beautiful and has nice coffee and is nicely located in an area of the pueblo that’s undergoing revitalization.

I had a small negative experience with one of the help, but have adjusted to 4 stars because the owner replied kindly to express her condolence about it. That matters; Probably the ONLY coffee local shop with WIFI available for customers! The AC was Divine on a hot summer day. The coffee / latte drinks were DELICIOUS! I love how they added cinnamon and sugar to the matcha latte which tasted so amazing! And I wasn’t expecting the quesadilla To be SO GOOD !
We were lucky to find this gem in Mayagüez to get our work done and get fast speed internet wifi! 100% recommend !; Very very nice quaint place and inviting! As always the staff are always very hospitable and always happy to help you! Had this great looking and tasting cappuccino with fairy dust (sparkles) so beautiful. Also had the Pancakes with Nutella and Peanut Butter topping, berries on the side and whipped cream. Soooo delish! My friend had the egg, ham, cheese croissant 🥐 and it was very tasty. Small portion on the croissant but pancakes are a nice size, three large pancakes 🥞; This is a cute little place. Food and coffee were outstanding. Employees were super nice!; Very cute spot, yummy açaí bowls + croissants !

Name: Barril Sin Fondo
Address: Edificio Roig, 102 Calle de la Candelaria, Mayagüez, 00680, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 – 10:30 PM; Tuesday: 4:00 – 10:30 PM; Wednesday: 4:00 – 10:30 PM; Thursday: 4:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 4:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 4:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Vicinity: Edificio Roig, 102 Calle de la Candelaria, Mayagüez
Address Components: Edificio Roig (point_of_interest); 102 (street_number); Calle de la Candelaria (route); Mayagüez Pueblo (sublocality_level_1); Mayagüez (locality); Salud (administrative_area_level_3); Mayagüez (administrative_area_level_2); Mayagüez (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00680 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I really enjoyed my visit. We tried out their new Bori-Mex menu and the dishes were really tasty. I think my only complaint with the birria tacos was that the tortilla is so toasty that if you try to fold it, it breaks apart. But honestly it wasn't much of a deal-breaker, since you can just eat the food that falls out with utensils. They also have a really cool fried burger that's really big. It comes with a dipping sauce. Their mojitos were really nice too, although I wish they'd add less ice to them. The coconut mojito was my favorite.; Wed giant mojitos are $5; To be sincere I only go there for the beer when I stop by the Plaza. It's the only restaurant that doesn't overcharge you for a craft beer like Ocean Lab.

Regarding the food, it seems very popular, usually whenever I go there are a lot people eating there.; I liked the prices, cocktail flavors, and liquor selection. They even had my favorite rum Kraken which is only available in the US normally. The staff is friendly but somewhat understaffed. Inky three bar tenders in the whole place. Since mayaguez is a college town it can get kinda full quickly. I suggest going in thier slower days for quicker service but the weekend is better for a nice atmosphere.; Ambient music is like living in a ghetto. There was an annoying alarm noise every half an hour inside the place and they forgot the aioli in my wife's burger. I ordered a Jack Daniels Pulled Pork burger and I was able to get a cilantro leaf on two bites I had. Was not supposed to be there...?
Overall it was okay.

Address: 11 C. Santo Tomás, Mayagüez, 00680, Puerto Rico

Address Components: 11 (street_number); Calle Santo Tomás (route); Mayagüez Pueblo (sublocality_level_1); Mayagüez (locality); Cárcel (administrative_area_level_3); Mayagüez (administrative_area_level_2); Mayagüez (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00680 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Incredible place! Very chill and very friendly people. We went in last night at 10 pm still hungry and they fired up the stove for us and made us some of the best burgers I’ve ever had! The cocktails were delicious and the service was incredible. It is a chill, quiet place where you can hang out and get comfortable while having a couple of drinks. One of the best bars I’ve ever been to, hands down 🙌; I loved this place! The atmosphere is perfect so are the drinks! I ordered a Lavender flavored London Mule and it was refreshing. My spouse ordered an Old Fashioned and said it ranks at the Top 3.

I wish I have a place like this back home!; Nice place to experiment with unique coctails. Perfect place for dates or girls night out. Soft music and pretty decorations are everywhere.; Great cocktail place, has an awesome vibe with very creative cocktails. Check it out!!!; Went with friends all the way from Dorado and the experience was great. Its a small bar, very unique and very affordable. They took the time to make high quality cocktails, they make their own syrups and infusions and it is notable. Ask for a PONO and thank me later.

Reviews:
I liked the layout and decor of this bar but dang those prices were cray cray.$17 for a shot of Buffalo Trace. I can buy the bottle for 34. So it's whatever you like to throw down in a bar. Some people like putting a $20 bill on the bar and getting a shot and some people wince a little. The wincer would be me. Even if you pull down 400 an hour I'm not sure, unless you come with friends, that this will be your favorite place. That being said I think their selection was great and the staff was nice and accommodating. They also have some appetizers that went well with our drinks so all in all it's worth a try we had a few drinks and enjoyed it.; This is an upscale lounge in Delano lobby with lots of seating options, great drinks and excellent service. A nice place to get away from the casino and relax, work, have pre-dinner cocktails, ... Suggestions: Please fix your hours on Google that say 24hrs. As of today the website says Mon-Sat 2-12, Sun closed. Consider moving the lobby waiting area further from the bar. When families are waiting with kids it can ruin the awesome vibe here. Doesn't happen often, but when it does, ugh.; Definitely make sure to stop by this bar at the Delano! They have some amazing craft cocktails, especially their "Comfortably Numb" - Woodford Reserve Double oak Bourbon infused with vanilla, coffee beans and Carpano. This drink is FIRE!!!! Jared is amazing and provides the most wonderful service.; The bartender was super friendly!! Perfect espresso martini. He also recommended a red wine that I ended up loving! Definitely will be back.; Awesome bar and especially Gerad. He makes the most incredible cocktails.
But…. Where did the food go? Please bring back the food. We’d stay longer if there was something to eat while we drank.

There's a lot of vintage character to this area. You pass by a lot of restaurants and performers and activities. Worth a trip if you're in the Las Vegas area for a vacation.; Ahh Las Vegas Blvd. brings back good memories from long ago (i.e. 1999 ish). I don't know if this was the precise location of the picture attached to my review here but I wanted to document that I was here. :); Las Vegas is always a great option to have fun!; Sensory trigger central - and this is coming from someone who got through NM’s Meow Wolf largely without issue. The lights, smell, and crowd was a near-instant migraine for me.

Name: Troy Liquor Bar
Address: 129 Fremont Street Experience, Las Vegas, NV 89101, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 9:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Friday: 9:00 PM – 4:00 AM; Saturday: 9:00 PM – 4:00 AM; Sunday: 9:00 PM – 3:00 AM
Address Components: 129 (street_number); Fremont Street Experience (route); Downtown Las Vegas (neighborhood); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89101 (postal_code)
Reviews:
My wife and I decided to get a table on the patio overlooking the 1st Street stage. We were not sure what to expect but were very pleased with everyone one we encountered. The table spend was $100 and the drinks were very good and priced well.

There are free no cover charge options, but having a table in a sectioned off area was nice.

The only thing lacking was not able to get food, snacks or coffee

We would go back as the staff was professional and the vibe is nice.; Great club.  Recommend the balcony seating.  Jeff and his staff are very accommodating.   Great music.  Lots of fun.; Went here Halloween night like an hour before it closed for the night and the club itself isn't too bad and medium sized. The drink prices in my opinion were average but at least cheaper than the mega clubs on the strip. I like that it's got a balcony that overlooks Fremont Street Experience. Was a little surprised that there wasn't more people there than there was especially since there was no cover charge when I went which is always nice but of course Halloween was on a Monday night which shouldn't of been a surprise to me that it wasn't packed. I think its still definitely a place worth checking out when your on Fremont Street to party; No cover charge dance bar. However music was kinda old and lame. Mostly older people. No college kids here really; This place was great to our large group last night.  We reserved some of their VIP tables on the balcony overlooking Fremont St and it could not have been better!  It’s the only club in Fremont but it’s also the only open air balcony under the lights and overlooking the stage.  The staff is what really made it top notch... all of them.  Highly recommend.

Name: Skyfall Panoramic Bar & Lounge
Address: 3940 Mandalay Bay Rd Delano, Las Vegas, NV 89119, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Vicinity: 3940 Mandalay Bay Road Delano, Las Vegas
Address Components: Delano (subpremise); 3940 (street_number); Mandalay Bay Road (route); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89119 (postal_code)
Reviews:
We first visited Skyfall Panoramic Bar and Lounge in late December, and the nighttime view is absolutely stunning. It’s one of those moments where you realize how close and connected all the resorts on the Strip really are.

Lounge Experience:
The staff at Skyfall are exceptional—very friendly and inviting. We enjoyed it so much that we recently cancelled another reservation at the Venetian to come back and relax here. The drinks are excellent, and the bite-sized foods are a highlight. We especially loved the 8” pesto pizza with Parmesan and arugula. The Setting Sun with whisky and Kiwi Colada were a good start, both were refreshing cocktails. Their typical whiskey and martinis are also excellent.

Recommendation:
If you’re looking for a less crowded, chill vibe to unwind and enjoy the skyline with a good cocktail, Skyfall is the place to go.; Skyfall is an excellent spot to enjoy a good cocktail. The service is very good, and the atmosphere is pleasant, with an ideal setting for couples or groups of friends looking for a more relaxed environment. The music and lighting are on point, but what really stands out about this place is its panoramic view of Las Vegas, which makes it truly special.

I’ll definitely be back soon.; Skyfall Lounge, perched atop the Delano Hotel and Casino, offers some of the most breathtaking views in Las Vegas. Whether you're watching the sun dip below the horizon or taking in the glittering city lights, the panoramic sights alone make this a must-visit spot. The food is solid--no complaints there--but I didn't come for the culinary experience. The real stars here are the drinks. Each cocktail is crafted with precision, bursting with flavor, and truly elevates the lounge experience. If you're seeking a place where the views and drinks are equally spectacular, Skyfall Lounge is where you want to be.; I knew I wanted to visit Skyfall for the view so we popped in after a nice meal for an after dinner drink. The hostess offered a table but we declined and just said we wanted a drink at the bar. We rode the elevator up with another couple who complained that they were pushing tables and the place is "dead". When we arrived, they weren't wrong. A second hostess offered a table, which we politely declined and went to the bar. The bartender, Shaggy was friendly and made us 2 drinks. We listened to the music for a bit, which was "soft techno" and admired the view. We also discussed what would make the place better and popping. The space and view is incredible so it baffles me why it would be dead- it boils down to marketing and ambiance. I had to use the restroom and that view was incredible as well. However, there was nothing that would lure me back unless I brought friends to Vegas that had never been...; Food was subpar, but that's not why you're coming here.  View is fantastic.  Romantic getaway,  or just enjoying what Las Vegas has to offer; this is a must go for anyone who is on there 2nd visit+. Drinks plus service are good. Walk around to meet new people. Worth at least one of your nights in Vegas.

Name: Legacy Club
Address: 8 Fremont St, Las Vegas, NV 89101, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Thursday: 4:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Saturday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Sunday: 4:00 PM – 2:00 AM
Address Components: 8 (street_number); Fremont Street (route); Downtown Las Vegas (neighborhood); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89101 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Okay the view up here is probably the best in Las Vegas you see the entire strip you see the mountains to the West when the Sun is setting it is truly amazing but you pay for it.   Water was $11 a small bottle and we had two drinks one margarita with a side shot of Don Julio and one beer anyway the total for those two drinks with the shot and the water was $133 with the mandatory included 20% tip but the view is worth something and the music is pretty nice.; This was an amazing experience.  I scheduled the Sunset Toast as a surprise for my friends.  The cocktails & mocktails were extraordinary.  The views were perfect.  We were able to see the perfect transition from day to night.  I super highly recommend.; Went here based on a recommendation from a buddy of mine. Like he had previously mentioned, the views were incredible. The ambiance is super nice, and the overall vibe is super chill. Nevertheless you tend to get a high end snobbish kind of feel from the moment you walk in. And when I went to the bar to order a beer, it turns out they don't offer any domestic beers. They only offer craft beers. So that was my queue to bail. Don't get me wrong I'm not necessarily trying to knock the place. I'm just saying it's not my cup of tea. But if you like that upper echelon kind of vibe, that caters to those who feel comfortable in a high society kind of atmosphere, then this place is definitely for you. I did enjoy the views though.; A rooftop club at a newly built property. It’s a bit outside the strip. The view is amazing. The wind is cool. The drinks are awesome and very affordable. Please note that they don’t serve any food. It’s located at 60 floor with an amazing 360 view of Vegas city. There are casinos and restaurants at level 1 . The cab pickup and drop points are on the other side of the road. It’s connected to the hotel through an enclosed glass walkway.; Location at the top of the circa hotel, this place has a very James bond vibe to it, very nice .
The drinks are your average vegas price of about $20+, but they are well served cocktails.
They have a variety of old fashions which I loved!.
I would recommend stopping by and grabbing an old fashion if you are into those types of drinks.

Name: Gold Spike
Address: 217 Las Vegas Blvd N, Las Vegas, NV 89101, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Open 24 hours; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours
Vicinity: 217 Las Vegas Boulevard North, Las Vegas
Address Components: 217 (street_number); Las Vegas Boulevard North (route); Downtown Las Vegas (neighborhood); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89101 (postal_code)
Reviews:
We celebrated my husband's retirement at Gold Spike and everyone had an amazing time! The manager Will went above and beyond to make sure that all of our needs were met :). The bartender Lexi always had a smile on her face and was happy to serve us, our friends and family! The security at the door was friendly and we all felt welcome! I highly recommend this place for your next happy hour, event or just to have a good old time! By the way, their happy hour has great drink prices! Enjoy!; Might be a bit busy on the weekends so be mindful of dress code and cost but during the week is pretty chill to play games like pool and fooseball! Gary keeps the place SUPER clean too; always on top of it; never a sticky floor!; I recently stayed at Gold Spike and had an amazing experience. The hotel itself is stunning, with a modern design and impeccable cleanliness. The amenities were top-notch, and I especially enjoyed the bar
But what truly made my stay exceptional was the outstanding service. Phillip, one of the front desk attendants, went above and beyond to make sure I had everything I needed. From the warm welcome to the thoughtful recommendations for local spots, Phillip was attentive, friendly, and genuinely cared about making my stay perfect. His professionalism and kindness made a lasting impression, and I can’t thank him enough.

If you're looking for a hotel that combines luxury with personalized service, gold spike is the place to be. I can't wait to return!; It was a dark but mostly welcoming place situated in old downtown Las Vegas. It was a bit off the beaten path, but it was not hard to find and within walking distance of the main street there. The people were nice, and the drinks were affordable. There were also large games you could play for free, which was fun and an interesting way to spend time there as well as meet new people.; I've had the chance to go here a few times while in Vegas for work and it never disappoints! Good mix of people and it doesn't feel like Vegas (I don't care for the Strip). Just a great joint.

Reviews: Vegas isn't what it used to be.  Delano pool is nice.  Be patient for servers and plan on paying $8 for a bottle of water.  Pro tip:  bartenders will give you a large glass of ice for free and there is a water stand.; Horrible experience. Wait list was crazy and mask policy not fair to all guests. Lazy river line was nonsense. Just don't go for the Mandalay Bay pools.; We had a cabana and enjoyed all it's amenities.  Fridge, lounge chairs,  and lots of shade. The pool was very unique with a large chess game in it. The environment is very relaxed and more on the quiet side than other beach clubs.; Today I checked in. I requested high floors with a strip view. April the front desk staff advised me that they can honor high floors but no strip view but only a pool view. Why would I want to look at a pool in November in Vegas. Then I request to speak to a manager and the manager only option is offer a lessor room with strip view or pay additional for penthouse suite. So never did she tell me I would pay less for a lessor room but was quick to say I would pay $175 additional per night. Crazy I tell you. This is my 2nd mishap with the Delano and after this I don’t think I’ll pick this resort again. Vegas has way more to offer and everyone speaks to you as if it’s not their problem. I’m over it. 11-7-2020; beautiful cabanas. Smaller pool was much more peaceful than Mandalay Bay wave pool, but only a 1 minute walk away. Drinks and food served by waitstaff. Curved pool floats are great for lounging in the shallows. Life sized chess board in the pool. very nice day we had there.

Name: Casa Blanca Dolls
Address: 3 PR-345, Hormigueros, 00660, Puerto Rico

Reviews: Compared to the other local establishments this place is more posh. The ladies are talented and beautiful. They wear pasties though, so took away from reality exceeding expectations. Otherwise would definitely visit again and recommend others to do the same. You won't be disappointed. Good luck keeping your $$$; I'm giving it a high rating almost solely because of the girls. They are all gorgeous, with a variety of good looks, and they are all great at dancing and making the customers feel welcomed. The venue itself is small, and the private lounge is furnished only with foldable chairs. That said, it is clean and has a good atmosphere with good music. The prices I would say are typical for a gentleman's club. To management, I suggest installing an ATM and investing in more comfortable seating. Please note that the only baked good you will find here is cake.; Girls were hot and thick! My wife and I really enjoyed this place. Only knocking off one star because of no ATM- other than that, the place had  friendly staff, clean building, relaxed environment, and big booties! 🤤; I have been to different places in the Island, but by far this has been the best one ever!, Security, service, the environment this place has it all! As soon as I arrived to the club, I was greeted and treated like a king. I have never seen so much attention to detail for every customer that walks in to the club.; I recently ordered catering from here and it was really good. Yeliann was the one who I spoke with and she was able to suggest a menu based on my budget and needs. I coordinated everything before even getting to PR and she was very accomodating. I wish I had taken pictures, but it was so good that everyone repeated and even took leftovers home because of the generous servings. The menu was "arroz griego, con pechugas de pollo en salsa alfredo, ensalada de coditos, y panecillos". I also ordered a tray of "quesitos y pastelillos de guayaba", those were a winner with the people, they were crunchy and fresh. I definitely recommend this bakery!

Name: Boho Beach Club
Address: Carr. 101 Km. 18.1, Boquerón, Cabo Rojo 00622, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Open 24 hours; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours
Address Components: Boquerón (locality); Boquerón (administrative_area_level_2); Cabo Rojo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00622 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Upon arrival they request an invasive amount of information

They distribute wrist bands that they require you to wear when at the pool area, I guess to keep track of whom is in there but that’s not my problem

Requested room service at 10:30 a.m
No one ever came

Pools are closed to the quests after 10 p.m 🤷🏻‍♂️ not sure as to why considering anyone who comes here wouldn’t want to be limited to any time frame to go for a swim

We asked for ice and the staff insisted they can only give you ice in a very specific container, one in which is provided to you in the room however I left In the room and brought my own container they said no… than I simply ask for a few pieces in a cup that I had they said no…

Staff can provide kitchen room service but no one has planted that seed yet or just unwilling to do so; Great place with amazing prices.  The people at the front desk were very friendly and spoke great Spanish and English.  Have plenty of parking g and even a dog run outside.  Minutes away from the beach and they even have a restaurant/bar in the main lobby.  Would definitely recommend.   We stayed in their economy room which was perfect for us, 2 people; king size bed, shower with hygiene products, and TV for relaxing.; Booked last minute and I would definitely not recommend. A bit over hyped imo.
2 separate buildings, I booked in the second building (not mentioned online while booking) the first building is taken care of more. That’s where the restaurant and front desk are located.
Upon arrival they ask you to fill out a form online, they give you a parking permit slip so I don’t understand the point of filling out the online form with license plate, car info and so forth.
Wrist bands are given upon arrival for the pool, but no one even checks them.
No self service Ice machine, if you stay in the second building you have to exit and walk over to the main building and go to the restaurant for ice. Which they can only give ice inside a specific container that can be found in the room. Such an inconvenience, I was not even able to get ice in a cup or a scoop of ice in my personal cooler.
The room I stayed in was on the 3rd floor, with metal container roofs, so you can hear every noise that hit the roof. I can see how this may bother some people especially when there’s heavy rain.
Ac unit is directly facing front of the bed making it uncomfortable to sleep.
No night stands just inconvenient small metal stools ( everything I placed there would slide off)
There is a breakfast menu in the room but no room service, you have to go down to the main building and pick up your order.
Room service only came by once during my 4 day stay despite having the room service request sign on my door.
I was charged twice after my stay, one for overpriced Fiji water
Second for “damages” which was a wine stain. IMO is ridiculous over 50$ charge in total.
Only good thing about this hotel is the view and pool area. (Which btw closes after a certain time)
1 star all around; The Boho Beach Club is an excellent and charming hotel with great staff and service.  From the moment I called for the reservation until check out we were treated with the outmost kindness and respect. Super friendly and courteous staff made it an awesome stay. Liannette went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect.  Anthony and Erin were super helpful as well.  They also have awesome baristas and I enjoyed some yummy lattes they made to perfection.  The entire hotel is super clean and my room was immaculate.  The hotel is walking distance to El Poblado in Boquerón and only 8 minutes from Buyé Beach. It’s also fairly close to Ricon and other must see/visit places in the west. I loved my stay there and hope to go back soon!! I highly recommend this hotel!; Was a last minute reservation. The host was friendly. The room are outdated. The door room not close well and make loud noise scrathing with the floor. Over the bed a mesh "mosquitero" very dificult to watch TV, is on front og the TV screen.The air condition close to the floor with the fan direct to the bed. Not confortable to sleep. The parking lot, very difficult get inside, just one lane. I had wait 5 minutes after turn on the hot water to begin hot. The place has a Power generator and that is possite, but I dont know is working propertly.

Name: Aquarela Beach Club
Address: 46 Luis Muñoz Rivera, Cabo Rojo, 00622, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 46 (street_number); Luis Muñoz Rivera (route); Cabo Rojo (locality); Boquerón (administrative_area_level_2); Cabo Rojo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00622 (postal_code)
Reviews: What I liked: The room was clean, it had 2 Tvs, and the shower was big and it had hot water (unlike the hotel room I stayed the night before). I walked to the beach everyday and I loved that. And there's a minimarket right next to the villas, I bought coffee, cream etc. There's a laundromat nearby (about 3 mins in car) and everyone was nice there. What I didn't like: is that the sofa-bed is very uncomfortable, it would be nicer if they added a bed topper to make it more comfortable, we ended up with backaches. It would be nice if they added blankets and pillows cause my brother and I had to share the same blanket and we fought over it all night. At least for the people who are sleeping in the sofa-bed.; Clean rooms nice pool in center of Boqueron rooms very little have a kitchenette; New and modern facilities.  I loved it and will return soon.; Great place!!; Accessible place, very clean. And when calling to reserve it was easy and friendly. We liked that there is camera surveillance at all times.  We feel safe. We recommend it 💯

Had more beer than ever, it's hard to resist a super, super cold beer.; Great place for drinks & food, their fried fish was generously served, we loved it 😋👌🍺🇵🇷; The best place to  have bolitas de pescao on the west side of Puerto Rico 🇵🇷 gracias a Juano; This place is outstanding. Everything is clean, sanitized. Pack though, we were told at the entrance, that the place was full, but we could order drinks and food, and that the  waitress would deliver to the parking lot at our vehicles, we were lucky cause as we were being told a table right in front was being cleared. Breaded fish is what you see and we combined it with Tostones de Pana (breadfruit), with mayoketchup dressing. 😋 😋 😋. Fresh abd delicious, mixed drinks are loaded, I mean LOADED, we had whiskey & coconut water, & it was loaded, loved it. Beers are cold too. Waitress very attentive. Always wanted to visit this place, definitely will be back. Last but not least, everyone kept their distance due to this pandemia situation.; Met up with a few friends for a drink. The piñacolada was too sweet. We did not order any food because we had already eaten. No one came to offer us any food or more drinks.
The atmosphere was good, the patio was chill.

Name: Buyé Beach
Address: Buyé Beach, Cam Buye, Cabo Rojo, 00623, Puerto Rico
Vicinity: Buyé Beach, Camino Buye, Cabo Rojo
Address Components: Buyé Beach (natural_feature); Camino Buye (route); Cabo Rojo (locality); Pedernales (administrative_area_level_2); Cabo Rojo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00623 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Beautiful beach bay. Soft waves. Clean beach appearance, blue turquoise tones sea basin, a few algae. Soft sand, wavy sea bottom. Limited access through a narrow aisle. Plenty shade casting trees a few feet away and along the shore (see shade side view photo). Public facilities: Change rooms, bathroom. Free parking by the road and pay to park in resort. Kayak, paddle board rentals. Excellent day outing. Arrive early.; Buye Beach in Cabo Rojo, Puerto Rico, is an absolute gem! 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟 The pristine white sand and crystal-clear turquoise waters create a breathtaking and serene environment, perfect for a relaxing day by the sea.

The calm, shallow waters are ideal for swimming, making it a great spot for families with children. There are also plenty of shaded areas under the lush trees, perfect for a picnic or just lounging with a good book. The local food vendors offer delicious Puerto Rican snacks and refreshing drinks, adding to the authentic experience.

The sunsets here are absolutely stunning, providing the perfect backdrop for an unforgettable evening. Whether you're looking to relax, swim, or simply take in the natural beauty, Buye Beach is a must-visit. Highly recommended!; This is one of the best beaches to come to when visiting PR. The water is so clear, it has it seaweed but what beach doesn’t. It does get crowed so come early. The food there is amazing too.; Excellent place, small shop and kiosk for food and beverages. Parking lot is pretty nice with showers, unfortunately people litter a lot, rest of barbecue ashes and beer cans, If this is turned to a private beach it could be cleaner. The water and nature is immaculate beautiful. A must to visit in Puerto Rico.; This beach is so beautiful water is so clean and clear has hacking and camping areas not many parking areas and get extremely busy on the weekend

Suggest you going over there instead to get food/drinks. The pool was cool and the beach was right next to it. The rooms had rust on the handles and the game room was kind of weak. But you are here to enjoy the beach and out doors and that is what I recommend.; Be aware. The resort does not handle guest room keys. The system has being down since January. Anytime you need your room door open . You must request the registration staff to open your room door for you. That is big safety concern.; The hotel is a very good option to get access to Boqueron beach. The beach is well taken care of and very good to swim. One thing that I would recommend is having a rule for people not bringing their own music to the pool area, specially with a loud speaker. Not everybody has the same music tastes. A single visitor can't impose the music he/she likes on others.; this is totally not worth the stars it has. I don't know why it's rated so well. the rooms are dated for the price. there's bugs in the rooms and no one picks up the front desk phone. when I asked for an extra blanket no one knows which room I am in. they say my room doesn't exist. the lobby phone number is incorrect, the one listed here is for the one in Dorado. no one is at the front desk after 12am, I'm waiting in the lobby for a blanket and no one is around even though it says to call extention 2653, they said they were gonna send someone and no one came.; Awesome place.
