Reviews: I attended a family gathering in the premises.  We were about 80 people, and the business was open as usual.  They had a pretty good band performing.  Even though there were only 3 persons working the bar, everything ran smoothly and the waiting period was negligible.  All the staff was extremely courteous and the overall ambiance was excellent.  If you happen to be in Quebradillas, go to Q, have a couple of drinks and have fun.; Best music venue around, good food and vibes.; Lighting inside this place is terrible. Bartenders with bad attitude. The bar area looks like a storage area for broken down appliances, boxes, etc. I was told to bring my receipt to the register to pay because the bartender couldn't come to me to collect the bill as if the bartender was not in a position to come get the bill from me. In every place I've gone, they bring you the receipt, & they come back to collect the cash or the credit card. The bartenders are extremely rude & inexperienced in their line of work. I asked to speak to the manager, he totally ignored to come to us. Walked right by me with no care in the world. The crowd that come here seem unclassy. Hippy looking joint. People dressed up all weird. As for the music, very good. The DJ was great! That's why I went there. Beer & drinks are limited. No variety. If I go there again, it'll be for the same reason, to hear the music. The place where this business is located, is a total ghost town. So, go at your own risk!; Great Place, love it, customer service is excellent, Noel and Agustín they both took good care of me and my family, Pizza is awesome. This place also is booming during weekends with either great live music, spanning from local jazz & tropical (salsa) music orchestras to local rock, & reggae bands, and even stand-up comedy show or any type of live show. This place is big, but cozy and air-conditioned. This place is Hip, you'll feel comfortable and the people that come here are very nice and amicable. Enjoy.; great place in the small town of quebradillas they have live music on the weekends and live shows on certain occasion. the place has air conditioning (its not a common thing in the area) and the bartenders make a pretty mean mojito! prices are super good.

Reviews: Had a great time — there was a show that night that started at 1:00 AM! They made two announcements before it started to keep you updated. The DJ was playing well while we waited —reggaeton, pop, RNB and house mixes were playing. The inside is cute and well air conditioned. People were friendly and the vibe was good. The show was absolutely amazing. We didn’t have to give cover when we came at 12:00.; My favorite gay bar in San Juan. Great music and drag shows. Bathrooms also very clean and drinks are good.!; $8 cover charge, not bad, however the gentlemen who paid in front of us paid less than we did.  The drag show was FANTASTIC and the entertainers were beautiful and super talented.  The vibe is a mix of young and older, fun dance atmosphere.  The bar service was HORRIBLE.  Even after politely asking the bartender several times for a drink, he continued to serve others that jumped in front of us, seemed to play favorites with locals. Would I go back yes, but service could improve.  I appreciate the environment and would love to spend money, but don’t be rude.  If you don’t want to service out of towners’ ‘mainlander’s’ say so…; Slowest bartenders in the northern hemisphere. It wasn't overly busy and they weren't understaffed. They just moved at a glacial pace. 45 minute wait for a single drink. And yes, I made sure to tip every time I ordered; The decorations are great and drinks were good. $6 cover charge to enter. But the show started super late! We arrived at 12am and were told that the drag show started at 1am but it didn't start until 1:40am. Had to sit and wait for over an hour and a half. Performance was subpar and it was an older style of drag (ballods and ballgowns) which didn't match the vibe before the show. The drag performers we saw on Thursday were not well rehearsed, some didn't know all the words, and they had a lot of technical difficulties (sound and curtain cues). Very unprofessional and disappointing. Not a great experience for my first Drag Bar.

Name: Peñón Amador Beach
Address: Punta Peñon, Camuy 00627, Puerto Rico
Address Components: Punta Peñon (point_of_interest); Membrillo (administrative_area_level_2); Camuy (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00627 (postal_code)
Reviews: Stopped by on our way to a restaurant. Holy cow! Waves are huge and relentless. You can spend the day watching them crash into the rocks. Cow pasture opposite the beach. Free parking. Nature is grand.; Cool little beach that no one ever talks about, I think only the locals ever go here. The beach was super clean, shallow, I believe it fits all the criteria of how a beach should be. No bathrooms, no kiosks, everyone should bring their supplies. There is a boat ramp available. Other than that perfect place to chill.; We visited during the weekday and it was quiet and relaxing. We had a small pool all to ourselves! There were other families there having a great time as well. One thing we quickly learned is that most touristy spots in the area open Thursday through Sunday. We didn't mind as we were staying with family.; It's small, strong waves, good for surfing. There is a small natural tidal pool, but it was too crowded. Not good for small children. Lots of rocks too. But the views are beautiful.; One of, if not the favorite beach spot for our family. It offers everything from surfing, Boogie Boarding, snorkeling, fishing, camping, cliff jumping, or simply a relaxing family time playing in the water and sand! The city of Camuy has done an excellent job keeping this little beach spot clean and safe!

Reviews:
Me and my partner are from Bayamon and when travelling to visit family we stop by here. The donuts are fresh, delicious and their presentation is great. The customer service is always great!; Awesome stop to have a coffee and donuts.  You need to try the mini cinnabons!  It's so delicious!  The variety of donuts is fantastic.  The filling is from good quality and plenty within the donut.  The coffee is prepared at the moment of order, thus it can take some time to be prepared.

The store has seats inside that are kept clean.  They accept all sort of payment.; Visited for the first time today. Just become one of my favorite donut places!! Everything is fresh, soft and sweet. Just perfect. 💕; Costumer Service is awesome to sum ir up. They take my 3 stars, the reaming would’ve been for the facilities, but they DONT let the employees turn on the a/c till 10:00am when they open at 8:00, not to mention they employees come in before that to work on the FRYER!!! with NO a/c! Horrible employee treatment bro!; The only location anywhere from Aguadilla to Arecibo to be able to get Donuts are always fresh. Most popular is guava, guava-gueso, and pineapple. They also have lemon, creme, gueso, cinnamon rolls, boston creme, glazed and other assorted flavored glazed donuts. A dozen for $11 bucks but it's worth it. They also sell slushy slurpees, coffee, assorted carbonated beverages and limited selection of ice cream. Currently, patrons are not allowed to sit in this establishment; just order and go! Usually people hang out briefly to consume their sweets before going right back in to order & take home. This place is also next to an eatery Don Kike where if you go EARLY, you can dine in and nourish yourself with typical authentic Spanish dishes.

Reviews:
Clean place with a good vibes and nice chill music, attentive employees and helpful cashier helps you with choosing from the menu. I m had the pastrami sandwich and it was delicious and a nice decent portion. My coffee was ok and the service was on point. Tables clean weather was good! Place is big enough to feel confortable  lots of spaces between tables. Definitely coming back again for a beer ore coffee.; I found this place and they have good coffee.
I try the JQH Bagel with ham, american cheese, egg in a omelette served in a Multigrain Bagel, I added avocado and for me it was a good choice.

The place is very nice and the staff is very friendly.

Recommended 💯; The first time here, the food was good and hot. Loved the coffee. Had to come back and try lunch.; The service was great the eggs and bagel were delightful, but the coffee was a bit watered down. Overall though it’s a very nice breakfast spot.; I love this place. We get our beans and a cup of coffee here whenever we are visiting the Island. Our usual is a Flat White with oat milk. They make one of the most delicious coffee cups in the Island.

My only complaint is the 2 pm closing time. As it is hard to schedule going to purchase more beans.

Other than that, this place is great.

Reviews: Nice place to go play golf. You can rent a  bucket and stick  to play. The restaurant has a good menu, outdoor sitting, and great service. On weekends have great live music until 6 P.M. Salsa dance classes during the week $10 per class.; I played Caguas Real Golf Club in February of 2024. The staff was friendly and welcoming and the course was beautiful and in really good shape. There were challenging and interesting holes and great views on each nine. My only regret was that I was only able to play it once as our rental house was an hour away. The price was reasonable especially compared to some of the resort courses on the island.; This is a really good course. If you are in the eastern part of town, it was right behind my hotel. I really enjoyed playing it. I intend to play it again before I leave. Even though it had Marshall’s the pace was very slow. Even though I complained to the Marshall, they never did anything about slow pace skilled players, and nearly 12 minutes waiting for each whole. Very beautiful course. Picture. Highly playable. Some challenges. But really, really a solid horse.; Unique situation.  We booked through our concierge for this course on a Tuesday and when we arrived we were told the course was closed. Jaime greeting us and even though they were closed allowed us to play nonetheless. Beautiful course, fairways immaculate. Greens were good but they were in the process of redoing. Overall great day. Huge shoutout to Jaimie and his group.; Great place for golf, beers and a burguer. Nicest golf place near Caguas. Greens are well kept and service at the Palos and Green bar is very good.👍🏼

Even with my limited Spanish, I get checked in and loaded to play with no hassles; Buyers Beware! FYI. This complex is supplied by well water and the apartments are having a lot of issues because the water is rationed with the houses. The houses at Caguas Real have water tanks therefore don't have a problem, but the apartments do.  Make sure you are well informed if you are thinking of buying in this complex. Name: OMNIA Nightclub
Address: 3570 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: 10:30 PM – 4:00 AM; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 10:30 PM – 4:00 AM; Friday: 10:30 PM – 4:00 AM; Saturday: 10:30 PM – 4:00 AM; Sunday: 10:30 PM – 4:00 AM

Address Components: 3570 (street_number); South Las Vegas Boulevard (route); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89109 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Best club but they prioritize profit over experience. The dance floor and general spaces were packed nuts to butts. My cocktail cost $75 due to having to buy some glass. Surprised I wasn't charged a breathing fee also.

Great lighting and sound system; The music at the club is great, but there are some downsides. Assume boys and girls are promoted but girls can get in for free, while guys must pay about $130 just for entry, which is quite expensive. Inside, there are no menus or prices listed for drinks, so be sure to ask the bar keepers about both the drink options and their prices, my cocktail cost $70 🥴. The club is poorly organized, often very crowded, and space can be hard to come by. No one controlls how many people are already inside. Be mindful of the stamps you receive on your arm, as after midnight, security guards at the dance floor entries will only let people with specific stamps in. Make sure to ask about everything to avoid any surprises 😅. At the terrace you have a good view of the Las Vegas strip.; First time here, very well organized, was a Friday night and absolutely packed. But not uncomfortable. Got in quickly, bought tickets before hand. Loved this place and would definitely return. Good mix of people in the crowd, security and employees were very friendly and helpful. Drinks were extremely expensive but that’s Vegas: would recommend and return. Not a bad spot in the place.; We had a good time at this nightclub to watch Zedd. We were able to skip much of the line since we got the VIP bar card option which includes entrance, VIP line and a $100 bar card. The line can get VERY long so it’s definitely worth it to grab the bar card option! Drinks are $20-25 so the bar card is also helpful since it covers some of your drinks while giving you the entrance and quicker line. Small bags are allowed and they do have a dress code so make sure to check that on their website. Zedd was incredible! They also offer VIP table options at different price points. The club itself is very large and has tons of areas. They also offer different bars around the place. It was overall a very fun night. They do definitely oversell tickets as it did get quite packed throughout the night and some people can be very rude when shoving past you.; The most memorable night club in Vegas for me. The lighting, sound, smoke effects, the moving center piece. Quiet literally blows your socks off. Esp since I expected none of it coming in. The space is more of a tighter/intimate setting..but plenty of room to breathe if you get off the center dance floor. Highly recommend the experience!

Reviews:
Very bad experience. It is simply scam. Disgusting gin tonic in plastick cup for 28 USD. They are talking about dress code but club is full of people in trucksuit, sneakers and caps like people from carousels. We have bought tickets for 50 cent. We have left club at 2:15 am and concert still doesn’t start. Save money and don’t go to this overpriced place full awkward posers.; THIS MANGER IS RUDE TODAY IS MY BIRTHDAY I HAVE A TABLE ETC HE PUSH ME AND TOLD ME TO BACK UP!!! I HAVE NEVER HAVE A MAN TOUCH ME!!! I STAY IN LAS VEGAS AND THIS ISN'T IT!!! I LOVE THIS CLUB BUT PUTTING YOU'RE HANDS ON A WOMEN!!! I ALSO HAVE A VIDEO OF HIM GRABBING ME UNACCEPTABLE; Great place after hours, line wasn’t a long wait. Second time in Vegas and definitely a great club and the vibes were amazing. The bartenders were amazing and great customer service. Tory Lanez happened to show up and was the dj for a a while, that was fun!! Definitely would come back if I return to Vegas.; DO NOT PURCHASE TICKETS FOR ANY ARTST THAT ARE SCHEDULED TO PERFORM AT THIS NIGHTCLUB! I purchased 2 tickets to see Moneybagg Yo perform on 12/8/23 and he never showed up. I reached out the venue and they are refusing to refund my money. I wish I could give this rating negative stars.; I went to Drais After Hours for the first time on the Saturday of Memorial Day weekend, 2023. I recommend purchasing tickets to presale online because they will undoubtedly jack up the price at the door. When purchasing presale tickets, select the correct day according to Drais After Hours standards. I bought a presale ticket for Saturday and attempted to enter early Saturday morning at approximately 4:15 am. The bouncer informed me that despite the day being Saturday, I should return on Sunday around 4:00 am. For instance, if you go to Drais nightclub on Friday night, purchase an after-hours ticket for Friday, even though it will technically be Saturday once you arrive.

The After Hours is super disorganized, and they do not operate as professionally or smoothly as Drais nightclub. The After-hours don’t have a presale ticket line which they should. Despite having a presale ticket, I watched people jump past me because they paid a “ convenience fee” to skip the line or knew a bouncer. After standing near the front line for some time, I informed the bouncer that I had a presale ticket, and he let me through. The bouncers never made any announcements regarding presale entry; they focused on announcing that patrons could skip the line if they paid “ convenience charges.”

I showed the bouncer my presale ticket and headed down the stairs to the nightclub. Once I reached the front,  the cashier informed me that I had to get a ticket upstairs to gain entry. Again, no one communicated this to me upstairs. Therefore, I had to walk upstairs and show my ticket in the area located to the right of the entrance door. I skipped back toward the front of the line because I had waited so long!

The inside of the club has a bat cave feel with red lighting, and three areas have a dance floor. I liked the vibe, and it has a more down-to-earth feel than my beloved Drais nightclub. People danced and mingled inside the packed lounge. I would return,  because I liked the scene inside.

My review could have been a 5-star. However, based on how extremely disorganized the staff and line for entry are, I deducted two stars. They need to tighten up their organization in a major way!

The music and DJ was on point, and we were loving every moment of it. Overall, it was a great night—definitely a cool spot to check out if you’re in town!; The dress code is #12 on their FAQ, as of this writing... The signage when you arrive though is very clear.

I understand there's a user agreement where I shouldn't expect my money back for not attending a show, but I feel it is inappropriate to prioritize bottle service tips over being able to get inside.

I hope this venue considers putting it's dress code as clear on its website and the ticket confirmation process as it is on the venue's large entry sign... I'm adding a star for the understanding and thoughtful staff.; I came here for a networking event before the club opened. The drinks are extremely overpriced. Although the venue is large, the dance floor is cornered off and get very crowded after midnight.; If I could give zero stars I would. Doors are supposed to open at 10:30.. was going on 11pm without letting a single person in. We bought an all you can drink package till midnight. We were first in line waiting. My husband went up to the security and asked when about the doors would be opening.. considering we paid extra for unlimited drinks till midnight. Security kicked us out for absolutely no reason.. we simply asked when the doors would open and they took offense to it. Take your money elsewhere. Security needs to be retrained.; Celebrated my wedding with an after party here.  Deadmau5 put on a great show.  Fantastic service from table staff, wouldn’t have been possible without my awesome host.  Brian Pfeiffer vip host for Zouk his cell is 773-459-8133

Name: Mango Tango Nightclub
Address: 2101 S Decatur Blvd Ste. 1, Las Vegas, NV 89102, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 5:00 AM; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 10:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Thursday: 12:00 – 5:00 AM, 10:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 12:00 – 5:00 AM, 10:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 12:00 – 6:00 AM, 10:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 12:00 – 6:00 AM, 10:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Vicinity: 2101 South Decatur Boulevard Ste. 1, Las Vegas
Address Components: Ste. 1 (subpremise); 2101 (street_number); South Decatur Boulevard (route); Charleston (neighborhood); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89102 (postal_code)
Reviews:
They charge $220 for a dirty cheap table that you’d assume is free and charge girls on Saturday for entry even though it’s empty. The music and Dj aren’t great. The bouncers act like jerks. The bartender was rude. Wait until Sunday and go to omnia instead. Also they kicked our group off the dance floor because we had a drink in our hand. Every other club in Vegas allows you to dance while you’re drinking not here. It’s so ghetto they have furniture ads on the tvs.; Enjoyed the service even when I ordered a bucket of water on my second round. They played the right music, great place for Latin music. Didn't know they served food I'll have to try it next time.; Came here on a lunch break. Not only did they charge me 20 dollars to get in. But all I wanted was to order food. Ordered at the podium at the front (didn’t even need to fully enter to place my order) sat and tried to enjoy the atmosphere but maybe it’s a culture thing because nothing about the show they had that night was appealing to me. It was essentially four partially nude women dancing around what appeared to be a man in a wig and dress with terribly done makeup and a crunchy wig. The entire thing made me uncomfortable but then again I didn’t want to offend. I just waited for my food. The server/waitress who helped me was nice enough so I gave her the change for my order as a tip. I haven’t returned because 20$ to enter this place is kind of steep in my opinion. The food (shrimp tacos) was okay. I know bar food isn’t the best but it was super greasy without much flavor. I won’t be returning.; Horrible experience
50th birthday trip to vegas. Uber guy recommended this place. I ordered 2 lemon drops. Gal with fishnet stocking had no idea how to make a martini. Served us two with ice, lime and cherries without vodka! $31 when I told her how to make them the guy got in my face and told us it wasn't a bar! They even took my vape at the door! Don't go here! Bullshit!; Not too shabby of a Latin nightclub. I have a already inquired getting table service for my family at a later date this year. I don't go out as much as I used to but I do believe this is a place where everyone can have a good time. Good music, strong drinks and room to dance.

Name: XS Nightclub
Address: 3131 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: Closed; Friday: 10:30 AM – 4:00 AM; Saturday: 10:30 AM – 4:00 AM; Sunday: 10:30 AM – 4:00 AM
Vicinity: 3131 Las Vegas Boulevard South, Las Vegas
Address Components: 3131 (street_number); Las Vegas Boulevard South (route); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89109 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This place is amazing! We went two nights in a row for Rufus Du Sol, and then Diplo & Dillon Francis. One night was the regular XS club, and the second night was night swim. Overall, the experience was way better than we were expecting. We did not have to wait long at all both nights (max 15 mins), and made it through security with our supplies with no issues. Though we did see a group in front of us get their stiizy confiscated, and security literally pocketed it for herself (lol good for you queen). The bar service was very fast, even with open bar, and the drinks were strong. The first night we were too late for open bar, and drinks were EXPENSIVE. $55 for a vodka lemonade & long island. The open bar was only $40 and we got about 10 drinks each so very worth it. The dance floor space is kinda small, however there is SO MUCH space in the club as a whole, and you can easily find a spot to sit down and get air if you need it. They have water fountains and bathrooms easily accessible. Security was not an issue. If you are not used to nightlife etiquette, I can see how you might not enjoy this place. But as someone who comes from a big nightlife city, Vegas does it like no other and XS blew it out of the park! Also, if you have girls in your group, absolutely go through a promoter and get on the guest list!; Not sure why reviews are so low, but had the best new years evening of my life. I've been to many big cities(NY, London, Toronto) and many different clubs. This had terrific music, great vibes and good crowd. Was quite busy considering it's NYE, but definitely was an unforgettable experience.; I went to XS on June 9th for my cousin’s Bachelorette to see Diplo.

We had VIP tickets via the Las Vegas Keys and arrived at the club around 12:30 AM with no issues. The first hour was great, it was us 5 girl cousins dancing in front of the DJ booth having a ton of fun until about an hour later when we suddenly separated.

This club was packed to the brim with thousands of people, I’m curious to know if they keep track of capacity but anyway I eventually made eye contact with one of my cousins who was inside a VIP booth. As I was making my over to them, a 350 pound bouncer blocked me from entering the area and shoved be really hard with his forearm. I’m lucky I didn’t fall but I did retaliate by shoving him back because I felt it was extremely inappropriate for a very large man to aggressively push a 5’2 117 pound woman for trying to reunite with her family.

The bouncer ordered another security personnel  to escort me out of the club but before doing so I managed to snap a couple pics of the bouncer who aggressively shoved me.

So yes, I was essentially kicked out, couldn’t get back in and I just went back to my hotel alone.

I complained to the  VIP club concierge but he said he couldn’t do anything and that the club bouncers are known for being aggressive. I found this appalling and also read several reviews on google about other women having similar experiences.

What’s the moral of the story, avoid this club. If you go, be very careful if you’re a woman, make sure you’re not alone, and don’t be surprised by aggressive behaviour from their security staff because apparently this is normal.

Photos of the bouncer attached.; Two Friends lived up to the hype and turned a bad experience into a not so horrible experience. My group of friends (we were four girls) arrived at the club around 11:30ish on Saturday night, 03/23/24, and so far so good. However, when it was closer to 12:30ish, the club was way too packed and we wanted to go down to the dance floor to see the DJs better. The security guards were barricading the aisle that connected the booths to the dance floor. In an attempt to squeeze our group in after the security allowed us to go through, everyone was pushing and shoving so I was separated from my group and made it onto the floor but my friends were barred from entering. I told BOTH security guards I need my friends with me because a single woman shouldn’t be alone at the club while they forced me to separate from them. They also did not allow me to wait for them to enter. I saw that they discriminately allowed a group of five/six guys through with no issues but they can’t let four girls through? Anyways, security was terrible and ruined the mood. The bartender was the only saving grace and the only reason this review received an additional star because she was really kind and gave us good suggestions for what we should order. Anyways, for future club-goers, if you want to have fun, definitely a packed Saturday night should be avoided at all costs unless you can somehow get into one of the booths. It’ll be a mediocre experience regardless.; I had an amazing New Year's Eve at this nightclub! The atmosphere was fantastic, the design was beautiful, and the spacious bars made it easy to enjoy the night. The DJ kept the energy high, making it a truly wonderful experience. Highly recommend for a great night out!

Name: Chateau Nightclub
Address: 3655 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: Closed; Friday: 10:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 10:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Vicinity: 3655 South Las Vegas Boulevard, Las Vegas
Address Components: 3655 (street_number); South Las Vegas Boulevard (route); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89109 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I highly recommend this club for a special occasion. We went here for my friend’s bachelorette party and had an amazing time. With your ticket price that secures a table for your group and beverage credit equals the price of your ticket which turns out to be a great deal with how expensive 1 drink is at most clubs. There are designated security guards for each section that introduced themselves to us upon arrival. Our waitress was friendly and attentive. The views and atmosphere is amazing. The music was great. I will continue to recommend it here for anyone looking to have a special celebration.; Bought tickets to the 2020 NYE event and was disapointed. Ticket prices were about 170$ each. We showed up 45 minutes early which apparently wasnt enough because the line was already huge and we waited about an hour to get inside. The ticket price included open bar but was impossible to get to the actual bar once inside so we left the cool nightclub and went downstairs to the less crowded beer garden for the open bar. The only saving grace of this New Years Eve event is the view of the fireworks, and the fact that you dont have to deal with the 400,000 people on the strip. My advice, find a free or cheap alternative with a rooftop view for New Year Eve.; The club itself is interesting as it is set under the Eiffel tower. The view from up there is pretty good as well.

The biggest issue was getting through the door. The cover charge is $30 a person. However, if you walk out onto the strip you can easily get passes to get you in for a much cheaper rate. After about 30 seconds of walking I was able to get $20 coupon for myself, with another one for ladies to get in free. This brought the cover charge down to just $20 for 2. After we got our IDs checked by the first bouncer, we then got to the cover charge counter and paid our $20 fee. Then, we got to the third bouncer who wouldn't allow us in because we had a bag with us. They did not seem to have anything coordinated between themselves, and the 3rd bouncer said the cover charge counter could hold a bag for us, but they refused. They definitely need to get their stuff together, because if I had paid $60 just to find out I can't get through the door there would have been a serious problem. I hope the owner of the establishment reads this review, because the bouncing staff is very inefficient. There will be issues if this ever happens again.

After finally stowing our bags back at our hotel, we were able to get into the club. The people shuttling us through the elevators were very polite.

Drinks were very, very expensive. But I suspect this is typical for all clubs on the strip.

TL;DR: find discounted entry cards on the strip. The bouncers absolutely need to get their game together.; I visited this club while at a conference. We had the whole club to ourselves as it was a private party. Great location and beautiful design as it's built into the base of the Eiffel Tower in the Paris hotel. You have to take an elevator in and out of the hotel so that can slow you down. Food and drink were high quality but no Canadian Whiskey :(; My friends and I came here last weekend to celebrate a birthday. Since we had 8 people in our group, we chose to get a VIP table. The service was awesome! She made us all drinks and a round of shots with the bottle of Vodka we ordered. The vibe was very upbeat and chill. Exactly what we were looking for.

Name: Nightclub on Wheels Experience
Address: 3753 Howard Hughes Pkwy #244, Las Vegas, NV 89169, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 3:00 AM
Address Components: #244 (subpremise); 3753 (street_number); Howard Hughes Parkway (route); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89169 (postal_code)
Reviews: What an amazing night out! The Nightclub on Wheels experience was absolutely incredible. From the lively atmosphere to the top-notch music, it exceeded all my expectations. The drinks were delicious, the staff was friendly and attentive, and the dance floor was always pumping. I can't wait to go back for another unforgettable night of partying on wheels!; Wow, just wow! The Nightclub on Wheels Experience blew my mind. They picked us up in style from the hotel, and the 1-hour open bar got the party started pronto. The scenic tour and Vegas sign stop were Instagram-worthy moments, and the complimentary club/pool guest list made us feel like VIPs. This is how you do Vegas right!; Nightclub on Wheels is the ultimate party experience! The music was on point, the drinks were flowing, and the vibe was contagious. I danced the night away with friends and had the time of my life. It's a must-do for party enthusiasts!; If you're looking for a one-of-a-kind night out, the Nightclub on Wheels Experience is a must-try. The top-notch sound system and interactive entertainment made it a memorable and electrifying experience.; “Best party bus experience ever!  My new go-to activity whenever I go to Vegas.  You get to play your own music, there's plenty of complimentary top-shelf alcohol, and everyone appreciates a private tour of the strip in a decked-out Sprinter.  I can't think of anything I've done in Vegas that cost under $100/person that offers this much value.  Nightclub on Wheels is the real deal!”

Name: Piranha Nightclub
Address: 4633 Paradise Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89169, USA
Address Components: 4633 (street_number); Paradise Road (route); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89169 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Fantastic experience!!  Visited so that we could see plane Jane performing and LOVED THE CLUB.  Multiple areas that play different music which all have their own bars.  Each area feels very separate and the isolated.  Drinks were reasonable and not watered down.  With all the different areas for drinks, never had to wait even though I visited on a busy Saturday night, that happened to also be the 18th anniversary. Gogo Dancers were hott, and entrance fee was 20 for a Saturday night.  Great time!!!; Worst bartender! We came as a group from San Diego, a friend recommended us but the bartender named Jeremiah altitudes us very badly. My friend wanted to buy me a drink but I had such a sugary drink that I wanted to change but he charged us again. These payments were definitely canceled! By the way, I asked for water but he wanted to sell me a bottle. In this country cup of water has to be free if you sell alcohol. He didn't know that! He almost kicked us out of the bar with his answers. And because I was sitting at the bar I could see that he was doing all the drinks wrong. Too little alcohol, too much soft drink. If I come again I will never buy a drink from that boy.  Also last think; at the end of the conversation he told me not to talk to me anymore, I have never seen such a bartender in my life. It is really bad for friends who work and labor because they lose us because of people like this who do not like their job.; The worst club in terms of customer service.
I asked 3 different employees where the Main Stage was so I wouldn't miss the Artist's performance.
Everyone pointed to a different room!
As a result, I walked between the rooms and at the end of the performance I caught the artist.

I have no desire to visit this club anymore! 💯

Even the bartender didn't mix the cocktail well, he just poured liquid from two bottles and served it to me. 2 of 10! 🤢; Nice place but one of the barmen ruined our mood he charged us for drinks twice because he made it wrong drink we just asked its not our order but he did not take responsibility at all and started an argument with us he used very arrogant language against one of my girlfriends! We paid but definitely, he does not deserve that money and must understand he was wrong otherwise we can pay its not the issue!; My 1st drag show in Vegas, I went for Mirage but she was out on tour. But over all had fun! Will be returning.

Name: Drai's Beachclub & Nightclub
Address: 3595 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 5:00 PM; Tuesday: 12:00 – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 12:00 – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 12:00 – 5:00 PM; Friday: 12:00 – 5:00 PM, 10:30 PM – 3:30 AM; Saturday: 12:00 – 6:00 PM, 10:30 PM – 3:30 AM; Sunday: 12:00 – 5:00 PM
Vicinity: 3595 South Las Vegas Boulevard, Las Vegas
Address Components: 3595 (street_number); South Las Vegas Boulevard (route); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89109 (postal_code); 8918 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Loved my first experience here, security are very strict make sure you bring ID and leave any unnecessary items at home/hotel or they will be thrown in "in the trash" with zero hesitation. They provide towels at $5 each (you can't bring your own inside). If you book booths/tables etc do so before your trip as they are super expensive. This place gets packed. Food was really good but don't expect to sit down and eat as seating is pretty scarce, drinks are expensive but very strong. Some great acts too. Definitely recommend this beach club.; Obviously it's the place to be for great pool parties and performances... this day 2 chains was preforming at both pool party and that night.

A group of cousins in town decided to go after brunch, all planned some had tickets others were on a list but brunch held over. Major cost difference but that was the easy part.

We were in line and I had a Nike pouch, fan, gum, a little bottle of alcohol, and yes my Lactaid pills (Iykyk lol)
Suddenly all these things were being placed apart from my items, as I was last in line I'm making sure everyone else is fine.

She hands me by bag and leaves items on table, in confusion about most, I question why are those thee, what happened. "You can't take them in with you"
While I knew why some, others I was simply confused as the items had been with me everywhere 3 days prior to.
Things did escalate due to the dismissive nature of the conversation in which I do not tolerate. A simple explanation would suffice (as I was given later on by a security guard TO BE NOTED-- NOTHING THAT CAN BE INJ) simply stating a reason why shouldn't be such a far cry of providing good customer service, even in a security role.

Otherwise, pool party was great 2 Chains kept crowd going during his performance. Drinks were extremely high, ordered 6 frozen drinks and a cocktail and total was around $200. Very steep but whatever.

After a few in the group getting rounds we realized we should have planned for that section. So push yourself if you feel that maybe the case to avoid a lot of confusion and also offering you a place to sit, outside of the pool.

Overall not the best experience but for the vibes would return.; 1/5 stars - Extremely Disappointing Experience at Drai's on 8/18

We've been loyal customers of Drai's for over 3 years, with multiple trips and sections, but our latest visit was a disaster. The issue arose when my friend and I went downstairs from our booked section (pictured) and were confronted by an aggressive security guard on the 1st floor with braids/twists. He accused us of not owning the bottles in our section, which was completely unfounded and disrespectful.

As a long-time customer, I expect a higher level of service and respect. The security guard's behavior was unacceptable and ruined our night. We've never had an issue before, but this experience has left a sour taste. Hopefully, Drai's will address this incident and take steps to ensure their security team is properly trained to handle customers with respect.; Had a good time at a private event at Drai's, then stayed longer for an evening club setting. Nice music,  good drinks, energizing atmosphere.  Enjoy!; This pool is definitely the vibe. Went on a chill afternoon, no concert going on and loved it! Grabbing a cabana is next level.

Name: LV Nightlife VIP
Address: 3722 S Las Vegas Blvd UNIT 2107, Las Vegas, NV 89158, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 2:00 AM
Vicinity: 3722 South Las Vegas Boulevard UNIT 2107, Las Vegas
Address Components: UNIT 2107 (subpremise); 3722 (street_number); South Las Vegas Boulevard (route); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89158 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I shopped around trying to book with several companies. I decided to work with Bottle Service Las Vegas because they had the best prices and didn't force me to prepay for everything. It was a great choice and my host Brandon is clearly the man to know. I'll be using their serviced every time I come to Vegas. Marquee was amazing by the way!!!; Please do not book with this company!!!! Put a $500 deposit down on 2 tables at the Chateau 8 months before the date of arrival. Contacted the company the day before the date I had reserved 8 months ago. Come to find out the reservation had not been booked. The way I found out was contacting the Chateau Night Club. All bottle Service Vegas did was give me the run around. Bottle Service Vegas ended up booking a reservation last minute. When my party showed up at the Chateau we were told the club promoter needed to be there with us to get in under the reservation. So the $500 I put down 8 months ago was useless. The Chateau ended up being awesome about everything and help us to get two great tables and have a good time. This company is a joke! For what bottle  service Vegas charged on the invoice  I had for 2 tables and bottle service was marked up $700 more than if I went through the Chateau directly. So I got scammed out of $500 dollars. The club said it is honestly not a good idea to go through 3rd parties. Learned my lesson don't buy a Rolex off the street! This company is grabage. Thank you club Chateau for helping to make our night amazing!; After shopping around with a few different host companies a few weeks before we were to arrive, Bottle Service Vegas was the only one to respond in a prompt manner. We were provided options and various package prices to choose from. Rene was very friendly and answered all of my questions quickly. Best booking experience & by far the best customer service.; Had a blast! Rene made it simple to get hooked up. Offered some tables at the clubs we wanted but they were a little out of our range because of the weekend and our large group so he got us another table different club same hotel with the option to go to the club we wanted to see the performer. Will definitely use them again. They have different options for different budgets.; By far the best experience with Vegas bottles Services thus far!!! Everything they said they came thru on , me and my friends had the time of our lives !!! I recommend that BSV be your first and only option A+++ service and shotout to Renee, Shannon, Jamall and any others associated with this company!!!! I defiently
coming back!!!!

Thanks again

Name: Ghostbar
Address: 4321 W Flamingo Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89103, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 7:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Thursday: 7:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 7:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 7:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: Closed

Reviews:
Amazing view of Vegas. Live and vivid ambience. Music is awesome. It opens at 9 pm on Wednesdays. Gets crowded around 11. Don’t go by the timings as available on google. Once they check your identity, they will stamp a logo on your hand. Take the lift and get an amazing view of the city. No food, only drinks.; Went here to start off our night on the town.

The view was great. The bartenders were kind and attentive. The music was decent. Thus, 2 stars. We ordered rail drinks and champagne, which were fine.

Everything else was an absolute shambles. When we entered the bouncer (VERY rudely) rejected our friend’s valid international government ID (it was accepted everywhere else in Vegas). Once we spoke to the manager and sorted it out we waited a while to be put into an unlabeled service elevator lobby. Staff there were inattentive. We ended up taking the wrong elevator to two random service corridors before coming back and being put on the right elevator. That elevator dropped us in the kitchen of the club - not a great look.; Beautiful bar, amazing view and great drinks. We loved this place; Awesome place! Had so much fun here, music is great, vibes are fun.; The view is amazing, get to see the whole strip. The room set up is cool. The bartenders were amazing, Lawrence introduced himself to me and was super attentive all evening. All the stuff was pretty awesome. Had a really fun night thank you, I’ll def be back.

Name: Luna Lounge
Address: 3057 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Tuesday: 7:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Wednesday: 7:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Thursday: 7:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Friday: 4:00 PM – 4:00 AM; Saturday: 4:00 PM – 4:00 AM; Sunday: 12:00 PM – 4:00 AM
Vicinity: 3057 South Las Vegas Boulevard, Las Vegas
Address Components: 3057 (street_number); South Las Vegas Boulevard (route); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89109 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Loved the vibe! Got the skittles and vanilla. Both were good but the vanilla is very light flavored. Dustin was our server and we loved his charisma and epic style!; I visited this hookah lounge while in Vegas, and I must say, the atmosphere was great. The vibe was chill, the music was good, and the place had a relaxed feel. However, something happened that made me uncomfortable. When I asked to open a tab, the waitress requested both my credit card and ID card. As a tourist, I wasn’t sure if this was standard practice in Vegas, but it definitely raised a red flag for me.

From a previous experience, I know that this can be risky. I had a similar situation at another place, and later found out my credit card was used to order a fridge from Walmart in another state! Thankfully, I caught it in time and blocked the card, but that memory stuck with me.

At this lounge, I asked the waitress to take a look at my ID but give it back, and she still insisted on keeping it. At that point, I decided not to risk it. I asked for both my cards back and paid with cash for each drink instead.

I’m sharing this story as a heads-up to anyone visiting. If you’re ever asked to hand over both your credit card and ID, be cautious and consider paying as you go or with cash. Better to be safe than sorry!; The atmosphere and food was amazing! Sal was a great help very nice and helpful. Definitely will rate this establishment 10/10!; I’m an influencer, so you can count on me to share on my social media just how awful your establishment is. We had a disappointing experience at Luna Lounge in Las Vegas. It all started with a 5-minute check of our passports and bags, only for them to tell us to throw away the McDonald's I had taken to go, which is, of course, understandable. After complying, we were then told we couldn’t enter because one of us was wearing shorts. My friend pointed out how disrespectful that was, especially after we had already thrown away our food, and that they should’ve told us beforehand!

Eventually, someone came over and told us we could enter. We were then seated outside on a terrace, on camping chairs and tables, all facing the wall. We asked if we could move the tables around to sit properly and actually see each other, but the waitress said we couldn’t and that we needed permission (what a joke!), which we finally got.

When ordering, the waitress asked for a passport, even though we had already been checked. And to our surprise, she also wanted a credit card “in case” we left without paying. Seriously?! There were five of us, two couples and a friend. The guys were ready to leave at that point, feeling insulted by this treatment.

The two hookahs we ordered were disgusting.

To top it off, when I asked for the bill, the waitress brought only the check but neither my passport nor my credit card. I pointed it out to her, and she said she had to process the payment before returning my things. How ironic! I hadn’t even decided if I’d pay with cash or card. My friends had to pay first, and only after I gave cash did she return my passport and card. Absolutely unacceptable!

All this for a $150 bill 😂 Seriously, did you think our group of five vacationers couldn’t afford two hookahs and two bottles of water? My god, avoid this place at all costs!

I’d also like to point out that at no point were we rude or gave any impression that we wouldn’t pay. Honestly, this place is to be avoided—there are plenty of other spots in Vegas to have a good time!; My husband and I had the best time here. The drinks are strong, the hookah is fabulous…and the music remix had me dancing all night!!!! Highly recommend. Great vibe

Name: Foundation Room Las Vegas
Address: 3950 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89119, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 PM – 2:30 AM; Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 2:30 AM; Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 2:30 AM; Thursday: 5:00 PM – 2:30 AM; Friday: 6:00 PM – 2:30 AM; Saturday: 6:00 PM – 2:30 AM; Sunday: 6:00 PM – 2:30 AM
Vicinity: 3950 South Las Vegas Boulevard, Las Vegas
Address Components: 3950 (street_number); South Las Vegas Boulevard (route); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89119 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Fantastic period decor and atmosphere. Fillet cooked perfectly. Servers on point all night. My glass never quite got to half empty. Great job, Julie! The view is very hard to beat. Definitely recommend.; Perched on the 63rd floor of the Mandalay Bay, The Foundation Room is not just a bar; it's an experience that begins with a slightly nerve-wracking elevator ride which, in retrospect, is a small price for the panoramic payoff. Upon arrival, you're greeted by breathtaking views of the Las Vegas Strip, sprawling out beneath you like a carpet of lights, setting the stage for an unforgettable night.

The atmosphere inside is an elegant blend of opulence and comfort, with an intimate setting that makes it feel like you've stepped into a secret club for those in the know. The ambiance strikes a perfect balance between upscale lounge and cozy hangout, making it ideal for both special occasions and casual nights out.

I ventured there for the Heightened Shenanigans uncensored comedy show, hosted by the charismatic Gabe Lopez. Here's where The Foundation Room transforms from just another high-end bar to a comedy haven. Entry to the show is surprisingly free, a generous touch that adds incredible value to the evening. Just mention at the door that you're there for the comedy, and you're in. The lineup, featuring comedians like Trix, delivered non-stop laughter, proving that the room's talent for curating entertainment is as impressive as its cocktail menu.

Speaking of which, my evening started with one of their signature Old Fashioneds. Crafted with skill, it was the ideal blend of smooth and strong, setting a high bar for the night. As the laughs rolled on, I switched to Jameson and Coke, finding them well-priced for the setting, which often isn't the case in such an exclusive venue.

Service throughout was attentive but not intrusive, allowing the comedy to take center stage while ensuring your glass was never empty. The fact that this caliber of entertainment comes without a cover charge on what I discovered to be the last Saturday of each month, makes The Foundation Room not just a recommendation but a must-visit.

In summary, The Foundation Room offers more than just drinks; it provides a full sensory experience with its stunning views, top-notch cocktails, and quality entertainment. Whether you're a local or a visitor looking to elevate your Vegas nightlife experience, this spot deserves a top spot on your list. I'm already looking forward to my next visit, and if you appreciate good humor with your views, you should too.; Foundation Room was a wonderful experience. This rooftop bar has an extraordinary view of the strip, best at night time. It's a perfect atmosphere for a date night or to just hang out with friends. I would recommend Foundation Room to those visiting Vegas. Going during happy hour for better deals is an opportunity worth taking. Happy Hours are 6pm to 9pm Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Sundays.; Great experience from start to finish.  Had a VIP host /manager, Kaloni who took great care of us.  David was our waiter that was beyond top notch.  Food was amazing.  View and magician were magical!  Stayed for a table after and Chris took care of us.  Amazing display of true service.  Would highly recommend.; Such a neat venue! We worked with Jad to book a small private party and had great service by everyone involved. The whole team was accommodating and kind. Our attendees thought it was a great event!

Name: Double Down Saloon
Address: 4640 Paradise Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89169, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Open 24 hours; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours
Address Components: 4640 (street_number); Paradise Road (route); University District (neighborhood); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89169 (postal_code); 8000 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
I've been coming to this small bar for over 20 years, and it never disappoints. The atmosphere has that same welcoming vibe, and it's always a great spot to kick off the night. If you're looking to get the party started, definitely try the "Ass Juice"—it's a classic! This place may be small, but it’s packed with personality.; Not so smashy the two times I rolled thru. Shows must be the scene unless their fake punk rock, always check under the hood. Strictly dives and ales, yaga yo.; High-quality dive bar. I enjoyed the house “ass juice” for $4. It was much sweeter than I imagined it would be.

Really friendly vibe. Great bartenders. Free music most nights. I can’t think of a single flaw, except that it doesn’t exist in SF or LA.; When you look up dive in the dictionary, you’ll find a picture of the DD.  This is a dive bar that includes live punk music.  Take your prom date someplace else.  On a quiet Friday we found the bar area dark and somehow smokey with just a few regulars in attendance.  The bartender was welcoming.  And the small crew at the bar similarly friendly.  A interesting blend of punk and rock pounded out of the juke box.  Two jack and cokes cost much less than one fruity cocktail on the Strip.  I didn’t order an “ass-juice” this time, but I certainly will when I return. I cannot image what the DD is like at 2 a.m. after a busy night of punk and general debauchery, but I intend to find out.  God bless you and keep you DD.  I like forward to my return. Oh yes, and the men’s room is a delightful homage to New York’s long gone CBGB.  Don’t miss it.; Was here with my buddies for some pre-party! The atmosphere was great and the personal was very social and nice also the band that was playing did a good show even with less people and also was social after the show. Great place to catch some good vibes before a club

Name: The Pinky Ring by Bruno Mars
Address: Bellagio Hotel & Casino, 3600 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Thursday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 6:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Saturday: 6:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Sunday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM
Vicinity: Bellagio Hotel & Casino, 3600 South Las Vegas Boulevard, Las Vegas
Address Components: Bellagio Hotel & Casino (point_of_interest); 3600 (street_number); South Las Vegas Boulevard (route); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89109 (postal_code)
Reviews:
It was a good experience overall.
Probably they don't allow pictures because of their experience of it. But the decor was ok. Is not something out of the extraordinary.
Service was good, but you feel they are always watching you.
Also, I think they don't allow pictures because all the bathrooms were clogged.
We had to all go out and look for bathrooms in the casino, and they mentioned that this happens often and all clients go look for bathrooms with no problem.; As a day 1 Bruno fan, I’m so glad I finally came to visit here! The hooligans played last night, so I knew I couldn’t miss the opportunity of seeing him stop by and joining them later on the night 💗 The energy Bruno and the hooligans bring to the crowd is unmatched! I also ordered the E Panda cocktail and had the best bartender David! He was very attentive and friendly towards all the million questions I asked him lol.. 10/10 night out ✨; I cannot wait to return to Vegas.  This is definitely a do again spot.  We went for after hours fun.  There was a little bit of a wait to get in, but man was it worth it.  The band was killer and the DJ kept us jumping in between sets and once the band was finished for the night.   It's not a large place so if you don't like waiting, you can reserve seating at a premium cost,  but even that is worth it.  Can't add photos because what happens in Pinky Ring, stays in Pinky Ring.  They will snatched that phone if they see you snapping pics.  Just wish Bruno had popped in.  That would have mad e this birthday celebration a complete hit.; I went as my husband's +1 to a professional organization meeting at The Pinky Ring at Bellagio. The lounge doesn't allow phones inside but because this was a special event where the organization bought a bunch of tables, we got to bring our phones but were asked not to be too obvious taking photos because they didn't rent the entire venue out.

This place is very small and cozy with a definite 70's vibe. The dance floor is compact in the center of what is designed to look like a conversation pit surrounded by tables.

Apparently Bruno Mars stops by often to play with their live band, but this time they had a woman singing with a full band starting around 9:30 PM. Prior to the live music there was a DJ.

I had a cocktail called the Mars Mocha for $25. It was coffee, cognac and chocolate rum with a bruleed banana slice garnish and sesame foam. It was very good and not too sweet. I also had the $20 Skin-e Panda cocktail, which was coconut rum, pineapple, lime, mint and club soda. It was just ok. My husband had an espresso martini (great) and another cocktail made with gin (yuck) and they were STRONG.

The organization did not pay menu price for the bottles and between at least 6 tables (maybe 8?) Each table with stocked with different alcohol. One table was beer, another white wines.

Our table had a Krug, Grand Cuvée Brut which retails for about $250 (menu price $725.) We also had Henriot Brut Souverain (retails for like $55) but I didn't catch the menu price for that bottle.

Overall, I think this was a great place to have a professional mixer and it was nice to go somewhere with a full band rather than a DJ only.

Visited: August 2024; Wow!!! My friend and I went to the Pinky Ring on 09/4/24. We had an amazing time. We purchased a table for $100 and spent over $200 for alcohol. Pricey, but it is Vegas. We did get $100 credit towards our drinks, so that was helpful.

As a person of color, we were treated nicely, so I am a bit confused on the racism claims made in some of these reviews.

No pictures!! Those are the rules. Though, my friend and I absent-minded took a selfie. We were talked to by security. They were nice enough to not kick us out. Our sincere apologies to East Asian security for breaking the rules.

Other than that the drinks are pricey, I have nothing bad to say about the place. Everyone was pleasantly from start to finish. My friend and I will be back in Vegas from April 23 to April 30, 2025. We will definitely visit the Pinky Ring a couple of times while we are there.

Name: Vegas Party VIP
Address: 4100 W Flamingo Rd #1467, Las Vegas, NV 89103, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Open 24 hours; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours
Address Components: #1467 (subpremise); 4100 (street_number); West Flamingo Road (route); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89103 (postal_code)
Reviews:
They helped me put together a bachelor party.  Jeremy C was fantastic and made this a very stress free experience.  This was my first time going to Vegas, but with their knowledge and expertise, they were able to put together an event that was an exact match to what I was looking for.  They were helpful and quickly responded to any changes that arose during the process.  Their flexible payment program allowed me to pay for the event without putting extra stress on my personal finances.  I am definitely looking forward to using Vegas VIP again, even if just for a party weekend in Vegas.  Great job guys.; First time working with Vegas Party VIP and I gotta say that it was definitely impressive.  Getting in contact with someone that would help us organize our events was very easy and got a response quickly.

We went to Vegas for a bachelor party for a group of about 12 folks.  Romero reached out to figure out what the groups interest and budget was.  From there he quickly came up with an itinerary for our trip.  Any changes that we requested were conveniently managed which made the experience a lot better.

Romero was very courteous, professional and helpful.  He worked with our group to make sure that we got everything that we wanted.  Everything went according to how it was planned and turned out a lot better than expected.

With that being said, I will definitely be using Vegas party VIP for my next Vegas visit!; The absolute best way to organize a Las Vegas bachelor party!

Never having been to Vegas before, the task of planning a bachelor party seemed quite daunting to me. That is, until I discovered Vegas Party VIP. I did a ton of research on the various party/event planning options in Las Vegas and couldn't be happier that I decided to go with these guys.

Jeremy was beyond helpful and put together a fantastic package for our group of 10. On Friday night, we did the VIP club crawl. Jeremy made sure we were well stocked with drinks on the party bus (which was super fun!), and we never had to wait in line to get into the clubs. While Jeremy didn't come out with us, our hostess - Hailey - was super fun and did an expert job of handling some of the more inebriated members of our group.

On Saturday night, we did the more "traditional" bachelor party activities. Jeremy put together another great itinerary for us, and our host for the evening, Rich, made sure that we all had a great time and got where we needed to be.

Finally, I cannot recommended Vegas Party VIP enough for their superb customer service. Jeremy worked with me to put together a package that met the bachelor's desires while still fitting our budget. My only criticism is that it wasn't clear beforehand that Jeremy wouldn't actually be taking us out both nights. While Rich and Hailey did fantastic jobs, a big reason why I decided to go with Vegas Party VIP was that I'd only have to tip one person for the weekend (everything else was built into the upfront cost). While it wasn't a huge deal, it still would've been nice to know ahead of time.

That said, I would highly recommend Vegas Party VIP to anyone planning an event in Las Vegas. No lines, no covers, no hassles... what more could you ask for?; Awesome party planning and service! Went here for my friends bachelor and bachelorette party planning needs and they did not disappoint! Tristan was the one who helped me out and i cannot tell you how amazing he was! Always ready to help and give us info on what's happening in Vegas at the time. Couldn't have done it without him, your the man Tristan hope to be back soon!; The only way I’ll ever plan a trip to Vegas from now on. Carl Myers worked with me for nearly 8 months planning my brother’s bachelor party for our group of 8. Communication was great all throughout.

When we arrived, our expectations were exceeded. We had hookups at every spot we visited. Including a pool party at Daylight, bottle service at Tao and Chateau, waitstaff, and no waiting in line. Carl (and Chris) met up with us in person to ensure we were situated and taken care of before leaving. We even made adjustments on the fly that he accomodated day of (added another club, cancelled an event). Antonio Wright was also instrumental in hooking us up at Chateau (rooftop bar at Paris).

All of this was a fraction of the cost and headache of booking everything ourselves. And you truly feel like a VIP with the service these folks provide.

Thanks to Carl and his crew for making a memorable and affordable experience for all of us.

Cheers my man.

Tam

Name: Chéri Rooftop
Address: 3655 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 6:00 – 10:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM, 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM, 6:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM, 6:00 – 10:00 PM

Reviews:
Our group of 8 on Thursday evening 10/3 had a wonderful time at Cheri Rooftop.  The glow of the neon signs, the leg of the faux Eiffel Tower and the sounds of the strip were perfect for vacationers like us.  The food was excellent, as were the drinks and all of our desserts.  My favorite were the Oysters Rockefeller, my wife loved her scallop entree.  Even posted a picture of it.  Loved it, will come again.; We had a wonderful time dining here. It was our wedding anniversary and the staff did a great job with making our experience special. Very attentive, kind, delicious food and great dining environment!; We were able to get in Cheri Rooftop. The atmosphere is really cool and you can see the water show from the Bellagio from the table. All my friends got burgers and I got the baked chicken, which is really good.; Eggs benny and bottomless mimosas (with different flavours to choose from) was so good. They mentioned they reopened recently and it was great fountain views, food and atmosphere with the dj. And great service, shoutout to Brandon!; I went when the wind was blowing but this spot looked like an excellent summer day spot.

The atmosphere is phenomenal & the bar tenders were fast and cool(probably because it wasn’t too crowded). A solid bar/club spot at Paris Las Vegas.

I’d definitely come back again when I visit Vegas and summer is back.

Name: Intrigue Nightclub
Address: 3131 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109, USA
Vicinity: 3131 South Las Vegas Boulevard, Las Vegas
Address Components: 3131 (street_number); South Las Vegas Boulevard (route); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89109 (postal_code)
Reviews:
We had a great private event at Intrigue. It is a great indoor/outdoor space with tiered seating, a dance floor, stage, bars and large display screen.; I had a great experience here, and the only reason I went was to see DJ Marshmello. The lights/lasers and visuals were very beautiful and the decor was lovely. In my opinion, you can tell a lot of thought was put in to making this club aesthetically pleasing. I was able to get a drink pretty quickly once reaching the bar, however I feel this is because I was there early (before 11) which I would advise anyone to be there in line early on before it opens at 10:30. There was a line around the block, but they were definitely prepared for it. Their staff has people go down the line and check IDs and all that long before you even get to the entrance which is genius and made the process nearly seamless. Will definitely be returning. My only problem was the dance floor was too small.; It's fine, good music. $20 drinks.
And like everyone has already mentioned, the security is on power trip. You could tell they were looking for anyone to kick out or not let in.
Be careful, I've had the security physically steal all my cash in the past, and letting​ the other staff know doesn't matter as they are buddies.; I wanted to dance on the stripper poles, but they wouldn't let me just because I'm male. The poles were not being used, yet I wasn't allowed despite a 2:1 female ratio. I want to be sexy too, why can't I shake my ass too? Some girls were up there just taking snapchats, not dancing at all. If you let makes dance, we would appreciate the opportunity.

Boourns.; Really difficult to navigate this club.  Came here on a club crawl and it was super packed.  People seemed stressed out though -- this is the only club out of 7 from our recent trip where I got dirty looks when trying to get through a crowd to the bar.  Eventually just gave up because not having fun and we went and grabbed a quick and much-needed sandwich.

Name: La Jolla Nightclub
Address: 2245 E Flamingo Rd, Las Vegas, NV 89119, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 5:00 AM; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 10:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 12:00 – 5:00 AM, 10:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 12:00 – 6:00 AM, 10:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 12:00 – 6:00 AM, 10:00 PM – 12:00 AM

Reviews:
Vladimir; the host that greeted us and helped us get a table was so amazing. We had a great night because of him! Would recommend coming here for a great time!; Awesome atmosphere for a night out ! VLAD is the best he is very attentive wil be coming back; Honestly one of the best table services we've ever had. We hosted a party for 30 and I liked that we were asked to pay at first (while we were still sober lol) so that way there would be no confusion- especially if you've had a lil but to much to drink by the end of the night. And there were no hidden charges and no trouble with my guests as we have been double charged for guests at other clubs. Hostess were very attentive and with our party size we were given a VIP space. Variety of bottles to choose from, the cubitazo were loved by our guests, and the option of adding hookah was a plus. Highly recommend!!!!!; The age group is for everyone! You will NOT feel excluded, whether you’re in your 20s or your 40s/50s.
The music is a great variety.
I recommend reaching out to Vlad. He was so friendly, and made my night great. He set up my table and bottle service for a smooth process.
100%%% recommend.; Went to La Jolla to celebrate my sister bday. We had the best time. Vladimir was the best VIP host one could ask for. Super attentive, welcoming and very kind. Kino the security was very friendly and made us feel safe, he made sure our section was protected.  All in all we have a great time, everyone was so nice and the music was a vibe all night.

Name: LIV Nightclub Las Vegas
Address: 2777 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: Closed; Friday: 10:00 PM – 4:00 AM; Saturday: 10:00 PM – 4:00 AM; Sunday: 10:00 PM – 4:00 AM
Vicinity: 2777 South Las Vegas Boulevard, Las Vegas
Address Components: 2777 (street_number); South Las Vegas Boulevard (route); Las Vegas (locality); Clark County (administrative_area_level_2); Nevada (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 89109 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Overall a very nice and fun night club experience! We got there around midnight and waited ~20mins in line to get in. Even though you can get in for free by being on the guest list and arrive early, it’s totally worth paying $65 for 2 GA tickets to have the reassurance and faster check in.

Two Tito’s drinks were $50 which is expected. The dance floor will get very crowded and you’d have to wait in line to get in, so try to be on the dance floor before the big name DJ starts.; Bought tickets in advanced to see tiesto who did an amazing set and waited less than 20 min to enter into the venue which was nice. Unfortunately if you don’t spend money on a table you will most likely have no view of the DJ/artist. We were also not allowed on the dance floor and kept being sent to different entrances on the floor just to be rejected in the pit area over and over again. I would avoid this club and I wouldn’t go back.  Also it’s Vegas the main artist will not start until after 1 am.; I go to a lot of Vegas nightclubs, first time at LIV.

I was treated well as a single male. I got there "late" (12:30ish) not on the guest list, and was able to get in quickly. I got a rum and coke for 24 bucks. The dance floor was "full", and they were only letting table wristbands through, but however I tipped the floor bouncer and got in-out privileges. I consider that fair to get up in front after not paying to get in, and not having to stand for 2 hours if I got there at 10:30. YMMV on A-list nights. There is a small walkway behind the tables that people who weren't on the floor could stand in, but that didn't seem like a good view. The lights and sounds were great, and the talent came on at about 1:45 and played until 3. I would go back, but i don't think i would wrangle a group there without a table. It appeared the upstairs tables might have had a tough view from the ceiling lights moving around.; I was way too old for this place being 54! But it was really fun walking around and seeing the beauty of all the design of the light shows, the music was a lot of fun. I was surprised that more young people were not going crazy dancing on the floor. A lot of times they were just standing there drinking their drinks and looking around. The DJ was just great. Sound system is incredibly loud so bring your plugs if you like me! Overall a fun time.; This is a nightclub located in the Fontainebleau hotel and casino. It’s a moderate size with the vast majority of space reserved for table service and three bars on the first floor. It gets extremely crowded - basically shoulder to shoulder on a Friday night - and getting a drink at the bar takes about 15-20 minutes…that is, if you can manage to squeeze your way through the crowd to get to the bar lol

Address: Located Inside the Cosmopolitan, 3708 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109, USA

Reviews:
I quite enjoyed my VIP experience here! I love the location - it’s right on the center of the Strip in the Cosmopolitan. Music could’ve been better especially towards the end, but I had a good time. Staff was really nice overall.; Nice rooftop club with a nice view! Place was pack and I feel the music was a hit or miss depending on what you like. Like any other Las Vegas clubs, the drinks are expensive. My friend had two drinks for $90. I'm not sure or how parking was as we just Lyft there and back.; Went here to a private open bar party. It’s dead center Las Vegas right on the strip! They had great music and loved the “boom box” atmosphere.

The balcony overlooked the strip below which kinda gave me the feel of being in time square but instead in Vegas.

Drinks were good and so was the food. Recommend for private parties or just in general.; Cray-cray good Vegas club experience. Great music from top DJs, handy location in the Cosmo.; Hip place. Ladies on the guest list get free drinks from 10 to 11:30pm. The place is spacious, there are booths with cushioned sofas and sectionals, large bar area where people can stand around away from the dance floor and still dance! Music is hip hop. There are several large TV monitors from floor to ceiling, great psychedelic reels streaming... an area beyond the bar area that's by the pools quickly filled up with the crowd, much more spacious but screened in, super cold on evenings like this but quickly heated up with the packed crowd dancing the night away. You can rent out cabanas, take dip in the pool, come near closing time there are dances in sea life costumes and lights.
