Reviews: Absolutely best beach. Lots of marine life. Great snorkeling right to the shore. Crystal clear water and almost no current. Very few people.; Lovely beach with calm water, silky soft sand, and great hammock spots. Some sand burrs, ants, and the road in is pretty fun in a sturdy golf cart!; Very weedy on the shore now (November 2023) which smells a little. It’s pretty easy to see that this is a very beautiful beach when not overcome with weeds.; One of the most beautiful beaches on earth. Calm like an extra large warm bath.; Clear and shallow waters with soft white sand. A little further in than the other beaches but worth the extra minutes it takes to get there.

Name: Sailh's Paradise Horse Riding
Address: Llave, Vieques 00765, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 4:00 PM
Address Components: Llave (administrative_area_level_2); Vieques (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00765 (postal_code)
Reviews:
We did an early morning tour and it was just the 3 of us, Jeremy was our guide and the BEST!!!  We had all different experience levels and he made everyone feel safe, the views and the tour was AMAZING!!  We all talked about it all day after and he also referred us to some great restaurants and other tours to take which also did not disappoint.  We will definitely be back and ride with Jeremy again!!!; I had an extraordinary experience today at Sailhs Paradise Horse back Riding. Our guide, Jeremy, was exceptional, and we truly couldn't have asked for a better tour. He meticulously walked us through each step of guiding the horses, ensuring we felt confident and comfortable. The journey led us to breathtaking sights, including a stunning beach with striking jet black sand and the most vibrant blue water I have ever encountered. It was a remarkable adventure that I will cherish for years to come!; We booked the Black Sand Beach tour for July 14th, and it was an incredible experience. The ranch had more than just horses; there was also a parrot and a donkey.

The route took us through a beach, a black sand beach, forests, and roads, with some sections going through the sea. Even though it unexpectedly poured rain and we couldn't take many pictures, it was still a very unique experience and definitely worth it.

Our guide, Jeremy, led us the whole way. He was very attentive, patient, and humorous, and he pointed out sights along the way. At the end, when we couldn't get a taxi, he and his colleague gave us a ride in their pickup truck and recommended great restaurants. They were super nice! I highly recommend Sailh’s Paradise Horse Riding and our guide, Jeremy!; Great experience here. Jeremy was fun, stayed comfortably in charge and kept everything safe and enjoyable. Offered to take lots of pictures for us and you can see he has some great spots for photo ops. Highly recommend taking the tour.; We headed to do this mini adventure not really knowing what to expect , let’s just say pictures do not do this experience justice .. Jeremy and Licha were our tour guides , they were so patient , thorough and helpful. They made sure we were all comfortable with the horses , during the tour Jeremy and Licha made sure all the horses were behaving and that we were all doing okay. My family felt safe and really enjoyed this beautiful horse back riding tour along the beach and pathways. In addition they were great photographers and captured many memories for our family! Highly recommend to everyone!

Name: Almendros Disc Golf Park
Address: PR-200, Vieques 00765, Puerto Rico
Address Components: Puerto Rico 200 (route); Mosquito (administrative_area_level_2); Vieques (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00765 (postal_code)
Reviews: Haven’t tried playing disc golf here yet but it’s a great spot to watch the feral horses. Watch out for the ant hills though.; An absolute blessing. Came in with no expectations, and found our favorite disc golf course we had ever played. We've had the ability to play around 50 courses in the US & this one takes the cake for an all around experience. Thank you to those that take care of the course, you gave us a round we will never forget. If you are in Puerto Rico & play it's an absolute must.; Vieques is a pretty special place, and for anyone who plays Disc Golf this course is the cream on top. Sure, there are fancier courses, courses with bigger budgets, etc. But this is a unique course, maintained by volunteers who obviously love the job, and surrounded by an amazing environment. The fact that there are wild horse hazards is unique in the world, as far as I know. 🤓 And the views are simply beautiful. I could spend every day of a vacation at the nearby beaches, followed by drinks at the local rum distillery (and food truck with the best fish tacos I've ever had!), and this Disc Golf course. I can't wait to visit again!; Fun, variable course that's maintained by a small group of local disc golf enthusiasts.  The first few holes get you warmed up for the more wooded holes.  Most have generous fairways, but the undergrowth is insanely thick if you're not accurate with your shots.  Unique extra features include wild horses that feed on the natural mango trees and a distillery next to the course that offers tastings. Check Udisc for a map of the course and local contact information.; Fun playing disc golf with the horses and getting to see a great ocean view was definitely a bonus. Although I didn't throw when horses were in the way because I'm not good enough to not hit them, it was still a cool experience.

Name: Puertas at El Quenepo
Address: 148 Calle Flamboyan, Vieques, 00765, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 6:00 PM
Address Components: 148 (street_number); Calle Flamboyan (route); Vieques (locality); Puerto Real (administrative_area_level_2); Vieques (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00765 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Unfortunately I was only able to stay one night!  Puertas is conveniently located across the street from Esperanza Beach with restaurants and tour companies all around it.  They message you before your arrival to ensure they have your details and message you the day of to ensure you have a smooth check in.  Lisa helped with every need.  I was literally across the street from my check in for my excursion!  My room was super cute with so many details that made it truly unique.  Also, they deliver breakfast for you in the morning in the cutest wicker basket ever.  And the best part was that breakfast was healthy with all of favorites.  I can't wait to stay again!; What an absolute gem of a place! I hope to come back to Vieques again and stay here. The attention to detail and service were incredible. We loved the breakfast basket, having a private hammock right outside our room and having access to our own cooler/beach chairs. There is a bar/nightclub across the street that gets a little noisy but Puertas provides a white noise machine + ear plugs that we used. Anything that we needed was immediately accommodated. We stayed here on a Monday night so we did not get to try the restaurant everyone raves about but we really hope to come back. This was my favorite hotel during my PR vacation!; This is just about the cutest hotel I've ever stayed at. I loved how small and boutique it felt with absolutely gorgeous and thoughtfully designed spaces. The service from all staff was so helpful and fast! Even though we were on our own in the evenings, any help we would need was a text away. The breakfast baskets were so charming and hit the spot each morning. The location couldn't be any more ideal. We walked to the beach and restaurants easily every day. I do wish the downstairs restaurant had been open while we were there but it was late in the summer and they had already shut down in advance of hurricane season.

Puertas' rooms are reasonably priced considering there aren't a whole lot of extra amenities (no pool, no bar, seasonally open restaurant) but again, anything you could need was so close - including an ocean literally across the street if we wanted to swim. We were a bit at the whims of other restaurants/shops' schedules - but that's island life! (Note: The very loud bar across the street is very loud on the weekends but Puertas' staff provided ear plugs each night. We were so tired after full days of beach and sun it didn't stop us from falling asleep.) I was also pleased with the beach chairs, cooler, and towels waiting for us each day outside our charming doorway. They even have an app for you to explore with all the info about the hotel and town of Esperanza that you might need. They really do think of everything.

I was seriously blown away by how beautifully decorated the whole place was. Everything just felt so perfectly and purposefully built, designed, and arranged. The ambiance cannot be beat. The craftsmanship of all the woodwork and doorways/windows was just the icing on the cake. Loved this place and hope to come back one day!; Hands down one of the best hotel experiences we’ve ever had! Every detail was so thoughtfully curated. From the picnic basket breakfast delivered to our door each morning to the beautifully appointed rooms with our very own cooler and beach chairs, Puertas truly delivered. We felt like we were the only ones on the property with little fairies catering to our every need. I cannot recommend Puertas enough! Do yourself a favor and enjoy a few nights in absolute paradise!; Pictures do not do it justice! Beautiful premise and room! Comfortable. View from ocean view room amazing!   Walking distance to all. Lisa is fantastic and very informative. She gives you all the time you need. This was an absolutely wonderful establishment!

Name: Boys & Girls Club Vieques
Address: 1-59 Calle Benitez Guzman, Vieques, 00765, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 3:00 – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 3:00 – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 3:00 – 8:00 PM; Friday: 3:00 – 8:00 PM; Saturday: Closed; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 1-59 (street_number); Calle Benitez Guzman (route); Isabel Segunda (sublocality_level_1); Vieques (locality); Isabel II (administrative_area_level_2); Vieques (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00765 (postal_code)

Name: Hacienda Tamarindo
Address: Rte. 996 Km. 4.5, Vieques, 00765, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 7:00 PM
Address Components: Km. 4.5 (subpremise); Rte. 996 (route); Vieques (locality); Puerto Real (administrative_area_level_2); Vieques (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00765 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Our stay was wonderful! We loved the ambiance, the attention to detail and the view of the ocean from our room. Check-in was easy and all of the staff were friendly and helpful. We especially loved the mango jam served at breakfast and the option to have a packed lunch made for us so that we could enjoy some beach outings. We hope to come back very soon!; Very nice place. Very clean. Comfortable beds, fair location, the staff are excellent, the breakfast is good, the cats are a PITA, but I’m not a “cat guy.”  I cannot state strongly enough how great are the staff, from the reception staff, to groundskeepers, to restaurant workers, all were friendly, helpful, and welcoming.; Extremely misleading wedsite.   They are not customer service oriented as they claim.  I've had better service at a Comfort Inn.   The employees act like they really don't like working there.  The view from the pool is a trailer they obviously don't highlight on the web page.    Room was very clean and spacious.  Must have a car if you stay here and want to leave.   They don't offer dinner.   The breakfast was good.; I recently had the pleasure of spending a night at Hacienda Tamarindo in Vieques, and it was an unforgettable experience. From the moment I arrived, the staff went above and beyond to ensure I felt welcomed and at home. The check-in process was seamless, and the front desk team provided a warm and informative introduction to the property and the island.

The room was spacious, impeccably clean, and tastefully decorated with charming island-themed decor. The bed was incredibly comfortable, ensuring a restful night's sleep. One of the highlights was the stunning view from my window, overlooking the lush gardens and the sparkling Caribbean Sea in the distance.

The hotel's amenities were top-notch. I enjoyed a refreshing dip in the beautiful pool, surrounded by palm trees and tropical flowers. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was delightful, with a variety of fresh fruits, smoothies, and local specialties of hash browns that set the perfect tone for the day.

What truly sets Hacienda Tamarindo apart is its unique ambiance and the sense of tranquility that permeates the property. It's clear that great care has been taken to preserve the natural beauty of the surroundings while providing modern comforts.

The location is also ideal, offering easy access to some of the best beaches and attractions in Vieques. The staff was incredibly helpful in suggesting activities and providing directions, making it easy to explore the island even with a limited timeframe.

Overall, my stay at Hacienda Tamarindo exceeded all expectations. It's a hidden gem in Vieques, perfect for anyone seeking a peaceful and luxurious retreat. I can't wait to return for a longer stay and fully immerse myself in this tropical paradise.; This was our favorite place to stay during our 12 day visit in PR. The breakfast is great. The views are stunning. The hotel is historic and beautiful. My family will return.

Name: Esperanza Riding Company
Address: Calle Flamboyan, Vieques, 00765, Puerto Rico
Address Components: Calle Flamboyan (route); Vieques (locality); Puerto Real (administrative_area_level_2); Vieques (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00765 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This was a fantastic experience and probably one of the best trail rides I’ll ever do!!  The guides were friendly and knowledgeable, and the horses were EXCELLENT. I rode Rico Suave and he was incredibly well-behaved and easy to control (I have a bit of riding experience but not much). The owner, Elizabeth, took a different tour out, and another guide, Trish, took ours out - both really knew what they were doing!

I can’t say enough about the incredible trail. It had a little bit of everything, including two walks on the beach, walks through the woods, walks along the street, and walks in a canyon/dry river. Such a beautiful spot!; Incredible experience.  Well worth it.  We booked a private ride and had an amazing time.  Our guide was patient and had an upbeat attitude ... she took her time with my partner who'd never ridden before (I didn't know that when I booked this!) The horses were responsive and we all loved the areas where we were able to trot and even open up into a gallop in places.  But mostly, we gently walked and enjoy the views.   The beaches were amazing, the scenic vista's were shocking, I didn't expect it to be as good as it was.  10/10 experience.  We plan on doing it again when we return.; Our trail host was amazing! Super friendly. Talked about the island. Was knowledgeable. Horses are taken care of and treated very well. If you're looking for ethical, you found it here. views were beautiful. Thank you very much!; What a magnificent experience! Esperanza Riding Company made our family feel very comfortable riding. Some of us had never ridden and some had not ridden in decades. The team at Esperanza Riding Company made the whole experience, one we will
cherish for a lifetime. We will be back to ride again! The views were amazing. The information was helpful, this is an experience for the memory books!; Dante was a great guide. His experience and respect for the horses was very evident. The whole experience was breathtaking and unforgettable. I wouldn’t ride with any other company while in Vieques.

Name: Supermercado Morales
Address: 13 Calle Baldorioty de Castro #19, Vieques, 00765, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 7:30 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 7:30 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 7:30 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 7:30 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 7:30 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 19 (subpremise); 13 (street_number); Calle Baldorioty de Castro (route); Isabel Segunda (sublocality_level_1); Vieques (locality); Isabel II (administrative_area_level_2); Vieques (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00765 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Go here first! The best market of three we have been to in Vieques so far. This is why I rate Supermercado Morales 5 💥💥💥💥💥.
1.💥an employee gave me a cart when he saw me struggling to get one from the row outside.
2.💥 store is very clean, well air-conditioned.
3.💥biggest size store with wider walk-through aisles.
4. 💥best quality products, frozen, canned, dry goods, canned and otherwise shelf stable products such as juice or milk, baking ingredients AND the freshest produce, meat, and dairy we have seen thus far-the first place I have found a real dairy butter product (Borden spreadable butter with canola oil).
5. 💥fully stocked wide variety  of food, wine, school supplies, hardware, pet products, cleaning supplies, personal products, and kitchen products. This is the ONLY place we have found an implement to wash dishes by hand! I nearly cried with relief-sponges, steel scrubbers, combination scrubbers, brushes, even dishwashing gloves!

It is expensive, on par with every other store we have shopped on Vieques so far, but fresh beefsteak was about the same price as we pay in the state of Tennessee, USA.; Well stocked in August with friendly staff; One of the better grocery stores.
Eggs were $6.89/dozen
Milk was $7.07/ gallon for 2%.
Ground beef was $7.76 for not quite 2lbs.
Not too bad for island prices but just mentally prepare for anything imported from the US to be more. 👍🏽😊; This is the only grocery store in Isabel II which has gallon-sized jugs of drinking water.  (You may need to ask where they are located.)  Great price, friendly service!  Thank you.; Surprisingly good and clean. People are kind and helpful, prices can be high for some things but low and fair for other things.  I have been here many times and continue to be satisfied.
I think it is challenging to run a supermarket on a small island and this people are doing an excellent job.

Name: Encantada Vieques
Address: Calle Flamboyan, Esperanza, Vieques 00765, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Address Components: Calle Flamboyan (route); Esperanza (locality); Puerto Real (administrative_area_level_2); Vieques (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00765 (postal_code)
Reviews:
We had my daughter's gorgeous wedding here.  The place is beautiful with all the amenities you need, other than no air conditioning in May and misquiros with no glass windows. We had a fantastic time.; I just celebrated my Bday at this house and had a blast.

Who needs AC when the cool ocean breezes require you to reach for that comforter at night.

Very quiet and peaceful location close to but away from everything!

Everywhere you turn you are mesmerized by the huge open views of the sea and the blue skies.

Great hostess, always available to answer any questions.

If you can stay the whole week do it you will not regret it.

The cloud sofa awaits!; A spectacular location on the southside of Vieques.  Just around the corner from the best restaurants.  The Main house is a modern architectural gem designed to capture the island breezes and bring you closer to nature and the sea.  The Casita is a personal favorite for smaller groups.  Highly reccomend a stay at this enchanting property.; Beautiful house and pool. Suitable for parties and weddings.; Super divine, very spacious, it met all my expectations.

Name: Hix Island House
Address: Route 995, km 1.5, Vieques, 00765, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Address Components: Vieques (locality); Puerto Real (administrative_area_level_2); Vieques (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00765 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Beautiful property with horses and mango trees all over. Yoga and massage with Maureen were life changing - she was so generous with her time and I loved talking to her about her wellness journey. She also gave us two great hike recommendations! The staff was lovely as well - the chef they recommended to come cook for us, Vicente, was a highlight of our stay.

I was skeptical about the open concept at first but it was worth it. Birds would hang out on the balconies and fly through sometimes, and the outdoor shower had excellent water pressure. This stay was wonderful.; This property is beautiful from top to bottom. Very well laid out space between the various room options. Spacious living and dining areas. Outdoor showers were nice and other amenities to really get the most out of the space such as kitchen equipment, items in the fridge, and sufficient space to really unpack and spread out. Agree with some reviews that it is really in the thick of nature. While there were some wild horses around, there were also many bugs throughout the day. Carmen and the staff were very accommodating. Thank you!; John Hix nailed his goal of helping guests truly explore nature using minimalism.  The views (sunrises and sunsets) are outstanding!  I loved listening to the sounds throughout the night.

I used the netting and slept like a baby!  The breezes!

You can get food delivered and you don't even have to leave the compound.

There were delicious wonders in the fridge waiting (muffins, assorted jams and jellies, butter, milk, juice, coffee, cold cereal, and a wonderful sourdough bread.
And...
The shower!  I stayed in Solaris where the water is solar-heated.  It was such an incredible shower I woke up in the morning before heading back to the main island to take another!

I didn't get a chance to really explore everything in the Hix Island House community, but overall, I loved it!  The stairs were a bit much for my knees, but other than that, it's incredible!; This place was amazing! Initially, I was a bit apprehensive about the open concept and some mentions of bugs, but our experience turned out to be fabulous. It was incredible to see the stars while showering—an unforgettable experience. The weather was perfect, which made the open room feel amazing. The check-in process was smooth and easy, and the food/drinks provided were a delightful touch. The location was great, too. I would absolutely stay here again!; Solaris 2 DOG BARKED ALL NIGHT LONG!! The front desk suggested that it may be an AirBnb tenant down the road but that didn’t make sense. Who would bring their big dog on vacation to bark all night?

This all said,  I’d totally stay here again! This place is beautiful, inside and out. The architecture is beautiful and sweet. The rooms are open air, the heat was never an issue, the breeze was super sweet. The pool is cool and refreshing after swimming in all the salt water. The front desk has beach chairs, pool noodles and coolers for you to take to the beach. Everything you need.

A full-size fridge allowed us to store leftovers and freeze bottles of water for our cooler. The hotel supplied us with fresh bread, jam, eggs and coffee (for French press) in the morning. No toaster though (you have to pan fry the bread). FYI there is no restaurant at this hotel.

Outdoor shower was awesome. SUPER HIGH pressure got all the sunblock off!

Looking up at the stars at night and watching the sun rise from our bed was magical. Dog barking aside, if we go back to Vieques, we’d stay here (but perhaps choose a different building- or not). It was THAT great!!

Oh! And the Neeva Gayle day shirts!! I would never buy one because they are unnecessarily expensive but they were amazing to wear whenever I was lounging in our room.

Name: Panadería La Viequense
Address: Calle Antonio Mellado, Vieques, 00765, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM; Thursday: Closed; Friday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM
Address Components: Calle Antonio Mellado (route); Isabel Segunda (sublocality_level_1); Vieques (locality); Isabel II (administrative_area_level_2); Vieques (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00765 (postal_code)
Reviews: Pan! Yummy bread! Ready bright and early but it closes at noon. A very nice seating area and beautiful tables, we came at around 9 and the selection of goodies wasn’t great but their pan de agua is really good and warm. We had a couple of sandwiches but thought the Cuban was a bit salty the quesitos were good and the guava pastry too. We’ll be back!; The service was good!!! don’t get me wrong but the prices are extremelyyyy outrageous! Coming from the main island and knowing that at a panadería you would pay maybeeee 18-20 dollars not even that for a few breakfast sandwiches with juices, you know coming here is a complete rip off & its mainly to take $$ from tourists since its one of the few breakfast shops. The sandwich was alright, it could have been way better for the price tbh.. I spent 40 dollars (it still hurts to say) on three sandwiches, 1 with just cheese, lettuce & egg & the other 2 with cheese, lettuce, egg & ham w/ 3 juices that were just pulpy juice you get at the supermarket (the juice wasn’t good) and one donut. When she said 40$ I literally couldn’t believe it…. Better go to the colmado (mini grocery store) thats two stores down & buy everything you need there! not only is it way cheaper but you can feed more people. Ended up going to the colmado & spent about 30 bucks on a big amount of groceries for lunch later that day (salami, cheese slices, bread, chips, water, juice etc) & didnt even reach the amount I paid here… yikes; Great place to pick up a sandwich to go and bring with you to the beach! I ordered number 14 which was so so good! It’s pork just an FYI. But they have a long list of sandwiches you can select from!! I couldn’t recommend this place more!!; Good sandwiches, donuts and coffee, but it is a bit expensive. Two of each cost about $30. Service was ok, but they don’t have dine-in seating at the moment so to-go orders only. They open early at 6am, so good for breakfast before catching the ferry or before exploring the island.; All we wanted when we arrived from Ohio was café con leche y pan de agua y pan sobao. And we found it!! Best breakfast ever (coffee and good bread). Their bread was super fresh, warm and fluffy. Just what we wanted to start our day. Their sandwiches are supposed to be legendary. The pastrami sandwich especially. Next time we’ll come for lunch!

Name: Run Vieques
Address: Vieques, 00765, Puerto Rico
Address Components: Vieques (locality); Puerto Ferro (administrative_area_level_2); Vieques (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00765 (postal_code)

Name: Crab Island Rum Distillery
Address: 4FCF+PV, Vieques, 00765, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 4FCF+PV (plus_code); Hacienda Arcadia (neighborhood); Vieques (locality); Mosquito (administrative_area_level_2); Vieques (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00765 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Where to start! It was an amazing experience, from the hospitality to the cocktails! We had planned to visit and our good friend Glo accompanied us. I did the 4 shot sampler, then we sat at the bar where our bartender Alfonso fixed us up some drinks. I tried their piña colada, pain killer, and Crab Island Punch, all three were excellent. We also ordered a food sampler and I was very honored to have gotten a picture taken with the founder Ivan 🙏🏽 After our drinks we purchased some rum and my wife got herself and Glo some earrings. We were gifted some stickers and neck keychains as well. We definitely will be returning on our next  visit.
If you’re in Vieques visiting the Crab Island Rum Distillery is a must!! They also offer tours of the distillery, don’t miss out!; Tips on ordering and contacting the venue.
First, what a beautiful experience with friendly bartenders and delicious rum. I thought it would be interesting to take a tour and was wondering why tours were not offered, until I arrived and saw that it is a boutique operation. Quite small, and a tour would take about five minutes. Instead, we were treated to local live music; we purchased two rum tastings, and then we ordered some exquisite cocktails. Keep in mind it was a Saturday, and their hours are later on a Saturday, as they stay open until 8 PM.

The vibe is local and friendly and again, boutique. We did not try the food truck, though I am reading reviews here that it is excellent.  The food truck seems to have a porch and patio, so it looks like more of a permanent installation.

I had been trying to email the venue with no success and ask for a tour, because it was really hard to tell from the website if tours were offered. Though it appeared as if they were not. I finally called them and somebody answered the phone right away.

Tips on cocktail ordering: try some of the drinks you cannot find anywhere else. My husband ordered a Mojito, and it was OK, but you can get a Mojito anywhere else. Not a great order.

My daughter ordered the chupi, and it was excellent. So creative with the rosemary syrup. Really well balanced, and a beautiful drink. If you’re looking at the photos, it’s the one with the pink swirl.
I ordered the ginger parcha, and it was one of the most refreshing and interesting cocktails I have ever tasted. And we live in a town known for their craft cocktails. The ginger and the lime balanced beautifully with the passionfruit. I ordered a second one, because it was just too delicious not too! If you are looking at the photos, it is the one that is orange.

As far as the rums, we took home a bottle of crab orange and a bottle of crab coffee. Both of these rums were delicious on their own, and would be excellent over ice. We bought a big bottle of each and are excited to share them with our friends on the mainland (or maybe not. Maybe we will keep them all to ourselves! It will clearly depend on how well our friends are behaving!); Live music on Saturday night with the rum tasting and legit food.  Piña coladas were great, both virgin and with rum.; The food and rum are amazing!  So glad we stopped. Carlos our bartender did a fantastic job with the drinks!; Yummy passion fruit mojitos! HH $7 each
Open air bar concept with a kiosk next door to order food. Owner was very nice and fun to talk to! A woman sells beautiful homemade jewelry and dried flowers/herbs( for teas/cooking). A must do!

Name: Vieques Gun Club & Sporting Clays
Address: 3FWW+FP2, PR-201, Vieques, 00765, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 3FWW+FP2 (plus_code); Puerto Rico 201 (route); Vieques (locality); Llave (administrative_area_level_2); Vieques (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00765 (postal_code)
Reviews: Richard is an excellent instructor. I’m a new firearm owner and he helped me get comfortable using my gun, and improved my technique greatly. I also tried skeet shooting with him for the first time and was very successful thanks to his instruction. Wonderful human. I’ll definitely return if I go back to Vieques!; Sweeping vistas of the Caribbean Sea mixed with a superb shooting experience! When we arrived, Richard greeted the family (three of us) and we immediately felt welcomed, comfortable, and at ease. What really impressed upon us was how Richard stressed gun safety - it was the theme every step of the way. After an initial instruction on safety and procedure, we then went up the mountain to the range. And wow - what a beautiful environment to work in. But anyway! We opted for the gun safety and training with pistols, rifle, and shotgun. Richard took great care to stress how to handle and fire each gun safely. And most of all we had great fun! Richard runs a world class shooting range that stresses safety, and you'll have a lot of fun learning about the various guns and how to shoot straight.; Richard, the owner, took great care in explaining the safety regulations and ensuring a secure environment for my son, nephew, and me during our skeet shooting experience. Not only will you have a great time, but the views that come with the experience are priceless.; Hands down on of the most exhilarating experiences in Vieques. After our diving trip got canceled because of a storm we scrambled for something to do on our last day in the island. Thankfully we found Richard and his shooting range. He graciously accommodated us last minute and made our trip that much special. He gave us a thorough safety and shooting lesson and then the fun started. We shot clay disks for a couple of hours and the whole experience was amazing. Richard is a local businessman with a true passion for the sport. You wont go wrong spending a few hours with him at his shooting range overlooking the ocean.; WHAT A BLAST! I highly recommend this experience! I booked a private tour for my brother’s birthday to shoot at the Vieques Gun Club and do the buggy tour. It was SO AWESOME! I was super impressed by the emphasis on safety and the instruction was great. Plus it was fun! 20/10 recommend and will be doing it again.

Address: 349 Calle Antonio Mellado, Vieques, 00765, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 349 (street_number); Calle Antonio Mellado (route); Isabel Segunda (sublocality_level_1); Vieques (locality); Isabel II (administrative_area_level_2); Vieques (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00765 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Got to stay at Beatriz Airbnb but also get a pedicure. Loved everything about being at Beatriz place…the service was wonderful and she was overal just great to work with. The person who did my pedicure was really nice and took her time. Will forsure come back whenever I am in the area!

PS Beatriz is all about QUALITY you will not be disappointed!; Beatriz was an absolute pleasure.  The deep tissue massage was therapeutic and worked out many knots.  I could feel the stress dissipate.; How amazing to fullfill my bucket list and get a massage on the terrace overlooking the beach at sunset! Thank you Ms. Deanna for driving over, setting up the table, and giving a wonderful 90 minute massage! Wonderful attitude, arrived on time, and was very thorough. I can't wait until my next trip.; Anyone who knows me, knows that, I absolutely love Beatriz Beauty Boutique and Spa! This is hands down my favorite spa to pamper myself and indulge in some much-needed self-care. From the moment I step through the door, I am greeted with warm smiles and a calming ambiance that instantly puts me at ease.

The services they offer are top-notch. And Beatriz and her staff, are exceptional at what they do. Beatriz has the newest, and most innovative, skin treatments. Whether it's a manicure, pedicure, facial, or massage, I always leave feeling rejuvenated and refreshed. The skilled technicians, truly know their craft and go above and beyond to ensure a relaxing experience.

The manicures and pedicures are meticulous, leaving my nails looking flawless. The facials are tailored to my specific skin needs, leaving my complexion glowing and radiant. And don't even get me started on the massages - pure bliss!

Overall, I cannot recommend Beatriz enough. Whether you're in need of a little self-care or looking to treat someone special, this spa is the perfect destination. With their exceptional services, tranquil ambiance, and friendly staff, it's an experience you won't want to miss. Trust me, once you visit, you'll be hooked, just like I am!; Edit: After several other attempts at finding deep tissue massages in PR, it seems like a massage that tries to fix knots is standard and PR is pricy in general.

Booked 3x deep tissue massages for 3 pax. We were able to reserve for late 6-7 pm and the next day 5-7 pm. However, our masseuse for both days (K, not Beatriz) was not very effective for deep tissue. For a hefty $110 for 50 minutes this was more than disappointing. If I was looking for a swedish massage, this would have been relaxing and to expectations.

Name: Malecón House
Address: 105 Calle Flamboyan, Vieques, 00765, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Open 24 hours; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours
Address Components: 105 (street_number); Calle Flamboyan (route); Vieques (locality); Puerto Real (administrative_area_level_2); Vieques (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00765 (postal_code)
Reviews:
We had the PERFECT stay at Malecón house!! We stayed in the ocean view king which offered the most beautiful view of the ocean-honestly it makes you almost want to never leave the hotel! AC works well and bed was comfortable. Staff is so friendly and accommodating, especially Porsche who went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed.   The amenities here are also wonderful-easy and free to grab beach towels and umbrellas, honor bar with snacks and drinks open 24/7, and lovely continental breakfast every morning. Finally, the pool with fountains and the banana garden/courtyard are so soothing and the perfect place to cool off after a day at the beach. Thank you so much to everyone at Malecón house-we cannot recommend them enough!!!; We had the best stay!  Everything was lovely.  Daphney and Portia even made sure the weather was perfect for us.  This is the best location on the island.  Walking distance to everything that you need.  They supply the beach coolers, ice and chairs.  You want for nothing!; We came to Vieques for one day because our granddaughter wanted to experience the bioluminescence bay. We did that last night and it was amazing. The Malacon Hotel is a beautiful boutique hotel. The furnishings, style, the outdoor pool area, and grounds had to have been professionally designed. We had the pool to ourselves yesterday and it was so nice and refreshing. The Malacon is across the street from the ocean and has nice restaurants just steps away. We love it here. Had we known, we would have stayed longer but we already have plans back on the main island. We’re going to the black sand beach which is not too far from the Malacon today before taking the ferry back to San Juan. Next time come to Vieques, we will definitely come back to the Malacon Hotel. The vibe, atmosphere, and beauty of the Malacon reminded of Lamu island in Kenya. So beautiful and serene!!!; We LOVED our stay at Malecon House. The property is clean and beautiful. The staff are all so kind and helpful. They truly have everything you could need for a beach vacation. I HIGHLY recommend. I already want to go back.; This was a wonderful stay in Vieques. The staff were great; friendly, knowledgeable about the area, honest recommendations, and just overall nice people.
-The room was beautiful, #11, with nice balcony and view of the water. The AC worked really well! Appreciated the ceiling fan, small fridge, and we never lacked for towels.
-The extras were so helpful; coolers, beach chairs, umbrellas, beach towels, ice. The honor bar for drinks and snacks were great. Along with insider info, those extras made our day trips so easy.
-Location is great; walkable to plenty of great restaurants and bars, as well as meeting points for multiple tours. But you do want to get a 4x4 vehicle if you plan to go beach hopping. Parking is easy and secure, on site.
-The pool area was serene, pool was small but nice, and we used it every single evening. It was also a perfect place to have an early morning cup of coffee.

This is such a special place in beautiful Vieques. We are already planning our next trip.

Reviews:
Our stay was nothing short of spectacular. The views were absolutely stunning, offering a breathtaking panorama of the surrounding landscape. The private beach provided a serene and exclusive retreat, perfect for unwinding in peace. The beautiful pool was an oasis of relaxation, adding to the overall sense of luxury. Truly, this place is paradise. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a perfect blend of natural beauty and top-notch amenities.; Peaceful, Relaxed, Tranquil, is like your private oasis.....access to the beach for long walk also tipical Puerto Rican food along the beach on a Kiosks....mmmmmm; Beach lovers!! Golfers!!  This is it!
Grand Bay Beach is next Bahia Beach and Golf resort In Rio Grande, PR.    Also other great courses at: Coco Beach and the Wyndham Grand Rio Mar Puerto Rico Golf & Beach Resort; Gorgeous place for vacations or just a week end, with a good beach area for relaxing. Name: Bahia Beach Resort & Golf Club
Address: 2 PR-187, Río Grande, 00745, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 2 (street_number); Puerto Rico 187 (route); Río Grande (locality); Herreras (administrative_area_level_2); Río Grande (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00745 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Beautiful course. Not easy but well worth the experience. I've played 5 courses in PR this is by far the best experience. It is run like the higher end courses in the states. Great service.; If I could give this course more than five stars, I would do it in a heartbeat! Let me begin with the phenomenal customer service! From the time You enter the property at the gate. The young lady who is at the gate is exceptional with customer service! There were two wonderful representatives in the pro shop that were without question the best customer service representatives I’ve seen thus far in Puerto Rico!

The golf course is One of the best you will ever play and certainly should be in the top 100 in the world. Being that this is US Puerto Rico it should be in the top 25 public courses In the United States.

From greens to tee boxes to Fairways To the rough you name it… it was five star. You will see my videos, and in my pictures how this course was stellar. It is sufficiently challenging, and yet it is amazingly playable. You can make par consistently on this course.  This is a $400 course that still provides military discounts and you play at the most economically reasonable course. You’re going to find I am blown away. I am coming back to Puerto Rico for one reason, and that is to play this course again

Facilities: five
Clubhouse: five
Hospitality and staff: 5+
The course: five
The practice facility: five

This is a must play!!!

And one last little extra tip to make it a 5+ plus plus golf course they had a 75% off rack for men and women and the deal was so deep I don’t need any of the things I purchased but I bought because it was so cheap!!! Now it is very pricey. It’s a very pricey clubhouse, but they do it right they make sure that there’s something for everybody and for that reason I’m coming back off to the management of this course you got it right and you got it right!!!

Hodge; Exceptional service & attention to detail, difficult greens, great layout, and majestic views. Best course I've played.; Bahia beach golf course is the most beautiful course I have been. I love the tropical trees, well kept grass and diverse scenery. Body scrub by Josefina is absolutely amazing and magical. The care and personal touch makes it exceptional. I forever remember her beautiful spirit and energy. The stay in rainforests is fun. The sounds of nature is magical; Great Track And scenery. Plush greens are also true.

Name: Rio Mar Cluster's Beach Club
Address: 96VQ+JJ3, Río Grande 00745, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 96VQ+JJ3 (plus_code); Mameyes II (administrative_area_level_2); Río Grande (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00745 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Nice place good attention, security guards are very helpful and highly skilled  , nice beach view and quiet place to enjoy; Wonderful resort facilities with beach an other amenities.; Each cluster varies and as you go up in number the cluster will generally be newer. However, for real Spanish charm with modern touches generally cluster 2 is the best. They have great beach and would definitely recommend spending some time there, be careful of the undertow and no lifegaurd.; absolutely a beautiful place to stay. Pool by the beach and Jacuzzi by the pool. Clean usable bathrooms and pleasing environment. plenty of parking within a couple of footsteps from the pool. I can see ourselves returning back here for another awesome vacation. everyone one so nice and the area was quite private. enjoy your stay and enjoy the sun. plenty of umbrellas and seating poolside.; This beach ended up being one of our favorites.

First, there is no service here so bring your cooler and snacks to enjoy the day.  No umbrellas and no one to set out your chairs, but there was always plenty to grab and at no extra cost.

No lifeguards on duty and we did encounter some currents so use caution with non swimmers and kids.

Most beaches that we have been to in the past have had white sand and no trees.  You don't really need an umbrella as there was plenty of natural shade in the afternoon from the trees, which also add to the beautif beach view.  We also enjoyed the uniqueness of the brown sand.

On the first day we encountered thousands of sand dollars in the ocean, but they were gone the next day and never returned.

The pool area appeared clean and not too busy.  The gazebo provides a great duck and cover area when the typical shower rolls buy.

There was a smoothie food truck that was open on Saturday that was an extra bonus as well.

Name: Margaritaville Vacation Club by Wyndham - Rio Mar
Address: 6000 Blvd. Río Mar, Río Grande, 00745, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Address Components: 6000 (street_number); Boulevard Río Mar (route); Río Grande (locality); Mameyes 2 (administrative_area_level_2); Río Grande (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00745 (postal_code)
Reviews: Though we’ve only stayed in San Juan and Humacao, Rio Mar blows everything else out of the water with its beauty! The beach is wonderfully natural and secluded. The rooms are immaculate and modern while the staff are all very friendly and helpful! It took 2 calls for service to get us more towels, but other than that, it was a great and very relaxing experience!; Rooms were clean and convenient with the stove and sink.  The rooms amd hallways had a Margheritaville feel, but the overall feel wasn't there for a Margheritaville property.  Maybe they are still evolving. The music in the lobby was nice each night.  Do yourself a favor, when you drive out of the propery take a right and go about a mile you will find a  restaurant thay has the most spectacular view.(it's the second restaurant) we had a drink there and wished I found it earlier in the week to have dinner or lunch.  Then go just a bit further and you will find a Eric's Pinchos.  He has his stand set up on the top of his driveway to his home.  They were magnificent and again the view was incredible.  I told him he has it made with the best view on the island.  He said yes this is my office and that is my home.  The paella at Picuas 123 when coming into the access street off hwy 3 was amazing.  It could have fed 3 easlily.  Overall a great property in a fine location being on the beach, near the rainforest and out of San Juan.  Staff were friendly and the hotel was not crowded at all.; We had the most amazing time in Puerto Rico.  The rooms are very nice and clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful.  We had a view of the ocean.  It was beautiful!  So relaxing and fun.  We would go back again and again.  The food in the restaurants was quite delicious. We highly recommend vacationing at Margaritaville Rio Mar.; When I say Margartaville resort was everything. We finally had a chance to experience this resort after hearing about it. I will be returning with my daughter and son to experience Puerto Rico and this resort. To add my room was nice and we were able to cook every night and when I continuously ask for sugar they did bring the request. Also , I wanted a snicker bar at 12midnight and they did bring that as well lol. To the people who is reading this review trust me I’m very picky ,but I enjoyed  my stay and go see for yourself and take plenty pictures like I did; If you don't like 5 pools, 4 restaurants, sound of the ocean, natural bird and frog sounds, 2 poolside bars and a walk up bar, strolls through landscaped walkways to the ocean beach, path through the jungle to view the confluence of the river to the ocean, then this place is not for you. However, if you like the things you read, then here is your high quality resort. Still casual though and staff and surroundings are difficult to equal. From restaurants to gift shop to casino can be found in this mega structure. Covered parking, room service and valet are available if so inclined. Car rental is advised as it's a way to the main road, about 40 minutes from San Juan airport and then all the attractions beyond. Convenient to snorkeling trips, El Yunque is basically across the street (it's a long street) and the forts are about an hour away. Quite an impressive stay.

Reviews: 7 handicapper here. I booked on golf now and paid $100 for Friday morning. Online price was $195. They give you range balls to warmup and water bottles. No starter or anyone to communicate that it’s your turn to tee off. There were only a few other groups so not busy which was nice. The course had a good set up, was fun to play, and had ocean views on a couple holes. Condition of the course was in the middle: greens were long and slow which was disappointing, tee box grass was a little long, bunkers had perfect sand, rest of the course was decent with some dry patches but it is summer. I would never pay more than $125 for this course personally. Hope this helps fellow golfers!; Played 01/17/2024  had a great round.  course had some amazing views.  the grounds crews would stop mowing or working when i was walking up to my ball.  then resume once i hit.  the pro shop was friendly and kind. 200 for the round plus 65 for rentals.  didn't figure it to be too out of line considering the championship style course.  definitely will be back!; This is a PGA level course with extraordinary facilities to complement the play. Maintenance crews avidly maintain the course. The Pro is available and friendly. The food cart and kiosk service is excellent with good rates. A must play location for golf lovers.; Great course to play at, well maintained, greens were immaculate and the staff was very friendly and welcoming. Clubhouse had a great fun atmosphere.; All I can say is wow!! We were so excited to play this course after the tournament. One thing I didn't understand was all the negative reviews about the course. Well once we finally played it made complete sense. We literally had to deal with the grounds crew mowing, and blowing grass all over us during our entire round...completely unprofessional. I went and spoke with the head pro about the situation. His words "sorry" after we just spent a $1000 to play. The course and staff made it very clear they didn't care if we had a good experience or not. Don't waste your time or your money!!

Name: Coco Beach Vacation Club & Residences
Address: 200 Coco Beach Blvd., Río Grande, 00745, Puerto Rico

Reviews:
The ground of the club area are very nice, however the rooms are horrible!!! The furniture in the rooms are very out dated the sofas have large stains on them and so do the chairs in the rooms. The refrigerator have corrosion and rust  so do all the appliances in the room the cabinets are being held together by obvious screws and the cabinet handles are rusty from humidity. The rooms smell musty and the air conditioning are not working correctly so you don’t feel comfortable in the room. This place need a major rehab. I would think twice about paying to come here. They have obvious not made any upgrades since Hurricane Maria they just opened and started to operate the place. It’s a shame because the grounds are really nice.; The service desk girls are very attentive. The restaurant was great. The rooms need repairs and deep cleaning.; Spectacular; The furniture was disgusting 🤮
It no longer has cleaning service, the air conditioning was leaking.
Every year it deteriorates more.
And so much money is paid for maintenance.; Only negative comment. Don't hold conventions of such magnitude again.
Otherwise 10 stars

Reviews: Beautiful golf club right on the ocean. The course is in great shape and the views and the breeze of the water can't be beat!; Beautiful location, amazing seaside holes.; The course is very scenic but it was totally flooded out. We weren’t told of the condition and quickly figured out that we weren’t going to be able to play a good round. When we stopped after 9 we received no refund except for a store credit that is useless to us. Would recommend if dry, but make sure conditions are known.; Amazing views and layout that offer a challenge to any level golfer. Just returned from a trip to Puerto Rico and this Club met every expectation I had prior to my visit. Fantastic greens, excellent condition, super staff, professionally managed, and well worth the visit. They were getting ready for the Puerto Rico Open PGA Event and while preparations were underway and both courses were incredible. Do not go to Puerto Rico to play golf and miss this Club; Truly enjoyed the golf course.  My only complain is that a number of greens had significant burnt damage.  This damage did get me upset because since I had to putt over the damage I left my putts short and missed a couple of birdie opportunities.  Yes, I will play this course again but please fix the greens with damage.

Name: Finca Neo Jibairo
Address: Carr. #187 Km. 28.6, Río Grande, 00745, Puerto Rico

Reviews: This was a unique place that had a place to get mixed drinks, a cigar shop, Brick Oven Pizza, and some various other stuff. We just grabbed the pizza to go. It was good, and we would definitely get it again.; Cool spot with weird hours. I'm sure the tours would be cool, but they have even stranger hours. They serve drinks and cigars out of a makeshift sea container, which is a bit odd, but the staff is friendly, and it's a cool place to visit if you enjoy decent cigars.; Awesome place! A must visit when in Puerto Rico especially for cigar lovers. Not only can you make your own cigars but you can learn the history along with the whole process of what it takes to make a good cigar. I learned so much and enjoyed every minute of it. The host Antonio was great and knowledgeable. They have a store with cigars and rum and other items for sale. Also have food/drink options. And a sitting area to enjoy. Check this place out, you won't be sorry.; Visiting Finca Neo Jibairo in Puerto Rico was an amazing experience! The staff were incredibly welcoming and knowledgeable. The tour was both educational and fun, and I loved learning about sustainable tobacco farming. Rolling my own cigar was a unique highlight, and the quality of their products is top-notch. The beautiful scenery and genuine hospitality made this visit unforgettable. Highly recommend!; Truly amazing place, by far my favorite after work spot. Wonderful staff , the cigars and pizzas are to die for.

Address: 200 Coco Beach Blvd., Río Grande, 00745, Puerto Rico

Reviews: coco beach offers an amazing walk and view. lot of coconuts on the way,  and almonds trees. free to grab; My sister and I stayed here in April and had the best time. We were a little skeptical after reading the reviews but let me tell you, we were beyond impressed with this beautiful resort! It was in such a gorgeous location and if you want to relax, this is the place for you! Get the red level upgrade - it was absolutely worth it.  We enjoyed happy hour every night! (Thanks Danny!) All of the staff were very kind and helpful.  The room we stayed in was really nice and we didn't have any issues. It was clean and kept in great shape. We will definitely be back!; The resort is about a five minute drive off the main road with 2 security checkpoints so you’re well protect and you don’t have to worry about local vendors trying to sell u souvenirs. The grounds is beautiful and well kept, amazing staff and great service. Meals at the on-site restaurants are very pricey so we dined at local restaurants. On-site parking also very expensive especially if u have an extended stay. The beach is very rocky and filled with seaweed perfect for lounging not swimming.; My girlfriends and I stayed at this resort and had an incredible time. We highly recommend the red level club rooms. The only thing that was a little disappointing was the beach area. It was very small and had lots of rocks. The views, service and location were perfect! We enjoyed every minute of our trip.; The hotel is absolutely beautiful. The staff is very welcoming, friendly and helpful. When we first arrived, the ruin that they had assigned to us wasn't cleaned, so the gave us a free beach front bungalow upgrade!! They were very accommodating considering it was our 10 year anniversary. Honestly the best resort we've stayed in, and can't wait to come back again.

The reason you go to PR ❤️; Friendly staff and opulent amenities.; Terrible service for St Regis hotel guests. We had a reservation but the manager could careless because we were hotel guests and not members. After an hour of wait we ate and it was meh. The manager there is terrible, have dinner elsewhere.; Lousy service. We tried calling the restaurant numerous times but couldn’t get through. We then had St Regis Bahia Beach book us a table (same property) 5 nights in advance when we arrived at the hotel. The St Regis concierge used Resy. We got numerous confirmations from Resy leading up to the reservation, but the restaurant wouldn’t honor the reservation when we arrived. If the restaurant uses Resy for reservations, they should honor bookings made that way.; Did not eat in the golf house but the pool and beach are there. Helpful staff and good drinks.

Name: Rainforest Zipline Park
Address: Road 191, km 1.1, Rio Grande, PR 00745, United, Río Grande 00745, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Vicinity: Road 191, km 1.1, Rio Grande, PR 00745, United
Address Components: Puerto Rico (country); Mameyes II (administrative_area_level_2); Río Grande (administrative_area_level_1); 00745 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Super fun! Great way to enjoy a day in the Rainforest area. The guys that worked with us were really great.
The zip lines were easy to access, with lots of ladder climbing, and the scenery was beautiful.
We chose to add the obstacle course, and because we were the only ones doing it, it was pretty quick. The guys were very knowledgeable of the local animals and plants, so they passed a lot of that information on to us. My 13 year old really enjoyed it.
Definitely worth the time and money. Check 'em out!!!; Me and my 10 year old daughter enjoyed a great time on the zip-lines. The staff was incredible with making sure my daughter was comfortable and confident at each take off point. We both had a great time and enjoyed some great views.; This was the best experience ever.  At first. I was so afraid, but the staff made me feel so comfortable to where I wanted to do all 8 courses. I recommend everyone try this place.; I recently went on a zipline adventure with this company, and it was an unforgettable experience. The staff were exceptional—friendly, professional, and clearly passionate about their work. They took the time to ensure everyone felt comfortable and safe, providing thorough instructions and answering all questions with patience and expertise.; Absolutely amazing experience and top notch service from the first person we met and every other employee along the way. We are a family of 5 (kids 12, 10 and 8). We didn't make a reservation and walked in at their 3pm time slot. They graciously allowed us to go even though they were about full and closing up shop for the day. It took us about 1.5hrs (about 10 people ahead of us so it takes time clipping everyone in and out of the lines).

They send you in to get your harness and helmet- they work fast and efficiently. They were very friendly and great with the kids, trying to make them comfortable and confident. My 8yo son was hesitant about the heights but the way they have it setup helps build up to the bigger, faster ziplines. There are 8 ziplines total. The 1-2 are shorter and one goes over the parking lot, but by the end you're climbing up some ladders/towers or going into the rainforest canopy. The staff were so attentive- talking to the kids and joking with- them putting them at ease. All 3 kids completed all the ziplines!

Wear bug spray! They provided breaks to grab water and sunscreen. They had a hand washing station at the end and gave us cold bottles of water before leaving.

TIP THE STAFF- these guys work hard and provide an amazing experience! 10/10 highly recommend

Name: The St. Regis Bahia Beach Resort, Puerto Rico
Address: State Road 187 Kilometer 4.2, Río Grande, 00745, Puerto Rico
Address Components: Río Grande (locality); Herreras (administrative_area_level_2); Río Grande (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00745 (postal_code)
Reviews:
One of the nicest places I’ve ever stayed!!  Impeccable staff and service. You drive through tropical road. Greeted by name and given welcome drinks. A former coconut plantation. Very relaxing and great amenities. Bikes, spa facilities-by appointment only, water sports and BUTLER SERVICE!!  They bring you French press coffee every morning. My friends are coffee drinkers and couldn’t get enough of it!; The property is so gorgeous. Handed a delicious drink when you arrive. It is clean and feels like you’re in a jungle. They provide sunscreen and bug spray. There’s water stations all around the property. They set you up with seats and towels at the pool and beach. Employees are so kind and helpful, they are very attentive and easily contacted. The turn down service was a great surprise. My room was so nice and spacious. There isn’t much around the resort, so you can only really eat at their restaurants (the hours were confusing). The food and drinks were good for breakfast lunch and dinner. The only negative thing I will say is that if you are going for a quiet romantic couples trip, this isn’t the place. Children and babies are running all around unsupervised and screaming. The room for morning breakfast was small and my head always hurt from all the screaming. Besides that, I totally recommend!; Having spent over 2000 nights in hotels during the past 30 years, I can confidently say that The St. Regis Bahia Beach Resort in Puerto Rico stands out as one of the best experiences I've ever had. From the moment my wife and I began planning our trip, the resort staff exceeded our expectations in every way. Our interactions with the team over the phone were seamless, and everyone we spoke to was both accommodating and professional. They truly set the tone for what was to be an extraordinary stay.

Upon arrival, we were warmly welcomed by the staff, who consistently went out of their way to ensure we had an exceptional experience. Their genuine interest in making our stay memorable was evident in every interaction. The food at the resort was nothing short of phenomenal, offering a wide variety of options to suit every palate. The attention to detail was remarkable, particularly with the changing cheese selection at the breakfast buffet, which showcased the thoughtful care put into every aspect of our stay.

The resort itself is stunning, with beautiful facilities that reflect the exquisite environment. The combination of the breathtaking surroundings, the impeccable service, and the outstanding cuisine made our stay truly unforgettable. The St. Regis Bahia Beach Resort is, without a doubt, the best place we've ever stayed. If you're looking for an extraordinary experience where everything is perfect – from the people to the food to the facility – this resort is a must-visit.
Sent from my iPhone; Favorite hotel on the island. Small, intimate, beautiful campus (Audobon Society reserve). Great service. Family friendly. Nice restaurant, pool and bar options. Can't miss.; We recently stayed for 7 nights. I’ll start with the only con of the trip: the dining options are pretty limited especially if you stay for an extended period of time. That being said, the majority of our dining experiences at the hotel (food wise) were good, not great. However,
that does not include the service whatsoever…

The service at this resort far exceeded our expectations. There was not a single request that was not accommodated exactly. Need to preorder in- room dining for breakfast before a day touring Puerto Rico: not a problem. Need transportation set up? They will arrange it, make sure it’s round trip and text you the information while you lay at the pool sipping  pina coladas.  Everything from setting up your pool chairs, to shuttling you around the property, to delivering you coffee every morning is done promptly and with a smile. Every person we encountered was friendly and kind. They went above and beyond to make our anniversary special, delivering us a bottle of Champaign one night and truffles another. When our kids missed out on s’mores night (due to our own plans- not the hotel’s fault) they made s’mores for us and sent them to our room. This was one of them most relaxing and hassle free vacations I have had and that is 100% attributable to staff and their amazing service.

We also enjoyed the amenities  the resort offers. The boathouse is extremely fun and offers several activities for all ages. We enjoyed  spa day which was extremely luxurious and again, the service was amazing. While we enjoyed the spa, the kids enjoyed the kids club, where the staff kept them busy with crafts, movies, video games, etc. They didn’t want to leave when we picked them up. The private beach is such a luxury- no fighting for chairs or space and they come and serve you drinks and food just like the pool. The nightly Champaign sabering is a fun way to start the evening and the kids loved feeding the Koi fish before dinner. The views are breathtaking.

The resort is remote and surrounded by a rain forest and river, so yes there are birds and iguanas and other wildlife around. But we were not bothered at all and felt it added to the experience. It does take some time to get to places off property due to the location- but if you plan for that it’s totally workable.  It took about 35-40 mins to get to Old San Juan, during high traffic times it can be longer.

Overall we really enjoyed our stay and were sad to leave. We would recommend this resort and would stay again if we are back in Puerto Rico.

Name: Armería 3T Shooting Club
Address: PR-967, Río Grande, 00745, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM

Reviews:
Very unfriendly customer service with my case as well. Went to try to have my wife get a feel of a few handguns as she is soon to get her carry license so that she could leave the gun on layaway. The man rudely said she wasn’t allowed to hold any guns because she didn’t have her licence yet despite me stating that she’ll acquire one soon(the guns are unloaded for pete’s sake and my wife has been taught gun safety rules). I drove though a very rough road to a very remote armory to be treated with rudeness. I’ve went to armories where I’ve held the pistols before I had my license and was treated with respect as any person made in the image of God deserves. Don’t go here, the trip alone made it difficult, the abhorrent customer service was the last nail in the coffin.; Don't waste your time going here if you are trying to buy a gun and bullets.  They price their weapons in accordance on how much they feel you can pay and then smile as they claim  they gave u a discount.  These people do not have a website, never have up to date bullets, holster, nor accessories.
I found Metro gun in San juan.  I will drive there for now on.  METRO GUN  has up to date bullets, guns, and accessories.  3T can  kicks rocks.; This shooting club is a public nuisance, they have no consideration for the neighbors and residents of the area who have to live with constant noise from their outdoor and surely illegal firing range. Now they plan to open night sessions, they have created a nightmare for all the people in that community and they refuse to do anything about it. No one should support this business.; Just dont; Nice range. Good service and the instructors are Bi-Lingual. Wide variety of products and a complete activity area for large groups.

Name: Hacienda Siesta Alegre
Address: PR-186, Río Grande, 00745, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Address Components: Puerto Rico 186 (route); Río Grande (locality); Guzmán Abajo (administrative_area_level_2); Río Grande (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00745 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I stayed at the tree room, the room was interesting to stay in at first but then you notice many small things that people built it didn't think through: power outlet covered by the mirror, shower curtain cannot cover the whole shower, sliding doors with extreme resistance to open/close...
Adding to that, we had a defective sink and informed the staff during breakfast, and hang out the 'please clean' tag, but when we came back in the evening, nothing was attended to, housekeeping did not even show up! When I confronted the staff about it, they just said that 'we will report to management', but nothing was done to compensate for it, and in my follow up to ask about this, they even lied and said that the manager asked the staff to 'take action to fix the issue', yet from my side I did not notice anything being done. Overall just terrible containment of a small mistake from the staff. Avoiding responsibilities.; This place is a gem tucked away in the rainforest. It was a perfect escape into nature. The location is convenient to El Yunque, and the hacienda is beautifully designed and decorated. We had a wonderful stay and wish we could have stayed longer!; Beautiful, serene and a wonderful included breakfast. We went on a riding tour with Yari and it was so fun! Great place to relax in the jungle.; My daughter and now son in-law got married in this location. This is an amazing place for their beauty, organization and helpful team in the middle of the rainforest.; You just can't find something like this in our world! Made a wedding a true fairy tale!
A must see place

Name: Coco Beach Resort
Address: 95VV+C8H, PR-955R, Río Grande, 00745, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 95VV+C8H (plus_code); Puerto Rico 955R (route); Río Grande (locality); Zarzal (administrative_area_level_2); Río Grande (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00745 (postal_code)
Reviews: We stayed at the vacation club 1 room apartments. It has a full kitchen which is nice with microwave, full sized stove, refrigerator, dishwasher, etc. Also, a full dining table for 6 people. Room was nice and bathroom also okay. The living room, however, left much to be desired. It has two couches that can be used as sleeper sofas. They were sooo dirty and in such bad shape it was very disgusting. We would expect a hotel like this one to care for these kinds of details. These couches should really be replaced ASAP. Vacation club amenities were nice and people behind the desk were very friendly. But the room living room needs to be addressed for me to want to stay there again.; We loved our stay at Coco Beach! The Hyatt resort is beautiful, directly on the ocean with a huge pool, space for everyone. The restaurants on site were very tasty! You do need to reserve your table in agave if you want to eat on site as they were booked full every night! The staff was great, very friendly. The weather was absolutely gorgeous, warm and sunny! Bring sunscreen!  This is a gated community, and we felt very secure never being on this island before. Most people speak English  & Spanish. Road signs are in Spanish and distance is in kilometers, which was Very different for us. 😅 There are a lot of potholes on the island and locals drive very fast,  sort of like Boston.😂; The resort was gorgeous. The main pool was quite large. The beach was no big deal for me coming from Florida. But all the decorations were quite nice. The hotel is a bit out of the way so you really need to rent a car.; This resort is so beautiful. I have come two years in a row. This is the place if you are ready to relax and just get away. If you plan on leaving the resort you need a car to enjoy the island. Greet location for you to get around the island and enjoy all what Puerto Rico has to offer.; Beautifully scenery and great location. Good service and delicious food. Good for families or couples. They have a kids club. Rooms are clean and comfortable.  Great and free wifi. You can choose from a variety of restaurants or just have room service, but it's a bitpricey.  They also have a golf course. We have a nice time.

Name: Wyndham Rio Mar Golf Course
Address: 6000 Blvd. Río Mar, Río Grande, 00745, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Address Components: 6000 (street_number); Boulevard Río Mar (route); Río Grande (locality); Mameyes 2 (administrative_area_level_2); Río Grande (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00745 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I have played lots of beautiful courses and this one is by far the best. The course is in great condition and only costs 40$ to play. The wildlife will come up and look at you (including nice iguanas) and there are beautiful views of the rainforest mountains. Hole sixteen is gorgeous with views of the ocean past amazing palm trees laced around the whole hole. The staff and hospitality are excellent and Manny (I think was his name) was very helpful when checking you in and greeting you immediately. The golf store is wonderful and has great polos.; I recently played the River course while staying at the Wyndham Grand Rio Mar Golf & Beach resort. This review is for this particular golf course only.

Pros:
The golf course has great views. You can often see the rainforest in the background and almost every hole is lined with palm trees. There is lots of water but each hole feels unique. The fairways are in great shape. The sand traps are decent, but could use more to have more fluff. The tee boxes are decent, but some of them were a bit more beat up than others. The rental clubs are a nice set of Ping G425s and they also supply you with two sleeves. They do have a driving range with free range balls available. Also, they have a putting green/chipping area. Lastly, the cart girl came around a lot and had all the beverages you would expect.

Cons:
The greens are quite bad. They are super slow and a lot of them have issues where there is no grass, just sand. However, the biggest issue is that the price for this type of course is much higher than you would expect given the quality. All in I paid $262 ($70 of that is rental clubs). That price puts it in line with some of the nicer public courses you can play in the 50 states, which this course simply is not.

Overall, I still enjoyed my time golfing on this course despite the high price tag. If you are OK with paying a premium to golf in the winter months while you are vacation, then I would suggest booking a tee time.; Golf review only! Very disappointed. Been looking forward to playing here since moving to PR. Thought since it was Troon it would be in good shape but it was not! Range - bad. Greens - bad. Grass - long and fluffy. Tee boxes - very bad. Home #16 is the only ocean hole. Took a moment to enjoy the beach. But the hole was in bad shape and really long for a par 3. Staff was friendly and that was the only good thing.  I don’t think I’ll play there again.; Played River Course this morning with an ancient set of Kmarts from the resort freebies. Hot and humid, but the rain stayed away.; I need to preface my review first….
I wanted to plan a group golf outing while in my wedding cruise that had a stop in San Juan, PR.
I had tried multiple times, and I mean close to a dozen times to communicate with the staff and facility to make this a reality.
After those failed attempts, I utilized my Concierge Services through my American Express card and they were able to get the ball really rolling.

Once I was put in direct contact with management, the process was quite smooth.

The staff were friendly, attentive, courteous and respectful.

Amenities were good and welcoming.

There were many requests that I had made and those requests were fulfilled.

Some other items that had been offered and agreed upon were not fulfilled which was a disappointment to myself and my guests.

Course is challenging but fun.

I would recommend Wyndam Grand Rio Mar to others, but I would be upfront about my experience.

Name: Hyatt Regency Grand Reserve Puerto Rico
Address: 200 Coco Beach Blvd. Highway, 955-I, Río Grande, 00745, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Open 24 hours; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours
