Address Components: 955-I (route); Río Grande (locality); Zarzal (administrative_area_level_2); Río Grande (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00745 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This Hyatt was absolutely one of the best! The attention to detail was amazing and exceeded my expectations. What I loved the most was the service of the place!
Gabriel, watched over us throughout our stay to ensure we had everything we needed and gave us suggestions of things to do and places to visit.
El macho, was phenomenal. He drives the cart around picking up and dropping off people treating everyone with respect and care.
Gotta say, we were very pleased and will return.
Ricardo; Hotel grounds are beautiful, and given we went during a week when occupancy was very low the experience was nice, quiet and relaxing. Beyond that however, I can see an experience during more crowded times that would be chaotic and the opposite of relaxing. I was traveling with a small family and despite a tremendous amount of empty rooms on property I was shocked that there are none that can accommodate a family beyond a few private villas reserved for those with much deeper pockets, which seems like a huge mismatch between sheer quantity of rooms and the types of travelers you can accommodate. Staff were quite nice, and the physical location is very nice, but the overall experience just doesn't meet what should be a high bar deserving of the 'Grand Reserve' title.; We had read some negative reviews before coming, so we were a little nervous about what to expect, but our stay was AMAZING! The food and drink prices were exactly what you would expect and comparable to places off site (except the breakfast buffet is way overpriced). The pool is probably the best pool I’ve been in. It’s huge with plenty of space to swim and play. The beach is calm and quiet (don’t expect waves). The rooms were spacious and served our family of 4 well for the week. With our family it was easiest to eat dinner at Brassire (Water’s Edge during the day) or the Lobby Bar. The food truck for lunch was great. Our room was cleaned every day. The grounds are beautiful. We had a car to do lots of adventures off site and it’s probably best to have a car. Overall, we loved our stay and would happily come back!; Nice beach.  Housekeeping doesn't do a great job and seem to be overworked.  One told me she has to clean 14 rooms a day. Pool is smaller than the pics.  Restaurants are decent. 45+ min from anything. Looks like they have a good golf course.  Wouldn't stay here again..; Everything about my stay at the Hyatt Regency Grand Reserve was amazing! I was nervous after reading previous negative reviews, but the location, room, and overall resort property were PERFECT! I’m so glad that I didn’t allow the negative reviews to sway my decision to stay here. I’ve stayed in San Juan in the past but this was a breath of fresh air. I highly recommend and plan on staying at this property again.

Name: Land Shark Bar

Name: Beach Club - St. Regis Bahia Beach Hotel
Address: State Road 187 Km. 4.2 Rio Grande, Río Grande 00745, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 7:30 PM; Thursday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Sunday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: Puerto Rico (country); Herreras (administrative_area_level_2); Río Grande (administrative_area_level_1); 00745 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Above average local flavors, but not gourmet.
The relation between quantity, quality, taste, presentation and price it’s not balanced, kind overpriced and definitely can be better in all the mentioned areas… keep in mind: you’re in a luxury resort.
Really nice Ocean View during the day time, and I suggest you to eat outside to enjoy the sea breeze while you’re eating.
Missing the Goat Stew…
The Servers Angel and Orlando are always assisting quickly with a smile on their faces and professionalism.; The dress code is advertised to be resort casual  (long pants, closed toe shoes) but the majority of the customers seem to be residents who were extremely casually dressed. There was a very loud party inside, so loud that they only explanation they were allowed to continue t be loud is that they were regulars / residents.  The food was just ok and below expectations at this price range and the service was very slow - it took over an hour to get our food and the waiter didn’t come to check on us often enough so we ended up running out of drinks and wait quite a long time for him to stop by.; Waited for 40 minutes for a cold hamburger that cost $28.  They took it off the total but charged me $20 for water that I drank while waiting for the food.  They claimed it was bottled water, but I never saw or ordered bottled water.  I ordered still water.  I felt I had been conned and I hate a con artist , so this review is for you.  Buyer beware!  The rest of the food was boring and below average but priced exorbitantly.  I know it’s a resort but if you charge these prices I expect the food to be excellent.  This place is not worth the time or money.; Had dinner here during our stay at the St Regis. We were here during the slow season so the restaurant was not very busy. The food was excellent. We shared the snapper which was cooked and plated perfectly. The St Regis offered transportation from the hotel via golf cart but if you walk along the beach the restaurant is a manageable walk from the hotel.; This was our farewell dinner and it didn’t disappoint!!!
Wonderful views, service and food.
We started with the cauliflower and ceviche. Then we had the red snapper with mofongo. Yum!! To finish we got the cream brûlée.
Angel and I think Leonell our server were absolutely kind and accommodating.
The chef even came out to talk to us and share some food tips to practice at home.
I will highly recommend this restaurant.

Reviews:
This place is great. I went because I wanted to treat my mother and she had told me of this place before but I was skeptical about it. When we got there rush hour was starting for them so we got there before it got packed! The waitress were so helpful and were happy to answer our doubts we had about the food.

The quality of the coffee they had was great and oh so smooth! I have tasted, in other coffee shops, the brand of coffee they use but their barista excelled at prepare it because that Triple Espresso was perfect!

I highly recommend that if you find yourself in San Lorenzo for whatever reason you visit them.

Follow me on instagram: @thecoffeeisgone and @juanconhambre; The food and attention to service is second to none! Their breakfast, sandwiches, and wraps are excellent---they can customize it to your liking. I believe they also serve brunch. ✌🏻👍🏻; Love it, friendly good price.food good; Although P.R. has great coffee across the board, it's the atmosphere here that keeps me returning week after week. Staff is phenomenal, earthy and fresh decor, and a fantastic selection of food and beverages never disappoints.; What a jewel!!! Tacita dulce is like heaven in a cup. The food is divine! Healthy without sacrificing the taste. Had the wrap de revoltillo it was amazing and really filling. My husband had the San Lorenzo sandwich it was a good combination of goodness cant explain it ..left him speechless. The latte it was perfect,smooth, creamy, all the way to the last drop. Service was amazing they have a great team. The ambiance is super friendly.

Reviews: Drove here to try something new and it had other good reviews. Coffee was amazing! They have plenty of flavors to try and I had the pistachio and the Creme Brulee and both were flavorful and a little sweet. I also tried the carrot cake and guava cheesecake and both were very good. There is parking but it was pretty crowded. The inside is closed for now which was sad and there's table to sit out outside but it was crowded so I ended up taking my Coffee to go.; Great service, the coffee/drinks were pretty good. Would not recommend the pastries. The banana bread was dry and cold, the chocolate chip cookie was burnt, and the tiramisu was ok.; Coffee is great and the employees who took and made my coffee were excellent. Unfortunately my experience was ruined by the employee at the parking, he doesn't know how to communicate. This individual was disrespectful and doesn't know how to treat people and we are talking about customers here that this guy was dealing with. I visited this place 20-Sept-24 at noon and if it wasn't for this employee at the parking my experience and my co-workers experience would've been great.; We got iced vanilla coffee and a mango frappe. Both were really good and refreshing! Perfect spot to hit up after eating lechón next door.; Like many other reviews here ... The setting is just amazing. It's right off the Highway so it's a great stop wether you are driving south to Ponce or going up into the Metro area. The selection of pastries and dessert just makes it unique.

Reviews: Went here because the music was rocking at first. Hookah was not all of that the flavored very quick. Could have mixed the songs better. Drinks was okay. Hookah was $45.; Security is a joke and after a certain time if you don't buy a bottle they legit force you out. Got thrown out because I didn't immediately pick up my hookah from a table that suddenly became only bottle service. There's a dozen better bars across the street and up the block.; We went on a Tuesday night and it was actually pretty busy. Music was great. Played a mix of hip hop and reggaeton. Drinks were good.  Friendly security.  Heard it’s really the place to go on Friday nights.; Got there with a group of five when the bar was empty. Four rounds of drinks later and moments after buying a hookah, security suddenly appeared and told us we had to leave because its bottle service only and they don’t care that we had a fresh round of drinks and just ordered a hookah. They weren’t moving anyone else, even people who didn’t have drinks or hookah, and there was nowhere for us to go because the place is small and packed. Security was a team of two imbeciles who were sent to rough us up and get us out of there so they can bring in the next group of people to take advantage of. Any decent place would have management come over and inform us that after a certain time it’s bottle service only and give us time to finish our drinks and hookah. You don’t start cleaning a table and grabbing peoples drinks because you suddenly need them gone. This is a trash place that’s just a tourist trap. Don’t bother waiting in line for this place. There lots of other places to go with much better vibes.; This area was perfect for night spot hang out in Puerto Rico!

Reviews:
Had to stop by after seeing so many reviews and videos on YouTube. And it did not disappoint! The best drinks I’ve tried in the island since I’ve been visiting! Joe was our bartender and he was super cool and knowledgeable. Will definitely be back before leaving to the main land!; 6 different bars in 1, rated in the top 50 bars in the US. My favorite was the Spanish section.  The drink was the best I had my entire time in PR! Fast and polite service.  Music bumping! I loved it!; Can’t speak on the food but these were the best cocktails we have had in San Juan. The drinks are aesthetically pleasing and they are actually strong and taste great! The old fashio was my favorite drink. A must try if you are visiting. Plus they have 4-5 different rooms with different music. The vibes are there for everyone! I believe our bartenders name was Murph and he was super dope and made our experience great.; Great experience.
Great cocktails, great atmosphere and better hospitality.
Monday fun day with live boricua salsa.
They open at 11am, if you go there after walking the Old San Juan need to try La Champeta, refreshing rum cocktail with pineapple, also they make delicious mojitos.
Harry and Junelly talented bartenders have an exceptional customer service, great conversations.
Ask to Harry to make a delicious Rum expreso martini with barrilito 3 estrellas, he has a special recipe.; Great drinks from great bartenders. Was so good, I had to come back again. I don't usually do mezcal but the Mercado Roma was on point. Bartenders are passionate about what they do and work well as a team and it shows. Definitely stop by if in Old San Juan.

Reviews:
The security at this club was ridiculous.
A white male security staff member, supposedly tasked with ensuring safety, exhibited unprofessionalism and disrespect. He forcibly grabbed my arm under the pretext of speaking "Spanish" to me, solely because of "my Hispanic appearance" (his words). Despite calmly explaining that I was looking for my companion and not causing any disruption, he callously dragged me out, using excessive force. It's worth noting that even other club staff members were urging him to release me.

Additionally, this security guy, hired to maintain order, had been dancing the night away instead of prioritizing his responsibilities. It's baffling that he felt compelled to exert force on me, a 5'5" female who posed no threat and was simply trying to locate someone. The club was full of people, yet he singled me out, displaying a blatant disregard for professionalism.

When questioned about his unnecessary use of force, he cited my failure to follow his "directive" to turn around. However, his inconsistency was glaring, as he passed numerous individuals without enforcing such directives. This incident has left me extremely disappointed. Never to return to this establishment. I am compelled to share my experience with family and friends, as it's disheartening to witness individuals with the slightest authority abusing their roles, prioritizing personal issues/frustrations over safety.; It's always a blast hanging out there, drinking and dancing in their 3 dance floors. I do miss the karaoke spot on Saturdays.. but specifically now I the winter it's the best place to go party cause of the cold  ❄️😁🎶; They’re only job is to keep beer cold for their customers and they failed, last 4 times i ‘ve been there, the beer downstairs is warm, no wonder i see less and less people every-time i go there, keep selling warm beer and soon you’ll be outta business, sorry!; Came to celebrate a friends bday and a person who claimed he was the DJ just came and took my seat and used an excuse he couldn’t hear hear me. After siting at my set they continued to bump into me as they wanted me to move forcefully. I will never come to this place. They also have so many violations in the facility. Stairway is not secure to down stairs club Will not come to this place again. People who think they have the right to bump you off you chair because they fell they have the righter way is not they way to do business.. This place is a fire hazard.; Bartenders are inattentive. Extremely poor service.  At the bar over 15 minutes, front, bar top, and still wasn't able to get a drink. Music is pretty good but terrible service without a doubt from the bartenders at the first bar. Place gets packed. Women restroom downstairs. Messy floor. Completely wet.

Name: Tattoo Tavern #17
Address: C. Marginal, Luquillo, 00773, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Address Components: Calle Marginal (route); Luquillo (locality); Mata de Plátano (administrative_area_level_2); Luquillo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00773 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I absolutely love this place and will be coming back! Coming from New York, this place makes you feel sooo so welcome and they are so generous with how they treat their customers!
I sat at the bar and watched them squeeze oranges, lemons, even passion fruit 😍 the wings were SO GOOD, so crispy, so perfect. The fish taco had TWO fish fillets, deliciously crispy, so thick you can’t close the tortilla. The drinks were great but the best was the conversation tbh. It’s family-owned so the vibes were perfect. Can’t wait to come back!; If you're a tattoo loving metal head, this is the spot for you! The owner, Falu, is an extremely friendly and professional bartender who runs the most fun bar on luquillo Beach. That man and his crew truly made me feel at home. On Sundays, they also hold Karaoke if you feel like singing your sole out or want to listen to one of the incredible bartenders Scream some Slipknot! If you get the chance to hear Jake's voice, you'll see that tattoo tavern is the bar for any alt/goth lover.

PS, Richard's the guy that got me to visit the bar. A true local and gentleman of tattoo tavern; The burger, Buffalo wings, and daiquiris are absolutely delicious! Everyone was so friendly. I know this isn’t typical Puerto Rican food, but I think this was the BEST burger I have ever had. The live music was really good as well, this is a perfect spot for dinner; Good place with good music 🎶 and Karaoke 🎤 Chicken wings with spicy sauce delicious 😋 👌 😍; We came here on a whim from El Yunque after hearing it was a great place for a cold beer and a snack after sweating through our clothes hiking to Mt. Britton. Our advice was SO correct! Ingrid, the bartender, guided me through her favorite local beers, and brought out some homemade hot sauce after we ordered two plates of (delicious) nachos! It's dark, the music's great, and Ingrid was a wealth of knowledge about where else to go and what to do. If I lived closer, I'd probably be a regular here.

Name: Casa Coral Luquillo
Address: 160 CALLE QUINTO CENTENARIO #1803, Luquillo, 00773, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 10:30 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 10:30 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM
Address Components: Luquillo (locality); Luquillo (administrative_area_level_2); Luquillo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00773 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Stay here for a hostel! Nice airconditioned bedrooms. use of kitchen facilities. Well organized. Really Clean for a hostel. Friendly and helpful staff. A little away from the busy strip but within walking distance. Just a great place at an amazing price. A gem of a place.
Cons- Swimming is not easy at this time of the year- more for surfing.  Parking can be tricky. - they have some spots, but I could see them fill up quickly when it is busier.  And unlike a hotel, the space you can just sit and read a book and look out at the view isn't airconditioned. This could be a dealbreaker for some people.; I stayed at Casa Coral for 12 nights with my two children. I was hesitant to stay at a hostel with two kids, but I am SO happy we did. Everyone was very welcoming. We rented a lovely private room that was extremely clean and cleaned periodically through our vacation. Laundry was available which is essential for a beach vacation with children. During Tropical Storm Ernesto, Tyrone stayed the night at the hostel to ensure everyone was safe and comfortable. Every staff member stepped up to make sure the generator was running until power returned. They were super helpful with restaurant and tour recommendations. My son, especially loved his surf lesson they offered! We also enjoyed kayaking/paddle boarding down the adjacent river. Casa Coral is staffed by people that begin to feel like friends and family. From daily chats, to cooking mofongo, to eating delicious papaya and guava con queso pastries!  It provides an opportunity to connect and explore with people from around the world. My little one is a wild one, but we felt at home every step of the way. Highly recommend!; This place is the Puerto Rican experience you need! The workers are so friendly, the rooms are good and the bathrooms are spectacular. The amenities are amazing for cooking, chilling…
A MUST here is rent a paddle board and go down the river! This was one of the highlights of our trips.
Thanks Derrick for the recommendations too; Amazing in every aspect.
Beautiful location in front of the beach.
Cute private room with super comfortable bed and great AC unit.
Super nice living area with plenty of appliances able to use, fridge/stove/air fryer.
Beach towels given to use, paddleboard / surfboard to rent.

Plenty of great places to eat and drink nearby too!
Beautiful. Staying here next time I come!; This hostel is a hidden germ. The location is perfect right in front of the beach. Very quiet and perfect if you needed to work remote for a few days. The beds in the dorms are super comfortable and they have curtains for pricacy. The staff is very sweet and helpful and came accross amazing travelers. This is definitely my go to place next time in PR.

Name: Luquillo Beach Balneario
Address: 97PF+5HQ, Luquillo, 00773, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 97PF+5HQ (plus_code); Luquillo (locality); Mata de Plátano (administrative_area_level_2); Luquillo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00773 (postal_code)
Reviews: I love this beach, probably my all time go to beach in Puerto Rico. The water is very calm, no huge waves. The have a bathhouse, so you can take a shower and leave nice and clean. In addition they have beach chairs and umbrellas available. If you want a drink or beer, they have bar staff on the beach which is convenient. When you come in they have plenty of parking available. If you get hungry, you can walk over to the kiosks to get something to eat.; Used to be a gorgeous beach before locals and tourists completely trashed it. There's literally trash everywhere. Piles of it. Next to dumpsters. And it smells so bad. Then there's the weed smoke. Loud jet skis so close to swimmers, I was concerned about my kids swimming. No actual flushing bathroom, sink to wash hands, or rinse shower. There are two port a johns. That's it. Definitely the worst condition in over 30yrs of visiting here. Sad. So sad.; One of the best beaches in the island, my favorite!; Great beach, calm waters, friendly atmosphere!; Super quiet, excellent for the family.

Name: Selva Boutique Hotel- Luquillo Oceanfront Retreat- Adults-only
Address: 6 Cll 1, Playa Fortuna, Luquillo 00773, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 6 (street_number); Calle 1 (route); Playa Fortuna (locality); Mameyes I (administrative_area_level_2); Luquillo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00773 (postal_code)
Reviews: Great getaway from the kids! My husband and I wanted a break and had a great time just relaxing at this little hotel.  Close to everything.. we barely had to use our car since the beach and many restaurants are nearby over at the kiosks. The rooms were great, and it was an amazing overall experience. Definitely coming back next year and recreating this fab trip.; Great views and very helpful staff we were greeted by the owner a little after hours and check-in was super easy. They always communicated with me and let me know when and where I needed to be. The rooms were very nice and clean along with the bathroom. We had a balcony overlooking the pool with a view of the ocean. Unfortunately could not go down towards the water due to on going construction, but the pool was very nice and the views were spectacular!; We 2 “Grannys “ ran away from home for 5 days. It was a spur of the moment trip and we found a great deal to Selva Boutique Hotel. We wanted days of rest/Relaxation. This charming hotel on the beach in Luquillo was just what we needed. We walked to the beach and local shops just minutes away-as we didn’t rent a car. We loved the manager and owner, both charming women! And the hotel cat, Selva, was an added bonus. We came as strangers and will be leaving our new friends .; Found this gem last minute while venturing to hike in the Rain Forest which was amazing. Our room was clean,  faced the beautiful ocean and the staff answered all of our many questions. Kiosks were in walking distance and the beach was right around the corner. So relaxing and beautiful. Will be back.; What a great experience!  The hotel is right on the water and has a pool.  The staff was super friendly.  The room was spotless.  Very close to the Luquillo kiosks and convenient to the highway.  We stayed to visit El Yunque, but feel like we found a little gem in this hotel.  Will be back for sure!

Name: Carabalí Rainforest Park
Address: Puerto Rico 992, Luquillo, 00773, Puerto Rico
Address Components: Puerto Rico 992 (route); Luquillo (locality); Mameyes I (administrative_area_level_2); Luquillo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00773 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Planned a birthday trip for three family members back in September and this was the most memorable thing we did. Everyone couldn’t stop talking about how professional the staff was. Amazing views, fun experiences and good food! Forgive me if I’m wrong but I think our tour guides name was Luis. He was the absolute best!! We can’t wait to book another ATV session here!; My first time visiting PR riding ATVS was definitely on top of the list and I can say that we definitely went to the right place. The staff was very friendly there was no wait time. We got there and got our gear and on to ride the ATVS after instructions. Our instructor Christopher was an amazing guy he was very enthusiastic and very friendly. I would recommend anyone to ask him as an instructor. I would definitely be visiting again in the future.; This tour was awesome. Our tour guide (forgot his name, young Puerto Rican gentleman). Made sure we were safe. Checked on us frequently throughout the tour. Gave clear thorough instructions. I would definitely recommend this tour.; Great ride with awesome scenery and views!  Our guides did a great job keeping everyone together.

It was about an hour to the beach with a stop for photos once we were on the beach and a 30 minute rest at a place with drinks and food.  Then it was a 15 minute ride back.  All in all, it was a great excursion and well worth it!; All 4 in my group thought this horseback riding adventure was the best part of our trip. The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating to the entire group but especially to my 6 and 10 year old kids. Great views and lots of fun. Our only regret was only booking the one hour ride instead of two hours!

Name: Playa La Pared
Address: Playa La Pared, Cll Herminio Diaz Navarro, Luquillo, 00773, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Open 24 hours; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours
Vicinity: Playa La Pared, Calle Herminio Diaz Navarro, Luquillo
Address Components: Playa La Pared (natural_feature); Calle Herminio Diaz Navarro (route); Luquillo (locality); Luquillo (administrative_area_level_2); Luquillo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00773 (postal_code)
Reviews: If Rincon is the surfers paradise on the west of the island, Playa La Pared is close to its equal on the North East coast.  About 50km east of San Juan.  Located in the town of Luquillo.  A good beach to explore for hours even if you don’t surf.  You can walk the beach and swim closer to the shore.  Watch the surfers and other water/beach activities.  There are cafes & restaurants in the neighborhood and oceanfront restaurants and bars that can get busy on some days.  We were told that food trucks are only there on Saturdays.  We went on Saturday on our next visit and the beach was busy.  There were several food trucks that offered variety of food with reasonable prices.  We highly recommend the Simple Food Truck.  There’s plenty of spots in the big parking lot but if you want to be close to the beach and park on the beachfront street, get there early!; It's a good beach to relax, play some dominoes and spend time with family and friends. The downside is that you have to park on the street; on weekdays you can find a spot but on the weekends it is really difficult.; Absolutely beautiful beach in Puerto Rico.  When the tide is low, you can go around to the calmer lagoon and enjoy more beautiful views.  Very good waves if you like surfing or body surfing.  For sure worth a visit.; Quite a lovely beach. Loved seeing the well maintained & protected turtle nests during the nesting season. Parking lot is right there and FREE. Clean, with lots of walking area. I love late afternoon walks along the quiet shore.; A Beautiful, bright orange stretch of sand makes for a very nice beach for walking and relaxing. The waves are amazing and many people were swimming when the seas weren't too rough. This beach has amazingly soft sands, and is nice and wide, a great spot to relax!

Name: Casa club espiritus

Reviews: atmosphere is 5 stars IF you’re looking for a quiet/neighborhood oriented spot. its a small spot but gets quite busy and it can take some time to order. the ladies in here were killing it when i visited!!!! food was simple and delicioussssss omg. the bread. the bread was so good and lives in my head rent free. i got the ham and cheese, it’s so simple that when i say it was so delicious i sound crazy.. but im telling you, the bread is *chefs kiss*; Antique Bakery offers a delightful breakfast experience with a cozy, old-world charm. Their breakfast menu is filled with a variety of delicious options, from perfectly baked pastries to hearty plates that satisfy any appetite. The fresh ingredients and homemade touch in every dish really stand out. It's a great place to start your day, with a warm and welcoming atmosphere that makes you feel right at home. They get busy so beating the crowd is important.; We bought a couple of apple pastries, a guava pastry, tres leches, and a guava roll with powdered sugar.  Everything was delicious except the guava jelly roll with powdered sugar.  The roll tasted and smelled like it was made with rancid oil and we threw it out.; I live for pan, this place has some great breakfast, pan, sandwiches, pastries, warm food. Come and eat with them starting at 5:45 AM. Everyone is nice and they sell a variety of candies, chips, cold drinks too. I really like the pan con man tequila, flan.; Great pastries. A bit of a language barrier but that is completely my fault. And they were very sweet in working with me through communication. The donuts and strawberry cheesecake quesito were amazing. There is a $5 minimum for credit cards. Which is understandable I am glad I got more than intended because they were so good!

Name: Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn
Address: A2 Costa Azul, Luquillo, 00773, Puerto Rico
Address Components: Luquillo (locality); Luquillo (administrative_area_level_2); Luquillo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00773 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I loved this place. It was exactly what I had in mind when I thought of a tropical hotel. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff was very friendly.  It was my first time in Puerto Rico, and I plan on going back the next  chance I get. I will definitely stay at the Luquillo Sunrise Beach Inn again.; Loved that I had a beautiful view of the beach. The room was comfortable, and the bed was okay, but not the softest. The service was great. This is a perfect location if you want to get away from the hustle of San Juan and fewer tourists. The attached hotel is great!; I was pleased with my 4-night stay @ Luquillo Sunrise Inn. There are a number of things that I liked about it. It's nice to hear the sound of the ocean from your balcony at night, & to see the beautiful beach sunrise (hence the name.) It feels safe, and the location is a great hub to venture out and explore the beautiful region, or simply enjoy the beach RIGHT THERE, just just a few feet across a narrow street on the seaboard.

The staff was very helpful and friendly, and it is nice that they do offer beach towels, chairs, coffee, & have an on-site ice machine.  I've been to other places that don't offer these essential items, and those are additional costs that you will incur.

I like to have my provisions and own food, and loved having the Amigo Mart very nearby. This is a "real grocery store" that has everything you might need (including adult beverages; beer, wine, liquor) and it is reasonably priced.

Luquillo Sunrise Inn is not some fancy-schmancy bougie resort, but that was not what we were looking, or paying for. Some people may have unlimited funds, and don't really care what things cost, but for those of us who want to have a fun vacation on a reasonable budget at a nice safe place, Luquillo Sunrise Inn deserves two thumbs up, and I recommend it. I am looking forward to coming back.; Very nice hotel to stay. The beach is across the street . It's a very nice place to stay if you want to scape from the daily rush. You will find a lot of places nearby to eat and stay cool.I don't care what other people say. For me is an A+; Perfect location, view, proximity to beaches and walking distance to restaurants. Staff are amazing, especially Dianna. We loved our stay there. The photos are from our balcony. Highly recommend.

Name: Sea Culebra
Address: Cll Romero, Culebra, 00775, Puerto Rico
Address Components: Calle Romero (route); Culebra Pueblo (sublocality_level_1); Culebra (locality); Culebra (administrative_area_level_2); Culebra (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00775 (postal_code)
Reviews:
BEST THING TO DO IN PUERTO RICO!!!!

This is not my first time to Culebra or Culebrita but this is the BEST things to do in Puerto Rico. PERIOD!

Let's say I am an avid traveler and planner but this experience was 8 STARS our of 5 stars for me. So off the chart AMAZING!

My boyfriend and I wanted to do a date in Culebra but we did not expect this level or service and hospitality. Can not be found anywhere else in Puerto Rico (trust me, I looked & tried). Captain Camillo and first mate Danny was such incredible host that we thought we were on our honeymoon (seriously, tooo romantic).

HOW IT WORK:
1. Pre-trip communication was surprisingly detailed and prompt. Will help you with how to get to Culebra. I.E. Ferry tickets. Very accommodating on start time. Camillo gave us great recommendation where I wanted to visit.
2. TRANSPORTATION IS NOT INCLUDED but Camillo went out of his way and picked us up from the airport since we didn't rent a golf-cart so we were very grateful for his kindness. Please don't expect transportation because of this review.
3. Meet up point was in a central area. Easy to find. Right next to the restaurant El Navegante. Have dinner there after your trip.
4. The crew greeted us with a plate of fresh fruits, cheese, and deli meat. So luxurious~
5. Took a short ride to Playa Tortuga in Culebrita where the water was so clear like swimming in a pool. Brought out the Bose speaker to set the mood.
6. We started to float in the water while the crew set up the beach chairs and umbrella for us. They brought the cheese plate, Bose speakers, drinks, and our phones via Kayak to the beach for us! That was so wonderful because last time we had to do it ourselves via Water Taxi. We felt so spoiled.
7. FRESH & HOT lunch! They grilled delicious shrimp and chicken on the boat for us. Paired with an amazing gourmet salad and asparagus. Don't forget to take pictures because it was so romantic. (last time I went on a Catamaran to Culebra, they gave us cold sandwiches) Probably the best meal I had in Culebra.
8. Camillo took us on a adventure via kayak that's included on our trip to the water pool near by. (I had to pay for a snorkeling tour separated last time so this was a definitely worth the money to book with Sea Culebra). Camillo took us on a snorkeling tour and we got to swim with turtles and saw a stingray. We both can't swim but with a life vest, Camillo gave us the confidence to explore these beautiful water.
9. Also included water a SUP board, floaties, kayaks, snorkeling gears and anything you'll need to lounge or exploring. And we LOUNGED!

We will NEVER come back to Culebrita without booking with Sea Culebra again because it cost more and took a lot of time to logistically plan all the activities you should be doing in Culebra. Despite the unforgettable memories we made in Culebrita, we made friends with the crew that made the experience more memorable.

BEST MOMENTS:
1. Made friends with crew
2. Greeted us with fruit platter
3. Fresh, hot lunch
4. Set up camp for us with everything we need (Bose speaker, beach chairs, snacks, drinks, phones, sunscreens, towels, floaties). We literally didn't lift a finger.
5. Included snorkeling and kayak adventure tours lead by Camillo.
6. The passion and love of nature from the crew made us fell in love with Culebrita
7. Allowed us to have quality time with each other

I found them on TripAdvisor but directly booking with them will help small businesses! #smallbusiness; We did a six hour charter with Camilo, and it was fantastic!  He took us to Culebrita, which was gorgeous.  We snorkeled, and kayaked around this beautiful, calm bay.  Camilo set up chairs for us on our own private strip of beach, and then cooked us the best meal we’ve had on Culebra - grilled chicken and shrimp, corn and asparagus, and a delightful and fresh salad.  He is a delightful guy, and great source of info about life on Culebra.  His boat is super comfortable and perfect for day trips  like this.  Highest recommendation!; Captain Camillo and Nester were so cool! The vibe was laid back as we enjoyed one of the most beautiful beaches in the world on Culebrita... for hours my family snorkeled with dozens of turtles and fish... Camillo and Nester even built sandcastles with my 3 year old... Nester is a hell of a cook as well grilled up some burgers chicken and the shrimp was delicious! The boat had the music going while i laid out enjoying the hammock my wife and friends enjoyed their adult beverages ... we all did jumps of the boat into the crystal clear water! Booking process was easy... paypal Camillo a deposit and paid the rest in person and had one of the best days of my life! Thanks so much guys!!!; Words can't describe how beautiful the island of Culebra truly is, it's definitely worth the hype 🥰🌅;

But very quiet, peaceful and private.; Needs some love the place has no pool its been out of service for more than a year . The photos are old it's not in that condition; The road to get to the “resort” is a disaster. It takes forever trying to get to the place because of the number of gaps in the road. 4x4 vehicle required. Although the place at first glance or impression seems spectacular, you find the situation that there is no staff. The green areas are well maintained, but the physical facilities are abandoned. (Especially the reception. There was a swarm of bees on the lobby furniture). You are welcomed upon arrival by countless cats, roosters, chickens, chicks, iguanas, peacocks and even seagulls (if a zoo). The pool is closed until 11:00am. When they start cleaning it, the few maintenance personnel there are. Too bad, it's not what's in the promotional photos.; Costa Bonita in Culebra, PR, is a very beautiful and quiet place. It features a pool and beach access, making it ideal for relaxation. However, the clubhouse is abandoned, parking is a bit complex, and fishing is not allowed on the pier, which is a downside for fishing enthusiasts. Despite these issues, it remains an attractive option for those seeking peace and natural beauty.

Costa Bonita in Culebra, PR is a very nice and quiet place. It has a pool and beach access, making it ideal for relaxing. However, the clubhouse is abandoned, parking is a bit difficult, and fishing is not allowed off the pier, which is a drawback for fishing enthusiasts. Despite these details, it remains an attractive option for those seeking tranquility and natural beauty.

They still require masks for Covid and leave the door LOCKED unless you have one on. They won’t even come tell you why they won’t let you in. Yes there are signs on the doors but  every business where we live has mask signs on their doors from the 2019 Covid pandemic but the ones where we live have moved on and no longer actually require masks. Someone left the store and we tried to enter but the woman working was extremely rude and would only permit one of us to enter. Just really cross and rude, bad communication. They don’t want your money at this business especially if you aren’t a local. We love spending money at local shops and will go get our hundreds of dollars of groceries elsewhere!; The owner of this store is not what some people think she is. She is a HUMAN being like everyone on here and is trying her best to bring income to take care of her family. SHOW some respect, and please understand her guidelines. Her first language is Spanish, NOT English. Some people are so very narrow-minded still. Take the blank in your stupid eyes. Wake up, foolish people. She is doing her best to run the business that was given by her father. I 1000% support her and her family business. Stop being ignorant and show some respect, plus understanding of her guidelines. Not everyone is feeling safe after the pandemic.; The female owner is super grumpy and should not be working with the general public. She is burnt.

They don’t care about your business.

Perhaps they are better to the locals.

* must wear a mask but they will sell you a highly over priced disposable mask for $1.00 and one customer per group only.; I read the reviews before coming here just as others have mentioned.
Brought a mask with me and was pleasantly greeted upon entry. Large, well laid out store with a good island variety. Really appreciated all of the items prices being marked. Paid by card. No issues. Pleasant transaction. I feel sorry for some of the feedback from people who are too proud to respect the owners' guidelines.; I read the reviews before going to this grocery (to where I have gone during my 4 vacation visits of years past).  I brought and wore my mask and used the hand sanitizer just inside the door and got the groceries (good selection, prices marked, and take credit cards) I needed today. I was treated respectfully, just like in any other store. I noticed an elderly person seated behind the counter with a walker near the younger lady (perhaps a family member) checking out my groceries. Maybe they are doing everything they can to help keep her healthy/safe? In my opinion it's their right (store owner's) to ask that customers wear a mask and sanitize their hands. I will be returning here.

My friend and I once came by out there around 10:30, everything was alright and it seemed really relaxing and cool. My problem though was with the service, I felt the other people were not very welcoming and giving us dirty looks simply because of the way we looked. We both felt very uncomfortable and unfairly treated. One of the waitresses served everybody else in our general area except us on several occasions, she eventually did come one time but only with a cold shoulder and no manners. I don’t want to go back again and too expensive for getting shunned by the staff and the clubbers.; They're never open. I first came on a Wednesday night with my girlfriend around 830 and said they didn't open until 9 even tho it shows 8 on Google but they let me in anyway. Had a great time. Good music, good atmosphere. Have tried to go again at least 3 times and every time I go they are closed.

Response to Watra: fair enough. It was a good time but I've been on those days and hours and has been closed. Please update your hours on Google to reflect days and hours you are actually open; This place is lacking good music, and good drinks.
I would not recommend it to anyone.; I was invited to a Southwest airlines event from a friend to watch the bears game, so the bar was open outside of his normal operating hours. The food was catered which is why I have no stars selected for food, however, the bartenders were good at the way they prepare drinks and the atmosphere is very nice! I really love the large dance floor area that they have for those who may not be into sports. I believe they need a couple more TVs for events and this would be a great go-to spot at any time. Parking is limited around the club so be prepared to walk at least a half a block.; The space has the typical flashy lights, small stage, dance floor that can accommodate maybe 50 people or so with the furniture in place and the VIP area that is a mixture of everyone. Went for a birthday party and it wasn’t crowded when we arrived close to 11pm, the music selection was versatile from Too Short to Beyoncé but it still missed the mark somewhere at the beginning but once the DJ was on scene it was better. Interesting and confident crowd, this is a dress comfortably not dress to impress type of establishment.

Name: Zoni Beach
Address: Puerto Rico, Fraile, Culebra 00775, Puerto Rico
Address Components: Fraile (locality); Fraile (administrative_area_level_2); Culebra (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00775 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This beach is the hidden treasure on the island. It's practically empty, with a very large beach in either direction to lounge on. In my opinion, the water was clearer than Flamenco. The waves were not as strong, at least on the day I visited. If you go approximately 50 yards to the left from entrance after parking, you'll find the best area to go out with no rocks to maneuver around and you can walk out pretty far. I regret not bringing snorkel equipment as this is the ideal place to go.

The only drawback was the sand was mixed with some black stone, which caused it to get VERY hot and you couldn't stand barefoot in one area long, so either get in a shady spot, on a towel, or stay in the water!

We went back the next morning for sunrise as it faces to the east. Highly recommend!; Really beautiful and isolated beach, without many tourists.
Please keep in mind that the beach is not organized and there are no bathrooms or any places close to have food/drinks. There are also lots of sharp rocks, but there are clear spots to swim.; One of the most beautiful beaches I've seen. Calm waters, different hues of emerald green and turquoise and shallow for 60 feet. I liked this beach more than Flamenco because it was only a.fee people; Here is the BEST review: Once you get out of parking, you will encounter the palm tree. If you go to the right, you will find the most calm area as you approximate the end of the beach. You will find fishes, rocks and ecosystems. Cons: you will go in the water and find rocks almost everywhere, expect to get bruises. BUT if you go left from the palm tree, you will find more pure water, no rocks , water is less calm, you can expect even turtle’s nests and even deer accessing the beach when there is no people. If you like more adventure, Go LEFT!! More waves too and fun. Expect walking at lest 30ft going left from the tree.; Absolutely my favorite beach in the world! Stunning landscape! Very few people, zero resorts, free to enjoy, only palm trees and water on this beach.  Gahhh, i will dream about this place until i see it again.

Address Components: Culebra (locality); Culebra Pueblo (sublocality_level_1); Culebra (administrative_area_level_2); Culebra (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00775 (postal_code)
Reviews:
5 stars because I had no issue whatsoever with my rental.

Rented a Jeep for the day, shuttle was waiting at the ferry terminal when I arrived. Only the driver is allowed on the shuttle to the rental place. Was in and out in about 30 minutes or so due to a line. Car I had was nice and new. I dropped off my car later on in the day so they were closed but dropping it off after hours is super easy. Had to walk back to the ferry terminal, not a bad walk and quite pleasant. Would recommend and would book again.

Keep in mind that the gas station closes pretty early, or at least it did in my case. So if you rent a vehicle and don’t want to pay for the rental company to fill it up or don’t want to run out of gas and get stuck somewhere, I suggest going early in the day before they close. I think this information should’ve been disclosed.; Great rental company giving it 4 instead of 5 because of the trouble I had with the golf cart. The guys going over the cars are super nice. My first golf cart was smoking/burning and had to return same day. Super nice and switched it out. I decided to stay another day. It rained pretty bad the golf cart just died in the middle of the road because the engine got wet. Luckily their ferry shuttle was right behind me and help move it. Super nice gentlemen, he told me to call him if it didn't turn on. I finally did but there was a beeping noise. I went back to the rental company. Just done with the cart. The nice young lady reassured me that when get wet it makes that sound until it dries. I build up the confidence to drive it back to my hotel. Next time I know to just rent a Jeep especially if your staying more then one day.; Amazing rent a cart,helpful,friendly staff,l wish in the future carlos rent a cart offer half day option .l don’t think is fear that my friend rent a golf cart for a whole day and pay $68 and l rent same cart for 6 hours and l pay same amount, of money in the future hopefully that change .; This was a great experience but I want to add a special thank you to their staff as I had left my wallet in one of their jeeps. I had to take a ferry back to get it but they retrieved it and had it ready for me to pick up with everything still in it! You guys are fabulous! Praying the Lord’s blessing over you all ♥️; Great people, great brand new jeeps, highly highly recommend if youre doing anything more than a day trip.

I didn't realize they served food until I saw the bartender eating  because no one offered us a menu.; On September 17, 2017 my best friend fell to her death outside of this club after being overserved. May she rest in peace 💔; Security was great, that's bout it for me. First it was $40 after 11pm to get in👎🏾, then $11 for a vodka and cranberry in what I believe was an 6-8oz cup👎🏾 and then soooo many tables that you had no space to dance, move, even to take pics. I'm not sure if it was just the timing but they don't allow you out to smoke and re-enter.; I asked for my bill and I paid with a credit card and they brought me a different receipt with a 15% charge for paying with a credit card, and they did not warn you before. They are literally stealing.

Name: Colmado y Carnicería Milka
Address: 8M2X+MX5, Cll Escudero, Culebra, 00775, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Tuesday: 7:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Wednesday: 7:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Thursday: 7:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Friday: 7:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Saturday: 7:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Sunday: 7:00 AM – 1:00 PM
Address Components: 8M2X+MX5 (plus_code); Calle Escudero (route); Culebra (locality); Culebra (administrative_area_level_2); Culebra (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00775 (postal_code)
Reviews:
We needed to re-provision our catamaran during our three-day journey around the Spanish Virgin Islands. We found Colmado Milka via Yelp and decided to give them a try. From our anchorage just offshore, we were able to dinghy to a dock located just 20 yards from the front door of the store. We were there via boat, but it was obvious from the customers in the store that there were many locals as well as tourists staying on the island shopping there.

Colmado Milka is probably one of the best stocked stores in the Virgin Islands. It's not big, but the selection and variety were incredible. Everything we needed was available. The store has a well-stocked beer and liquor section too! There is also a meat department in the back. Check out was easy too, they take credit cards... the hardest part of the shopping trip was hauling everything back to the dinghy. It took three trips on the dinghy to get all the supplies and personnel back to the catamaran.

Colmado Milka was a great find on this trip. Recommend the store whether you find yourself on Culebra by boat or airplane. The store will likely have everything you need.; Nice supermarket which is bigger than expected once you are inside. Prices are a little higher than main land but it cost money to drag all these goods over to the island. I stayed at this great hotel Posada La Hamaca next to the bridge so this super market was a minute walk away to getting waters, chips, juice etc before and after the beach.; A very well stocked general store with good quality fresh produce at decent prices. There is a dinghy dock around the back.
2 large fresh chicken breast $5.40, 1lb of good quality ground beef $5.67, large box of fresh Spinach $5.90
Also has a good selection of diy hardware items.; Whatever you need, they probably have it. Best place to get meat on the island. Nothing has prices on it which is really annoying, but there is a price scanner in the middle of the chaotic shop that you can scan items on.; Wow...wow. From outside looks very small but once inside is big and have a lot of things. The people were also very attentive and prices are not to bad.

Name: Villa Flamenco Beach
Address: Flamenco Beach, Flamenco, Culebra 00775, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Address Components: Puerto Rico (country); Flamenco (locality); Flamenco (administrative_area_level_2); Culebra (administrative_area_level_1); 00775 (postal_code)
Reviews:
We were so lucky to have found this wonderful place! The owner and host, Juan, was super nice and gave us all the information we needed prior our arrival. The house is a little outdated but had everything we needed and just steps away from one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. There were beach chairs and umbrellas available at the house we could use. We were a bit away from the public beach entrance—where they also sell food—so it was never crowded and felt like we had the beach all to ourselves. We did snorkeling near the rocks and saw plenty of fish. We enjoyed our stay and will definitely come back!; I cannot speak highly enough of the owners, Juan and Violeta. They are so warm and welcoming. We ran into an unfortunate emergency, and they were quick to assist and even supplied some extra items when we had to make an unplanned trip to San Juan. Juan checked in multiple times during the situation to see how we were doing. They went above and beyond what was required simply out of the goodness of their hearts.

The location of this place is incredible. Having one of the most beautiful beaches on your doorstep is impossible to beat. The rooms are simple but comfortable and clean, especially when you'll want to spend most of your days on Flamenco Beach. We already are dreaming about the day when we'll get to go back.; Our stay here in culebra was one of the highlights of our 9 days in Puerto Rico. They have amazingly well kept grounds right on the world famous flamenco beach. The villa itself was clean, spacious, had plenty of kitchen supplies and it was very comfortable. The owners are super friendly and want to ensure everyone here has a great experience. We can’t wait to come back!; I highly recommend this place!!!

Fabulous experience, truly a place to disconnect and undwaind. FANTASTIC BEACH!!!

Violeta and Juan are very kind and friendly.

I can't wait to go back...; Cozy and privately beach front setting. Perfect for couples wanting quality time.

Reviews: I go here when I have an urge to dance. It is a great place to go dancing, the atmosphere is great. It focused on Latin music, so if you want to bachata and Cumbia, this is the place for you. Parking can be a hassle but worth it when you find one.; Terrible in all senses, super overpriced FOR DRINKS AND FOOD! Even at capacity they're still charging you the cover. Mind you even when it's about to close. RUDE STAFF. AND WORST THEY MAKE YOU PAY TO CHECK IN YOUR COAT, SWEATER, BLAZER, ANYTHING THATS NOT ATTACHED TO YOUR SKIN. LIKE I THINK IT SHOULD BE YOUR CHOICE IF YOU WANT TO KEEP YOUR CARDIGAN OR WHATEVER ON AS PART OF YOUR OUTFIT. WELL NO. THEYRE TRYING TO GET MONEY FROM EVERYWHERE... NO THANK YOU.!! I WILL NEVER SET FOOT THERE AGAIN!! I RATHER TAKE MY MONEY SOMEWHERE ELSE..; After working whole week ,this place is best to relax and dance and drink and food. Price is reasonable and they welcome u with respect and treat u as ur family. Love this place my all time favorite place in chicago.; The place is good to dance and have a good time anyway if you want a table you have to consume no less than 30 per person that's abuse I don't know if it's the waitress who wants to make more 💰 or it's something from the owner...The thing is that I had already spent more than 50 in the bar without counting my friends; They are very, very strict on dress code. Definitely don’t come with sneakers, or jeans. We got lucky on a Friday night and they let us in... dance floor was fun and full of people dancing. Coat check was 3$ and mandatory so bring some cash. Overall good time, but be sure to dress nice or expect a rude bouncer.

Name: Granero Lounge
Address: 51 Vine St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: Closed; Friday: 11:00 AM – 2:30 AM; Saturday: 11:00 AM – 2:30 AM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 51 (street_number); Vine Street (route); Short North Arts District (neighborhood); Columbus (locality); Franklin County (administrative_area_level_2); Ohio (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 43215 (postal_code)
Reviews:
We went here for fun with friends.. their couch seats is just available if you buy their $200 drink.. restroom needs update and seats too.. it was so dirty that time we went and person who was sitting inside the restroom is a bit off.. anyway just needs more update other than that music was nice and the dj.; Cool and hip spot to have good drinks, mixed with a diverse crowd who are out to have a good time. I’ve participated in one of their Mojitos tasting which pleasantly delivered. Cool and hip staff. Safely secured spot. Street metered parking and near by parking garages; The bartenders are clueless, bored-looking, and unprofessional. First bartender charged me $10 for a single shot of Tito's using a Quick Charge (not POS buttons). 2nd bartender did not know how to make a cake shot, and then charged $9 for it. I asked the 2nd how much a shot of Tito's was to confirm my first charge and he shrugged. Bartender did not know what Disaronno was, had to explain to him it was a type of amaretto, which he then had to look for by name with a phone flashlight. Heard another patron ask for a Bacardi and Coke, bartender said they didn't have Bacardi. Other guest literally pointed to the bottle of Bacardi sitting in plain view. If you're going to be totally clueless at least be friendly, but they weren't. Apathetic at best, annoyed & rude at worst. Bruh.; I bought two shots and got charged $20.40. The bartender was rude to us and we spent 25$ to get in for the event that was going on. We left after that because I asked how much a vodka red bull was and they said 10$, then how did I spend 10$ a piece on just a shot of vodka.

We left and went to a bar down the road with 1$ shots.; Unfortunately I cannot leave 0 stars. I went out with my wife, who happens to be African American, and her cousins, also African American. There wasn't a cover for anyone else in front of us. But when we got to the front, apparently they started charging a cover fee. Pretty convenient since no one in front of us had to pay to get in. The people in front of us that got in were not African American. Do not support this business!

Name: Culebra UTV Rental
Address: Extensión Clark 146, Flamenco, Culebra 00775, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Address Components: Barrio (neighborhood); Flamenco (locality); Culebra (administrative_area_level_2); Culebra (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00775 (postal_code)
Reviews: We were here 7/23/24. We called on the ferry on our way to Culebra and reserved our golf cart. Once we got off the boat they were there to receive us and drove us to their location. When we were finished. One of the lovely ladies rushed us in their golf cart to make sure we made the ferry back to the main island! From start to finish this company was great to spend our money with. Will use again in the future. Thanks again for getting my friend and I back to the ferry right on time before they left!; Would NEVER recommend this rental car place to anyone. We rented this Ford Bronco, and paid $126 for a day, even though we stayed in Vieques for 5 hours, and returned it in that time frame. First of all, the Bronco had the check engine light on, the tires needed air, among other things (shown in picture); the outside of the car it had missing pieces ( shown in photo) and most importantly whenever the car had to be put in reverse or turn it sounded like it was going to break in half. Here comes the fun part, when we returned the car, at first everything was ok, but then comes out the first girl to “check it”…of course we acknowledge that there was sand in the car (it was a beach day), but she said that the sand didn’t matter, then she proceded to “touch” the seats, looked at us and said “they are humid” “we are going to charge you for this” … then she went inside the place to ask the other girl/clerk how much they were going to charge us for this. The second girl, while talking on the phone, answered us screaming, with an attitude, mentioning about the contract we signed, and how they were going to charge us an additional $50. We obviously left the place, without saying anything else to her, and surprise surprise, right after we received the email of them charging us a “cleaning fee”. We are locals, puertoricans, helping other puertoricas with their business, but they will NOT be getting us another time!!!; Easy rental process and a great UTV! We had tons of fun visiting Flamenco Beach and had no issues with the vehicle. We were able to drop it back after hours and they shuttled us back since the staff were closing when we left. Great experience, we’d use this company again! Note that you can get a ride from the ferry - look for their logo. That would have saved us a hot walk if we’d known!; Fast service and friendly staff! Their golf carts were very comfortable, stylish, and new. Rented one with speakers, which made the trip around the island even better. Truly a must have if you want to enjoy the scenic views around Culebra to the maximum!; Had a reservation for a month with the understanding that someone would meet us at pier for the after hours ferry. Everything was already paid for. Not only was there no golf cart at the pier but we took a taxi ride to the rental shop.  there were multiple carts outside but none were ours.  Went back the next day and the lady running the place was extremely rude to us and she took no fault in the mix up. She said I did not answer the phone to confirm my reservation. Therefore they did not feel the need to leave the rental available.   Once we did get the Cart it was the jankiest,  most tore up cart I'd ever seen.  Seriously, go elsewhere.

Reviews:
I've had fun every time I've been here. The only "complaint" I have is the inconvenient bathroom location upstairs but other than that, the music slaps and the vibe is nice. Would recommend buying a ticket online in advance since day-of pricing is higher. Drinks are good and reasonably priced for downtown Chicago. There's a coat check and it's only a few bucks too. Finding free street parking nearby is easy on Kingsbury. Come to Prysm and dance the night away.; Security just plain rude not a fan. The club is smallish and it was packed for Martinez bros after. Not a ton of room but the people were friendly. Good sound and lighting! I would go back but definitely depends on who’s playing.; Very rude and disrespectful staff! I was waiting outside for a friend to come out the bar, with my hazard lights on no less, and the parking guy starting flashing his light at me! I was sitting there for literally less than 5 minutes before he started flickering his flashlight on and off directly at my car. If I had epilepsy he would’ve sent me into an episode; it was very egregious. I explained to him that I was waiting on friend but he just yelled and screamed that I needed to move my car even though I wasn’t blocking anyone from coming in or out the parking lot. I will never come back to this establishment nor will I ever again recommend it to others!; My experience  with this night club but especially  people  who's  look after  the place. I give 5 star review for; the atmosphere, ambiance and bartender.  Big shout out for to the person who is there making  things happen, Row is the RO outside.; overcrowded as fukk. sold twice more tickets than capacity. Other sounds behind the wall louder than the DJ. No place to dance. Flashing lights on right wall causing epilepsy. I had a digital ticket, but they gave me handwrites too)))
Mans restroom visit is American Ninja Challenge.

pros: great screen, nice lasers, NO security

Idk some people at other VIPs didn't have a damn lock on there bottles but as soon as they see that are bottle wasn't locked after the 2nd time coming to our area she locks it back up you guys shouldn't be locking the bottles that is why we paid for them not the suck ass service JUST looks like you don't make money anywhere else that you have to lock it up even though it's already PAID!!!!

Reviews:
Tiny VIP lounge with substandard food choices and quality, nasty Nescafe coffee machine, and no bathroom. If it's not crowded and you need a beer or rum it could be a decent alternative. Staff were friendly at least. Came with Priority Pass and I expect much more in an airport lounge. Funny - they had an offer to pay $5 to pre-book a spot - it's so small, that could be necessary, however, you'd be pretty disappointed if you paid to pre-book a spot here!; A decent lounge. Smaller than expected. I travel quite often and it's nice to go to a lounge, but my experience was nothing special. Nice to get a coffee and refreshment before take off. Do not expect a meal, just light food. Selection was quite limited.

Positives- Had a small kid section and business sections (4 ish seats/cubicals); One of the best lounges we've tried so far. It's a bit more tucked away so it's not as busy as some others. Breakfast was really good and the service is pretty quick. My boyfriend really enjoyed the open bar even with a limited selection. I enjoyed being able to have a couple glasses of wine before having to stay overnight at the airport.; This is a very nice club. People were very nice and the food was pretty good. Nice and clean. A lot of sitting area. Didn’t see if they had a shower, however, one of the better clubs I’ve been too.  Definitely a thumbs up! 👍🏼; Much nicer than many of the reviews I have seen. Service was excellent and all the tables were bussed promptly. A really nice respite in an airport with limited quality food and beverages. Only complaint would be the furniture could use some deep cleaning.

Reviews:
BEST MOJITOS FROZEN! Excellent beach bar. The service was amazing and the food was delicious. Nice beach view, live music, cleaning and Everything was great. Can't wait to go back!!!; Came here while exploring a few different spots in piñones. Always on the hunt for some good carrucho.

Unfortunately, they did not have carrucho to offer at the time, and upon peaking at the qr menu prices... we hightailed it out of there😅.

Looked like a cool place with nice views but even on easter week it was pretty empty. I found the menu a bit limited and prices high.

Only open fri-sun from what it showed. Maybe next time.; I visited this place back in 2020; and it was very good. I went it today and it hasn’t changed. It seems to be owned by a guy from the US which he even clean our table and was very kindness. The host was very helpful ( sorry I forgot your name). Beers very cold; but What I want to recommend is the food. Please try the “Gouda Cheese Potizers” ( Croquetas de Queso Gouda). Those are out of this world with the Mayo-Ketchup sauce. The wings are big, juicy and delicious try it with the fried plantain sticks with the house chimichurri. You won’t be disappointed! The place, bathrooms and parking, clean. The Atlantic Ocean view…incredible. Also no lousy music or bad smell like the Piñones places.; A good Stop and go bar.

This place has a great view, beach side and good location.

Food selection is very limited. Only fried food, ceviche and ribs. This is a great place to have a couple of drinks an appitizer and leave. Also the food is a bit overpriced compared to other restaurants in the area.

Overall  4.1 out of 5; THE BEST!  It has everything - great food (we tried a sampler of all kinds of things), fabulous drinks (mojitos and vodka soursops were incredible!), and amazing views!!!

Reviews: Sat here a few times during our stay. Limited hours but great experience. The bartender, Keith made it for us. Best off-the-menu drinks ever. We were feeling spicy margs and he whipped up the best ever, coming from some people who work at bars. Keith is 10/10, wish there was more Keith’s in PR; Very quick and friendly service. You don't need a reservation if you're sitting up at the bar. First place we found in Puerto Rico that had Fernet Branca and Absolut!; Good grief, if you are interested in cocktails or craft cocktails, this is the venue for you. The bar does not make any craft juices but Jose Ortega (21 years of experience in the bartending world) is well renowned bartender. Average price per drink is ~$20 but worth every penny.; I was excited to eat here given then vibe and live band.  I was however highly disappointed!  The service was poor. It took a long time to get drinks and nearly 40 minutes to get a sushi role. I understand 4 people called in sick but communication was not clear.  I would recommend only going there for a cocktail and maybe an appetizer but don't count on it being your dinner; Service is pretty slow, but the place is constantly packed so it makes sense. Regardless they should do something to address this, as it has been a problem for years. Hire more servers on the weekends. Those poor guys need help.

Reviews: If you’re looking for a cool place to hang anytime off day, this cute 24-hour bar is the right place to check out. I can’t comment on the food, but the drinks are cheap AND tasty! The best thing about this place is the staff. We were waiting for our flights out and found this place on Google maps. It’s LGBTQ+ friendly and everyone is welcome! We had such a great time chatting with our bartender and enjoying our drinks. This is definitely a good place to stop by.; I love 101! Been going here on and off for years! Very chill spot with great drinks and friendly patrons and staff. Haven't had the food yet. So there's the bar area and then a separate area with games like darts, connect 4, chess, and video games. Big open windows so you get air. The beach is just a few blocks away and this is at just about the end of isla verde. Oh the almost forget the best part... it's 24 hours 😍🥳🍻🎉💃🏽; Best bar in PR, great staff, awesome drinks and service. Last but not least really cool people. Open 24 hrs!!!; Great dive bar in Isla Verde, cool bartender Kemley (hope spelled right) served cold beer and had a pleasant talk. Will be back again to try their pizza. Highly recommended...; Wonderful spot, right next to the airport. Awesome staff. Convenient location. Loved it.

Reviews: If they would have an IMAX in this theater it would easily be a 5 stars. But is old and little out-dated. Thing is service in this one is good and fast. Don’t need a big arcade room because the mall already has one. But solid theater to watch a movie.; On Saturday they open before 2pm, prices are a little cheaper although they do have good prices.  The cinema is clean, comfortable and has new movies showing and coming soon also.  They open during the week at 4pm.; Excellent service, great manager. We were at a private event, early in the morning. Good for activities.; 3rd times a charm.; I went there with my father since I was a kid. And it was always a great time. Services are great compared to other movie theaters. Probably the best of all others in Puerto Rico. Even after Hurricane Maria passed, despite the ceilings to be a little bit messed up, is still safe. And they keep improving each passing year. It's a theater you must go at least once in a lifetime!

Address Components: 5 (street_number); Calle Saldaña (route); Rio Piedras (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Río Piedras Antiguo (administrative_area_level_3); Pueblo (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00925 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Not a bar person but while in PR on another solo trip I wanted to hear some live music 🎶 so I came across some reviews and decided to check out this place .

I enjoyed the atmosphere of a cheerful and respectful crowd, I’m not a crowd person but I tend to blend in here and there….Lol

Nice art vendors out and people enjoying themselves, mingling with one another and dancing with one another. Very chill seemed like your regular locals since this was also near the University.

I road my scooter 🛴 on a 45 min night ride to this place….. I was adventurous, it was raining on and off , made it just in time for the last set from the musicians. It was nice and I always appreciate the talent musicians share, big or small.

Would like to see the place during the day and no rain ☔️ but my night adventure was perfect . The staff and people were friendly and even the crowd was friendly. Loved it 🥰

I know they have other musicians that play there, but I wasn’t down in PR that long to see the ones I was interested in but I was well pleased the night I went . July 2023…… sorry I’m late writing a review 🥸

I enjoyed some of the art displayed at this place, some art not all of it was to raw for me….. lol ( hint-hint) but I came for the music 😉 and was outside .

For live music 🎶 I would recommend coming here. Thanks El Boricua for the memories
🇵🇷🥰🎶🛴☔️; We went there for live pleno music, it was amazing. The crowd was young and lively.; Neighborhood spot, live music, great drinks. The entire community comes alive with the music and dancing.; Great ambience Puerto Rico’s fines musicians, Monday “plena” nite is the best; Live music and $2.50 medallas. Heaven on earth.

Reviews: This place is so cool! I don't smoke but they have a bar and it's very nice. Great staff too. I will definitely come back here. If you're a pothead you'll love this place! 😆 they have vapes too. So when you go up the stairs there's an outdoor area that's smoke free. Beyond that there's a door that leads to an air-conditioned area. That's where the store is. They sell hookahs, bowls, and a lot more. They place is beautifully decorated in a fun instagram worthy style. This is definitely a great spot!; This place is a gem. Nice atmosphere. Food was delicious. Great customer service. Very interactive with customers. Good conversations. Great views. Definitely check this place out if you are visiting.; If i could give this place a ZERO i would. After coming off of an 8am flight, this was the first smoke shop we found through research and because the reviews were well we decided to check it out. There were by-standards posted on the balcony(couldn’t tell if they worked there or not, i’m guessing not because they failed to acknowledge the presence of customers.) while walking towards the inner doors where music seemed to be playing, a short an aggressive woman quickly flung open the door “how can I help you.” No greeting, as if she was disgusted by our presence. After asking whether she sold pre-rolls she continued to aggressively explain that if we don’t have a license then we are not welcome in her business. We were completely thrown off by her arrogance and aggression. I proceeded to say that she didn’t have to be rude with her information and she demanded we left, and we did.; OMG I visit Puerto Rico a few times a year to do massages and spa day getaways for Somar wellness Spa.  Close by the beach i found this gem!! It’s overlooking the beach and has such great IG themes for picture taking. So universal from, hookah, drinks and even Dj on wknds. Who was the Dj ?? this wknd-?? he was best Dj I ever heard to his thing. Highly recommend and I will be back. 5 star I give y’all!!!; The food and drinks are great. Cool atmosphere and very friendly staff. Oean view is perfect. Defenetly going back!!
