Address Components: 1265 (street_number); Calle Marginal Villamar (route); Cangrejo Arriba (sublocality_level_1); Carolina (locality); Cangrejo Arriba (administrative_area_level_2); Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00979 (postal_code)
Reviews:
My new favorite speakeasy.  The bartender and cocktail 🍸 expert Evert gave us a magical experience. Since we enter to the place.

He gave us a recommendation for the entrance.  Prepare a delicious drinks, show us the whole place.  But the food was amazing with great flavors and a good portion.

Highly recommended for any tourist or local. D
For sure will be back soon.

They offer a membership for another club experience. So you can take your cigar and drinks in a private environment.; I recently visited a hidden gem of a speakeasy, and I was blown away by the experience! The atmosphere was both cozy and vibrant, perfectly capturing the essence of the prohibition era. As soon as we walked in, we were greeted by friendly staff who made us feel right at home.

Now, let’s talk about the food—absolutely fantastic! Each dish was beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. From the appetizers to the main courses, it was clear that the chefs take great pride in their craft. The menu had a delightful mix of classic and innovative dishes, making it hard to choose what to order.

What really stood out was the service. Our server was attentive without being intrusive, offering great recommendations and ensuring our glasses were never empty. It's rare to find such a perfect balance, and it truly enhanced our dining experience.

Overall, this speakeasy is a must-visit for anyone looking for a unique night out filled with delicious food and exceptional service. I can't wait to go back!; Vagabundo Social is a hidden gem that exudes a cool, sexy vibe from the moment you step in. The ambiance is captivating with multiple rooms that each offer a unique experience. The cocktail menu is impressive, featuring a delightful selection that caters to various tastes. I loved the intimate setting and the attention to detail in every aspect. Whether you're looking for a night out with friends or a romantic evening, Vagabundo Social is a must-visit destination. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a memorable and sophisticated lounge experience.
Additionally, it is a fantastic venue for events and parties. I had the pleasure of attending a network event here and was thoroughly impressed. The ambiance, cocktails, and overall vibe make it a perfect choice for hosting memorable gatherings.; Wow! I can not Recommend MORE if in Puerto Rico YOU MUST experience the Atmosphere.. The Food Skillful prepared amazing food.; This place is phenomenal.  The food and drinks and atmosphere are incredible.  Even their vegan dish was out of this world.  Every cocktail was well balanced and unique

Reviews:
This place is incredible. It reminds me of being in Manhattan New York City absolutely spectacular environment beautiful awesome drinks and food. The music is the best.
Is the only place that offers life quality music almost every night!
If you are anywhere in the East Coast in Puerto Rico you gotta stop at Palmas Del Mar and visit Norberto’s; Great & romantic place  ♡♡ , Beautiful set up (almost like Scarface)Nice to have a couple of drinks, and enjoy life music on Fridays and Saturdays 8:30 -10:30 p.m. They have happy hours on Sundays and  brunch with reservations.  Also, for residents  of Palmas, they have transportation available (pick-up and drop off *on golf cart); The Sunday afternoon tea was incredible! The tower of delights was just that - delightful. The top tier had assorted treats, and we were given several options for the scone and sandwich tiers. In addition to the tea, we also ordered mimosas. The delicious food and drinks would have been enough, but the owners went above and beyond to create magical experience. I can't recommend this place enough!; Norberto’s is a much needed addition to Palmanova. A place where you can go & dine & enjoy great food & amazing cocktails or just have an after dinner drink. The host & staff are professional and attentive. The owners are hands on with obvious experience in operations. Offering a wide array of great cuisine & cocktails, you won’t be disappointed with their choice of ambiance thru their eclectic furnishings and diverse music. They are warm & welcoming & hope to offer you a place to kick back, enjoy the place & each other in a relaxed atmosphere. Ivd visited more than once and will certainly visit again. With open mic Thursdays, fine piano on Weekends and considering “Salsa Sundays” it’s a place you simply have to check out. I would describe Norberto’s as “a touch of class”….you be the judge 🥰‼️; I’ve been here multiple times over the past few months and each time have had a wonderful experience! The staff are so friendly and the food and cocktails are delicious. With trivia nights, karaoke and music, the atmosphere is always so enjoyable. Such a fabulous addition to Palmas and the plaza!! Thank you!

Reviews:
The location is nice and the staff are absolutely lovely. Sadly the food is not. The only thing worth ordering is the mofongo. The grilled calamari was rubbery and the Mahi Mahi bites were over so overbreaded and over fried we couldn’t even taste the fish. The side of veggies was okay and the chocolate cake was very good. The Bloody Mary was just fresh tomato juice and vodka 😅..; Tapas at The Pool Club offers an exceptional dining experience with a unique fusion of French and Puerto Rican cuisine.

Their paella is outstanding and a must-try.

The staff, especially Elisabeth, are friendly and welcoming. A five-star experience for anyone looking for culinary creativity and great service.

Simple, casual, you will not be disappointed.; Beautiful ocean view &access!!
Good burgers and chicken wings 😋  Excellent flavors
Good service!!; Service with slow, it's a very small restaurant. Not more than 50 people, they can't handle the capacity. The food that I ordered especially the steak. When I asked well done, it came pink and bloody absolutely disgusting. The worker's try to help as much as possible. The manager is an a******. Overall disliked; This restaurant is not allowing people to eat there or order take out because they want everyone to show proof of vaccination according to “Puerto Rican COVID guidelines” which is no where in any mandate by the government. I was told to show proof of vaccination when I wanted to order and I told the lady I was ordering to go and I was given attitude as she told me in Spanish “it doesn’t matter I still want your vaccine certification”. Which according to this restaurant guidelines which they sent out a notice that they will not serve any unvaccinated individuals for dine in according to the PR government guidelines which is a lie, and now the employees have taken it upon themselves to not serve anyone wether they’re eating in or taking out if they’re not vaccinated which is against what was sent in a memo from the restaurant themselves and ALSO not in line with government mandates or recommendations. So if you don’t want to serve me due to YOUR OWN wishes then so be it, but give me attitude because I told you I was eating out and I do not need a vaccine certification for that according to your own rules is a different story and definitely don’t tell me you’re following government guidelines because you’re also lying. That is absolutely horrible service. Enjoy losing a regular costumer.

Name: Palmas Athletic Club at Palmas del Mar
Address: 1 Country Club Dr, Humacao, 00791, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:30 AM – 5:30 PM; Tuesday: 6:30 AM – 5:30 PM; Wednesday: 6:30 AM – 5:30 PM; Thursday: 6:30 AM – 5:30 PM; Friday: 6:30 AM – 5:30 PM; Saturday: 6:30 AM – 5:30 PM; Sunday: 6:30 AM – 5:30 PM
Address Components: 1 (street_number); Country Club Drive (route); Humacao (locality); Candelero Abajo (administrative_area_level_2); Humacao (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00791 (postal_code)
Reviews:
If I could give more stars, I would!! I have played several courses in PR and this club is by far my favorite!! Didn't get to play the Flamboyan course yet but the Palms course was absolutely beautiful!! The course is so well taken care of. Fairways and greens were in immaculate shape. The Palm side is the first course they built and is not as challenging as Flamboyan. However for the average golfer, I feel this course is perfect. Plenty of wide fairways with beautiful rolling hills, surrounded by absolutely beautiful scenery. There is plenty of challenges that make your round so much fun. It has its share of big fairway and greenside bunkers as well as some beautiful, long, dog-leg par 5s. There are just the right amount of water hazards too. The property is absolutely stunning and very well maintained. The pro shop staff, the cart staff, and the rangers were all assets to this country club! All were friendly, courteous, and informative. They looked after our every need and made our visit that much more enjoyable. It's the little things that make a big difference in customer service and here they hit all the point and think of everything.
Can't wait to come back and hopefully it will be a longer stay next time. If you are looking for a top notch country club and a beautiful golf course while you are in PR then try Palmas Athletic Club, you will not be disappointed!; Palmas Athletic Club is a nice facility to enjoy lounging near the pool or grabbing a meal.; It is definitely the best Golf Course of Puerto Rico! Service and Food is Paramount to them!; The new golf pro is highly unprofessional. I have been a member of the Palmas Athletic Club for over four years and have been going to the golf club hitting range every Sunday. I was just now informed that golf clubs will no longer be lent out because others were supposedly using them in an unruly fashion. This decision was made solely by this new pro and I do not understand why the actions of a few can prevent me, a years-long member that has paid over $5,000 and counting to this organization, from using golf clubs at the hitting range.; It's a good solid course that's $150 before 1pm and $90 for twilight if you're staying at a local resort. That also includes range balls and a gps cart.

The guys at the cart barn and the woman in the pro shop were super cool and your name will be listed on your cart.

As for the course; the greens were super quick and I had to putt a 15 footer like it was 8-10 feet.  And although the greens were smooth they weren't lush and spongy but rather dry and slick.  It's like they needed to be over seeded. Take time on the practice green to get the speed.  Also the ball doesn't rip back on wedge shots but will check up while chipping around the greens.

Playing from the tips (Flamboyan course) you'll need at least a 250 yard carry, but if a slice is your miss I suggest you move up a tee box because going right is no bueno on 3,5,6,7,10, 11, 14 and 18.

Would I play it again? Absolutely! Nice views, friendly people and it's not an overly difficult golf course as long as you don't go way right.

Reviews:
They are renovating the offices so check in was a little tricky. We tried an activity (a nature walk on the pterocarpus park) but found out that it was not as organized as we would like.
However the shuttle drivers and the other staff have been exceedingly friendly and helpful; The place itself wasn't bad, sade secure.  There was water in my kitchen area that most likely was left from the cleaning people.  I had to reach out two times to get someone out.  Javier was great 👍.  The front desk was good.  But the area not good at all.  If you are planning to eat dinner make sure you do it before 7pm because everything around that area closes at 8pm that's crazy to me.  Most people that go to vacation in PR don't eat at 7pm.  Nothing around to pick and eat unless you want chain fast foods. It was a turn off for us.  The room itself property was nice.; 🤢BED BUGS 🤢Im so disgusted I got horrible bites on my neck and arm that were so painful and swollen from staying here. They have BED BUGS dont stay here an its hours away from attractions. When trying to go to our room they took us to the wrong room, then at the right room there was someone already in it. Then they gave us a room with bed bugs.; Nice location. Weather was very nice in January. 2 pools one with swim up ba; Rooms were being renovated..ours wasn't.   The layout was very comfortable and ADA compliant.   We enjoyed our week here..  the resort had many amenities.

Reviews: Love the people, drinks, and had good fish tacos. Atmosphere is great if you love to be outdoors; Service was terrible by server Kristal L. We arrived and the bartender told us to have a seat and a server would be with us.  15+ minutes later we asked the bartender if we should give him our order, so he took it.  I ordered a gluten free pizza (and said the GF part twice).  Then 5 minutes later Kristal came over and took the order again.  We again said the Gluten Free part twice and also ordered fries.  The food took forever (note: there were 6 other people here and didn't look like they were eating anyway).  The food arrived and we had no napkins, silverware, plates etc.  She dropped off the food and that was it.  Every visit back to us took a long time and we wouldn't receive everything we asked for.  She would completely disappear unless I asked the bartender for her.  The pizza took a long time to cool and when it finally did, I took a bite and realized it was NOT gluten free (mind you we had now stated this 4 times).  Since Kristal never came to check on us I asked the bartender for her.  She came and I said "this doesn't look GF" and she said "oh it's not".  Good Lord, another 30 minutes later we got the correct pizza and left.; Mr. Jose Navarro is wonderful! He is provides great service! Highly recommend!; Great place to grab a drink poolside. It is resort style pool menu along with prices. They do make fresh brick oven pizzas and smelled great. Will have to try. There is music and also a DJ on certain days. The area has plenty of seating areas around the pool and also swim up bar. Tables are available along with lounge chair.  Showers and bathrooms are nearby.  There is also some hammocks to enjoy.  The beach is down the path about 3 minute walk.; Great Pool Bar at the Wyndham in Palmas. Staff if awsome.

Reviews:
Truly such a fun environment! The owner is wonderful and let us stay later for karaoke and served us so well! We had the most fun time and would HIGHLY recommend their food! It was unreal!! Even being super understaffed, they all had big smiles on their faces and served us so well! Will definitely be going back!!; Would HIGHLY recommend Zócalo. All the food is incredible, drinks are delicious, atmosphere is so fun and the owner and his workers go above and beyond to give you the best. We are here visiting from Alabama and this has been our favorite spot on our trip so far! We had a big party eating and Jonathan, the owner was wonderful. He has such a kind heart and makes sure his customers are taken care of. Yolanda was the bar tender and she was so kind and makes phenomenal drinks. If you are in Humaco GO HERE!!; The service is very slow so keep that in mind before you go because they are short staffed.
But overall we had the best night at this restaurant. Good food (I had the burrito and it was huge and good). The owner Johnathan loves people and loves his job and it’s so evident through this place. We kareoked all night and we will definitely be back. One of our funnest nights so far!; I came to PR for the first time and this was the best place and experience on the island. The best food was served but most importantly the customer service was the best of the best. You truly will not find a better experience and I highly recommend everyone giving it a shot. Between the owner as well as the bar tender , you couldn’t find better people to run the business. Don’t go to PR without getting to El Zocalo.; While visiting Puerto Rico for the first time, this was a hidden gem.  Great food and music.  Awesome atmosphere.  Did I mention the food?!  The staff was friendly and service oriented.  …oh, and the food!!! YUM!  So glad we ate here.  More than 5 stars!!

All key services are available, including a club house with a laundry room, an outdoor pool bar and restaurant, and golf. It's located in a beautiful gated resort community. We stayed for 3 nights and we met nice neighbors there who stayed for a long term as well.

However the people at the service line speak B1/B2 English which is fine but might be a concern to some tourists

The electricity is wack though- the lights constantly flicker, same with lamps when plugged in, toaster randomly stops working, but other than that it’s fine; Resort Lifestyle, beach club, golf, back horse riding, marine, tennis course, spa, pools.

Atmosphere was chill and fun. Thank you!; One of our favorite places in PR. Amazing food with attentive service. The cafe is really cute with a menu focused on high quality coffee drinks, sweet & savory waffle creations, and sandwiches.

We got the New York (waffle with bacon + eggs), French toast (toast was chewy and not too sweet, comes with bacon + eggs), Over the Sea (waffle with smoked salmon + cream cheese), and a fruit with chocolate waffle. Their chai iced lattes and iced coffees are also good. Get them with whipped cream!; This breakfast was an experience ! The food was excellent, the owners were pleasant. They recommended ‘over the seas’ the waffle pictured below has smoked salmon, cream cheese, onions, and honey. I haven’t had anything like it ! Will definitely be coming back.; Clean establishment and good service...just (I wish) little more knowledge can put them higher then their competitors. Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: Humacao (locality); Collores (administrative_area_level_2); Humacao (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00791 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Food was delicious and atmosphere was shabby rustic.  The service was great but not too welcoming.  I think we will be back but we had to leave because we couldn't find that they had a bathroom.  To be fair, we didn't ask because they were busy and it was pouring down rain.  The food was so pretty we forgot to take photos!; Delicious cappuccinos and equally delicious and fresh home made cakes :)

Came back again! Such warm, friendly people. This time had a ham and cheese sandwich and a corn bread/cake that they served warm. Both delicious!!; My family and I are visiting PR for the first time and, as mostly vegetarians, it’s hard to get something that all of us enjoy. But wow, what a gem. The coffee was delicious - be sure to get it with whipped cream on top! We ordered a breakfast sandwich with eggs and cheese and it was amazing. The lady also took the time to explain the different baked goods and how they are made. We took one of coco flour filled with guava and one of almond flour filled with guava. Both were scrumptious - we were fighting for the crumbs! Thank you for such a lovely experience, we will definitely be back!!; Coffee is amazing.
Place is clean.
It’s an authentic place.; I don't have a photo of what I ate because the breakfast was so good that I ate it before I remembered to take a photo. I highly recommend this place. Oh yes, here you can enjoy an amazing view of El Yunque while eating outside. A true family business. Kind, flavourful, delicious, homey.

Name: Wyndham Palmas Beach and Golf Boutique Resort
Address: 170 Candelero Dr, Humacao, 00791, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Open 24 hours; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours
Address Components: 170 (street_number); Candelero Drive (route); Humacao (locality); Candelero Abajo (administrative_area_level_2); Humacao (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00791 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Beautiful place and good rooms beach isn't that swimmable lots of seaweed but lots of activities to do on  and around the property. However when I arrived at check in time I was told to wait for a room waited about 2 hours for a room when I arrived to the room given it was still being cleaned went back told the guy and he apologized and held are bags in the back for us so we could explore around and when we came back to get our room he gave us free meal vouchers and told me he would be giving me 5,000 points to my account. I stayed at this property on 07/28/2024-07/29/2024 I still have not received the points promised and have tried calling the property and they never respond.; The place is really beautiful. Staying here will really put you in the beach/tropical vacation mood. The lobby has smoothing and jazzy music to make a really calm atmosphere. The ballrooms are spectacular. My church hosted an event here in which we were able to have 700 people. The bathrooms are SO nice and clean. I love this hotel; I really enjoyed my nine nights here! The pools are amazing, the rooms are modern, and the staff was superb!!  Carlos and Shirley at the front desk were very helpful. Kayla at the pool was a gem, and Jayson Santos, the general service manager, went above and beyond. The staff really made the stay exceptional.; The hotel's proximity to the beach and the quality of the pools were highlights of my stay.

However, I would like to share some feedback regarding a few aspects that did not meet my expectations. As a Diamond member, I excepted a better treatment, at the very least, a room in better condition. Unfortunately, the phone in my room was non-functional, and both the bathtub and sink lacked drain protection. Additionally, there were no water bottles provided in the room, requiring us to refill them in an area that was not well-maintained and had an unpleasant odor. The towels also appeared to be overused, as their texture was not as soft as I would have expected. The balcony door didn’t lock properly, which left the room unsecured. Lastly, I was surprised by the parking fee of $15 per night, which I may have overlooked on the website.; Since the moment we got here it was desolate and there was no one to help or give any direction, when checking in we were told we would have to wait for our room since they have no systems working (whatever that means) after waiting we finally got the room and off we went with all of our luggage only to find that there are no elevators at this hotel and we got a room with a great view of the front entrance from our balcony. The room was extremely cold and after a long day I was looking forward to a hot bath but what I got was a bathtub that looks so old and dirty and that I can’t fill up, oh! And also there’s no hot water!!! After calling the front desk we were told that the water heater was not working and there was no estimate for it to be fixed and also some rooms have bathtubs you can fill but this one doesn’t so just deal with it. At that point I was already pissed and when I woke up next morning to find that there was still no hot water and that now I have to walk around with my card because they have no system and can’t charge anything to the room.

Edit: I changed it to 3 stars just because the staff and service were really good. The manager Jason reached out and went above and beyond to make our stay more comfortable, he was great. The system never worked during our stay though and water was never really hot just a bit warm, I’m not sure if that’s just as hot as the water gets or if it will be fixed. All in all the manager and staff along with the great pools managed to turn everything around for us. I will say the food was average and sometimes plain inedible and highly overpriced.  I will say in my opinion the issues are not due to the manager or staff and I believe is Wyndham who is responsible for how poorly their resorts perform and they have been going downhill for a year now, they clearly have no care for the people choosing to stay in their hotels.

Emilio; Good lil' chinchorro, cold beers, great drinks, good prices, and the bartender took great care of us. Good place to stop for a quick drink!; Fun place to grab a drink, great harbor views. Local dive bar  🍻; Looking for a late-night spot for some beers and good vibes? Look no further than Chinchorro de J. We heard about this spot from a server where we had dinner and decided to check it out. The place did not disappoint - the drinks were cheap and the people were friendly. Although it's cash-only, this made for quick service, so we didn't have to wait long for our drinks. And the view from the place was great. But the highlight of the night was the karaoke - it started late night and was a big hit with everyone. If you're in the area and looking for a fun and affordable late-night spot, be sure to check out Chinchorro de J.

The ambience is very nice with AC, no mosquitoes and exceptionally service. There’s several eateries with pizza, Mexican, juice bar, Criollo, and sweets. The hours of the cafes vary but there always seems to be 2 or 3 open. The crowd is varied but leans towards 50+ with many retired couples.

No Sprite or 7up; Chicken Skewers were very tasty and not dry, the BBQ sauce was not very strong, if you order with pique be prepared because it is quite spicy but with a very good flavor. The natural juice of delicious passion fruit and acerola.

Reviews: 6 Medalla lights for 9 dollars. Need I say more. Take in the ocean. Have fun and have a few drinks before dinner there or somewhere else close by. View is from where we were sitting on the sidewalk. Bar across street has direct ocean views.; El Cariduro Sport Bar in Fajardo, Puerto Rico, is an absolute gem! The service is incredibly friendly, the beer is refreshingly cold, and the prices are unbeatable. Plus, the food is delicious, offering a perfect blend of flavors to tantalize your taste buds. And let's not forget the breathtaking view overlooking the beach, adding to the overall ambiance. Whether you're a local or just passing through, a visit to El Cariduro Sport Bar is a must for anyone looking for an unforgettable experience in Fajardo. Five stars all the way!; Service, food and people were great. The sampler was amazing and tacos too. Drinks are super cheap. They need more tables, only three tables available. Tourist, understand this is a place were locals hangout and is not fancy at all. They will be listening to music, playing pool and  having fun, but they wont mess with you. Great place!!!; made a short little stop here and ordered the empanadillas. Food was fresh and flavorful.; A HIDDEN GEM!!! The food was amazing!!!  The steak tacos are the best I have EVER had!!!  My wife loved the fish nuggets!  Ice cold beer, great drinks, and friendly service. They treated us like we were locals!!!

We did not try the food.; Cozy, unique, excellent for cigar and jazz. Service poor because a short staff. The upstairs bar wasn't staffed and the
only 3 servers had to take care of 2 floors crowded with customers. Could have made bigger proffitt.with.my.group if had better and quicker service. Waiters had to.run to the first floor to get drinks to the 3rd.floor. Think about it manager. Tapas were great!; We were close by and it was our anniversary. We enjoyed wonderful live music and had amazing drinks! Would recommend; The food was great, cocktails were divine and music amazing! Had the opportunity to listen to a live jazz show this past friday. This is my second time, and I will definitely be back soon. Love the chorizo and shrimp batata hash for brunch!🤩; We went to the C Note to enjoy the live band. We did not eat anything, so I am unable to rate the food. The atmosphere is upbeat and so much fun! The band was excellent! The only sad thing was the band announced they were going to take a 20 minute break; we waited 35 minutes in which the band still hadn't returned so we decided to leave. That was a bit of a bummer. I'd still go back since they do offer different bands each night; Thursday thru Sunday.

Reviews:
Facilities were great. However, parking was not flexible enough even though we notified the amount of adults and cars included in our stay. Infinity pool was nice but not clean enough (specifically the hot tub) even though we were the first ones there that day. Overall, enjoyed our stay.; Exceptional!!! We have stayed there several times, and every time, we honestly don't want to leave. It's like being in the center of it all!
The marinas with the Catamaran tours, Bioluminece Bay, Icacos, Seven Seas Beach. Near to shops, it's located on the Gastronomical route with so many restaurants to choose from. The expresso coffee at local Bakery is amazing!  Also, you will be near 10 to 15 minutes from Luquillo Beach & El Yunque tropical rainforest. Apartments I have stayed at are number #608 with a Nautical Theme & #506 with an Atlantis theme!; The place and surrounding areas are espectacular. However this Airbnb needs attention. It’s drab and tired. Place is spacious and ACs work well. However there is NO AC in the living room kitchen and dining area. That was a bad experience getting there. The apartment was too hot and it took more than 3 hr to feel some fresh in the place. Walls, bathrooms, rooms are outdated. Door lock doesn’t feel safe as it is about to break down. Coffee mugs are chipped and there only a few utensils to eat. All appliances worked well.
Sliding doors to the balcony need your muscles to get them to open. Balcony view is stunning 😍
Pls fix this apartment. Exhaust fans at both bathrooms are breaking down too. You are pushing it when it comes to maintenance of this place
Pool and other facilities are great. Safety at the gate is awesome although gate guards need a customer service training or at least learn how to be nice.

It’s a place I would come back; We had an absolutely fantastic time at Casa Luz! The accommodations were not only comfortable but also beautifully decorated, creating a cozy and inviting atmosphere. The attention to detail really stood out, and the location was ideal, offering both a peaceful retreat and easy access to nearby attractions. The management went above and beyond to ensure that our stay was memorable, and the place had everything we needed. We would highly recommend Casa Luz to anyone seeking a wonderful getaway experience.; Excellent accommodations. Lovely condo set up. Ocean View on balcony. Yacht yard as well. Calm, peaceful & relaxing. Security well maintained. Grounds are taking care of. Pool accessible. Not far from Luquillo Beach.

Name: Lions Club Fajardo
Address: Fajardo 00738, Puerto Rico
Address Components: Puerto Rico (country); Cabezas (administrative_area_level_2); Fajardo (administrative_area_level_1); 00738 (postal_code)
Reviews: I rented the center for activities. The contract indicated that it was no later than 12 at night and at nine o'clock the manager was in the area without authorization. He entered the activities and turned off the air and the fans and began to open the windows just barely. It was nine o'clock at night, failing to comply with the contract, I find that an amount of money was paid so that the people in charge would respect said activities. We had not even left the center and the gentleman closed the main door. The lack of inconsideration and ethics was not there, but to collect, yes. They are fast, we had a very bad time. Reviews: Spectacular view, great maintenance, very friendly personnel; Nice gated condo complex  on east end of island in Fajardo nice views; It was a nice condo in a good location. They have 24-hour security and a gate that must be used for entrance and exit. The pool is very big and there is a hot tub and a covered area with tables to sit at and restrooms. You will need wristbands to get in or out of the pool area. The location is very good if you are going to the islands off the east coast or if you are planning to hike in El Yunque . It is about 45 minutes from the airport, an hour from Old San Juan, or an hour and 10 from Casa Bacardi. It is right by Laguna Grande (one of the Bio Bays) and there are great beaches within 5 minutes.; This is not a Resort o Vacation Condo. Minimum Rentals are 6 Months. The location is not far from the beach and will amaze you with its  deliciousness. The prices are just right for a quick stop for food and drink. The food is made with love and care, especially the fired plantains, fried chicken, and pork. Definitely recommend this spot 👌; A must visit. The owner is very welcoming and makes you feel like family. Live next door and it’s such a treasure to have them as a neighbor. Breakfast, lunch or dinner you can’t go wrong. And if you need a place to unwind after work this is the place to go!!; Ordered two sandwiches if I had known it would take an hour I would have left then. Address: 97J8+83W, Luquillo, 00773, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Thursday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM

Reviews: Terrible experience. Staff locked the bathroom door and induced a panic attack. Was a joke to them. Illegal locks are being used. Don't ever go there. I am a paying customer. I shouldn't have to go through this. It took them 20 minutes to acknowledge the situation. Meanwhile they were playing pool and enjoying themselves.; Has a couple of names. Thought it was gringos bar and grill  and also rents jet skis. Food was good.; Had such a great time for Mother’s Day! Going back in July!!; If you're looking for a spot to grab some amazing food and drinks while taking in the beauty of Luquillo Beach, be sure to check out Bikini Bar. What drew us in was the small, independently run kitchen in the back and their $4 fish tacos, and let me tell you - they did not disappoint. We don't know what the chef used on them, but they were simply amazing - probably the best fish tacos we've ever had. They were simple, with just some salsa and lettuce on the fish, but the secret seasoning they used made all the difference. We're still talking about them! As for the bar itself, the service was good, prices were comparable, and there was a pool table in the back that seemed to stay busy. If you're looking for a laid-back spot with incredible food, drinks, and atmosphere, be sure to give Bikini Bar a try.; Great beach great variety of food and shops!!

"An Exceptional Cocktail Experience "

Nestled in the vibrant heart of Luquillo, MojitoLab is a premier destination for cocktail enthusiasts seeking a sophisticated and creative drinking experience. As an expert reviewer with a passion for mixology, my visit to MojitoLab was an absolute delight. Here’s an in-depth review of this standout establishment.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Cocktail Menu
MojitoLab takes the classic mojito to new heights with an inventive and diverse cocktail menu. Each drink is a testament to the bartenders' creativity and expertise, showcasing unique flavor combinations and high-quality ingredients. The signature mojitos, offered in a variety of flavors from traditional lime to exotic fruit blends, are expertly crafted and perfectly balanced. The attention to detail in each drink, from the muddling of fresh mint to the precise mix of spirits, ensures a consistently exceptional experience.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Service:
The service at MojitoLab is exceptional, characterized by engaging and friendly staff who go above and beyond to ensure a memorable experience. From the moment you walk up, you are greeted with genuine hospitality and a welcoming smile. The staff's attentiveness and willingness to accommodate special requests or dietary preferences add a personal touch that enhances the overall enjoyment of your visit.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Final Impressions
MojitoLab excels in delivering a top-tier cocktail experience. The innovative and expertly crafted drinks, coupled with a stylish setting and outstanding service, make it a standout choice for anyone looking to enjoy sophisticated cocktails in Luquillo. For a truly exceptional mixology experience, MojitoLab is the place to be.; Went to the kiosk that doesn’t serve food. Ordered the parcha and coconut mojito. EXTREMELY satisfying. I’m not a huge fan of coco, but the parcha was so refreshing. Definitely recommended stop.; So I just came here to return my drinks the next day because we got our drinks at closing,  we were walking to the car with my baby, so when we tried the drinks in the car it  was bad, we went to return it same day but they closed, so today we just explained how the drinks were not good, we didn’t drink it at all , we showed them the bag with the drinks, the manager did not care to understand at all, they actually made the drinks & asked me to pay again, after we said no to paying ,that’s 60 dollars, he rather throw the drinks in the garbage than having us take the drinks, guys don’t go here at all, the drinks are terrible & the good reviews must not know what good mojitos are, you’re going to spend a lot here for nasty drinks.; Great casual place to grab mojitos for the beach. A must visit whenever in Luquillo. I get the coco parcha and it hits every time, but you can combine any flavors you want. If you’re lucky they’ll give you a piece of candy with it. They have two sizes but beware - they’re strong!

Address: 97M2+Q4, Playa Fortuna, Luquillo 00773, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Friday: 11:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Saturday: 11:05 AM – 5:00 PM; Sunday: 11:05 AM – 5:00 PM
Address Components: 97M2+Q4 (plus_code); Playa Fortuna (locality); Mameyes I (administrative_area_level_2); Luquillo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00773 (postal_code)
Reviews:
A hidden gem in Luquillo for sure. In between Paradise Beach and Playa Fortuna. Our VRBO apartment was just a 5 min walk on the beach from this place. Music, staff and food was great. Shaded upstairs gazebo area has the perfect view and access to the beach. No parking avail. directly but if you drive find the old basketball court on the right side of Calle 1. Apple Pay, cash and card accepted. Food is locally prepared, it’s mostly fried, daiquiris of many flavors with choice of light or dark rum.; One of our favorite places we came across while visiting Puerto Rico. Delicious empanadas, and awesome drinks! The staff was also very fun, friendly, and efficient. A must visit if you are in the Luquillo area.

*
IMPORTANT
the only reason we were able to find the place is from another review.

Google maps will take you to a gated house that is behind the bar. Once you are a minute away from the google maps destination, you will see half of a basketball court with parking in front of it. Park here and talk to the beach and go to the left. You will then see the bar a couple buildings down.

Enjoy!; First off, this place is nearly impossible to find. If you’re going down the road that it’s on, they Our one house before the yellow house on the right at the end of the street. Easy way to get there, is somebody else’s pointed out in a prior review, park at the little little basketball court on your right, and walk down the beach. You’ll find it. But there’s no sign or anything.

That being said, My wife and I went there for lunch based on the reviews, which were outstanding. The reviews are spot on. The food is great, the drinks are absolutely incredible. Some of the best drinks we’ve had anywhere at any price.

We will definitely go back next time we’re in the area, I’m glad we found this place.; Absolutely amazing. This place is located in a secluded spot on the beach. We found it while walking one day and were impressed by the drinks-all the ingredients were fresh and the staff mixed some amazing concoctions. The food was also high-level. They make all the dishes from scratch and it shows! We also had the pleasure of meeting some horses while we visited. Absolutely wonderful!; This place is a true hidden gem!! The best service and great food. It’s a little difficult to find but if you’re driving, park at the blue basketball court 5 houses before and walk the beach. The staff were by far the friendliest we’ve met on any vacation.

Name: Casa E’ Chelo
Address: 67 Cll Fernández Garcia, Luquillo, 00773, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 67 (street_number); Calle Fernández Garcia (route); Luquillo (locality); Luquillo (administrative_area_level_2); Luquillo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00773 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Every time we visited, we found more amazingness.  The staff was SO friendly and helpful.  The first day we just grabbed a bottled drink to take back to the condo.  Who knew you could order margaritas to go and the beach is just a block or so away?  We learned that a few days late.  :-) They had adult juice boxes for $2 as well!!  This is a great local take away bar to experience local Puerto Rican friendliness along with yummy drinks.  Will return!!!; SO glad we stopped in for a drink. Such a fun and vibrant environment, and the people were very friendly. Cheap but strong drinks. Recommend stopping by!; One of my fave local places around as a non local but I can't stop coming back every 3 months it seems.

It's like a liquor store/bar.  I really love the entire area.  This is a total locals place.  Met some way cool people there who were just hanging out enjoying themselves.

As I said, I can't stop coming back to Luquilo itself because of places like Chelo's, and the insanely beautiful beach & ocean right there of course.

Sooo, Does anyone know their hours?
Not listed on Google.; Inexpensive, great place to get beach drinks and snacks...; Friendly people cheap drinks!

Name: Coquí Water Park
Address: 1000 El Conquistador Avenue 1, 653 70 mi, Fajardo, 00738, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Tuesday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Wednesday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM

Reviews:
Coqui water park was nice, my teens had a nice time!! It was definitely a chill vibe!; So much fun. It’s free if your staying at the resort. They have 3 slides and a lazy river. The pool is very relaxing. They had plenty of lounge chairs with umbrellas for shade. They provide towels. Food was very good too. Bathrooms are spotless. The only thing I didn’t like was that they don’t let you bring snacks in.; Sooo fun!  Three big waterslides including one with a free fall start.  Lazy river and little kid waterslides too.  At 4pm on a Sunday afternoon, very uncrowded and no lines.  Also has dressing rooms, showers, etc plus food.  Gorgeous views in the Caribbean too. Tip: have your friends take photos of you on the highest plunge slide from the bridge just in front of it. We visited in March 2022 and admission was included in the hotel stay - no additional charges as some reviews below indicate.; This waterpark is part of the El Conquistador resort and included in your stay. Very nice waterpark with three very fun slides and several pools and a lazy river.
They were very strict about outside food and drinks as well as teens without parents.  We had a great time, great lounge food and drink service.  No wait on any slides the day we were there.; Tons of fun, free if you’re staying at the resort! (Yes there was a rainbow when we left)

Name: Snorkeling Puerto Rico | Boat Tours
Address: Carr#987, Km 2.5 Bo, Fajardo, 00738, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Thursday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Friday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Saturday: 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM; Sunday: 8:00 AM – 3:00 PM
Address Components: Fajardo (locality); Sardinera (administrative_area_level_2); Fajardo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00738 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Amanda, Adriel,  Andrew, and Captain Danty were absolutely amazing!!!  The whole experience was breath taking!  The entire crew is so kind and attentive!  The snorkeling experience was really pretty!   And we def loved the beach and relaxing on the ship!  They also had a water slide we can go down as well.    Definitely recommend this to everyone!!!  Worth every penny!   ❤️; We had a great time. Amanda, Ellie, Andrew and the captain made sure we all enjoyed
Ourselves. They share their knowledge of the area and the marine life. It was amazing! I highly recommend this excursion.; This is my second time doing snorkeling Puerto Rico! The experience is always great! Definitely will keep booking them every time I come back. The views and the over all vibes is amazing! All the crew is really nice and friendly!; We absolutely loved our experience! There was 6 of us all different ages and they made sure every single person was safe and comfortable. We were on kraken and had Christian and his group who need more than 5 stars. They made sure everyone had a great time! Definitely recommend!; We had an absolute amazing time. Captain Joe, Andrew and Chris were amazing hosts. They all took the time to make sure we were safe and had an amazing experience. The food, and drinks were great. And they even brought their pup Rigo on board too. I would highly recommend buying tickets in advance as they sell out quickly. Completely worth the price you pay. We had so so much fun. It was an experience of a lifetime. Thanks gentlemen for making our last day memorable!!

Reviews: Looking for a place to stop and found this one. Was super excited to try it with the music and atmosphere. We were super disappointed when no one would serve us. We got right up to the front of the bar and were completely ignored. The girl working  walked away looked at us and then continued to serve other. The guy working just acted like we weren’t there. Tried getting there attention a couple times and finally gave up and left.; The music is to loud, where people can hardly hear each other in a conversation and more importantly, there’s no designated parking area. Not safe; We loved this place.  Great ambiance and decor, a very well done beach vibe.  It was very lively and the locals were so welcoming and fun.  We got dancing lessons and had an amazing time.  The fish tacos are unbelievable.; Great local hangout! So much fun!  You probably should speak spanish before entering if you're not from here. I think they have food but I've never eaten or seen anybody eating :-); I love this place. It's a great neighborhood bar, but we get local tourist traffic too.  It's pretty small and they don't take credit cards. Food is good. Bartenders are friendly. The owner is awesome. I'd give it 5 stars if I could use a card there.

The bar has low lighting and dope music (techno in one area reggaeton in another). There’s a dark room and two bars. Doesn’t get started until midnight. This place scratches all the right inches. Contrary to every one's reviews the $2 soda was fresh. The bartender, a blonde crossover male/female was really friendlyand steered me to these delicious apple and cherry frozen drinks. Delicious.; They don’t understand to any reason. I left my bag with my friends (with my phone), they went out to smoke and couldn’t enter again, I asked several times if they left  (describing to my friends in the door) and they only answer which I got it was “if you enter you don’t come back again”. I didn’t know if they were outside or not, I spent one hour looking for them to get my phone and keys for the apartment, everything was full of smoke and steam getting blind views inside of the bar. It’s so easy letting you know that you can no enter again if you go out.
Poor treatment and bad memory sadly 😓; First time in my mothers home land recently and had an amazing time!! If you’re looking for a dope night cap to let loose this is definitely a vibe!!; NOT WORTH THE COVER!!!! Dank, dark, dirty, and disgusting. No one was there and the bouncer lied about how many people were inside! DO NOT GO!

Nice bar in the middle of a bunch of clubs. It’s not really a small place but the amount allowed in is limited. Arrive early or you will have to wait outside for a while till someone leaves. We ordered drinks and a couple appetizers. The mozzarella sticks were not good. The bacon wrapped meatballs were good. Service was friendly. We would return.; El Techo Rooftop Bar, a hidden gem in La Placita, treats visitors to stunning views. While the drinks lean towards the pricier side, it's expected in this touristy zone. Less crowded than street-level spots, it's a picturesque escape. Note: No on-site parking, but a nearby public garage is available for $5. 🌆🍹; Good handout place to catch up for some drink and food.
Nice ambiance and friendly staff; The view is everything! Great service too. I really recommend it!!! It should be a must in your visit to La Placita.; Great ambient, service and really refreshing atmosphere. Rooftop view. Highly recommended if you are in the area!!

Reviews: Great place! Server / bar tender was on it. Great food! AMAZING drinks. Had the zombie. 10/10 recommend.; The cocktails are amazing. Our bartender Adrian recommended us really good drinks and made them very fast. This is one of the best bar set ups I have seen. You can see every type of alcohol they have available and I love that you can see all the inclusions they have in front of you. They have fun mini games in the bar you can enjoy. Nice music and very relax.; Came in to grab a drink before dinner and the restaurant was steadily busy. The bartender let us know that no tables or seats were available but let us know we could hangout at a ledge/ counter area. Once barstools became available though they so kindly brought them over to us. We enjoyed the mojito and rum old fashioned both were someone of the best cocktails we have ever had. We enjoyed one of the specials they had on feature chicken dumplings, they were so delicious. More then the amazing drinks and get app though is the staff! They are so kind and attentive. One of the bartenders Adrian even went out of her way to make us a list of her favorite places to check out. Highly recommend this establishment if visiting San Juan! Such a wonderful experience!; The food was alright, but not at all worth the wait. We had a reservation for 9p, ordered 4 tapas, and were not served after 10p (the last order was served at 10:20p). My first drink came quickly enough, and was okay, but I had to ask for my second drink three times, twice from the waitress, and once from the bartender (who ignored the request even though he was either not making other drinks or casually talking to other patrons); in general each time I approached them about the drink, it felt like the first time). It seems they were short staffed, which I’m usually sympathetic to, however if each time I ask for an update on my food or drinks, I’m not given even a faux apology for the wait, all sympathy is lost. I wanted to like this place for the vibe and location, but cannot recommend it in good faith.; Had a lackluster experience at a different restaurant across the street so we decided to give Kane’s a try.  Small menu and excellent rum selection with cocktails.  Had a wonderful salad with seared tuna and chicken dumplings.  The bartender even made me a daiquiri that wasn’t super sweet- just the way I like it!  Great small tapas bar….. with delightful staff- we’ll be back!

Name: Kweens Klub
Address: 1211 Av. Manuel Fernández Juncos, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 8:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Thursday: 8:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Friday: 8:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Saturday: 8:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Vicinity: 1211 Avenida Manuel Fernández Juncos, San Juan
Address Components: 1211 (street_number); Avenida Manuel Fernández Juncos (route); Santurce (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Figueroa (administrative_area_level_3); Santurce (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00907 (postal_code)
Reviews:
I was excited to attend this club, hoping I would easily be able to meet new people while on my solo vacation. But I was wrong. They didn't accept credit cards for the $10 cover at the front to enter the club, so I had to inconveniently walk to the ATM to get cash. I did like the DJ and music. The drinks were okay, but extremely overpriced. A single vodka cranberry drink was $10. I really think I was overcharged by the bartender, as I only ordered 2-3 drinks and a round of $1 Jello shots and my tab came out to be close to $50. The guests at the club were cliquey and stuck up. Both bathrooms were locked and occupied the entire time, and there were no urinals to use. I got so fed up after only spending about an hour at the club and just left. Wouldn't recommend and won't return.; Great space. Good drinks.  Totally blown away that they would have a full on family-fued style, long drag show with talking at 130am instead of music and dancing on a Friday night.

We ordered one drink and left.  So, so disappointing. Planned on staying and dancing til 3am.; Beware of purchasing advance tickets with this club for Rupaul Celebrity Guest Stars. They cancel events and don’t do refunds. Several times and zero luck. Don’t worth it. Be the judge with this two promos. SCAM!

Waiting for the person who replies this GMB say is lie! Because I had the screenshots of the request for refund on Eventbrite since the event was cancelled.; Scammers. They dont want to refund me two tickets because they said the event was not cancelled. My purchase was for Anetra and not AQUARIA. THIS MERCHANT HAS NOT SCRUPLES. I RECOMMEND TO AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COST. PLUS DRINKS TASTE BAD TOO MUCH ALCOHOL/WATER DILUTED. I ONLY WENT FOR RUPAUL SHOWS BECAUSE THAT PLACE IS THE WORSG AND NOW IS 100% CONFIRMED- GO TO TOXIC NIGHTCLUB- They refund you if a event is cancelled.; For a place called Kweens Klub, this place didn’t much seem to care much for their drag queens, because neither the doorman nor the bartender would break up a $10 bill for 1’s, so be sure to bring your own dollar bills. The place had maybe two dozen people there for the Saturday night 1am drag show ($8 cover), and the “music” was blasted so loud during intermission, it had the effect (and sound) of an electromagnetic pulse, clearing the room. My expectations were modest after reading the reviews, and no surprises. Great lighting and space, staff was friendly enough, and the queens put on a helluva show — it’s just a shame the promoters couldn’t fill the place or keep people there.

Name: El Local en Santurce
Address: 1425 Av. Manuel Fernández Juncos, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Tuesday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Wednesday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Thursday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Friday: 7:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 7:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: Closed

Reviews: i enjoyed this place and the vibe it had!! its definitely a lowkey kinda spot and the parking situation is a little adventurous but nothing crazy, pretty safe. the drinks were cheap but good and the bartender was cool. they had fans and AC by the stage which was appreciated. theres lots of spots to sit at and get comfy including a pretty big smokers area by the entrance. overall really enjoyed myself 🖤; This place is an absolute blast! Whether you're looking to belt out your favorite tunes with friends, challenge them to some friendly competition, or just chill out to some awesome tunes, this place has got you covered. I've been here twice now and I can't get enough of it - the atmosphere is electric and the service is top-notch. Trust me, there's no place quite like it!; Cozy place with a lot of charm and a nice ambience. Popular with local hipsters, artists and alternative crowd. They present events almost weekly with local and international alternative artists. Beers are cold with few variety, mixed drinks are ok...; It was really neat finding a place like this in PR. Very punk/alternative vibes. The local scene here is hella cool. Some local techno DJs were performing and we danced our butts off and had a great time. Will definitely be back next time I visit.; Best caramel corn in town. Curated, high-end decor. Cash only. "They play white music." Go to the food across the street and get something to put her hot sauce on. Our ABNB was right around the corner and we will be back.

Name: Taberna Los Vázquez
Address: 1348 C. Orbeta, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 4:00 PM – 1:30 AM; Saturday: 4:00 PM – 1:30 AM; Sunday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM

Reviews: I was three and did not have a chance to eat in that location. However, this is one of the most famous places in Santurce where many people gather just to enjoy and dance 💃 dance 🕺 salsa music.; If you want to have a good time with dancing, drinks and some food, it's the place to be; Great live music, vibe, and location. If you love the energy of large groups of people coming together to dance and socialize, this place and area is a MUST visit.; Great environment, you can feel the real San Juan vibes, great for a Salsa Night 👍🏻 Loved it 😍; Various ages, outdoor seating, access to beer, mixed drinks, tapas, and cigars.. Heavy police presence to aid in shutdown (COVID curfew). Parking within walking distance.

Name: Frenchy's Next Level Gentlemen Club
Address: Ave Juan Ponce De León, Callejón De Los Reyes, Santurce, San Juan 00907, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00 PM – 4:00 AM; Tuesday: 8:00 PM – 4:00 AM; Wednesday: 8:00 PM – 4:00 AM; Thursday: 9:00 PM – 5:00 AM; Friday: 9:00 PM – 5:00 AM; Saturday: 9:00 PM – 5:00 AM; Sunday: 8:00 PM – 4:00 AM

Reviews:
Entertainers were horrible. 1 dancer completely snubbed me so she could talk Spanish to some locals. And then she got angry at me when I said no thank you for her company. 2 of the dancers wore pasties. I took a lap dance with one of the pasties dancers. She didn't take the pasties off or take any clothing off at all. $40 at a supposed "strip club" and I didn't even see her nude. The other pasties dancer was doing a dance in the chair next to me, and she didn't take anything off either. The pasties dancer asked if I wanted more, and I said absolutely not. I walked in with $700 intending on spending it on more. And I walked out with $600. Which I spent at the next club.; Arrived 10pm on a Sunday.  Eight ladies ranging from cute to beautiful.  One grabbed me and we had about 8 drinks for less than $70 ... chatted and flirted.  Everyone was cool.  "Satisfaction" guaranteed at very reasonable rates.; If I could give this dump a zero I would. The place is in the ghetto and down a side street. The place said it opened at 9pm. We paid $20 and then the security said ....no closed come back 45 mins. We ask for our money and he was like no refunds. Well we went across the street where we part and when we went back the same guy said we had to pay again. I wanted to leave but my friend wanted to go in so we paid agian and went in. We had just ordered a beer that was $12 when one of the guys running to place begain to give us the run down. Lap dances was $40 and full service was $250. I know what goes on but in all the places ive been i have never seen it promoted .Place was a scam; Best strip club on the island by far. Guys trip definitely stop here they will show love.; Hands down worst strip club I’ve ever been to. Totally ghetto, sketchy location, overpriced drinks ( $10 for 4oz cups filled 80% w/ice) all the girls just stand around on their phones and we didn’t see a pretty one in the bunch. This place is more of a brothel than a strip club. Unless you’re paying for “full service” the girls have no clue how to dance. We paid $80 for a couples private dance and the girl literally just sat on a foot stool twerking the whole time. She never even took her top off.
Skip this place at all cost, you won’t be missing anything besides a penicillin shot…

Name: Patrick's Irish Bar
Address: 1157 Ashford Ave, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Tuesday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Wednesday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Thursday: 6:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Friday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 1:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Address Components: 1157 (street_number); Ashford Avenue (route); Santurce (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Condado (administrative_area_level_3); Santurce (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00907 (postal_code)
Reviews: This spot is hit or miss as far as the crowd goes. Depending on what night you go it's either lit or completely dead. The drinks are good and strong and reasonably cheap. On Fridays there's a $25 all you can drink option. The only issue I had was the kitchen was closed on both the nights I showed up. The bartender explained that if, it's not busy enough they won't open the kitchen and prepare food.; I loved this pub!! This is your friendly local neighborhood bar, nothing crazy or fancy. Just have a good cocktail / beer, listen to great music. We came here on a Sunday night, it was really chill group of people. Everyone is super friendly. The bartender Joe was really nice and made awesome drinks!! I will definitely be returning again in the future!!  Oh yeah, get a green Jell-O shot when you are here!; Went here with my wife and when I tell you the food was good drinks on point. But the bartender was cool and great customer service made us feel welcomed thank you again definitely going back everytime we visit; I love Patrick’s. It’s def my go to spot everytime I come home to PR. It’s very low key, but the customer service is amazing. They have hookah, the drinks are good, AC. They always showing the games on a projector and always playing hip hop. And it’s location is pretty good. They also have food.; We had a great time listening to Hip Hop Music with a $20 Wristband for All You can Drink from 9pm-2am. They had Dollar Bills hanging on the ceilings from Customers and Chalk filled writing on the walls with Customers names. They had Hookah. The place is on the 2nd floor.

Name: La Disquera
Address: 610 Calle Cerra, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Tuesday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Wednesday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Thursday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Friday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Saturday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Sunday: 7:00 PM – 12:00 AM

Reviews: Wow this is a very cool bar and lounge. It's a bit hidden so it's not super popular yet. A nice variety of cocktail drinks, we loved the Moma and San Juan. The appetizers taste pretty good too. I would recommend coming early because it gets very busy after 9pm and you'll have a hard time finding a seat. The bar and service will also slow down due to demand after that time as well. Very cool crowd. Parking is always difficult in calle cerra so I recommend ubering or valet.; La Disauera is easily one of the best bars in San Juan.  The service, music, and quality of drinks is all top notch. Can’t recommend this place enough.; Love this spot! We went to a pop up here and had so much fun. Great cocktails and good wine selection.; Saturday midnight, group of 6. Good crowd, Good music. Cute spot. We were able to find a area to sit all six right by the bar. Service was close to non-existent. The bar was super tight as there are people sitting on it, and the DJ is also there. We got thirsty and left. Has potential but desperately needs service,  another bar area, or less people inside.; Came here with my wife after literally everyone in PR recommend it to us. The atmosphere is electric, it’s such a vibe. The cocktails and drink offerings are extensive and high quality. The price point is great. The staff however treated us as unwelcome guests. Rolled their eyes and acted as if it was a bother that we came in to their bar. I do recommend this place simply for the vibe but just know customer service is lost on them.

If you are looking for an exclusive place to dress up and have a great time this is it. Great servers, cocktails and food. On Fridays they have the best house dj of PR, dj Guairo who kills it every single time!; The place is a cozy speakeasy with a nice variety of tapas and fantastic cocktails. Fer and Joma are the best!; Awesome vibes, great DJ, and amazing drinks. The atmosphere feel like a DJ nightclub with and Puerto Rican twist. I love I can have a late dinner next door at Semillas Kitchen and Bar, then cut through the back and be in Vine. Awesome place, and hats off to the amazing man making the drinks last night.; We didn't have a reservation, but we showed up early enough and the staff was very accommodating. We enjoyed a couple drinks at the bar in the fun and inviting atmosphere.; Loved it! Loved the decor, overall vibe and food!

But now they seriously need to fire the DJ. It’s such a shame that being in Puerto Rico all they play are those 5 2008 songs nonstop.; I can't rate food because I didn't eat at  this place is for young crowd or a party animal ....😅 music is loud overcrowded not a place for the simple people but party like animal; Extremely high intensity music at 3:30 AM. Great mix of music (impeccable really) and excellent customer service. 10/10 don’t be late or else you’ll miss out; The place to be at night, love that it's outside

Name: CHIMERA Rooftop
Address: 1501 Ave Juan Ponce de León, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Saturday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Vicinity: 1501 Avenue Juan Ponce de León, San Juan
Address Components: 1501 (street_number); Avenue Juan Ponce de León (route); Santurce (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Minillas (administrative_area_level_3); Santurce (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00907 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This bar is definitely a vibe!!!
We visited on a weekday, and although it was pretty slow, we had an amazing time. The drinks were delicious, and the bartenders were fantastic. They gave us plenty of recommendations for other bars and places to visit in Puerto Rico. Throughout our trip, we wanted to make a second stop there, but unfortunately, we ran out of time. Definitely recommend checking it out!; This hidden gem is amazing. Fantastic cocktails. Appetizers to die for and amazing service. ! I'll definitely head back here on my next trip in !; I was disappointed by my interaction with the bartender when I asked them about the ingredients in my drink. I ordered a Gold Rush. The menu lists it with Bulleit Bourbon, lemon, and honey. The drink I received had a sour flavor — and not the kind of sour flavor you want to taste in your cocktail. I tried a few sips before I reluctantly brought the drink back to the bar and explained the lemon tasted off to me. The bartender let me know he used lime instead of lemon. He tasted it in front of me and said it tasted right to him. I showed him the menu where it said lemon instead of lime. I asked him to make an old fashioned instead and left the drink at the bar. When I got my check, they still charged me $15 for the Gold Rush they made incorrectly and that I didn’t drink. I was disappointed with the response. I would have left a positive review if they refunded the drink they made incorrectly or at least made the drink again with the correct ingredients. The old fashioned was good, and we liked the atmosphere. Just wish they handled customer service differently.; Awesome cocktails and bartenders. The vibes are incredible here. Super fresh rooftop with tables tucked away in nooks.; Went on a Saturday & it was a fun date spot. Nice breeze, fun music, comfy chairs, beautiful people. Server came as soon as we sat, but after we received our drinks we never saw him again.

Name: Loko's Koko Bar
Address: 213 C. Canals, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 8:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Friday: 8:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 8:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 8:00 PM – 1:00 AM

Reviews:
Bouncer around 12:50am Saturday 07/13/24 was charging some ppl $5 dollars and letting his buddies in for free. I was going to buy a hookah, but decided to take my business elsewhere due to his favoritism. I would suggest the owner get rid of said bouncer. He’s losing money due to him.; We had so much fun here. It was great, drinks/shots were great, wings were salty, music was great as well. We also had hookahs and the bouncers were cool too. Would definitely go back again when we visit the island.; La Placita!!!! Had so much fun here for our last night in Puerto Rico 🇵🇷; Our bartenders were super awesome (Mariela & Ramon) and welcoming.
Had a blast decent food and loved the blueberry hookah and decent price in comparison with other local places near here. Will be coming back. Loved their sangria & passion fruit monjito; I had a great time at this venue; however, I warn the use of a credit card. I had a bill totaling 27.50 and my card was credited 30.50. The 3 bucks are not the issue if I gave the authority to tip, it is the principle of stealing monies via crediting my card more than the price of my drinks. I gave a cash tip: Be cautious when using credit.

Name: El Nie Bar
Address: 1013 Av. Las Palmas, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Wednesday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Thursday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Friday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM

Reviews: I love the vibe of this place! I went once during the weekend and they they had good music and a lot of people having fun and dancing. This second time I went for Kahoot Tuesday, it was SO FUN, perfect to go with friends and have spend a chill night with some drinks, if you’re smart enough, you might win and get some prizes! Starting at 8pm, they have three kahoot games with different themes, being the last one the one for the big prize! This week it was about starwars and someone from our table won🥳 after playing, we spent some time at the bar and left around 11! I also had a veggie burger and we shared some empanadillas, simple but tasty! Highly recommend it!; Super fun place. Games on the table with a great staff. The Empinadias are the best according to the locals I know. The area is surrounded by amazing local street art. This is a wonderful place to visit.; Food was excellent, service was average waitress didnt bring us any napkins and the bathrooms were disgusting. The atmosphere was hole in the wallish, the street is dark and intimidating but my overall experience wasn't totally horrible.; It was a great bar and Roberto played good music!! We loved the food as well, the wings were amazing and they did a great job with the drinks. Also loved the games available at the tables!; This has been my favorite bar during my vacation here. I’ve been here just about every night. Everyone is so nice and friendly and I can’t get enough of the empanadillas!!!

Name: La Penúltima
Address: 1359 Av. de la Constitución, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

Reviews: Loved the Disco Fries (poached egg on top fries is genius), Burger, and Korean style Wings. Had to come back to get their creamy cocktail again too. Super cozy and lowkey spot with great food and drinks!; This is the place where locals go to have a great cocktail and spectacular food (smash burger) the quality of products and knowledgeable bartenders are impressive. Don't miss the chance to come here.; Fantastic food, great service, and a really good selection of beers and mixed drinks.; The best bar in all of San Juan! Impeccable friendly service, tastefully curated wines (THEY HAVE ORANGE WINE, multiple good ones!) a backyard, and delicious food. We ordered three rounds of the shishito peppers. The wings and disco fries were perfect too. Still thinking about the ever so slightly savory sesame martini as well. Overall an excellent bar for lovers of natural wines, elevated pub food, and good bohemian vibes.; No joke …. Best burger I have had!!! Don’t skip out on the bacon and absolutely have the disco fries! Top it off with with a whisky coco and you are in heaven! Sooo good!

At some point I will return.  Grateful.; The atmosphere and music is the best to have a great time;

Name: SW Social Club 3.0
Address: 303 C. Condado, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: Closed; Friday: 7:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Saturday: 7:00 PM – 4:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 303 (street_number); Calle Condado (route); Santurce (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Campo Alegre (administrative_area_level_3); Santurce (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00907 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Great place to explore sexuality and the swinger life. They have great entertainment during the night. The service is really great and owners are always looking forward to giving the best experience.; Amazing place!! Service was excellent from start to end. Had the pleasure to meet the owners and they were fantastic not just with us but with all the guest. Loved the music, the drinks my husband and I had a great time, we danced and drank a lot! Can't wait to be back.

Att: Los miami; The Club is on the Second floor. It was $40 for a Couple on a Saturday. We were able to pay it with a debit card. We paid $2 for a locker and the lock was included. We recieved a Tour from the Host Couple and They have Private Rooms that start at $20 with $5 each additional person. Then they have Leather Red Beds in what seems like the hallway for everyone to watch that are Free. The Drinks are reasonably priced and We paid with a Debit Card. They played Latin Music all night. It was a small location but it was a Great Time.; This was a very unique experience to say the least,  staff was helpful once we found the place which isnt easy. But once we got there we had a fun night. Any place for any open couple to explore and have fun. Sorry no photos were allowed; Too loud to meet people

Address: 1055 Avenue Dr Ashford, Lobby Level, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 1:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Tuesday: 1:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Wednesday: 1:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Thursday: 1:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 1:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Saturday: 1:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Sunday: 1:00 PM – 12:00 AM

Reviews:
The service was impecable, this was our second time and it did not disappoint. Sebastian was our bartender that night and he was amazing and very considerate (As everyone else in this hotel). The drinks are amazing. Flavorful and very well balanced. Pricey but worth every penny.; Excellent cocktails, with beautiful ambiance. Expensive but it is a 5 star hotel.

Update: years passed and I have revisited several times, the drinks are still stunning. Certainly some of the best cocktails I have had.; I went with two of my friends to the Father’s Day event. We had a great time. But, the highlight of the night was the greatest waitress ever, Veronica. I was having such a great time that I misplaced a very important object in a napkin, thinking I was going to remember to put it in my purse. ( Such a stupid idea) When we were out of the lounge, I remembered and looked back, but our table was already clean. With an embarrassed face I told our waitress. She did not hesitate to help me out. She put some gloves on and did not stop until she got both of the objects!!!! For ever will be grateful!!!!  If you go, ask for Veronica she’s really nice, positive and hard worker. ❤️; Go to the bar and let Anthony serve you! Its perfect! You’ll love it!; Veronica was the best server I’ve ever had. Professional, polite, knowledgeable on drinks and recommended the tastiest drinks. She also recommended good restaurants for us to visit while we were vacationing in Puerto Rico. I would never come to Condado Vanderbilt Hotel without her here. Great experience.

Address: #55 Cll Barranquitas, San Juan, 00907, Puerto Rico

Reviews: We ate here almost every day that we were here! The food, the views, and the staff were amazing! Super friendly staff. We had Ricardo as our waiter, he was super helpful and gave us a list of things to do while we were in Puerto Rico! Highly recommend this restaurant.; Easily a 4.7, only thing that killed the vibe was the power outage which messed up the rooftop view of the beach.  Phenomenal food (duck HIGHLY RECOMMENDED), great service,  awesome views, and very relaxing....Definitely repeat!; Beautiful place, wonderful food, lovely scenery. I give it 1000/10… definitely will come here every visit no matter what💯; We had a great experience. It was really easy to make a reservation for the same day and the waiters gave us the best service and attention. Drinks and appetizers came out really fast. The dumplings and churrasco with rice are the best!!!! Really nice cocktails and decoration. Sunset was beautiful. Definitely a must visit. Very romantic to go with your partner or with family. Valet parking available $22.00; Must stop restaurant that will definitely be a returning favorite! Exquisite meal with the best view. The lagoon view was incredible and well shielded from the windy coastline. Churrasco and Mamposteao was the best meal I had during my entire San Juan vacation!

Food is amazing and the creativity of the interior design is unique- and the roads are great for touring!!; The employees and owners are very friendly. I love the half-lit atmosphere! Reviews:
Everything was so delicious, waiter was so friendly and amazing. The coffee is great, really recommend the place.; Best place to brunch in Barranquitas. Loved the passion fruit mimosas. Lots of food served to and great coffee; Amazing place. The employees are amazing with great charisma. Great coffee and El Jugo de China esta súper sabroso.; Small restaurant in Barranquitas. The restaurant seems that they do not have the adequate staff for influx of customers. Went with my wife on New Years Day as they were open. There were between 10-12 clients already seated. After they sat us, the employee indicated that due to the other clients just arrived, my order would take over 45 minutes. Wow….45 minutes. We asked for the time of coffee and the order would be serviced promptly. We decided to order the Cappuccino; which was delicious and decided to not wait for a breakfast order to be served.

Seems that Cafetalito is trying to emulate the Bistros located in the Metropolitan area, but are coming in short - location is small, cannot handle over 12 clients at the same time and from the plates I saw being serviced, they need to make them visually more attractive.; Just happened by this place while visiting expecting to quickly get coffee and bread. Surprisingly, this was one of the best brunches I’ve had anywhere. Coffee was amazing as well.
