Reviews:
Very nice course, which plays pretty long. Interesting shots have to be made if you miss the tee shot. Played last week, and everything was green and blooming.; I like this place, especially when it rains in the rest of the island.; A quiet and safe place to vacation. Gated entry with security. Outdoor parking. Golfing on site of course. Golf shop, restaurant and pool. Good food reasonably priced.; Very well kept grounds, reasonably priced, fantastic views, good on-course service and a very good restaurant/19th hole to boost are many of the qualities that make El Legado a great place to play golf on the island.

I also like the fact that there are no tee-time reservations. Get there early and you can play with few people ahead of you. Or pop-in a bit later and get going any time.

On top of it all, being in the South, it barely rains heavily so you can usually just keep playing through when there are light showers.

I’ve been there several times already and will keep going back.; Beautiful, accesible, really clean and a good place to play gulf

Reviews:
The concept is good. Its a beautiful club. However, its filled with wannabes. Broke people pretending to be rich. Its easy to spot a fake. They're the ones blowing their weeks pay on bottle service in a desperate attempt to look or feel important. Sad.; I got a table for my birthday celebration with my family and coworkers. Zeke (@vip_with_zeke) helped me out tremendously with getting the table set up for the night. His customer service was great as he made sure everybody was taken care of. The bottle girl that took care of us did great as well. Everybody had fun. No disappointments.
I would definitely book with Zeke again with no hesitation.; I booked a table at INTL 4 weeks in advance of my birthday, & when I arrived there I was satisfied with how I was taken care of. A guy named Zeke(@vip_with_zeke) was the Promoter that took care of me. I got that 5 star experience I wanted. Highly recommend if you want a table with “NO BS” get at him; PROS: Great R&B and Rap music and drink service.

CONS: This club is literally horrible. Yesterday they promised a table for their host. When we all got there for our table, they had us waiting 3 hours!!!

After the 3 hours we found out they gave our table away!! It would have made sense if we were late, but we were 30 minutes EARLY!!

It was very unprofessional. They should work on their customer service skills and not overbooking tables. Don't bother getting a table here.; I booked a table for my birthday with Zeke @vip_with_zeke on RnB Thursday. My friends and I had a good time, we enjoyed the vibe and the service was good. Zeke followed up to ensure we were there at the right time.  We were promptly seated and our bottle sever was attentive to our needs. Zeke provided an enjoyable, positive experience and I would recommend contacting him for your event needs.

The Friday night social Dance Experience at Sundial is pure perfection. Very large place to dance, nice variety of entertainers who providing the music. Some of them solo DJs some of them musicians with live music. Every week is different. They playing pretty nice variety of different ballroom music. Before each Friday night they providing a free ballroom dance lesson.
People are friendly, helpful almost like a big family.; Here is an enchanting venue for ballroom dancing. Large dance floor, and a welcoming group of dance enthusiasts. Free dance lesson before dance begins.; Rocking thru the years is a great dance club. Friendly people, good dance music. Always a fun night out.; A large dance floor, good dance music and a welcoming, friendly group of dancers of all levels.; Excellent time. Music was good. Plenty of dance floor.

Name: 11:11 Nightclub
Address: 4280 N Drinkwater Blvd #100, Scottsdale, AZ 85251, USA
Address Components: 100 (subpremise); 4280 (street_number); North Drinkwater Boulevard (route); South Scottsdale (neighborhood); Scottsdale (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85251 (postal_code)
Reviews: Love goin to this club I always have a good time. Once you know they dress code and why it’s like that you’ll forget there’s a dress code the artist that come always makes it pack which in my opinion is good. The owner is very involved and was very nice. A very friendly face when going. My go to club when I’m in Scottsdale. If you don’t like being crowded, this club is not for you, but if you like having a great time, I definitely recommend going.; HOMOPHOBIC CLUB‼️ GO TO CAKE OR HI-FI INSTEAD FOR FREE‼️ we have been there a few times with no problems until the owner decided to show up this time. 3 security guards let my whole group in. We get in and the owner tells my very masculine gay friend to follow him. I watch him take her outside and tell her she can’t come back. I asked him and he says oh she was rude and I was going to give her a shirt (because apparently both of her shirts were not allowed but no other club in OT  had a problem with it and neither did the 3 11:11 guards who let us in and charged us) but that never once happened. He approached her and asked her to follow him and she was confused but followed immediately. He lied through his yellow teeth and said she was disrespectful when she wasn’t whatsoever. Don’t waste your money here EVERY OTHER CLUB in old town has been accepting and kind. This weird owner lied and even his own guards thought it was messed up but didn’t say anything else to keep their jobs I’m sure. Can’t wait to report fraud to out banks for the cover fee!; Great club, great music, great atmosphere. My group and I had an awesome night.  Everyone was dressed well so don’t show up looking like you just came off the street. I will be returning.; Great experience and highly recommend if you're a fan of R&B and hip-hop! Beautiful hosts/bottle girls, great music, plenty of table seating available and the restaurant next door "Well Seasoned" is new and a vibe! I even found parking fairly easy. I didn't have food at 11:11 but the restaurant next door is under the same ownership so 5 stars; Paid $40 to stand in line and it wasn’t even crowded once we got in. The artist basically sat up in the corner & wouldn’t have even know they were there until it was almost time to close & only performed 2 songs and that was it. It’s ok to say you went once but that’s about it.

Address: 7333 E Indian Plaza, Scottsdale, AZ 85251, USA

Address Components: 7333 (street_number); East Indian Plaza (route); South Scottsdale (neighborhood); Scottsdale (locality); Maricopa County (administrative_area_level_2); Arizona (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 85251 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Plenty of nearby parking, fun atmosphere and didn’t take long to enter or get drinks from the bar. I just wish the DJ would have played some songs the regular way instead of mostly EDM mixes. But I had a great time and would return. Definitely made my first trip to Phoenix memorable.; The only reason this is not getting a 5 star rating is because of the lack of attractive men. The pretty girl to ugly guy ratio was out of this world. Other than that the vibes were 10/10 and so was the music.

I highly recommend you get a table so that you are not stuck in the sweltering heat or are forced to go in the pool to cool off.

If you are worried about the pool water just dont go in it. However, the pool was packed to the brim so if you’re not worried about germs than yolo!!!

If you are going on a bach/bachelorette trip than you should 100% be including this in your itinerary. But to my first point, if you are going with single girls do not expect to find a man here.

Can’t forget to mention our security guard, Louis, was absolutely amazing!!! He was so attentive and quick with clearing our table of empty cups and plates.; Love this place, however their scheduling with artists is super off. This issue has already happened a total of three times. My friends and I get there at 12pm, it is Arizona so you know the sun is beating down on you, since it is 100+ degree weather.  The artist didn’t come out until 7:00pm, and we were already exhausted from the heat and decided to leave.  So , for this next time / next artist we opted to go a bit later. Since we did just that, the artist played , and we had missed them. There is never a time when said artist will be playing and it is super frustrating. (You do not get a refund unless you picked to pay extra for any sickness related issues/weather conditions) So all I ask for future events is to have the MAIN artist play time on the flyer that is promoted. I get schedules get delayed etc. If the said artist knows when they’re arriving to the area, and how long their equipment takes to prepare, then there should be a set time to when they will start playing. Definitely will be coming back because of the service and how we are treated, but for future events I hope the venue and artists can do better with scheduling.; This pool was a good time. Drinks are pretty pricy. Water is offered for free but in those big water canisters with everyone’s hands touching it. I opt in to buy $6 waters x 3 since it had a lid and was more hygienic. Bathrooms were clean and plenty. Staff is tentative and responsive. The water was a bit murky, couldn’t really see your feet but our group didn’t have issues after our visit.; Charged us $200 for their “house champagne”. The waitress was just like “yeah…” when I questioned her about the twist top $200 champagne bottle.

Reviews:
The crowd was there! The atmosphere was there! But whoever was DJing tonight was trash . He wasn’t playing danceable music. Blue face, Kodak, and obscure tracks. Everyone was standing around waiting for THAT song. But it never came. Not one song was danceable. And we paid a $20 cover. So much potential but delivered so little.; They false advertised, kept promoting this event and highlighting that PartyNextDoor was going to perform. We were there the whole night waiting for him to come out, they kept telling us he’s “on his way” & making us believe he was still coming. Imagine the look on my face when the lights turned on & everyone started heading out… & on top of that, none of this has been addressed. Something could’ve happened that made him unavailable but regardless, no one has reached out to us regarding the event or our tickets. So it all just looks and sounds messy. Doesn’t seem like they have any plans of making this right since they deleted their Instagram post that was promoting this specific event. Too many complaints maybe? We just want our money back!!!; Music is always terrible. They need a new DJ. I don't understand why clubs don't evolve. This is a new club but they're giving the same dry experience we have always gotten from clubs. Wish they could have been creative and did something new. There's nowhere to sit but VIP, drinks are expensive, and bathrooms are single rooms with one toilet.; Giving two stars solely because the bartenders were phenomenal.  Overpriced entry ($20). Very underwhelming experience. You know it’s bad when the hype man and/or DJ can barely get a handful of people to dance and enjoy themselves. Music selection  was more of a miss than a hit. Definitely need to work on that.
I will say this place is very much “for the gram” aesthetic. Nothing else.
Also too small of a place to allow so much smoking.; Truly an amazing venue. Intimate but big for a small place that can easily fit about 350 people with 9 tables for bottle service. Drinks priced for a luxury lounge but expect great bartenders and solid service. Latin and hiphop/top40 is the primary music vibe. Definitely going to throw some shows here in the future.

Lap Lounge: A Speakeasy Gem
Lap Lounge is a hidden gem for cocktail enthusiasts. With a focus on expert mixology and a speakeasy ambiance, it's the perfect place for a unique and memorable night out.

* Dress Code:  Lap Lounge may have a dress code in place, so check before you go.; The place itself is small but cute. The bartender is nice. Name: El Bar Bero
Address: 1507 C. Loíza, San Juan, 00911, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Thursday: 7:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Friday: 7:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 7:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 1507 (street_number); Calle Loíza (route); Santurce (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Parque (administrative_area_level_3); Santurce (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00911 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Amazing cocktails, atmosphere, and service! The actual barber chairs are a fun detail. The bartender is a true artist and there is a huge variety of cocktail options on the menu. We went on a Wednesday night and the kitchen was already closed so we didn’t get a chance to try the food, but looked like they had some good munchies as well. A must stop if you are out in San Juan!; Love the vibe of this speakeasy, the barber shop theme is awesome, every detail was carefully planned. The got a lot of creative cocktails and every single one we tried was tasty. Very attentive staff, cocktails takes their time. Wednesday night was perfect, not crowded at all. Prices not on menu, but expect to pay $13 per cocktail. Parking on the street, credit cards accepted.; I recently had the pleasure of visiting this cool vibe bar in the Conado area, and it exceeded my expectations in every way. From the moment I walked to the front door, they invited me in, even though they weren't open yet. i  I was captivated by the stylish decor and the welcoming atmosphere. The dimly lit interior, coupled with a well-curated playlist, created the perfect ambiance for a night out.

The bar staff was not only attentive but also incredibly knowledgeable about their extensive cocktail menu. I tried their signature drinks, and each one was a delightful blend of flavors and presentation.

What truly set this bar apart was the music. The diverse crowd made for an engaging and fun experience, and I met some interesting people throughout the evening.

Overall, I can't recommend this cool vibe bar enough. Whether you're looking for a romantic date spot or a place to hang out with friends, it offers an unforgettable experience. I can't wait to go back and enjoy the cool vibes, drinks, and music all over again.; Outstanding drinks! Highly recommend, very welcoming, amazing quality cocktails! Thank you so much Jose and Lucas, my experience in PR was enlightened!! Carlos picture was so handsome!! Thank you guys!!!; We've been wanting a cozy, low key neighborhood bar with decent bar food and can't believe we only just found El Bar Bero! I loved the eclectic, vintage barbershop (bero) decor, good lighting & music- but the drink options were what really impressed. They had all the best "original" cocktails- I had the moscow mule & my husband the house manhattan- along with your traditional island drinks, and they were all expertly made. The bar is really the main attraction of the room, and for good reason- the drinks are perfect!

While this isn't a restaurant (so don't expect a server/ you go to the bar to order) they do serve a few food items and again, exceeded our expectations. The fish tacos were delicious and the chicken/sausage sliders- something the door man recommended- were not only tasty but really original. The bill was like $40- which is hard to beat...! We're super excited to have this great local option so close to home!!!
.
(Broc did have an issue with there not being soap in the men's bathroom, but I'm still giving 5 stars (the women's did!) bc I doubt that's the norm...)

Really cool, quiet place to hang out. Pool tables, Domino's, friendly people and good drinks. Definitely recommend; It was a nice billiards bar with cheap drinks. I’m only giving 2 stars because the hours are inconsistent and not what Google says.

We went at 6pm and they weren’t open till 8. Went another day and they were completely closed. Call ahead of time; My visit to the "Ready Go" bar lounge in Calle Loíza, Isla Verde, Puerto Rico was an absolute delight. This hidden gem offered the perfect combination of chill vibes and entertainment.

The moment I stepped into "Ready Go," I was welcomed by a relaxed and inviting atmosphere. The lounge's decor exuded a trendy yet comfortable ambiance, making it an ideal place to unwind with friends or even solo. The dimmed lighting and cozy seating added to the overall laid-back feel.

One of the standout features of "Ready Go" was the presence of pool tables. They provided a fantastic source of entertainment and camaraderie. Playing a few rounds of pool with friends while enjoying our drinks made for a memorable evening. The lounge had a friendly and welcoming crowd, making it easy to strike up conversations and meet new people.

The bar's drink selection was impressive, offering a variety of cocktails, beers, and spirits to suit different tastes. The bartenders were skilled at crafting delicious concoctions, and their service was top-notch.

What set "Ready Go" apart for me was its ability to balance the excitement of a bar with the comfort of a lounge. Whether you're looking to socialize, enjoy a game of pool, or simply relax and chat with friends, this place has you covered.

Overall, "Ready Go" in Isla Verde, Puerto Rico, is a fantastic destination for those seeking a laid-back yet vibrant atmosphere. The combination of chill vibes and pool tables makes it a standout spot for a fun night out on the town. I'll certainly be returning to soak in the great ambiance and enjoy the company of fellow patrons.; Great Spot. Great People. Best Ambiance on Loiza st. Excellent service.; Very simple experience, no frills, exactly what you pay for and not mad about it

Reviews:
This is the spot. Dive bar vibes that attracts all the characters and straight crushes it service wise. No frills nonsense great spot for meeting new friends. Luis kills it behind the bar!!!!; Cool punk bar in Old San Juan with graffiti and stickers littering the walls. Love the bar cat and diorama someone made of the bar itself inside. Not a huge drink list, but you're there for the vibe anyway. They have a pool table in back and let you smoke at the bar... which is great if you're a smoker and sucks if you aren't, so chose your own adventure!; Spent several hours here getting away from the heat and enjoying some ice cold beers! Super cool spot with writing covering the walls and even the ceiling.

Bianca was bartending and was a pleasure to chat with about the bar, OSJ, and the island in general. Showed us her photo album from her travels around PR and it was stunning.

Last but not least, there's a cat that wanders in and out of the bar named Cleo! (even has an insta). Tough luck if she takes your spot at the bar, but she's the boss.; Cool atmosphere. Nice music. Loved the cat at the bar.

Took way too long to get drinks. Only 2 bartenders on a Sunday. One was preparing many drinks, the other one was new and ignored us. Prices are definitely higher than most bars, but the place was mostly full of tourist, so they wouldn’t know.; El Batey Bar is way up there on my list of best dive bars in the world. It's a very cool mess. And you can't beat the $5 beer and a run shot combo. Definitely worth a stop if you're on a pub crawl in San Juan.

🇵🇷 This is for a review of the bar in the middle of Callejón Tanca that’s painted yellow and has a couple of steps in front. It doesn’t serve food (except when one of the ladies brings Alcapurrias from home) and it has a slamming JUKEBOX with the BEST SOUND SYSTEM!!! Every Puerto Rican hit from the Fania All-Stars is there. Bomba y Plena, Salsa, Santana, Roberto Roena, Celia Cruz, you name it, it’s on their jukebox.

They place Rubbermaid chairs in front and people from the neighborhood gather here on quiet afternoons to enjoy the camaraderie, music, an ice-cold Medalla and the breeze from the ocean 🌊 .

Thank you to the owner! 💐 💐 💐 Your jukebox brought me a lot of joy.; Could have better option for dinner.
Didn't serve Rice and Beans after 8pm.
Was not too great of a meal.
But the atmosphere and music was awesome.; This is where the locals hang out on Sunday from noon until late at night. Salsa, cha cha cha, guajira, plena, bomba and all
Kinds of afro-caribbean music to enjoy. Beers, cocktails and delicious puertorican food.; Slow, bad service. Overpriced for the kind of food that is served. Was expecting more, the server had an attitude. Will not.return and neither recommend it.; I love this place!!!

Name: Los 3 Cuernos
Address: 359 C. de San Francisco, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

Reviews: This bar was pretty cool, the bartenders were nice and personable. I got the most basic of basic : vodka soda and a medalla, can't go wrong. Atmosphere is cool, they have a bucket of things to decorate dollar bills with and add them to the wall, we put a T-Shirt shaped dollar up. It's worth the stop :); I absolutely LOVED this bar! It was soooo beautiful; not to mention, Miguel was the best bartender I’ve ever met!! He took great care of my bf and I for my 21st birthday this week! There are various shot flavors that will knock your socks off! Will be returning soon :); Used to be cooler before renovation. They make it out as if they were nice but me and my friends were inviting rounds, the exact same and got charged different prices, it will all depend on much the bartender fancies you. Or they add tip to the total, when I was already tipping generously. And by the time they close they want you gone in seconds, it doesn’t matter if you’re confused, drunk, talking, they will get in your face, grab you by the arm so that you leave. And as a person that has been assaulted that was super triggering, when I reacted as I got startled at being grabbed and said whats going on, dude got aggressive and shouting at me. Worst experience at a bar in a while.; Place is awesome but service took forever to get served by bartender, there was literally like 4 people seated at the bar if I wasn’t because I said something I probably would’ve never got served to be honest I should’ve left then before leaving I ordered a beer to go and after charging me I sat there like 5 to 8 mins waiting for her to grab my beer knowing I was leaving .; Favorite bar in all of PR so far. Always the nicest staff. They keep the drinks coming like no other. Thousands of artistic dollars on the walls. Great music and vibes. You gotta experience it. San Banito drink is fire!

Name: Casa de Montecristo Puerto Rico
Address: 201 Calle del Cristo, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Thursday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Friday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Saturday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Sunday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM

Reviews: This place has such a vibe! A must visit if you are a cigar aficionado. Beautiful ambiance and their servers are very attentive.  Lovely experience.  I am a member of Casa de Montecristo in New Jersey. I'm happy we visited this spot.; The atmosphere is awesome, drinks are great and selection of cigars, perfect. Me and my husband always stop here when in PR; Absolutely love this cigar lounge! They are so knowledgeable and professional and will help you choose the perfect cigar. The lounge is beautiful and trendy. The cocktails were delicious and the music set the perfect tone to a good evening. Can't wait to go back and visit!; An absolute must if you are in San Juan. The artistry and craftsmanship displayed by these bartenders is second to none. Great selection of cigars and the atmosphere is perfect.; Excellent service. The servers were attentive and accommodating. The atmosphere is very chilled and I really liked the vintage charm. Hope to visit again when we come back to old San Juan.

Address: 153 C. de San Sebastián, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

Reviews:
- Drinks are really good and cheap, $10 for a medium Guava Margarita that comes with a ring candy.
- Pretty good vibe although gets a little too crowded on late hours of the night, and its a small space.
- Music keeps repeating over and over. Would recommend to bar hop.
- Street parking only.
- Cobble stoned narrow roads.
- Seemed to be a gay bar? Or just a lot of LGBTQ+ people hanging out at that time.; Great fun vibe and the drinks were amazing I didn’t know they sold food here I brought a mojito with friends my drinks were good and flavorful; The mojitos are delicious must come and have a coconut mojito love ❤️; The best $5 mojitos!!!!!! Good music, food, games and dancing. Super tiny spot though, so if you manage to get a table hang onto it. I prefer this bar to La Factoría across the street. The only complaint is the bathrooms. They don’t have doors on the bathrooms and you have to ask for tissue at the bar.; This place has great but cheap mojitos, especially the tamarind one, which is very tasty. You can also play board games here. It's a fun spot with good drinks, cool music, and a friendly vibe, making it perfect for a fun outing.

Name: Antiguo 26
Address: 261 C. Tetuán, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Thursday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Saturday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Sunday: 5:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Address Components: 261 (street_number); Calle Tetuán (route); San Juan Antiguo (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); San Francisco (administrative_area_level_3); San Juan Antiguo (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00901 (postal_code)
Reviews: We visited from NYC and have been to many bars, but this one is definitely a must-visit. The cocktails are incredible—you can tell they make each drink with real passion. If I’m ever in San Juan again, I’ll definitely be back! The chocolate bacon whiskey cocktail is a must-try. The bar itself is clean and spacious, and the overall vibe is just great. We loved it here!; It’s located in an old soda factory. The historic decor was very nice. They make their own sodas and have creative drinks. Although I did not try their food because the kitchen had already closed, I enjoyed my Piragua drink with banana liquor, my friend’s old fashioned was one of the best and I enjoyed reading their interesting soda menu. I will be returning and recommend.; Probably one of the best cocktails i have had. We had 4 diff cocktails and they were all excellent! The details and ingredients of cocktail was next lvl; You will have a mixologists experience here. Mixologist are wonderful. Sit at the bar and you will find out as they prepare the cocktails. Place is away from the crowded places. You may have to walk a little around to find it.; Drinks were amazing and the atmosphere is beautiful and relaxed. If you're looking for a fancy cocktail with every little detail carefully planned out, this is the place. I had the rum old fashioned and it may have been the best drink I had in my week in Old San Juan. It's a bit pricey, but well worth a look if craft cocktails are your thing.

Name: The Red Monkey
Address: 252 C. de la Cruz, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM; Friday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Saturday: 2:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Sunday: 3:00 – 11:30 PM
Vicinity: 252 Calle de la Cruz, San Juan
Address Components: 252 (street_number); Calle de la Cruz (route); San Juan Antiguo (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Catedral (administrative_area_level_3); San Juan Antiguo (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00901 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Watch your money and don't get scammed by the girl with long black hair !

1 star because they will cheat you out of your tip!! She (with the long black hair) asked how much tip on the CC? I said 15% for 1 drink, she takes 30% 😂

I don't care about the $2 she pocketed but it's the principal!! So I asked her why did you take more tiip, what did you think I said? She answers 18%....but it's more like 30%!!!

You bet I took what she tried to pocket 🤪
Don't insult people's intelligence!!

Again watch your money especially when paying by CC!!; Overall experience to be just average. While the beer and drinks were decent, the service left much to be desired. The staff seemed indifferent and inattentive, which dampened the enjoyment of an otherwise okay selection of beverages. Unfortunately, I wouldn’t recommend it based solely on the service.; Delicious food! Burgers, chicken, and padtelillos were awesome. A really nice low key vibe on a busy day in Old Saun Juan.; It's what we call a "Hole In The Wall" Back home, and it didn't disappoint. We caught an Uber twice from Condado to Old San Jaun just for the food. The owner and service were equally as nice. Place is very laid back, a hidden gem💎. The wings and chicken on a stick were amazing. The house Sangria is a definite must try here too😉.; We came across this bar by pure chance, we were just looking for a place to get out of the rain after spending the day in Old San Juan. We were just gonna have a drink and wait for the rain to pass, boy we ended up staying almost 4 hrs there ..lol,  You cant beat there house drink, Mojitos and the price 2 for $10. We also weren't gonna eat , but we ordered a Cuban sandwich and we highly recommend it...The atmosphere and the staff is what made us stick around. The building is very historic and were fascinated by it...:)

Name: Monostereo
Address: 150 C. de San Sebastián, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

Reviews: Everything great about a dive bar, with too much charm to really qualify as a dive bar.  We loved this place and its great cocktails.  Great atmosphere to pop into as you’re in old San Juan.; This is probably the best bar in the area. Owner is fantastic, drinks are refreshing and FRESH. He madee a virgin lime/passion fruit drink and it was one of the best drinks I've ever had. FANTASTIC place. So chill and such a vibe.; The music and lighting with the location and looks sets the perfect vibe. Our bartender was friendly and made great drinks! Definitely a spot we will return to our next visit to the island; Great food great drinks. A DJ does the music some nights. The best Mojito in Old San Juan. Play board games or Nintendo games while you enjoy drinks and people and music. Don't forget the back where you can enjoy an open patio under the stars.; This was our favorite dance bar in all Puerto Rico! We got so lit! The music was so true to Puerto Rico, it’s the total Puerto Rico experience media puts out there! The raggaeton, the drinks, the humidity!!!! Such a vibe, our best night 🙌🏼

Name: Nono's
Address: 100 C. de San Sebastián, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Tuesday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Wednesday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Thursday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM

Reviews:
We saw this bar/restaurant returning from the Castillo San Felipe del Morro, we went inside just for one drink and we ended up having 5 drinks and some appetizers. The Mojitos are great specially the coconut with maracuya.; The bartender was a little surly at first but seemed to warm up by the time we were ready to leave. My husband was really interested in local brews and rum selection so maybe we asked too many questions. Hahaha. Prices are on the high side but the cuban sandwich was pretty good and the atmosphere is nice.; Nonos at old San Juan is a cozy lil bar/rest, drinks are cold and the atmosphere is great, located conveniently in the heart of old San Juan just steps from the old Spanish fort and other local attractions,; Great drinks. This is a tradition for my fiancé and I. We will never stop coming here when in Puerto Rico. Service is great, drinks are strong and food is delicious. Also unsure on why everyone has bad experiences with the bartenders, they’ve always been great to us and even recommend and small talk with us.; A bar located deep in old San Juan.
A little pricey compared to other bars.
It is on the corner of a street across from a small square (piazza).
Stayed for a few drinks. The bartender Luis was a good guy (took him a little bit to warm up to us).

Name: The Mezzanine
Address: 156 2nd Floor, Sol St, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 4:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 2:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 2:00 PM – 12:00 AM

Reviews:
Staff was super attentive and nice! The little bites were both really good. Loved the crostini with brie and all the drinks. Great place to go if you want some quietness or smaller place to drink in the party area; What a beautiful spot to go to. The place just oozes old school fancy coolness. With the high ceilings and large windows with balconies you definitely feel transported to a different time. The cocktails were great and the food was very good. The carnitas taco was surprisingly good. Will make this a go to spot everytime I go to PR. Get the Pappas Bravas; We had a delicious breakfast. Ray took great care of us! We'll be back

Came back for the piña colada festival and had another great time here!; The carnita tacos and margarita pizza were to die for. My grapefruit cosmo was perfectly mixed and had an amazing flavor. The atmosphere is very chill and comfy and great for relaxing after a long day.; Go to this place!  It will make you feel like you are in a place way far away from home.  The espresso martini is legit the best I’ve ever had.  It is the bartenders special recipe.

Name: Moreno Spot Bar & Grill
Address: 361 C. Tetuán, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM; Thursday: Closed; Friday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 12:00 – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 12:00 – 9:30 PM
Address Components: 361 (street_number); Calle Tetuán (route); San Juan Antiguo (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); San Francisco (administrative_area_level_3); San Juan Antiguo (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00901 (postal_code)
Reviews:
First time in Puerto Rico and just happened to stumble onto this place. Everything was great!!! No complaints. I have the mofongo and rice beans!!! Give it a shot!!!; My husband and I, came to San Juan from New York for the first time to celebrate his birthday. Moreno Spot was my favorite place to eat, out of all the places we went to. We went there twice during our trip.

The Pina colada was refreshing and tasty! I recommend the steak stuffed fried plantain, and the Tirita sampler. The serving portion is good and the food is packed with flavor. I’m Jamaican and I can tell when food is seasoned perfectly!

Our server Gigi was awesome! She was friendly and made us feel welcomed. She even have us try shots of this pomegranate flavored drink. It was amazing and had my tastebuds dancing. We’re looking forward to coming back to Moreno on our next trip back to San Juan.; The people here were so nice. We had a giant group of people with us for my mother in laws birthday and they went out of their way to accommodate us and they even surprised us and sang to my mother in law. Food was awesome and bartender was funny and great to talk to.; Great place! Stopped by on the Carnival Magic. They have outdoor and Indoor seating. The hookah and pins coladas are great. Check them out! Bathrooms were also nice and clean. Service also very fast and friendly. In walking distance to cruise port.; GO SOMEWHERE ELSE. The food was okay, there is better around the area. Prior to paying I was given an itemized receipt, it said the food total was $70. I gave the waitress a cash tip after the payment and asked for a receipt. I didn’t realized until I got back to the hotel, that the food total was $50 something dollars and the waitress had automatically added tip but listed it as a food item in the original receipt. Run if you don’t want to get scammed and want to have better tasting food.

Name: EDĒN
Address: 99 Calle del Cristo, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Tuesday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Wednesday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Thursday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Friday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM

Reviews:
They're cool until you want to pay with a card and they have a $20 minimum. We have them $40+ cash but wanted one more beer and a water, but they wouldn't honor us.

Don't waste your time. Cool until you're not.; Good cocktails and decoration. A/C is a plus in a hot day.  Good music and atmosphere. Very clean bathroom. They have sandwichitos de mezcla for sale, a must!!!!!
Overall, great for a refresh and some A/C, however, drinks are expensive.; What a perfect stop for a drink and some air conditioning! The traditional music and clean environment created the perfect place for us to take a break from walking up and down streets and grab a drink, piña coladas to be specific. They were delicious and the bartender was incredibly friendly and kind. We thoroughly enjoyed our time in this modern bar and would recommend it to anyone!; Great stop on a walk in a hot day. The air conditioning works GREAT!

Real cute inside.

Area set up in the back to chill & play games.

Bartender quiet but very pleasant.

Got the Empanada & Malta $6 special.
Malta was nice & cold.
Empanada just ok. Something to put on my stomach.

Yep...I'd come back.; This review is for the people like me who read the bad reviews and didn’t believe in them.
I bought a vodka tonic and a tequila sunrise, when I ask for the total the bartender said it was 38 dollars, after that my friend scanned the menu and both drinks were supposed to be a total of 23 dollars, I don’t know what’s their deal but my second step after the review will be reporting them to DACO, I recommend everyone scammed there to do the same, not for the money but to save other ppl from being in the same situation. Update: there you got the picture of the 2 receipts each for 2 drinks, the 43.70 have 15% tip (because I still appreciate employees)

Address: FV7P+94F, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 – 9:00 PM; Tuesday: 12:30 – 11:00 PM; Wednesday: 12:30 – 11:00 PM; Thursday: 12:30 – 11:00 PM; Friday: 12:30 – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Sunday: 12:00 – 11:30 PM
Address Components: FV7P+94F (plus_code); San Juan Antiguo (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Marina (administrative_area_level_3); San Juan Antiguo (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00901 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Cafe Darsenas Puerto Rico: A Taste of Tradition and Excellence

Located in the heart of Puerto Rico, Cafe Darsenas is a beloved establishment that has been serving up delicious coffee and pastries for decades. With its charming atmosphere, friendly staff, and high-quality products, Cafe Darsenas has become a staple in the community and a must-visit destination for locals and tourists alike.

One of the things that sets Cafe Darsenas apart from other cafes is its commitment to tradition. The cafe sources its coffee beans from local farmers, ensuring that each cup of coffee is not only delicious but also supports the local economy. The beans are roasted in-house, using traditional methods that have been passed down through generations. This attention to detail and dedication to quality is evident in every sip of coffee, making Cafe Darsenas a favorite among coffee connoisseurs.

In addition to its exceptional coffee, Cafe Darsenas also offers a wide selection of pastries and baked goods that are made fresh daily. From flaky croissants to decadent cakes, there is something for everyone to enjoy. The cafe's pastry chefs are skilled artisans who take pride in their craft, creating treats that are as beautiful as they are delicious. Whether you're in the mood for a sweet treat or a savory snack, Cafe Darsenas has you covered.

But it's not just the food and drink that make Cafe Darsenas special – it's also the atmosphere. The cafe is cozy and inviting, with comfortable seating and a warm, welcoming ambiance. Whether you're meeting a friend for coffee or simply taking a moment to relax and unwind, Cafe Darsenas provides the perfect setting. The staff is friendly and attentive, always ready to make recommendations or strike up a conversation. It's this personal touch that keeps customers coming back time and time again.

In conclusion, Cafe Darsenas Puerto Rico is a true gem in the world of cafes. With its commitment to tradition, high-quality products, and welcoming atmosphere, it's no wonder that this establishment has become a beloved institution in the community. Whether you're a coffee lover, a pastry enthusiast, or simply looking for a place to relax and enjoy good company, Cafe Darsenas has something for everyone. So next time you find yourself in Puerto Rico, be sure to stop by Cafe Darsenas for a taste of tradition and excellence.; Extremely rude young woman working the kiosk. We were greeted with “What?” We ordered 2 pina coladas and when it was time to pay she just stared at us. I had to ask what the total was and then she threw my change at me. I was beyond shocked.; A relaxing place in front of San Juan Bay.
Great experience, great drinks, friendly
personnel.
I do recommend Cafe Darsenas.; 🇵🇷 A charming simple open-air kiosk with bar stools encircling their “Pagoda-like” structure. There are some picnic tables nearby to sit at too.

It’s set in a small park with shade trees overlooking beautiful San Juan Bay  known as “Plaza Darsena” (dar sane ah) it sits beside all of the cruise 🚢 ships.

They’re lone bartender can provide: ;
Terrific Rum Punch 🍷 , Soda’s 🥤 and Beer 🍺., Coffee ☕️ Hard Liquor 🥃 and simple bar snacks like potato chips. It’s kind of a hidden gem, it’s calm and relaxing, totally chilled out  - never rowdy,

Cart vendors nearby sell Fried Puerto Rican savory treats and other local treats , try one! Perhaps a Bacalaito (bah cah lah ee toe) it’s a codfish fritter. Tastes like a pancake version of KFC’s Fried Chicken batter,  it’s not fishy tasting at all!!! 🇵🇷

Reviews:
I saw William Cepedo at Alegria on January 4, 2024. The concert was wonderful. The sound at Alegria is excellent! Really good sound engineering. I saw Luisito Quintero at Alegria the following night, on January 5, 2024, and it was another great concert. There was just enough room to dance and we danced the night away. Small salsa and jazz clubs like Alegria are special and much needed.; I discovered Alegria Bistro in San Juan and I was impressed,
Live music adds a very special touch. Definitely a place to return and I will definitely do so.
Attention 10 out of 10

Reviews:
Loved the vibes at this bar. The bartenders were super helpful and chill. They have cheap Jell-O shots and drink deals. I am glad my friends and I stopped here when we visited.; I wish I could give this place a 0 star. I asked why they let certain people in and not others. The person in charge of the line proceeds to say you’re not going in. If you’re not from PR I wouldn’t recommend this place. There’s an obvious bias.
Bartenders refused to serve us. I don’t recommend any LGBTQIA+ to come. You will not be welcomed.; A very crowded place! I may not be the right audience for this, but I wanted to get to know one of the most popular bars in the area, there were no type of services and the bartenders I think they could use a little extra help for the busy nights...; Loved this bar! My husband and I came here for a post dinner drink and left after 3 rounds of mixed drinks and shots with friendly patrons at the bar. The place has a fantastic vibe!! The type of energy that draws you in and makes you keep the night alive! Dianna ( I believe her name was Dianna but considering the loud music I may have got that mixed up, if so, lo siento senorita :) ) the bar tender, was absolutely incredible!!! If you are in Old San Juan and considering a trip to La Sombrilla...Rosa, find a way and let the good times roll!; Sergio was an awesome bartender!

The place is warm and cozy, and is the place to visit for a laidback hangout. Great deals on drinks! And you better trey their authentic chichaitos!

Reviews: Amazing rooftop bar/restaurant! Wonderful bartenders! Giovanni, Oswell, Rene are super!! The drinks are yummy and the atmosphere is great!!! The music needs a little help. Some of the songs are so boring, it almost puts you to sleep. Might want to add some 70’s 80’s classics. Or something that meets the dynamic of your patrons.; Gio was amazing! Cocktails were super delicious and the service was impeccable. One of the best views In San Juan; Everything we ordered was amazing in terms of food the staff was great. We were expecting it to be more lively in terms of crowd and music but it was a bit dead as per our expectations. Food was great so it’s recommended.; The drinks and bar tenders are incredible but the music on the rooftop terrance is horrendous. I feel like this music is elevator music and doesn’t stimulate a creative environment. If the music were to be modernized, it would attract both a younger crowd and increase revenue. Please change the atrocious music.; Super chill atmosphere with the best view and literally the most talented mixologist we encountered in all of PR

Reviews:
We had come and stayed at la Terraza the hotel next door and this bar is conveniently located to the side. This bar honestly has the best mojitos I’ve had in San Juan, the coconut mojito is delicious. They sell little snacks like empanadas and they are great. The bartender made us feel right at home and people are coming in and out of this cute little bar so it’s a great place to experience old San Juan while having a drink y empanadas.; Worst trained bartender ever. 20 minutes per drink. For rum and juice!
Didn’t know to muddle the mint in a mohijto. Or to use sugar. Put salt into a rum and seltzer instead of seltzer. And overcharged like crazy.  Avoid this ripoff watering hole.; Ridiculously tiny bar of the street,  great barman; Wifi available;

Reviews: FINALLY went down to visit La Perla through the recommendation of two bartenders - Ci ci (who works at La Garita at La Perla and Brickhaus in the city) and John (from Saoco bar). They both ensured that La Perla is safe to go to but has gotten a bad rap from some other bars who were jealous when the video "Despacito" was filmed there and people started to come in droves to see where the video was filmed. My husband and I chose to go to La Garita (restaurant) and just the walk there was BEAUTIFUL!  Give it a try and DO NOT be afraid bc its just an intimidation tactic. You'll be fine and have a great time looking at the views.; The best view of the water!! Full bar, nice staff; It was great had a good time also see a lot artists can't complain l.; Beautifl place, friendly people and GREAT AWESOME 80S music; One of the best spots in LA Perla. Love it

Name: Escambrón Beach Club
Address: Parque del Tercer Milenio, FW86+QCP, C. San Agustín, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico

Reviews:
Escambrón Beach Club is a popular destination for locals and tourists alike in San Juan, Puerto Rico. Situated on the beautiful shores of the Caribbean Sea, this beach club offers a range of amenities and activities for visitors to enjoy. However, despite its popularity, some may argue that Escambrón Beach Club is just an okay beach, especially considering the $5 entrance fee.

One of the main reasons why some may consider Escambrón Beach Club to be just an okay beach is the fact that there is an entrance fee of $5. While this may not seem like a significant amount, especially for tourists who are used to paying for beach access in other destinations, it can be a deterrent for some visitors. Many people believe that beaches should be free and open to the public, and having to pay for access can take away from the overall experience.

Additionally, some may argue that the amenities and activities offered at Escambrón Beach Club are not worth the entrance fee. While the beach club does have facilities such as restrooms, showers, and picnic areas, as well as rental equipment for water sports, some visitors may feel that these amenities are not enough to justify the cost. In comparison to other beaches in the area that offer similar amenities for free, Escambrón Beach Club may not stand out as a top choice for beachgoers.

Furthermore, the beach itself may not be as impressive as other beaches in Puerto Rico. While the water is clear and the sand is soft, some visitors may find that the beach is crowded and lacks the natural beauty that they were expecting. The presence of the beach club and the surrounding buildings can also take away from the natural charm of the area, making it feel more like a commercialized beach experience rather than a peaceful retreat.

Despite these criticisms, Escambrón Beach Club does have its merits. The beach club is well-maintained and clean, and the staff are friendly and helpful. The location is also convenient, with easy access to parking and nearby restaurants and shops. For those who are looking for a beach experience with amenities and activities, Escambrón Beach Club may still be a good choice, even with the $5 entrance fee.

In conclusion, Escambrón Beach Club may be considered just an okay beach by some due to the entrance fee and the overall beach experience. While the amenities and location are convenient, the beach itself may not be as impressive as other beaches in the area. Ultimately, whether or not Escambrón Beach Club is worth the; On vacation from Ohio, and we loved this beach, a must go when in Puerto Rico 🇵🇷; Love this place. This was our go to for a beach. Clear blue water with our own private lagoon. They have a place where you can rent snorkel and scuba gear. Clean restrooms and showers.; The water is crystal clear, beautiful view of the ocean.   Great place to snorkel.   Parking is only 5 bucks.   Real bathrooms on site no Ed's heads.   People mind there own and are beyond helpful and friendly.   Always a great time at this beach.   A must 👀; Beautiful beach!!! The water is clear and warm. Excellent view. Plenty of parking. Don't make the mistake I did and buy a Pina colada on the beach. They taste awful and cost $10. The owner had the nerve to argue with me because I told him it tasted awful to his face. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!!

Super friendly staff and a very comfortable vibe.; Our server Luis was great. Great music good food, good drinks, great spot. Highly recommended.; Delicious food, even took a plate back to hotel. View of the beautiful water and good music! Awesome service second visit!!; Luis was honestly the highlight of our trip!! Great food, location and people. The only stop I have to return to next time in PR!!; I love the great local vibe here will be returning

Name: Aquí Se Puede
Address: 50 C. de San Justo, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: 1:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 1:00 – 10:00 PM

Reviews:
Walked past this bar on our way to our Airbnb and the atmosphere was so inviting and welcoming. My friends and I went in for drinks and the owner was very friendly and the drinks were great. We loved it, wish we could have gone back!; Cozy bar with great drinks! The bar has a cozy rustic feel to it. It was quieter than the highly rated bar down the street possibly because they don’t have HH. But we enjoyed the more relaxed vibe here. The drinks were also fantastic especially the Gin Cucumber and Santo Mezcal.

One star off due to lack of transparency on the pricing. Some drinks were $15 to our surprise when we got the bill.; The owner is rude, disrespectful, racist and arrogant. I went into this establishment to use the bathroom while my friends waited by the bar to purchase drinks. He came running after me, yelling and cursing for me to get out! since I didn’t buy a drink. He violently opened the bathroom door while I was about to pull my skirt down. My privacy was invaded and I was forced out. He almost touched me If I didn’t tell him to stop. I truly felt violated and disrespected. Please do not support this place if you respect and care about women.; Bar hopping in Old San Juan and Aqui Se Puede should definitely on your list if you are looking for a cool vibe, awesome drinks, great appetizers, and chill beats. The bartender and waiters provide excellent, friendly, and fast service! Try it and enjoy.....you won't be disappointed.; Cocktails are amazing and the appetizers were yummy too. Passion fruit mojito was the best I've ever had.

Name: Tu Resuelve La Perla
Address: Calle Lucila Silva, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Open 24 hours; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours

Reviews:
I absolutely love all the artwork that was outside painted on the walls of the business. It was very unique, very colorful, very lively and bright. It draws you in immediately once you see the outside.; Stopped here for frozen drinks and they were delicious. The gummy candies they added were a great bonus.; El Resuelve Bar, located in La Perla, Old San Juan, is an absolute must-visit spot for bar hopping and a unique experience that combines delicious drinks, a vibrant atmosphere, and the convenience of finding snacks and groceries all in one place. Here's why you should definitely check it out:

First and foremost, the ambiance at El Resuelve Bar is unbeatable. Nestled in the colorful streets of La Perla, this bar exudes a lively and authentic Puerto Rican vibe. The friendly staff and energetic crowd create a welcoming and inclusive atmosphere, making it the perfect place to unwind and have a great time with friends.

One of the standout features of El Resuelve Bar is its versatility. Not only can you enjoy a wide range of expertly crafted cocktails and local beverages, but you can also find a variety of snacks and groceries conveniently available on-site. This unique combination sets it apart from other bars, allowing you to grab a quick bite or pick up some essentials while enjoying your night out.

The drink menu at El Resuelve Bar is diverse and impressive. From signature cocktails to local favorites, the bar offers a wide selection of drinks to cater to all tastes. The skilled bartenders are passionate about their craft and can whip up creative and refreshing concoctions that will leave you craving for more. Don't hesitate to ask for recommendations or try their specials of the night!

Moreover, El Resuelve Bar is located in the heart of Old San Juan, making it an ideal spot for bar hopping. You can easily explore the vibrant neighborhood, hopping from one bar to another, and El Resuelve Bar should undoubtedly be on your list. The lively energy and sense of community in La Perla make it a unique and exciting experience.

Lastly, the convenience of finding snacks and groceries at El Resuelve Bar is a definite plus. Whether you're in need of a late-night snack or forgot to pick up some essentials, the availability of these items saves you the hassle of making an extra stop elsewhere.

In conclusion, El Resuelve Bar in La Perla, Old San Juan, is a fantastic choice for bar hopping with friends. The lively ambiance, delicious drinks, and the added convenience of finding snacks and groceries make it a standout destination. Embrace the vibrant energy of La Perla, sip on exquisite cocktails, and enjoy the unique experience that El Resuelve Bar offers.; Prices were reasonable and the lady that helped me was very nice; First time in la Perla and it's a different world down here, this bar was pretty cool, tiny little spot but the beers were ice cold!

Reviews:
Tabú is an absolute gem in Puerto Rico! As a local, I can proudly say that this venue stands out for its unique international vibe and passionate local ownership. The historical significance of this place is undeniable, having hosted countless well-known talents that have graced the stage. The recently revamped building is absolutely stunning, offering a versatile environment that prioritizes safety without sacrificing the incredible experience. Tabú is a must-visit for anyone looking for an unforgettable night out in Puerto Rico. Highly recommended!; Place is on the expensive side for drinks but the inside is clean and looks proper for a club. Sound is proper, lights are proper, VIP is nice. Large building. Good security.; I would give them 10 stars if available!!!! As soon as I entered this nightclub I knew it was going to be GREAT! The staff is super friendly from the guards in the entrance, to the bartenders, to the owner... All of them made sure we had a great time! The drinks are awesome and the price can't be beat!!! I highly recommend this nightclub if you want to have a great local puertorrican experience!; Needs to be upgraded . Needs more restrictions on minors. Poor bathroom areas needs more security.
Needs local restaurants an ATM nearby. Looks creepy. Dark alleys.
Update...hopefully it does upgrade after all the problems the other weekend.; It was super comfortable!! I had a blast!

Name: Old San Juan
Address: FV8J+RJ6, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico
Address Components: FV8J+RJ6 (plus_code); San Juan Antiguo (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Catedral (administrative_area_level_3); San Juan Antiguo (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00901 (postal_code)
Reviews: I love the old world charm and architecture of the city. We arrived by cruise ship so we didn’t have much time but really left impression on us. We went on a mini tour lots of monuments. Also stop by the birthplace of the piña colada. We want to come back for a longer stay so much more to explore.; We LOVED our day in Old San Juan. Lots of eating and drinking and shopping. The people were super friendly. Great fun way to spend a day.; Old San Juan is a really nice place to visit and there are a lot of stores and restaurants to enjoy. The colorful  buildings and surrounding scenery are very pleasant. The cobble stone streets are really unique but not always maintained. Just be aware that this area caters to tourists so the prices can be several times higher than at local stores. The stores also close by five or six in the afternoon. There are usually plenty of police officers around to provide security.; So nice; The weather was amazing and it was nice to see different historical landmarks

Name: La Vergüenza Viejo San Juan
Address: 280 Calle Norzagaray, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Thursday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Friday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 11:00 AM – 12:00 AM
Address Components: 280 (street_number); Calle Norzagaray (route); San Juan Antiguo (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); San Cristóbal (administrative_area_level_3); San Juan Antiguo (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00901 (postal_code)
Reviews: We were recommended this restaurant by several people and we finally decided to give it a try and it met our expectations. Our server Andres/Anardy was amazing. We ordered every single dish he recommended and we were not disappointed! And let’s not forget the great view.; Went with a large group and the accommodated… even though we had to climb all the way to the 3rd floor (only issues for couple of older folks). Good Puertorican food and service was good (like most restaurants in San Juan… orders take time to serve).; The staff are very nice and rather quick to get your food to you. I was a bit disappointed by the Mofongo because it could have used more of the base soup/sauce to balance the starch. This is a preference thing rather than a quality concern. Quality wise, the shrimp were well cooked, the seasoning was great, and the mashed plantain was exactly how I imagined it would be! The portion was also plentiful at $23 to be split with my friend and for us to be satisfied. The atmosphere was okay, though there are three floors to choose from and the first floor wasn’t my favorite.; Great vibes, amazing views and the food and drinks were superb.  Could have stayed on the rooftop bar for hours without knowing.; Decided to stop by after watching a few vlogs that recommended La Vergüenza and it did not disappoint. Our waiter was very welcoming and helpful. Unfortunately their light was out on our visit so certain foods were off the menu. But we still had great options. The passion fruit mojito was very good with real passion fruit, to eat we had the octopus and shrimp salad, mofongo de carne frita and tostones. I definitely recommend if you’re nearby and I wish we would’ve gotten our waiter’s name, very cool guy!

Name: LA FACTORIA
Address: 103 C. de San Francisco, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico
Vicinity: 103 Calle de San Francisco, San Juan

Reviews: You must come here if you’re in Puerto Rico. This is my second time in San Juan and I made it a point to come back to La Factoria. They have three different sections which all give off different vibes and the drinks are just amazing. It was my first time ordering food which was also so delicious. It’s a must try when in the area!; I didn’t order any food. But the drinks are SOLID considering they have one of the best mixologists IN THE WORLD behind the bar. The salsa ATMOSPHERE IS WHERE YOU NEED TO BE IF YOU COME TO PR! Period. Full stop!; The rum punch is the best I’ve ever had. Definitely one of the best bar programs anywhere. Go every day if you can.; The different atmospheres are really nice and innovative but it’s to crowded; Young people committed to their work. They treated us spectacularly, they showed us the place, they told us their story, uuuuffff! Excellent!!! 💯 Recommended!

Reviews:
Nice little bar right on the water in the La Perla neighborhood. Wouldn’t really go at night but was good during the day. Not to much of a selection but good for a cold drink after walking Castillo San Felipe del Morro. Service was friendly. I would return.; One of my favorite spots to watch the surf, right next to The Bowl (which was recently painted by a local artist.) Family owned and operated. Quality food with generous portions & cold drinks. (Try the carne frita with mamposteao, ¡QUE RICO!🍽) Salsa music or DJ on the weekends.🎶❤️🇵🇷🌊🌈; Fantastic view, good drinks, right on the water. Beautiful up and coming community. Totally worth a visit.; Stopped in for lunch. Food was fresh and large portions. Classic American "Chinese" fare. Drinks were awesome.

We were looking for a different place but so glad we found Mundo. Server was very attentive and really seemed like she wanted us to be there.

A truly lovely place.; Beautiful place great people love the vibes ❤️I will be back in the future for sure

Name: Amazónico Night Club
Address: 1855 C. Loíza, San Juan, 00911, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 1855 (street_number); Calle Loíza (route); Santurce (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Parque (administrative_area_level_3); Santurce (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00911 (postal_code)
Reviews: One of the most inefficient clubs I’ve ever seen. Would partially let parties in and leave two or three people outside when they were clearly in a group. No organization whatsoever. Waited 40 minutes at the front of the line with the bouncers staring straight at us, just for them to tell us our friend with shorts couldn’t come in. I understand dress code, but they were letting plenty of people with “tables” in with shorts. This is only one out of countless bars/clubs on this amazing street, don’t waste your time here.; This place has an inside patio’s door that gets open every few seconds, and the music gets out blasting into their neighbors’ homes until 5am some days of the weekend. Between the ultra loud music and the people yelling, this “club” has disrupted the peace of their neighbors (who have been there for generations) in a very disgusting manner. This should be illegal.; from thursday to saturday, they blast reggaeton nonstop all night long right next to where elderly people have resided for decades. shameful and utterly disrespectful; Love this place! 5 stars (but needs better baño situation. Line is always brutall. ppl will buy more liquor if they can pee faster lol); 👍👍👍 not a bad place even with a line waiting to get in I guess if you got the right look they just let you go right in had fun good drinks especially for me not even being from around here home for me is NYC

Name: Marilyn's Place
Address: 100 C. de San Francisco, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: 12:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Wednesday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 12:00 – 9:00 PM; Friday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Saturday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM; Sunday: 12:00 – 6:00 PM
