Reviews: Little hole in the wall with barely 8 bar seats, but decent seating outside. The mojitos were the best we had the entire week in PR. They were boozy, fresh and reasonably priced. The passionfruit mojito wasn't made from concentrate and tasted like paradise in a glass. The bathrooms in the back were cool and worth checking out even if you don't have to go!; Been coming here for many years. Basically a nicely decorated hole in the wall with excellent drinks and comfort food. Dedicated to Marylin, with all sorts of memorabilia decorating the bar. Outdoor tables too. Drinks are made fresh, which is becoming a rare occurrence. Large TV plays concerts and videos, volume in low. Cannot park: you must walk here. It is well worth it. Very relaxing atmosphere with the tiniest bathrooms ever.; Piña Coladas were excellent. Small bar with friendly bartenders. Great alternative to Barrachina for piña coladas if it’s too busy.; Stopped in for Mojitos Mango, Strawberry and Passion fruit. Amazing 👏  strong and lively.  Came back to use tye restroom and order more drinks...love it here!!; A great place for drinks and appetizers either by yourself or with a few friends. Great service and drinks. Friendly and courteous staff. Do not know what to drink, just ask for recommendations and tell them the kind of drinks you like. By the way... they make excellent mojitos!

Name: Bar Catedral Rooftop | Old San Juan
Address: 106 C. San José, San Juan, 00901, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 5:00 – 10:00 PM; Friday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 5:00 – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 106 (street_number); Calle San José (route); San Juan Antiguo (sublocality_level_1); San Juan (locality); Mercado (administrative_area_level_3); San Juan Antiguo (administrative_area_level_2); San Juan (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00901 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Nice rooftop - quite romantic. Views on rooftop are mostly of the catedral next door. They have wonderful cocktails. Mixology worthy.; Met & spoke with chef Chris. She is very passionate about what she does. The fish tiradito is something to rave about. Best dish I have tried on the island. Will return! The atmosphere is such a vibe. Very relaxing.; Every little detail is perfection, from the superb, creative and unique cocktails to the atmosphere, view, and service, this place is a slice of heaven like no other. It’s the ideal place to let go of the day and feel connected to inner joy. You can enjoy killer alcohol free versions of their cocktails that will knock your socks off as well. The food is sublime and prepared perfectly.; Amazing view. Pricey but you are going for the experience not the price right? Service was great. Nice breeze on the rooftop and killer views. Food list is very short so we only did drinks.; Great rooftop!!! You get to enjoy the view while having good bites, great drinks in a fun  ambiance ! You can choose between the bar on the 1st floor (ideal for date night) and the rooftop (layback Afro lounge music).
A little gem to add to your SJ trip 🇵🇷

Name: The Press Box Daiquiri Lounge
Address: 1302 27th Ave, Gulfport, MS 39501, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: 3:00 – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 3:00 – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM; Friday: 3:00 – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 1:00 – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 1:00 – 8:00 PM
Address Components: 1302 (street_number); 27th Avenue (route); Gulfport (locality); Harrison County (administrative_area_level_2); Mississippi (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 39501 (postal_code)
Reviews: It was my birthday and my fiance and i were in town celebrating me. I loved every drink i had. There was also a DJ there by the name of DJ StepDaddy he kept us vibing the entire night. Whenever I'm down again, I will surely be returning!; Best daiquiris on the coast! Great vibe, music, karaoke nights be slamming, outdoor and indoor seating and walking distance to the beach! Got to love small business! Come grab you a daiquiri to go or just enjoy the ambience!; Amazing bar with great vibes great food and drinks; Nice chill spot. Block away from our Airbnb. Dj was playing 90s hip hop all night. We had rode in from Texas. The drinks were good!; We went on karaoke 🎤 night. Amazing singers. Even if you were not all that good, everyone participated and had a great time. Definitely would go back.

Name: Sipps Bar Gulfport
Address: 2218 25th Ave, Gulfport, MS 39501, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Tuesday: 4:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Wednesday: 4:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Thursday: 4:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Friday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Saturday: 4:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Sunday: 4:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Address Components: 2218 (street_number); 25th Avenue (route); Gulfport (locality); Harrison County (administrative_area_level_2); Mississippi (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 39501 (postal_code)
Reviews:
On weekends you can enjoy loud pop/dance music, drag shows, and a packed house or during the week you can relax with more mellow music, just a few regulars, and some fun trivia and game nights. The bartenders are exceptionally friendly and knowledgeable and the atmosphere is pleasantly sedated. The kind of gay bar that you could just hang out at for some company and a nice drink and wouldn't even know it was a gay bar until you started noticing the rainbows dotted around. Where is plenty of parking and outdoor seating around back for when the inside gets a little too exciting.; There can be very rude to their customers who are actually the ones that are paying their checks. I came in with my 83-year-old friend in the bartender was absolutely rude to her and says for the third time what the hell do you want to drink is that the way you should talk to your customer? We will not be back to this nasty place unless they get a new manager to run it or a new owner; Great atmosphere and Mondays are $2 of every drink all day. Karaoke Fridays at 9pm. It's my new favorite place!; Was a good night - they didn't have an early cover but I think when the drag show started there may have been one - the show was fun fast interesting - they do have an outdoor patio bar; This place is fabulous! I always love coming here. It's always a good time.

The only issue I have is with one of the bartenders. I've heard from many people that there is a bartender with red hair that is extremely rude and unprofessional.

Last night I finally had an interaction with him, and now I see why so many people have an issue with him.

I've heard he sometimes does not put liquor in your drink and then charges you for it. Well last night, 2 of my friends and myself had this experience...

I figured people were probably overly drunk and he cut them off and they were upset about it; however, last night my first drink of the night was great, but my 2nd and 3rd drink had ZERO alcohol in it. I made sure to have others taste it to confirm this was the case.

I would give this place a 5 star review if it weren't for this rude bartender inside. The bartender outside was very kind and professional.

I will not be getting my drinks at the inside bar if that rude bartender is working, that's for sure.

Name: Elaine's Place to Be
Address: 1915 31st Ave, Gulfport, MS 39501, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 6:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 8:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 3:00 – 10:00 PM
Address Components: 1915 (street_number); 31st Avenue (route); Gulfport (locality); Harrison County (administrative_area_level_2); Mississippi (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 39501 (postal_code)
Reviews: Elaine's is my go-to nightlife spot to go to on the Mississippi GulfCoast. A fun and safe atmosphere is always maintained.; Mixed feelings here. Its like an upscale dive bar. Margaritas are terrible! I wanted to jump behind the bar and make my own! I suppose you should only order 2 ingredient drinks because my Tito's and soda was ok. Don't ask for an Old Fashioned or Mai Tai here! HOWEVER, the ambiance was super chill and the music was great. There is a dance floor and a restaurant next door that you can get food from for the bar. There seems to be a decent mix of oldsters and youngsters and it seems like a cool place for a group of friends. I will go back on a Thursday or Friday to see what the crowd is like.; I'm from Missouri and have just moved to Gulfport a week ago. A Google search indirectly lead me to awareness of this place. I was ended up on their Facebook page and saw that it was a place for older crowds. Just what I was looking for. I loved my first experience at this lovely place. The staff were very welcoming and friendly. I will definitely be going back and recommending others to come out as well.; They had a R&B it was great. I would recommend a night out for mid 40 to 65 group; Terrible place. But if you like low standard service this is the place for you. Signs everywhere saying no weed and that's all you smell in the back outside. After 11pm the service just collapses. You have to wait for over 30mins to get a drink. They talk to their regulars like they have no one else to serve and 20 people are waiting. They don't care at all. I ordered food and it never came after 1 hr 30 mins. Had to even wait to get my refund. I know in low income areas this is expected so if this doesn't bother you then this is the place for you. I just deman better especially when you have a cover charge. That's a clear sign of a low income club.

Name: Gilligan's Karaoke
Address: 165 Hardy, Courthouse Plaza, Gulfport, MS 39507, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 AM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 AM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 AM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 AM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 AM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 AM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 5:00 AM
Address Components: Courthouse Plaza (route); Gulfport (locality); Harrison County (administrative_area_level_2); Mississippi (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 39507 (postal_code)
Reviews:
An overall enjoyable experience.   The owner makes everyone feel welcome and the drinks aren't expensive.   Gilligan's is fun place to hangout.; Three women from out of town went in this place because one loves to karaoke. Instantly felt out of place. The bartender was very ugly and rude at first but once we ordered and tipped she became more friendly. As soon as we finished our one beer we left. Pool sticks were absolutely horrible. Do not recommend for out of towners.; If you blink, you'd drive right past it, but Gilligan's is a cool, dark respite from the slow Southern heat of south Mississippi. Very low brow and reserved, the crowd leans towards the Retired end of the spectrum. Super friendly staff, the manager even came and introduced himself to me, since he didn't recognize me. There's home-cooked food available for patrons sometimes and live music other times. If you want to relax & unwind and you're okay with the scent of smoke lingering on your clothes, Gilligan's is a comfortable spot to put up your feet and relax.; Awesome 👌 karaoke 🎤 bar. Very fun atmosphere and a very nice bartender and patrons; A small treasure cove of a bar, with reasonably priced bottled beer (no tap) and lots of bottled liquor and booze.

The best thing, for us, was the great karaoke!!!

The owner is a former Brit and her daughter is the bartender.

No kitchen, so no food, hence the one star reduction.

Name: Club Thirty IV
Address: 1925 34th St, Gulfport, MS 39501, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: Closed; Friday: 10:00 PM – 4:00 AM; Saturday: 10:00 PM – 4:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 1925 (street_number); 34th Street (route); Gulfport (locality); Harrison County (administrative_area_level_2); Mississippi (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 39501 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Love their Monthly EDM shows!  Place is very clean and staff is friendly.; I've had mixed experiences with Latin night at this venue. While I appreciate the Mexican bands they bring in, it's always the same lineup and gets repetitive. I'm tired of the high ticket prices ($50+!) and miss the old days when Latin night was more affordable and featured a DJ spinning a variety of music (bachata, merengue, salsa, etc.).

If you're looking for a great example of how to get the party started with Latin music, check out Club Unique in Moss Point. Their DJs know how to create a lively atmosphere that appeals to everyone.

I hope the venue will take customer feedback into consideration and bring back more affordable and DIVERSE Latin night experiences.; **Update as of 22 April 2024 this establishment is still off limits**

Edit: This establishment is still on the off limits list aboard NCBC Gulfport effective 02 Apr 2023.

Club 3IV (34) is an Off Limits establishment for uniformed personnel aboard NCBC Gulfport.

Personal opinion is military bases don't Blacklist establishments that 1 follow the law and 2 promote a positive wholesome atmosphere for its customers.

I hope this establishment is able to make changes to get such a large revenue stream back in its doors whenever the base does a review.; Club was lit as a Christmas Tree, I will return soon!; Really nice place. Staff is pleasant and professional. The sound system is very nice, and the place is clean.

Name: Hot Spot
Address: 1948 E Pass Rd, Gulfport, MS 39507, USA
Address Components: 1948 (street_number); East Pass Road (route); Gulfport (locality); Harrison County (administrative_area_level_2); Mississippi (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 39507 (postal_code)
Reviews: Loved our experience & love their food!! From goodies to biscuits & gravy -- they are all SOOOOO good!!!!; Great dive type bar for live music shows. Casual atmosphere. Staff is friendly. Drink service is decent and quick. Always happy with the live music selection. Any band I have seen play was audience interactive. Don't think they serve food because I have seen people order take out and pizza and eat it inside.; The bar tender Nicole , please be aware of her . And who she is . Ps to the hot spot bar managers please keep this in mind .; Was a fun bar with live music! Bartender was awesome too!; The Hot Spot rocks!! Kirk and crew do a great job keeping the scene alive.

Name: Chill Ultra Lounge
Address: 850 Bayview Ave, Biloxi, MS 39530, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Friday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 5:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 5:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Address Components: 850 (street_number); Bayview Avenue (route); Biloxi (locality); Harrison County (administrative_area_level_2); Mississippi (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 39530 (postal_code)
Reviews: This is a great bar where you will get good service and a great seat for live music.  The bands are always good and not so loud that you can't sit in there and enjoy visiting with friends.; Absolutely loved! The Teacher Take Over After Party with Eddie B! I rented a VIP booth for $125 that was huge and came with a bottle of champagne and 6 cocktails and chocolate covered strawberries! Our VIP waitress Sarah was the bomb!!! So attentive and sweet!; Chas Collins Band played until midnight... The restaurant next to the Chill Bar serves great New Orleans style gumbo at a reasonable price. Free parking inside a garage with every floor handicap accessible.; Awesome place to party, Friendly atmosphere, Really good bands,   Great  Bar tenders One of the best bar tender on  the coast Mr. Lenny; Thursday is ladies night they drink for free until 12 I believe it starts at 9. Tonight they had a live band playing the best hits. They also have a DJ that plays the best hip hop music out there. I recommend a visit on a Thursday. I don't doubt the weekends are short of great. Definitely a must visit

Name: Pub Lounge
Address: 2061 Pass Rd, Biloxi, MS 39531, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Tuesday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Wednesday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Thursday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 10:00 AM – 4:00 AM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 4:00 AM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 AM

Reviews: If i could leave no stars i would . If i could give a negative number i would !  THESE BUMPKINS are so rude .. LETS JUST SAY THE GRANNY AS THE BARTENDER WOULD NOT EVEN SERVE ME WATER. I showed my STATE ID / THE MS MOBILE APP AND SHE COULDNT TAKE MY MS MOBILE APP BECAUSE “IN HER WORDS SHE DIDNT KNOW HOW TO WORK IT”.. please do better WILL NEVER RETURN !; So last night we went to the disturbed concert! We all live in Slidell and go to our regular bar called the pelican pub! Well we were looking up bars and my best friend found one called the pub lounge! Let me just say Mrs.Kay is absolutely wonderful and the regulars were super sweet! If we go back to biloxi soon we are definitely coming back!; Walked in and couldn't see or breathe through all of the smoke. Left and will never return; Very nice people, very good drinks, nice atmosphere. Will come back; Visiting from Orlando and lemme tell ya, I LOVE THIS BAR!  Ms. Kay is a fabulous lady, and one hell of a shot maker! Will definitely be returning to see her.

Name: Neon Moon
Address: 702 Bellande Ave, Ocean Springs, MS 39564, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: Closed; Friday: 7:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Saturday: 7:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 702 (street_number); Bellande Avenue (route); Ocean Springs (locality); Jackson County (administrative_area_level_2); Mississippi (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 39564 (postal_code)
Reviews: I’m a local, and I usually avoid this place because of the cover charge and the false advertising. NEON MOON? BROOKS AND DUNN WOULD BE ASHAMED. **THIS IS NOT WHERE THE COWBOY FOLKS GO TO BOOT SCOOT BOOGIE**THIS IS NOT A COUNTRY BAR. They even put the lyrics on the wall. *commence eye roll* so don’t come here if you wanna rock the jukebox because nobody here wants to hear some Jones. Anyhow it was my girl’s birthday and our inner Whitney Houston’s were dying to dance with somebody. So we went. We all had fun (who doesn’t with alcohol and music) but I’d personally only return if it was a special occasion. I paid WAAAAYYYYY TOO MUCH MONEY FOR MY DRINKS. And entry? How can you not have bathroom staff on deck but you’re gonna charge me a cover? Overall not worth it.; Bathroom is heinous. It feels like a true crime documentary. Drinks are WAY overpriced. “Random gun searches” for all males. My friend made this cute necklace with shooters for her friend who turned  21 and went ALL night with it in her purse after they checked it at the door but all of a sudden when she pulled it out to give it to her it was like TSA. Don’t go here rooftop is way better with cheaper alcohol. Only gave it one star bc zero isn’t an option. Also women can wear whatever they want but god forbid I as a male wear a tank top. ( forced to cover up by security); Drinks are good. Entertainment great!! Definitely for a younger crowd.; The red head girl at the front took my ID and told me it was fake. She would not give it back and told me I had to call the police if I wanted it. I literally had to get the police involved to tell her my ID was in fact real! I will not be returning and I hope she is trained better at her job soon.; Pay 50$ for a new years experience and you can’t even go outside to get fresh air. These people do not care about your experience. Avoid at all costs.

Name: Boogie Nights Biloxi
Address: 777 Beach Blvd, Biloxi, MS 39530, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: Closed; Friday: 10:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Saturday: 10:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Sunday: Closed
Address Components: 777 (street_number); Beach Boulevard (route); Biloxi (locality); Harrison County (administrative_area_level_2); Mississippi (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 39530 (postal_code)
Reviews: I was 18 serving in the U.S. Air Force when I first got mace'd in this club because a few civilians got into a big brawl (No guns were there or shot), and the security staff were quick to remove everyone else to safety. I was kinda laughing at the time because I was in Tech school and we just got out of boot camp where we got trained how to withstand pepper spray by going into the gas chamber......anyways, everyone evacuated the dance floor while me and my buddies (and ex-wife) watched security escort everyone else out lol. Great club pre-katrina, would love to go back someday.; Visited this club because we were there to see Aaron Lewis concert. I've been through this casino many times that I have never noticed it until now. Thanks Aaron. It was booming. A lot of nice-looking ladies and gentleman showed up for fun.; They make their drinks strong for a great price! Nice atmosphere very laid back and no judgement ❤️; Great dance music from back in the day; Fun

Name: Rooney's Irish Pub
Address: 1316 27th Ave, Gulfport, MS 39501, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Tuesday: 3:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Wednesday: 3:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Thursday: 3:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Friday: 3:00 PM – 5:00 AM; Saturday: 3:00 PM – 5:00 AM; Sunday: 3:00 PM – 3:00 AM

Reviews: Best Drinks in Town! Gotta come by and see Tanya! Best bartender around! Love this place.; Tonya is an Awesome bartender and mixes them drinks right!  We had a great time with 2 nights in a row. Nothing but love from the bachlor party from  Ga!; No food here, but has a couple of pool tables and the bartender was awesome. This is a chill spot to grab some beers 🍻 or liquor; Was in town for bachelor party last week..spent 2 evenings here..barmaid tanya was out standing, keeping the drinks flowing and keeping the night alive.; Had a great time here. It was recommended by another patron . I loved it .The bartender did a great job .Good place to have a few and unwind .

Name: Elevate Biloxi
Address: 279 Caillavet St, Biloxi, MS 39530, USA
Address Components: 279 (street_number); Caillavet Street (route); Biloxi (locality); Harrison County (administrative_area_level_2); Mississippi (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 39530 (postal_code); 3043 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews: Congratulations 🍾 to the Biloxi team on a job well done. After 6 months of renovations and countless hours of hard work we wish you nothing but the best in Biloxi. Fun environment, great customer service and the DJs are killing it.; Good music and great drinks. The security and bar staff did a very good job. This is the best nightclub on the gulf coast; My friends and I enjoyed ourselves at Elevate Biloxi. It’s located in close proximity of both the casinos and beach. Friendly environment and great customer service. We will be back soon; Best nightclub on the gulf coast.;

Name: Kelly's Sports Pub
Address: 2608 13th St, Gulfport, MS 39501, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Tuesday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Wednesday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Thursday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Friday: 3:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Saturday: 12:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Sunday: 12:00 PM – 12:00 AM
Address Components: 2608 (street_number); 13th Street (route); Gulfport (locality); Harrison County (administrative_area_level_2); Mississippi (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 39501 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Kelly’s is a full kilt Irish experience located in the heart of Gulfport, MS.
They have several local favorites on the menu, but their in-house buffalo sauce is something worth trying.
If their food doesn’t capture your desire, maybe their pint club promotions will. Take a journey down their “on tap” selection as you make your way to one of the stylish swag rewards.
The staff has and remains one of the reasons I continue to come back. They are friendly and makes everyone feel like a local/regular.
They will be loosing one of their greatest treasure, Nancy.
Come by tonight to wish her well on the next chapter of her journey. 9/21; Our kind of place! The girls are sweet and I love the corsets! The food was great bar food. We'll be back for sure.; I am a foodie and very critical on service and they knocked it out the park; for a pub you can tell the owner really put time into the menu. In addition to that the Bartenders and the cook was super awesome and friendly

It is a local type feel with some pool tables in the back if you have a group, highly recommend checking it out if you’re in town

And I do see some negative reviews here, but if you don’t tip at all and are a regular then I’m sure you will get poor service, how else are they going to make money? TIP your bartenders!!!; Please is that spot downtown Gulfport. My buddy Terry M love this spot and I’m understanding why.. shout-out to the staff: Sharon, Tori, Shelley, Shevy, Savannah, Nancy and Raegan!; We started with the half order of nachos during the game to warm up. After that we built our own $5 burger. I explained the Tom Collins to Sharon P and she did a fabulous job at it. Beware that it is a smoking establishment so be ready for that to happen as you eat.

Name: Eight 75
Address: Beau Rivage Resort & Casino, 875 Beach Blvd, Biloxi, MS 39530, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Tuesday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Wednesday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Thursday: 3:00 PM – 1:00 AM; Friday: 3:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: Closed; Sunday: 12:00 PM – 1:00 AM
Vicinity: Beau Rivage Resort & Casino, 875 Beach Boulevard, Biloxi
Address Components: Beau Rivage Resort & Casino (point_of_interest); 875 (street_number); Beach Boulevard (route); Biloxi (locality); Harrison County (administrative_area_level_2); Mississippi (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 39530 (postal_code); 4241 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
One of the most popular spots inside Beau Rivage, great music, hip atmosphere, good service IF you seat by the bar .

From our personal experience , if you sit at the bar, you can order drinks very fairly quickly, however, if you sit by one of the tables, the waitress can come to you with a bit delay especially and that wait time prolongs when they’re busy.

They have great selection of drinks, and bartenders make delicious handcrafted cocktails.
Definitely recommend .; This spot was cool, right off the casino floor. Strange that the waitresses kinda ignored us but it was still a cool spot. Live music was really good.; Loved this little bar! Bartenders were awesome! We had such a great time meeting others around this little oval, made fast friends. It was standing room only every night, the band was very good!; We had a group of 8 that came in looking for a good time.  Our waitress, Brianna Keys, went above and beyond to ensure we had all that we needed,  even when we were those annoying people separating the bill out into 5 separate checks. She was so welcoming and friendly and made the night enjoyable. The drinks are amazing as well.; Really like the atmosphere here—dope spot with good drinks and music.

Name: Ground Zero Blues Club Biloxi & Restaurant
Address: 814 Howard Ave, Biloxi, MS 39530, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Thursday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 11:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Saturday: 10:00 AM – 11:00 PM; Sunday: 10:00 AM – 2:00 PM
Address Components: 814 (street_number); Howard Avenue (route); Biloxi (locality); Harrison County (administrative_area_level_2); Mississippi (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 39530 (postal_code); 4110 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Wonderful establishment. The greeter at the door was extremely hospitable. Kylie was our waitress,  she was patient with my wife and I since it was our first time here.  My wife had the Morgan Special. It was delicious.  I had the GZBC. I am not exaggerating when I say it is the best burger I have had in 2024.  The “young’s fries” were delicious also. When it was time for the bill, Kylie let me know that military get 20% off there bill.  This is also a great venue for blues performances.  Best outing so far this year.; We went to see The Petty Things and sat in the general admission section downstairs. Photos include views of the stage (some visual obstruction) and the bar on each side.  There is a large screen overhead so that shows what's on stage, plus a few monitors behind each bar.  No bad seat downstairs. The drinks were great and service was good. Bathrooms were clean, a/c was great. We didn't get any food. There wasn't really any "standing room" - everyone was given a seat and mostly stayed sitting during the show.

I peeked upstairs at 3rd floor. Would be great to hang out, but there is very limited viewing of the stage. There were a few games and tables up there.; Absolutely incredible venue, always hosting amazing live music! The staff are fantastic, and we had an amazing time there. Definitely the place to be to catch amazing live bands, artists and to simply unwind for a bit!; What a great venue where GZ brings the blues to Biloxi.  The interior has an underground vibe that really helps set the mood.  We enjoyed the meal and drinks along with the live entertainment.; First time patron coming here for dinner. Did not know there would be a cover charge to enter but was informed there was live performer tonight. A great place to come if you like to hear live music. Great atmosphere. My wife and I sat at the high tables. I ordered a hamburger with fries. Can’t recall the name of the burger but it was cooked to my specifications and the patty was thick. My wife had the Cajun hot wings. As an appetizer, we had the homemade potato chips.
I like the vibe in the building. Will certainly return again soon. I did take a few photos. The lighting  inside the restaurant was dim.

Name: Razzoo Bar & Patio
Address: 511 Bourbon St, New Orleans, LA 70130, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Tuesday: 3:00 PM – 4:00 AM; Wednesday: 3:00 PM – 4:00 AM; Thursday: 3:00 PM – 4:00 AM; Friday: 12:00 PM – 5:00 AM; Saturday: 12:00 PM – 5:00 AM; Sunday: 12:00 PM – 4:00 AM
Address Components: 511 (street_number); Bourbon Street (route); French Quarter (neighborhood); New Orleans (locality); Orleans Parish (administrative_area_level_2); Louisiana (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 70130 (postal_code); 2105 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
My girlfriend and i spent 4 days in New Orleans and this spot was absolutely one of the highlights. The atmosphere was so phenomenal, service was great and all staff members seemed happy to have us coming in. We went back to back nights and the live bands were both spectacular. Drinks were good and not overpriced and the location was perfect right in the middle of bourbon street. Highly recommend to anyone visiting! Shout out to the MC the 15th and 16th, we loved her energy and she keeps the crowd involved and dancing while the live bands take a break!; Razzoo offers an endearing bar and nightclub experience just off Bourbon Street, with a large dance floor, complemented by great music that creates an inviting atmosphere. If you're in the area, this is one place you'll want to checkout.; We had a blast at Razzoo while we were in NOLA! Happy Hour is a great deal - buy 1 get 2 free on beers/seltzers. Music selection was great and DJs/Hype ppl were fantastic! We like the energy so much, we went back three times while we were there!; I always party here when I'm on bourbon street, the MC is hilarious and keeps the crowd hyped. Diverse crowd and music. Drinks moderately priced.; We took a quick trip to New Orleans recently and had to visit the world famous Razzoo’s. It did not disappoint, and we made a point to stop by all for days of our trip!

The vibe is awesome. Drinks are strong. Staff is super friendly and fun. Courtyard is amazing. We saw why so many people recommended this place to us.

We can’t wait to be back and check it out again!

Name: Dragon's Den
Address: 435 Esplanade Ave, New Orleans, LA 70116, USA
Address Components: 435 (street_number); Esplanade Avenue (route); Marigny (neighborhood); New Orleans (locality); Orleans Parish (administrative_area_level_2); Louisiana (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 70116 (postal_code); 2014 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
Dragons Den is dance club it's not a restaurant n they only serve oysters, wings, fries, chicken in the backyard of the club
Enjoyed the hookah in the backyard of the club n they serve food there so u can't bring in any food from outside. They also sell other merchandise like the creative socks that have cartoon characters on them n bracelets n jewelry in the yard; Nice bar, but it's very humid and hot so expect to sweat A LOT. The bathrooms need work, or at least locks, twice I've been exposed when using the bathroom.  Other than that, it's a nice atmosphere upstairs and downstairs, the balcony is small though (do whatever you will with that info).; Cool comedy shows and local comedians Friday and Saturday nights. Dive bar vibe of the best kind. Friendly people.; Funky jazz lounge, burlesque club, stand up comedy, dance club, and open mic all in 1! Early evenings it's a chill little spot for soulful jazz music with smooth & strong rum drinks. Nina the bartender is the coolest! She knows our drinks as soon as we walk in, super friendly & makes you feel at home. A little later in the night, they kick off an incredible burlesque show upstairs Talk Nerdy To Me. $20 well spent, it's a must see!! Sometimes they're serving up wings in the courtyard too, which are amazing. Late nights this place transforms again into a club. They've got something for everyone here! No cover early when you come for the bands downstairs. Such a good vibe here, don't pass it up!; The Atmosphere was on point. Everyone was relaxed having a good time. This Dj know how can keep the party vibe going and know how to slow it down with just the right song. And Dj can play some MK11 and Street fighter. Anime/Gaming night on Sunday will most definitely going again.

Name: The Pub Sports Bar
Address: 3254 Mallett Rd A, D'Iberville, MS 39540, USA

Reviews:
This location should be a fly club....but...the "owners" think that a buffet, a salon , and what ever else is there.....makes them wealthy...we have all -that-we-can eat around here.... maybe a nice place that provides music... drinks.... atmosphere.... IDK...it could be better.; Really enjoyed karaoke, DJ  D ray was great. Great music. Great time. Fun place to dance. Angela the Bartender was Amazing! Great smile..warm hearted. Great place. FUN!; The bouncers were the best. Friendly and on point. I felt safer than in other establishments.; I like to go here when I visit the area. So far, all the food I've had had been great. The wings rank up there with some of the best wings I've had, and I don't say that lightly. I just had the alligator sausage, and I would definitely get it again.

My only critique is how dark they keep in there. I get it, it's a sports pub, but I could barely see the menu.; We went for the 4th to the karaoke night and yes we enjoyed our self drinks were great and food was nice also

Address: 100 N Jeff Davis Ave, Long Beach, MS 39560, USA

Reviews: Just can’t say how much fun we had on a Monday night!! Thanks MJ… you have an amazing establishment 🍻🥃”Cheers! Here’s to originality “; Cool place - the bartender was very nice, good affordable food - I'll be going back to watch some football.; My 3 stars are for the bartenders and the tacos (Tuesday only), NOT for the owner. He is rude to customers. After 8 pm is definitely for the 20 something crowd.; One of the BEST spots in Long Beach! Great place to chill, meet people, and grab a good bite to eat. I recommend the captains mast sauce! House made spicy BBQ. 🔥; This is cool spot. Lively on weekends and surprisingly lively midweek. Even when I don't go in during the week I ride my bike past it all the time (usually after 9pm) and it's often pretty lively. A big plus is that it's in a decent spot with quick access to hwy 90 if you're coming from Gulfport or bay st Louis. The draft beer is crisp (they clean their lines & taps) and the is solid. The only thing is that it seems like it's mostly couples that go there which is good in one way and not so good in another way.

Name: Maison Bourbon
Address: 641 Bourbon St, New Orleans, LA 70130, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Thursday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM; Friday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 11:00 AM – 1:00 AM
Address Components: 641 (street_number); Bourbon Street (route); French Quarter (neighborhood); New Orleans (locality); Orleans Parish (administrative_area_level_2); Louisiana (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 70130 (postal_code)
Reviews:
When we decided to have our destination wedding in New Orleans, we knew we wanted something on Bourbon to give our guests the true party experience. When we met with Jeanne and the team at Maison Bourbon (Vieux Carre Venues), we were so excited about the possibilities! The venue has a balcony facing the best and most lively intersection of Bourbon St. and is such a gorgeous space. We rented both rooms - one above Maison Bourbon which is adjoined with the one above MyBar@365. We had our wedding catered and our guests are still raving about the selection of food. We highly recommend the brisket and the oysters!
There was so much comfortable seating and they allowed us bring in our own beads to toss from the balcony. There were clean restrooms, two full bars, and the ambiance was spectacular! We are so thankful to get to work with Jeanne as our coordinator - she is truly the sweetest and most patient person! We had so many questions along the way and their team never hesitated to get right back to us with details. Don't sleep on this venue! It's affordable and truly worth the experience!; Visited in early March. We were wandering down Bourbon Street heading for a different bar but came across this place. What a revelation!

It appeared fairly quiet, but had a great jazz band playing, and felt really authentic.

The beer was excellent and the barman kept things flowing, including the jokes. Also, had a great Sazerac.

We took in the atmosphere and were entranced by the music.

Would definitely recommend a visit, and would love to go back again.; What a wonderful place to hear some good jazz music in New Orleans and amazing cocktails. Loved the ambience. They don’t serve food. One of the best places in French Quarters.; A lovely place to hear jazz on Bourbon St. We walked past the bar and stood at the window to listen to the band. The next evening we stopped in, sat at the bar and had a quick drink as we enjoyed the band. Definitely worth sitting down on the comfy chairs for good jazz; If you want to try voodoo  Daiquiris and listened to live Jazz at the same time you can't go wrong with this place.

I felt Daiquiris wasn't really my favourite I really liked the bar and the Jazz. Super fun and what a vibe.

I met a waitress that she turned out to be super friendly and I didn't have a chance to know her name but all best for her to visit my country and do Thai massage as she wished. She told me about how strong Daiquiris could be.

Great vibe and great music I'm sure their drink were also good I wished I tried hurricane instead lol.

Recommended jazz bar on bourbon Street.

Name: Cinemark Gulfport 16
Address: 15171 Crossroads Pkwy, Gulfport, MS 39503, USA
Address Components: 15171 (street_number); Crossroads Parkway (route); Gulfport (locality); Harrison County (administrative_area_level_2); Mississippi (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 39503 (postal_code)
Reviews:
First off..I LOVED the movie “Am I Racist?” It’s obvious that this theater is biased and wanted to sabotage Matt Walsh’s movie (along with so many theaters in the country).
During the movie, they kept cutting the sound and making it difficult to hear. They also had NO movie poster for this film while every other movie had its poster displayed. This theater couldn’t even bother to correctly spell the title of the movie.
0/5 stars for this theater.
5/5 stars for this movie.
Well done, MATT WALSH!!! THE GRIFT IS UP!!!!; Chairs are very comfy. Picture and volume were excellent. Prices for admission and food are way too expensive,  but that has come to be the norm at all theaters.; I wish I could give zero stars.
Very unpleasant experience at Cinemark Gulfport today. I haven’t been in a while because other theaters seem newer and better but decided to give them another chance. I regret it. The smell inside is comparable to stinky feet. The ledges that are in between each row are nearly impossible to see over for kids and short people. I am 4’10 and couldn’t recline my seat or I couldn’t see. The 3 kids with me had to sit on their feet to see. The theater was so hot as well. Pretty uncomfortable for even my 5 year old who complained of being hot.
Lastly, their menu is very deceptive. I’ve attached a picture for reference. I asked multiple people and all agreed that if you buy a large drink (fountain or icee) you get free refills. I was denied refills because it’s “sodas only”. Although it does not specify. I even spoke with the manager and pointed out how deceptive the menu was and she refused to make it right.

I’ve been a patron of premiere Lux theater in Biloxi and the comparison is mind blowing. Free refills on ALL drinks and popcorn. Clean and smells nice. They have tables at the chairs and no ledges that obscure the view.
It is a much better option and worth the extra drive.; I love going to this location cause it's clean has nice workers and the seats are comfortably. I went again today and watched it ends with us. That movie was amazing. Food is expensive but tasty.; I went to watch the new "Twisters", and overall, it was decent. The movie was great, but the theater wasn't cleaned from the previous movie. There was a lot of trash and things scattered around. At least my seat didn't have any trash. The seats were pretty comfy, and they reclined.

Name: Funky 544
Address: 544 Bourbon St, New Orleans, LA 70130, USA
Address Components: 544 (street_number); Bourbon Street (route); French Quarter (neighborhood); New Orleans (locality); Orleans Parish (administrative_area_level_2); Louisiana (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 70130 (postal_code); 2106 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews:
I had a great time good vibes and great music. There wasn’t a cover charge. I came in on an R&B night. Drinks here were a bit more than other places I had went to throughout the night.; We had a wonderful time at this club. We happen to stumble upon it as we were walking down the street checking out all the things to be seen in New Orleans! We stopped in here for probably about two hours and we were thoroughly entertained by the All-Star band! And their name is very benefiting because those young folks performed their behinds off! That was the best time I’ve had in a long time!

They played everything from Chaka Khan to Whitney Houston to the Jackson 5 to the gap band to Jill Scott to Erykah Badu to NEO. Very nicely done!!!!; Awesome music and good service. Had good time. No pushy bar tenders or arrogant bouncers. The crowd was also good. Restrooms were also clean.

**they charge convenience fee on the credit card usage.
**most drinks are priced around $14; Good cover band strong drinks. This unapologetically a disco down disco ball.  It ‘s not too crowded  a little room to dance. If you go you should dance; Comfortable place with a great vibe. Live band, crowd, bartender, and even the bathroom attendant were all great. Hurricane I had here was the best tasting I had while visiting New Orleans.

We did not experience the overcharging mentioned in other reviews. In fact I liked how the bartender handled pricing. The music is so loud inside, the bartender rang up drinks on the register so I could see the amount before paying, which I always did with cash.

If there is a negative on this place it would be the very loud music volume.

Name: Buoys Bar
Address: 115 S Beach Blvd, Bay St Louis, MS 39520, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 4:00 – 10:00 PM; Friday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 12:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 12:00 – 7:00 PM

Reviews:
Absolutely stunning views!  Great food, great service.  It was pretty quiet when I stopped in, but I will definitely be back.  Much nicer staff than at the Blind Tiger, that's for sure.; Nice breeze & view. Good vibe. Can't speak to food, just stopped in for a  couple of drinks. Laid back crowd of locals on a Sunday afternoon. We'll be back!; Awesome cheeseburger and cheese fries sitting on the porch with a wonderful breeze coming off the ocean.  Hell yes I will have another. Great food and service with a great location and view.; I was going to take a picture of the burger, but I ate it all.

Hands down it was the best burger I've had in a while. My son had the new Jersey cheese balls and those were amazing as well. Highly recommend this place. The upstairs is a bar with great views of the gulf.; Very casual beach bar right by the tracks. Great views, be sure to find the stairs and go up too. Awesome staff and surprisingly good food. The burgers are freshly made and the garlic fries might knock your socks off. Nice beer and wine selection, fun bartender too. We'll be back!

Name: Blue Nile
Address: 532 Frenchmen St, New Orleans, LA 70116, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 PM – 12:30 AM; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: 9:00 PM – 12:30 AM; Thursday: 8:00 PM – 3:00 AM; Friday: 8:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 8:00 PM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 8:00 PM – 12:30 AM
Address Components: 532 (street_number); Frenchmen Street (route); Marigny (neighborhood); New Orleans (locality); Orleans Parish (administrative_area_level_2); Louisiana (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 70116 (postal_code); 2024 (postal_code_suffix)
Reviews: The Blue Nile is such a cool place inside and out that it immediately grabs your attention. The minute you walk in the door it feels like you're in an amazing creative space and it's al out magical. The band that was there when I visited was a relatively large brass band and the sound was great. Their sound guy is top notch. The drinks are expertly crafted and delicious and the staff was attentive and quick.; This place was off the chain!! My cousin and I were in search of hearing some great jazz music before leaving town, and this place delivered! The spot may be small, but it provided a more intimate setting. When the music started playing, it took that funky chill vibe to another level! They have a great drink selection as well, so between the libations and music, the mood is just right. I'd recommend coming here to listen to any musician, have a drink and a great time!; Went on the earlier end, so I imagine it gets busier and more lively as the night goes on - but even at 9:30/10pm, the band playing were great. Energetic and played a variety of hits, jazz style. The place was buzzing even with a smaller crowd. Drinks were decent and inexpensive.; This place is great with nice atmosphere and gets crowded over the weekend. I would recommend if you visit New Orleans.; I really dig the Blue Nile on Frenchmens street. It's a standing venue with a lot of good acts. This time, I saw Irvin Mayfield with an assortment of other characters including; Cyrille Neville, Kermit Ruffins, Jamal Batiste and others, plus a 6 person choir singing backup vocals from the audience. Quite the unique experience. Only in NOLA.

Name: Bourbon Heat
Address: 711 Bourbon St, New Orleans, LA 70116, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Thursday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 11:00 AM – 4:00 AM; Saturday: 11:00 AM – 4:00 AM; Sunday: 11:00 AM – 4:00 AM
Address Components: 711 (street_number); Bourbon Street (route); French Quarter (neighborhood); New Orleans (locality); Orleans Parish (administrative_area_level_2); Louisiana (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 70116 (postal_code)
Reviews: This was our go to spot this week. Most evening had good music ,great atmosphere  in the courtyard. Wonderful service, friendly staff. Just the best Bourbon Street atmosphere. Reasonable prices . Recommend boudin egg rolls, sweet potato biscuit and cheesecake; The po boy was excellent. Great recommendation from the server. Shrimp tasted fresh, and the portion was very good if you are hungry. I also loved the French fries. Live music was playing and also the outdoor patio was very nice. Beers were cold and service was great. Definitely willing to go back and take coworkers with me.; If you're looking for authentic Nawlins food and atmosphere, this is the place. The gumbo and red beans and rice are phenomenal! Haven't been to the city in 24 years and haven't had either of those dishes anywhere else that could compare! Thank you for the nostalgia and the great food!; We really enjoy the atmosphere and dinner time Mike  at the door was awesome !the bathrooms were clean and the music was what drawn us in from down the block! Plus you can’t forget the 2 for one drinks and bang bang shrimp happy hour it was very hot so we sat outside in the misters it was a very relaxing stop! Definitely worth the stop great conversation with Mike and other patrons smoking patios. Make your way to burbon Heat on bourbon st . if you are in the French quarter it doesn’t matter if it’s night or day. But dinner time mike was awesome and informative.; Stopped here to eat with my wife while walking on bourbon street and we really enjoyed the company of the bartender Nikki who is such a beautiful girl she has us laughing the whole time plus she makes the best bloody Mary’s we also the tacos and gumbo which we both enjoyed. The band included a saxophone player who was really blowing so the music was a vibe. Def a cool daytime spot we will be back

Name: Adventures Pub & Spirits
Address: 132 Lameuse St, Biloxi, MS 39530, USA
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Thursday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Friday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Saturday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM; Sunday: 11:00 AM – 2:00 AM
Address Components: 132 (street_number); Lameuse Street (route); Biloxi (locality); Harrison County (administrative_area_level_2); Mississippi (administrative_area_level_1); United States (country); 39530 (postal_code)
Reviews:
The minute she came up to take our order she had an attitude. Look I understand we all have things going on in our lives but I have never treated or have been treated like our server treated us that night. There were four of us and she didn’t put one of the others Poo-boy sandwich order in so he had to wait, we all waited till he got his food to eat which means it was all cold. Her service to the customer will kill any business!!! Price could be a little cheaper for what you get; One of our favorites when we go to Biloxi. We’ve gone several times, and we’re always pleased. Be careful with what you order because some items are enough for two people. Chicken skins were a big hit with my boyfriend. On our visits,
We’ve tried shrimp po boy, quesadillas, and burgers. Everything is always delicious! Check them out the next time you’re in town.; Fun bar atmosphere. Our 1st meal of the day…all good. Bloody Mary was ok.  Service great.  We got there when they opened the doors 4th of July, its was packed 15 minutes later. God Bless the USA.; I went here based on a bartender's recommendation (from Beau Rivage).  He made sure to warn me about the cigarette smoke.
I went around late lunch time on a Monday, so there wasn't that many people in there.  I sat at the bar, and even though a couple of people were smoking, I wasn't bad at all (no worse than any of the casinos).  I think timing has to do with everything.  I can see when this place is packed, that it's probably smoke filled.  They also have an outdoor patio
Service was outstanding.  The bar staff were friendly and welcoming.  The food is outta control. You wouldn't think it when you walk in, but I wish I lived nearby to try the massive menu.
I got the The "Ultimate" Oyster Po-Boy sandwich with a side of fries.  I was starving, and I couldn't finish it.  I also don't think I've ever had bacon on a po boy and it worked so well.
The bread was super soft and fresh, the oysters tasted fresh, the bacon was quality and the fried green tomatoes were delicious.  On top of that, the fries were excellent (and I consider myself a fry snob).  Everything that was fried tasted like fresh oil to me.  I made sure to finish all the good stuff (oysters/tomatoes).  The quantity is unbelievable.
Grab some cold drinks and have an awesome meal at this local/dive bar.  You won't be disappointed.  I suggest lunch/afternoon to avoid the crowds and cigarette smoke.; Excellent fast service. Great game day or late night atmosphere. The New Orleans oysters are amazing!!! Also had the Chicken Philly and it was spot on in flavor! We will definitely be back here!

Reviews: They didn't have as extensive of a yarn section as I seem to remember. Since that was the only reason I was here, they did not have what I needed.; There is plenty of parking, the store is clean and neat, and the staff is very helpful. Have a great selection of craft items for everyone to choose from; Always nice and clean and employee's are helpful. Manager Calvin Is great; Well kept store with pleasant staff; I love coming to this store. The employees are helpful and the store is always clean. My son likes doing the art class on Saturdays and the classroom helper is always enjoyable. They let me know when the summer camp is starting so we can come in for crafts.

Name: Noches Latinas

Reviews: It’s needs to be bigger; I'm out for a walk in Montgomery, and one of my worst outings was this Latin nights.👎 the customer service was super bad, after 10 minutes sitting I had to ask for a drink and if we're talking about prices😂 pay for a beer at can $7 dollars haha. Watch live artists.; Very good environment

Name: Workman's Lounge
Address: 809 34th St Suite C, Gulfport, MS 39501, USA

Name: El Pretexto
Address: Road 715, Cayey, 00736, Puerto Rico
Address Components: Road 715 (route); Cayey (locality); Cercadillo (administrative_area_level_2); Cayey (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00736 (postal_code)
Reviews: We had a wonderful four course  meal last night.  The food as well as the dinner plates were all locally sourced.  The location has a magnificent sunset view.  The owner is working hard in the PR economy to promote a sustainable food system.; We joined El Pretexto for our honeymoon. It was amazing! We had a room with a heated pool with gorgeous views of the mountains. The room was clean, comfortable, and cozy. Crystal was able to accommodate my dietary restrictions. We felt completely safe and were well taken care of. She planned a massage, yoga class, and meditation class for us. We learned a lot about Puerto Rico and their food systems and culture. Local renowned chefs gave us lessons on their cuisine which included bbq, seafood, desserts, sofrito, and much more. We were not the only ones on the food experience. We were joined by 2 other lovely couples. By the end of the trip, we felt like one big family. It was bittersweet to end our journey because Crystal made us all feel like a part of her family. If you are looking for a unique experience in Puerto Rico where you can learn about their food and culture outside of touristy attractions then I highly recommend this. We came out of this experience with so much knowledge and inspiration.; So when you first walk in, you recognize that you found a gem. And even with the place so beautiful, that is not what makes the experience. It’s Crystal, the most gracious, friendly, and warm host that I have ever met. She and the community that she has created, has made this the most incredible memory and by far, the best place we have ever stayed in Puerto Rico. If you are thinking about staying here, look no further, you have found the piece of paradise that you are looking for. Be sure to embrace every add on, such as the amazing dinner, and a massage. If you’re with your sweetheart, ask for the couples massage!; The chef, the owner, they could not be nicer people. The food was stunningly good, a perfect compliment to the views of the Puerto Rican sunset behind the misty mountains. If you get the chance to stay here, do not hesitate.; I really enjoyed my stay at El Pretexto! From the moment I  arrived i felt welcomed. The farm to table food was unlike anything i have tasted before.  It was a dream come true for a foodie like me. Being surrounded by nature was just what i needed to disconnect for a little bit. Spending time with Crystal felt like i was visiting an old friend. You can tell she really cares about making sure you have a memorable stay. Amazing experience overall! 💖

Reviews: At Frappe Artesanal in Cayey, the papaya smoothie, or frappe de papaya, is a delightful treat that combines freshness with speed. Served freshly prepared, it embodies the essence of tropical goodness. The smoothie's texture is smooth and velvety, highlighting the natural sweetness of ripe papaya. Its refreshing taste provides a burst of fruity flavor that is both satisfying and rejuvenating, making it a perfect choice for a quick and healthy beverage option. Ideal for warm days or anytime you crave a tropical escape, the frappe de papaya is a must-try for smoothie enthusiasts and fruit lovers alike.; Always quick and delicious. All flavors are wonderful, and the customer service is friendly. My favorite frappe spot in all PR.; Nice place with easy access.  Good diversity of products and friendly staff.  I will go back and try other frappes.  Prices just on the upper side.; No other frappe taste like what you'll purchase here. Good prices and fast service. 😂😂😂😁😁😁🌹🌹🌹♥♥♥💙💙💙; First time & love it. Reviews: This business definitely came from left field. It certainly is a whole in the wall and took me by surprise at how good the food and service is. Owned by local brother (Jonathan) and his sister whom serve the community by providing breakfast along with coffee. The prices are reasonably amazing for the quality of food along with their coffees. The place is small but has plenty of seats and give a taste of a modern coffee shop. I ordered the salmon with avocado toast, which left me impressed and full. Businesses like these are what I feel are helping Cayey prosper and become a hidden gem. I would highly recommend trying out this shop and enjiy the food with atmosphere.; Local is the best coffee in Cayey. We visit from Connecticut every few months to visit family in town and every morning we are here, Local is the first place we stop at. The coffee is absolutely amazing, the atmosphere is great, the owners and baristas are so nice and welcoming. It has truly been a pleasure finding this place, nothing compares.; Best Ceremonial Grade Matcha Latte 🍵 in Puerto Rico so far 🇵🇷 Customer service is top notch 💯 Cozy environment, WiFi, charging 🔌 plugs 💻, great side food! Coffee is from Puerto Rico and top quality. If you want a proper coffee or matcha (ceremonial grade), this is the spot.; Loved this coffee shop. Drinks were very good, the staff was great and enjoyed the breakfast options. Check it out!; The bread with the sandwiches at Local is absolutely incredible. We had the Caprese, Arugula Avacado toast, and the Ham and Cheese. Everything was fantastic from drinks to food to atmosphere. Highly recommend making a stop here if you are in the area.

Reviews: Every time I come to Puerto Rico I try to visit . Nice atmosphere very friendly owners. Price not bad . Just sit smoke your cigar and drink your whiskey and relax.; So far so good! Cayey is really flourishing and becoming more metropolitan. This little gem in the town is helping in that. I say little because the place is small but that's not a bad thing. Think cozy. With plenty of seating,   a room with a variety of cigars to purchase, and an assortment of liquors and wines. They offer outdoor seating and a lounge area in the back. Name: Cavalo Club Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu
Address: Guaynabo barrio-pueblo, Guaynabo 00969, Puerto Rico
Address Components: Guaynabo barrio-pueblo (sublocality_level_1); Guaynabo (locality); Guaynabo (administrative_area_level_2); Guaynabo (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00969 (postal_code)
Reviews:
During our stay in Puerto Rico, We visited Cavalo Club. My daughter enjoyed training in this academy. We recommend this place for anyone wanting to try BJJ. Thanks for allowing us to come and train :); Came once for open mat, I'm white belt, coach did a mir lock and before I could even reach my arm popped I was out for 3 months, and my arm took forever to fully recover to be able to even throw a ball.

Obviously don't think he did it on purpose but I don't really think it was necessary or good judgment to crank a mir lock on a beginner, first time in the gym, either against a black belt.

Especially Mir lock is known to be a dirty move and can easily injure someone. Essentially the mir lock threshold from pain to tearing a ligament is very close, so before I even felt pain my ligament tore.

First time I've been injured like this and I was sparring 3x a week for a long time so it isn't just random. This was like a year ago. I left three stars because it wasn't intentional but I wouldn't expect the black belt coach to do that when I've been sparring with plenty of other purple, brown and black belts without issues.; Great group of guys.   Very welcoming with a nice and spacious mat.  Weight room and wait room.  High level people and high level jiu jitsu.; This place is awesome. Professor Gabriel has extensive knowledge in Brazilian Jiujitsu and is a great teacher! I recommend this place to everyone.; Excellent & gracious group of guys for a brand new white belt that shows up to open mat. Much gratitude.

They can easily crush me, but they hold back.

Reviews: Great welcoming place, and great shows, but at least when I went they had a very very small selection of drinks, mostly two. Not for the weak spirited.; Open place for every soul, no critics, multicultural space, veeeery lay back place. Retro hipster artsy space. Bar and outdoor stage. Some days they play movies and it'll be 2am and the whole thing can be heard from a mile away. Contacted them and gave them ideas to make sure they don't make that amount of noise so late at night and left on read.; Dirty place, dirty floors, dirty seats, dirty bar. The restrooms are a disaster, broken toilet, broken sink, piss on the floor. There are homeless people outside (and sometimes inside) that ask you for cigarettes or money. Drinks are okay, but given the cleanliness of this place I would stick to canned beers. I would rate it 0 stars, but sometimes they bring nice local DJs and bands. Also the patio is not as bad as inside.

Exercise?? I thought you said extra fries 🍟

Highlights:
• Good Drinks

Review: This Bar was super! The ambiance was great, the bartenders were awesome and the food was tasty. We started off with an empanadilla de carne frita which was good had a nice flaky crust and the carne was tender. Then the super wings with a side of bbq sauce were nice and crunchy with added tanginess from the sauce. Finally the star of the show were the fully loaded fries and they don’t skimp on the toppings. These were cheesy loaded with beef and chicken. I can’t wait to go back and try their other food options.

Rating: 8/10
Fully Loaded Fries
Empanadilla de carne frita
Super Wings; Great place to hang out with friends and have something to eat. Will definitely visit again.; Found this place on Yelp while looking for a place to watch the Patriots vs Dolphins game (my Pats squished the fiah 43-0).  Showed up and found an awesome superhero-themed bar with great service, fun atmosphere, and lots of TVs.  The food was great and the service was amazing. They made me feel so welcomed and felt like a regular by the time I walked out. Best sports bar I have been to... definitely be coming back for all my football needs.; The outside doesnt look great but this place is a hidden gem. Good rock music

Reviews:
Came here on a Tuesday night during pandemic. Curfew was reinstated so the establishment had to close by 9pm. This place had great music. A mixture of hip hop, reggae, and reggaeton. Drinks are affordable. Hookahs are $20. The only con was the service when we first arrived. My group stood at door waiting for a staff member to acknowledge and seat us. Two staff members walked by. Finally I went to the bar and asked what was going on. The bartender explained that patrons come to bar n order hookah n drinks. It would have been nice if staff informed us of this especially because we were waiting by the entrance looking lost and confused. But in all this place has potential; My group wound up at this little place just trying to find something fun to do and we ended up meeting some great people and just talking and having a blast. Thanks for making our night out memorable!; My 1st time visiting this establishment and they are very nice… bryan have been a great host & the prices are awesome. Music is nice and the hookah was good. Overall a great experience and i will continue to come back here. Excellent 1st experience glad i found this place.. oh and the open bar was the perfect thing!!!; Went at 12am on a Wednesday and they were closed but their hours said open until 2am. Please update hours.

Update: Thank you for updating your hours after this review I made. No need to gaslight. Good luck to you all; After trying to find a lit place for me and my girlfriends to hang out we came across this place on Google maps. Super fun, we got a table and hookah, had drinks and danced. Exactly what we were looking for with good music. We had a rental car might be hard to find with taxi

Reviews:
Awesome staff!! Kudos to all of them because they do as much as they can to manage the orders at the bar... but the owner need to do a LOT bettet to reorganize the operation at the bar. The owner is losing money because when it's crowded, the staff can't keep up with the volume of orders and the amount of people they have to manage when its crowded. Specially when they are having a special event. I overheard someone laughing while saying, that he ordered three rounds and they billed him only one. They need to do much better to speed up the lines to order and pay when its packed. I don't know how often it gets crowded, but if it's often, then they are losing money big time. I could have spent 3 times what I spent if I didn't had to spend 20min in line to order a round of drinks. I hope if their management sees this review, they take it as a constructive review rather than a negative one. Despite all this, I would visit again!!

Don't take me wrong, I had a great time with my friends, we had a lot of fun, met great people, the atmosphere was great! I'm looking forward to see positive improvements next time!!; Okay this was a total stop and go! But it was a great one! Very rarely does a bartender actually acknowledge you, so you know to wait because they are busy. This may not seem like a big deal, but think about ... how many times have you waited at a bar wondering if they've noticed you?? This place is great. The vibe, the staff, the music. They had a dj!  Just come here. I'm about that night life. If you are too, then stop by! And just so you know... some pictures that show up are not this place. But don't let that change your mind. It's a whole vibe here!; Friendly and chill environment in a local bar.
Enjoy bomba music on Mondays.

* Licor bar

* Area to sit an relax
** Private parking lot available; If you want to chill and have a good time during the week this is the place to be. Great service by all the employees. They treat you like royalty. Reviews:
Super cool place to hang out. It's a small & the drinks are great if not slightly expensive for some beverages.

Staff was attentive and nice.

Their Kawaii drink was cute and tasty! ( wish they would sell the cups though- it would make more sense of the price for the drink)

Def would go again just to hang out with friends so we could show off this novelty bar for fun.; Anime inspired bar. The anime named drinks are great and about your typical $10/$12 like any bar. Arcade games are available. Wednesday OnlyJams gets poppin starting at 9. I love the booth sections. Yes there is loud music, you’re coming to drink at a bar, not just to watch anime like you’re at home. Ran by Cobra Arcade management.

A lot of people in the reviews upset that it’s not super “anime authentic” here. I’m really not sure what more they expected out of a bar. This is pretty much a bar that just so happens to be anime inspired. To a normie that’s not super into anime, it was great and good enough for me!; If I could give this place a zero I would. My cousin and I waited 20 minutes to used the restroom. When we got in there was no toilet paper. I alone stepped out to get napkins. The security was on a power trip and refused to let me inside accused me of short cutting. I went to give my cousin the napkins who was still in the waiting and he slammed the bathroom door open in front of everyone and forced us to get out. She could have been naked in there thank goodness she wasn’t or we’d be pressing charges.; Came here with a couple of friends in June. It's a lot of fun - Great music/dancing, drinks, and the environment is really cool with all of the anime pictures. Definitely will be coming back soon! Only downside is the Dance Floor is kind of small.; I'v been here twice on a Wednesday because of my friends, which also happens to be there better night's if you like hip-hop & r&b but recently I went late about 11pm as usual and there was a line a normal but no one was barely inside or on the patio.

I'v seen cobra packed through out the night, out to the patio with no problem on latin night's. This place has obviously got a stereo type towards one race (black people), especially on a night where you get to hear good music.

I only gave it 1 star for the music. The location is small and wear your worst shoes because the floor is filled with drinks.

I only write this because this is something I only noticed in a place like Scottsdale that's why I stopped going. but now starting to see downtown.

If your looking for a place you will be accepted and still play great music I know much better establishments.

If you want to enjoy security staff that judges you at the door especially the short white security guard with the long scruffy black and white beard who acts like it's his first day on the job. Well Hi-Score is your place.

I hope to return and have different experience. Be better Hi-Score it's literally the name and I gave you a 1 star.

Reviews: Took my daughter to a concert. The lay out is horrible for a show its jam packed and you will just be pushed into anything around you. There's absolutely no air they were spraying water into the crowd trying to cool it down which just made it more humid to the point it felt like a steam room. Charging 11 dollars for 2 water bottles and then ended up having to throw some out to the crowd cause how hot it was. People passing out n throwing up. Can't get to the bathrooms cause it's thru the crowd. Do not recommend they shouldn't be allowed to hold shows here not a good floor plan, too hot and seriously lacking security didn't even check our tickets or check people for weapons. Won't return here; Went here for my birthday and got bottle the platinum bottle service. We were promised 3 bottles, 2 house champagne bottles, and a round of shots for the price we paid. When we asked for our champagne bottles the server said we weren't there on time which was a lie since we did not get charged coverage at the door and had to be there before 11pm to secure our table. We never got the 2 extra bottles we were promised even after all the money we spent. Very disappointed, she said she would "ask" but got nowhere. Not one person mentioned we had to be there at a specific time to get the extra 2 champagne bottles and even If so we were there on time and had paid the platinum package fee. Also it was dead, not what is used to be.; The security services are terribly unwelcoming! They treat people like cattle. I paid and got in at 11 pm, took a call outside 11:40pm and got denied entry back by the security. I don’t drink, so the denial was based on their judgement; A very bad crowd enjoys this place. A lot of wanna he’s and drug dealers!  Definitely not a place you would ever want your kids to go.  I know for a fact that at times they let in underage girls as well.; The atmosphere and lighting is nice, entrance is nice and parking is close to door. Security sometimes will not be the nicest especially at big events

Reviews: Post remodel darkstar is the vibe ✨️ I love this place. Affordable shows and affordable drinks. I enjoy the lounge set up.  Staff is always good and service is too.; Wouldn’t recommend the bollywood night parties here! No clue of the DJ until 10 PM, for the night that was supposed to start at 9 PM! When asked, the staff mentions that they are missing a few cables! Lol! Funny people! Not gonna recommend this to anyone ever atleast if you are looking forward to any such bollywood parties!; This place hosts some pretty hardcore artists and expects you to just stand and nod your head. If moshpits are your thing do not go you will get arrested. I’m not sure why they’d allow hardcore artists to play where moshpits are expected then heavily police the floor and kick anyone who gets remotely rowdy out of the venue. I suggest they stick to hosting house music.; This place has declined significantly. The way they handle patrons is not professional. Security shows disdain for both men and women. For example, a friend who is neurodivergent was expelled because she "looked" inebriated. She was denied the opportunity to assert herself. There were other people who were denied before entry. How do you judge the appearance of people before allowing them to enter? I can attest; there were definitely a mix of people in line who appeared sober and also drunk. Yet they denied many people in line. I don’t wish anything bad on this establishment, but I simply wish everyone who decides to spend their money on them would be treated with more dignity.; Please save your money and go to literally any other venue. Staff here is so uptight and rude for no reason (besides bartenders they’re nice). They act like it’s some exclusive cool place when they actually have local djs and a lame lighting setup. Won’t ever be back.

Reviews:
Plays Spanish Oldies every Sunday from 12pm to 6pm.  A place for us old folks to hang out.; Very nice with nice and respectful people, I loved dancing with Carmen; The place was very spacious and comfortable...but very dirty inside and out. In addition, I had the bad experience that I booked it for my son's wedding with a signed contract paid in full.
I found out that on the same day as the wedding, the administrator decided to do an activity at 1 pm and the wedding was at 3 pm. When I arrived at 12 to bring the cake, the entire place was filled with the smell of food and grease. because they were also frying fried foods for their activity. In addition to that, he locked the refrigerator so that I wouldn't use it because he had another activity on Sunday and had already placed his drinks there, a refrigerator that he had offered when the contract was signed, I had to buy more ice and use refrigerators. of
Beach for my activity. When my wedding guests began to arrive at 3 pm, there were still people from their activity waiting for bacalaitos and others and not only that they used the cutlery and disposable cups that I had left for the dinner of my activity, without my consent for their sales. . Finally, after a week when we showed up to pick up the deposit of $200, the Administrator, Mr. Damian, assured us that we had taken all the utensils they used to serve and therefore he did not want to deliver them. We never use the utensils because the catering person brought his own utensils and also two ladles and some tongs do not cost $200... In short, this has been the worst experience in terms of renting a venue, a total disaster....The Mr. Damian, administrator of Apama, is a charlatan and lacks respect, with no professionalism.; YOU DANCE YOU HAVE FUN A LOT OF GOOD SAFETY!!!; Excellent!!!

Reviews: Food, drinks, local neighborhood atmosphere, and convenience store. One of my favorite places, as I drive by in PR (Cuz I was raised close by) Once they stared the food on weekends, wow!!! Pastelillos (puffed pastries with cheese, meat or chicken)BEST Alcapurias (a local fried appetizer or meal… made of a combination of potatoes-root-like, plantain and stuffed with ground beef, plain or crab meat) and many other goodies. Great bar, not expensive, nice seating area, horse racing bet area, casino machines, mini-market, great bathroom and more! This is not a restaurant, but a neighborhood heaven 🙏😎🌴🇵🇷💕; The person named Javier behind the bar goes beyond the call of duty he is very attentive and courteous goes out of his way on recommendations in drinks and thing to munch o while we were there he also speaks English very well we are Americans from Colorado and disided to stop here. We have been repeatedly stopping here and His customer service is 2nd to none. To the owners of this establishment you have areal jewel in Javier there. Thank you for making us feel welcomed to your establishment.; As local and real as it gets. The employees and customers were all so friendly, like one big family. The food, delicious! If you are in San Juan or Carolina, definitely consider El Punto 8!; Great Place to visit if you touring PR. Bartenders speak English.; Ask for "la gorda" on Thursday Friday &Saturday for the best alcapurrias & bacalaitos around

Reviews:
Positive comments:
Good food and the beers very cold.
Negative comments:
1- The music to high, you can’t even talk, you have to scream.
2- Watch out when you order because if they serve you what you didn’t order the manager wants you to take it and pay for the mistake of the waiter. Something incredibly absurd and unrespectful.
Manager should work in a Kiosk in Piñones.
3- When you order with plantains you only receive 3.
4- Unfortunately for them friends and me will not go again, unless the owner makes changes.; Come to watch good soccer!; The drinks are inexpensive compared to other places nearby, the staff are friendly, but what really sets this place apart, is the food, excellent local food for   not much money.  I really enjoy their fish tacos, and there chuleta kan kan (fried thick pork chop).   You can walk in, order food to go,  and sit back and relax with a drink while you wait for your food. Or eat there and enjoy the music or watch the game on the big screen. Note the only drawback, is during prime time, parking can be a little bit of a challenge.; I totally love grabbing a delicious lunch at this place! I’m obsessed with their chicharrones de pollo! So juicy and yet so crispy and perfectly seasoned 🤤

It’s clean, comfortable and the waitstaff are awesome. I would give them 20 ⭐️ if I could!!; My server was so nice and down to earth. Stuffed Mofongo slapped too
