Easy access from the highway 22, exit Rio Hondo (carretera 167) towards Bayamon Pueblo (left after exiting highway) and make a left on Calle Dr Veve (about 10 minutes in)...La Turreria will be immediately on you right hand (see their picture for reference).; Great.; Great place to have a good cigar and a drink; The town of Bayamon continues to surprise me more and more. We went to La Turriria and had a great time, wide selection of cigars, good selection of drinks and excellent service.  Parking is on the street but it is safe since the police are constantly patrolling and not to give you fines but for the safety of the good people who patronize and visit the town. If you are looking for a place for a good cigar, sit back and enjoy it, this is the spot.

Reviews:
This Sam's location is always packed, from the parking lot and inside the store you can't even walk around with the kart.  People in Puerto Rico always complain about don't have money, but you can't go to any big stores IT'S ALWAYS PACKED!!
Now about the store! It's clean,  organized but do not have most of the products I was looking for.; This is the last time I will ever enter this Sams. One of the worst on the island 👎🏽Every time I go to this sam,there is always something that goes wrong ALWAYS 😑 Well today was a nightmare. As soon as we found parking, Almost every parking space had a cart 😖 so we kept moving back and forth until we parked. Then when we reach in front of the entrance, guess what? No carts 😅🤣😡😤because half was in the parking lots and others was inside with costumers! So we got in pick up very few things Because we have No cart😗Lines was the worst I've ever seen ....Very slow service Horrible,even in self check out..
Then after getting whatever...I saw there was a spare cart by an employee and asked if I can have the cart,which She did responded In a passive aggressive way...NO MI AMOR YO NECESITO BLA BLA BLA....I Walked away 😒 I was so unsatisfied, it was her Stupid way of respond it was ugly. Can't stand messy employees. Sam please get more employees to help clean up the parking area,it was horrible fill with carts everywhere! And the one employee I ask for help was just rude. Not only that....it began to rain 😅🤣😭😫😿The Exit WAS BLOCKED,  and there a employee SCREAMING...GET OUT OF THE WAY....THE FIRE DEPARTMENT DOESN'T ALLOW ANYONE TO BLOCK EXIT. It was So bad....almost everyone didn't wanted to get wet...which I understand....But me and my family prefer to get wet in the rain than stay in that chaos 😒 We walked out with the products in our hands everything got WET...it would be easier if I had a cart 🙄 could of cover my sh*t with the boxes 📦 at least 😒 So that was today...horrible experience.; Everything is good in the store although they do not have a variety of products. You have to go to other Sam's. but when I arrive at the exit we are required to show the receipt to the employee. The three pretty employees chatting made me wait more than 5 minutes for them to decide to serve me.; I love this Sam's club. They have a very well controlled environment with regards to the COVID pandemic. The staff is always nice and friendly. However, they don't always have all the products available, and it takes a long time to receive them. For example I been waiting for mora then 2 weeks on strawberries and an air mattress. Their chicken asada is delicious 😋.; This store needs training on what customer service means and on how to treat customers. They lack the correct attitude. The good thing is this is not a store I frequently buy at.

Address Components: 167 (street_number); Expreso Río Hondo (route); Hato Tejas (sublocality_level_1); Bayamón (locality); Hato Tejas (administrative_area_level_2); Bayamón (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00961 (postal_code)
Reviews:
This place is awful, they promised one thing but never delivered. I ordered balloons for my wife’s birthday party at a restaurant and I was told they would close at 9:00 PM. They decided to close at 7:00 PM and claimed that they had called me to let me know. I had no cell signal since I was running around with the birthday set up details but arrived at the store at 7:30 PM to find that the store was closed and no arrangements were made to provide the service I had already paid for. The next day I showed up asking for a refund and a very nasty manager told me she didn’t have to help me in any way since the store policy covers her. Never buy anything here. The staff is highly insolent and arrogant, with the worst manners and store policies. PartyCity is much better, they helped me out in the end.; Double 5 Party Store.
I will never buy from this store again. On my birthday I ordered some pumps and paid for them as their policy requires. They would be ready that same day at night. Before leaving this store we asked what time they closed, they told us 9pm.
When we went to pick up the bombs the place was closed, it was 7:30pm.
It should be noted that before arriving at the Río Hondo mall, we called this store more than 10 times, without success.
Anyway, they didn't give me the service. The next day I called demanding my money back to which they responded with a TERRIBLE ATTITUDE “we can't do anything, we'll call you”
I never received their call and they didn't leave a message either. Their solution was to give me a loan that expired in a month.
I do not recommend this place. Better go to Party City, which was the one who solved it for us these days.; Excellent, there are many things for activities; Good assortment; Super attention I recommend

Reviews:
I recently had the pleasure of visiting Nyorklounge, and I must say, it exceeded all my expectations. From the moment I stepped through the door, I was greeted with energy and professionalism. The ambiance was very queer friendly, with elegant decor and comfortable seating.

The selection of drinks was impressive, ranging from classic cocktails to unique craft creations. The bartender Yanielys was  passionate, offering recommendations tailored to my taste preferences. Each drink was expertly crafted, bursting with flavor and made with high-quality ingredients.

The attention to detail at Nyorklounge is unparalleled. The staff goes above and beyond to ensure every patron feels valued and taken care of. Whether you’re a regular or a first-time visitor.

Overall, my experience at Nyorklounge was nothing short of exceptional. The combination of impeccable service, delicious drinks, make it a five-star establishment in every sense of the word. I can’t wait to return and create more wonderful memories at this hidden gem.; The place is not bad, but the security guard today 7/24/2024 is a very disrespectful and aggressive person with customers. If you want to be safe on the island, this is not the place. I tried to talk to a manager but no one is available. In Puerto Rico there are other places, not this one, nobody knows what could happen to you.; Great spot love the fact that it’s an open minded environment 🌈; Excellent service from the bartenders and a calm atmosphere. The best to hang out with friends and have drinks and shots.;

Can’t say enough good things about this pool and the people working there! Stunning views and service. Enwil and Wilfredo went above and beyond to offer an incredible experience. Fabio was a huge help in helping us make our reservation. Yerek was constantly checking it to make sure our time went well.
Other perks, they provide SPF 50 sunscreen and aloe.; Best pool in Puerto Rico with incredible food and drinks that are very reasonably priced for the area. The customer service is what really separates this place from others. Enwil, Eric, Maria, and Wilfredo really made it some memorable days. Fantastic DJ on the weekend really provided an unbelievable experience.; I ordered 2 burgers to go one for me one for my daughter and this what they gave me. It was so disrespectful. To give someone a bun looking like this is crazy. I paid almost 70 dollars and tipped them 20 dollars. All this for 2 burgers is ridiculous. Ima make sure I get thru wiru thr manager cause this was a slap to the face. For a person to make a burger and give someone it looking like this is crazy.; The ✨BEST✨ bartenders are Pedro and Eric! Customer service was above and beyond! Amazing service, great drinks, and even better views!; Please know the bartenders are rude.  He literally yelled ARE YOU AMERICAN because gratuity is not included. Well last time I checked gratuity isn’t guaranteed either if you are rude.
Disappointing.
We had asked what was included with the day pass prior to purchase  and the person I spoke with made it seem like it was more than just the pools and chairs. It felt a little like a bait and switch.
Just an FYI for any “American” tourists.

Name: Torres Place
Address: José M. Tartak Ave, Carolina, 00979, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM; Friday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 12:00 – 8:00 PM
Address Components: José M. Tartak Avenue (route); Cangrejo Arriba (sublocality_level_1); Carolina (locality); Cangrejo Arriba (administrative_area_level_2); Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00979 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Came by for Alambique next door, but it has been mysteriously closed for a year. This is a tiny place with a few food options and a decently sized drink menu. Fish tacos were pretty good. Beer is beer. I did not care for my wife’s Cucumber Collins. Service was friendly enough, if not particularly quick. Were not offered menus. Prices as expected. Beautiful view of the beach across the street. Nice and refreshingly breezy.; If you’re on Carolina Beach, this is the perfect place to grab a small bite. The price is so cheap compared to surrounding places but the dishes are fulfilling. The limited menu packs a punch of flavor! 💥

I ordered two PORK TACOS with a side of BASIC NACHOS. The tacos were simple, pulled pork with a drizzle of cilantro lime sauce and pico de gallo. The pork was tender but dry, while the sauce helped - the bite felt like it was missing something.

The nachos were my favorite I’ve had on the island. Most would think the cheese makes nachos the best, but the cilantro lime sauce was certainly the star here. With a heap of pico de gallo and fresh cilantro, the flavors on these fresh crispy nachos was out of this world. I loved it.

If you order either item, get extra cilantro sauce and add something spicy…like a hot sauce or salsa. I definitely recommend this little spot for any meal on the beach. Small, quaint and absolutely delicious.; This place is fire!! After 8 years we had the chance to spend the Holidays back in our home Puerto Rico. We told the staff about our visit and they were so excited that they gave us free shots of Pitorro( Puerto rican moonshine) and we all had a toast to celebrate. If you want super cold beers, Vodka with freshly squeezed grapefruit juice, freat food and friendly staff......this is the place!!!; it’s really cute place, but unfortunately not food. nachos aren’t good.; Layed back! Cool. An outdoor/ indoor bar/restaurant. A must, for the tourist. Very lively and breezy. Good food, and strong, yet tasty drinks! Salsa music playing in the background. Large screen T.V.'s for you Sports fans. Excellent collection of Salsa legends! Inviting decor. Handicap parking and entrance. Kids are always welcome! The waitresses are bilingual and friendly! Will be back!☘🇵🇷

Name: Gallístico Club of Puerto Rico

Puerto Rico needs to do better!; Moral corruption at the highest level. The brutality of having animals KILL one another for sport…is barbaric, but to want to watch them die and BET on it? Puerto Rico must not be very Catholic outside of “talk” then because the Saints don’t smile on this behavior.; Cleaner than expected. People were very friendly. Not very many people spoke English, so that was a challenge to learn the rules. Very interesting place. Was skeptical at first. Felt very safe when my wife and I went inside. Definitely an experience but not for the soft hearted. My wife was amazed but at the same time she was not a fan. I wouldn't go again as a tourist, however I recommend it if you are interested in learning the different traditions of other cultures.

Sketch crowd at night, they do serve hookah and have pool tables though. If that’s what your looking for by the beach. I recommend management to extend their video cloud storage. Someone used my credit card at this place and I was not able to get the photo 👎🏽
Crime pays here I guess.; Fun spot to hang out and play pool. The music was good and the people were nice. Would recommend.; Great experience when coming or visiting Puerto Rico!!!!! A must go tourist point.; Great place to play and listening to music. The drinks options are limited.; Great place to enjoy some pool and the service is awesome!

Name: San Juan Water and Beach Club Hotel
Address: 2 José M. Tartak Ave, Carolina, 00979, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: Open 24 hours; Tuesday: Open 24 hours; Wednesday: Open 24 hours; Thursday: Open 24 hours; Friday: Open 24 hours; Saturday: Open 24 hours; Sunday: Open 24 hours
Address Components: 2 (street_number); José M. Tartak Avenue (route); Cangrejo Arriba (sublocality_level_1); Carolina (locality); Cangrejo Arriba (administrative_area_level_2); Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00979 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Amazing place to stay.  We literally had 0 issues during our week stay there. One elevator was still out of order but really never waited more than a minute or two to get up to our room on 8 floor. Fernando was awesome and helps us several times with bookings for excursions and just places to go in the mountains. Valet was spot on every time we needed it. This is rare for me but I really have not one thing negative to say about our experience there. Was absolutely perfect!!!; I can't talk highly enough about the staff and the professionalism at this hotel. It blew my expectations. You get beach towels and a beach chair included with your stay and the beach is literally right across the street from the hotel. The rooms are amazing, newly upgraded, beautiful shower in the room. The rooftop bar is a nice touch as well as the pool. Even though there was construction going on, I still would highly recommend this stay here. It's in a perfect location and walking distance from downtown. That also has restaurants and bars right near.; Worst experience I’ve ever had at a hotel.

1) there is construction going on. It is LOUD. They did not disclose this and lied about when/where it was taking place on inquiry.
2) there is a problem with THEFT. My rescue medications were stolen from our room.
3) I filed a report with the hotel regarding the above. When I called to request a copy (needed this to fill my script), they REFUSED. The manager was supposed to call me back, but she didn’t bother.

Pros: they did move us to a different room after problem #1, that was nice. Unfortunately this does not outweigh the price of ER visits and doctors visits I’ve incurred since the happened.

We will never go back. I’m usually the go-to for advice on going to PR among my friends and colleagues. I will be sure to advise them not to stay at this hotel.; Been here 4 times starting in 2009 was a great experience. Has went down hill every time. Room were designed terribly. Huge showers no counter space, edges of the bed stuck out cut my leg on them twice. Restaurant on the roof had no help decent food, way expensive construction noise almost non stop. Love Puerto Rico but if we decide to return it will have to be somewhere else.; The hotel was nice! Housekeeping was great "Carmen". The smell was pleasant, the sheets were high quality, the only hiccup was the shower ran cold on Multiple occasions, the issue was resolved  after a few calls downstairs but....getting out the shower to make the call ....ahh! Other than that....amazing!

Name: Karaya
Address: 5961 Av. Isla Verde, Carolina, 00979, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 5961 (street_number); Avenida Isla Verde (route); Cangrejo Arriba (sublocality_level_1); Carolina (locality); Cangrejo Arriba (administrative_area_level_2); Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00979 (postal_code)
Reviews:
The restaurant is located at the hotel lobby, has inside and outside area, it looks very nice and clean. The ambient is nice as well, you could just sit and enjoy the view.
Food was very tasty and presentation of it was very modern and good looking.
Happy hour is 5-7pm and the choices are not big but anything you choose is gonna be good.
Good place to hang out at hotel after checking out.; Joel was amazing. He was incredibly helpful and took care of us the entire time of our stay. He was the best waiter we’ve ever had. Food was also delightful. Highly recommend.; Honestly, I just had the best snapper I’ve ever had. The seasoning was amazing, it was fried perfectly and came with the perfect sides. A snapper enjoyed is always eaten with the fingers and lemons. When nothing else but bones is left at the end you demolished it. And it’s huge. Very impressive size. Not photos unfortunately.
We had a couple of other items that were good too. The atmosphere on the patio was very nice. Run here if you like snapper.; The bartenders in the hotel bar are well trained, some are mixologists and  show a lot of talent for on the fly drink creations. I struggled with the menu, it was a short list of cocktails but the service was good, attentive and vocal about closing time as well as last call for food and drinks. Honestly 15-20$ a drink is what knocked the star off for me simply because the bar is in the middle of the lobby with no real ambiance to make it feel worth the high prices.; I stayed at the Royal Sonesta the last week of November 2022. The food at this restaurant, which is located in the hotel lobby, was awful and VERY expensive. I spent $30 on a 1/2 quesadilla that did not have any aromatics, seasonings, or herbs of any kind to give it flavor. It was just cheddar cheese and bland chicken in a store bought tortilla. It was so bad, I could not swallow it. I complained, and it took the restaurant manager about 30 minutes to come speak with me. She refused to provide a refund and instead gave me another horrible dish. This time, it was hotsauce and chicken on a store-bought piece of Flatbread. It was supposed to be a Buffalo Bleu cheese chicken Flatbread, but the "cheese" was nonexistant. It was just drizzled white sauce with no seasoning. Of course I didn't bother complaining again, so I just starved the first night and never returned.  There is no good restaurant off property nearby, so I don't recommend staying at this hotel. If you are only looking for a nice pool, it could work for you, but realize the rooms are also pretty worn and in need of renovation as well. There isn't much that is "Royal" about the Sonesta properties. Also, note that wi-fi isn't free there, unless you sign up for their marketing scam associated with it.

Name: ORO HOOKAH LOUNGE—CIGAR
Address: 5940 Av. Isla Verde, Carolina, 00979, Puerto Rico
Address Components: 5940 (street_number); Avenida Isla Verde (route); Cangrejo Arriba (sublocality_level_1); Carolina (locality); Cangrejo Arriba (administrative_area_level_2); Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00979 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Horrible customer service!! Bartenders only service VIP people and ignore you all night until they serve the VIP! I kid you not on May 24 on the hour of 4am, 2 people started arguing/fighting and one of them pulled out a gun! He shot one bullet and everyone started screaming and running from the place! Security is a joke and they let people in with guns inside! They have a good DJ but place stinks of weed and just filled with people of the hood who think they are better than everyone willing to cause trouble over anything stupid. 1 star for this place. Not for tourist to visit.; The is one of the worst “hookah bars” I’ve been to. They advertised they opened at 8pm just to get there and the doors are locked lights off. We called and they told us they opened at 10. We get there there the staff greets us we asked for every service basically. We asked for music the girl plays music off her phone. We then asked for hookah only for them to have only 2 hookah flavors. I asked for a strawberry margarita and the girl gave me a vodka and cranberry like wth. The dj finally came an hour later and he was really good the only good thing about this bar actually. After settling in we were kicked out of a booth which happened to be VIP I guess because someone wanted to buy a bottle. Waste of time and horrible service overall. Would not recommend this “hookah” bar at all.; Nice atmosphere but they were colorist against black Americans 😔…. Racism is real in the US but colorism is realer here in Puerto Rico be warned. They’ll like you more when you tip. I was there two nights in a row and it was the same, DJ told me VIP was closed but when his friends came he let them in, he could of said VIP is for more than 2 ppl but instead he lied and said it was closed. Not angry but disappointed because puertoricans are blacks, and since being here for a week I’ve witnessed a lot of discrimination against ppl of color. Do better.; Y’all!! Women, carry your own toilet paper/wipes. I went to the toilet, no toilet paper, no soap to wash your hands after. When I asked for toilet paper I got handed a bunch of bar napkins. Men’s bathroom has no light.

Pro:
Good music
Affordable drinks; Walked 15 mins to get to this place only for it to be closed even though it said it opened at 9. Stayed at another place until the opening time and walked down after. Gave enough time for them to open and settle and very disappointed.

Name: El Daiquiri Lounge
Address: CA-4, Condominio Saint Tropez, 6267 Av. Isla Verde, Carolina, 00979, Puerto Rico
Vicinity: Condominio Saint Tropez, CA-4, 6267 Avenida Isla Verde, Carolina
Address Components: Condominio Saint Tropez (point_of_interest); 6267 (street_number); Avenida Isla Verde (route); Cangrejo Arriba (sublocality_level_1); Carolina (locality); Cangrejo Arriba (administrative_area_level_2); Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00979 (postal_code)
Reviews:
El Daikirioke Lounge is a Gem. One that shines only for the people who frequently visit. It's nice and safe with acces control, and its hidden, so you gotta do some searching. I've frequented the Daiquiri for some time and Most of the time I visit it, I enjoy listening to at least a couple of amazingly talented singers who enjoy showing off their passion for song. Every so often people celebrate birthdays and Freddy, the barkeep, makes an event of it and everyone gets included in the festivity. So, if music is in your soul and you like the thrill of performing or watching someone blow you away every so often, you might enjoy...; This little bar is fantastic! Freddie, the bartender, who I was told is also the owner is super friendly, hilarious,  and his drinks were mixed just right. The regulars were also very friendly and welcoming. I'm so glad we found this hidden gem and we will definitely be back before our vaca ends; Such a fun place with awesome, funny and welcoming people. Very affordable drinks and both young & older crowd had fun here. The bartender made you feel welcome & like he knew you as soon as you walk in! Definitely recommend.; Freddy is a one-man-show worth checking out. The only thing between you and stiff drinks, friendly (and delightfully sarcastic) service, and karaoke of wildly varying quality is a gate that costs $0 to bypass.

5/5 if you wanna get drunk and sing. 0/5 if you're looking for fine dining lol.; This place is a local gem in San Juan. Only thing is I wish it better advertised.. you have to go through the Gate to get to it but you will be gld you did! Freddy the owner is fun and makes a point to know his customers.  The locals are nice and welcoming.  Left feeling Iike I've know everyone for years. I recommend and will definitely be back when I visit again.

Address: 6981 C. Avenue Boca de Cangrejos, Carolina, 00979, Puerto Rico

Reviews:
Best part of my experience was the pool bar at this hotel they had an excellent wait staff that took good care of us even though there were a large number of people and really only one or two individuals to wait on people. I thought it was worthwhile we came down here every day and never went away thinking that we had anything but good service.; I came here with my boyfriend for the beach and the swim up bar. Everyone was super nice to me EXCEPT for this one older gentleman part of the staff named FERNANDO . I was unaware that I needed to have a bracelet he was super pushy & not nice about it. It felt targeted and he even followed me around. Made me feel super uncomfortable especially because I am a woman of color and didn’t see him act like this to other guest that entered. I’ve been here before never had an experience like this before. Really sucked I even started to cry and the lady at the front desk LENASH  apologized on his behalf as well as the two gentleman who set up my beach chairs. My boyfriend even suggested we should leave but the rest staff were very welcoming and convinced us to stay. I do love this place but had to write a review for FERNANDO’S BEHAVIOR WHICH SHOULDN’T GO UNNOTICED.; Very good.
Unfortunately no music as a wedding was celebrated in the resort...and the bar was not supposed to disturb them...; What can I say. Look at this view😍😍; Very nice Pool Bar immersed  and outside the pool...good drinks...nice Pool.

Name: Global Lounge
Address: CXQW+7FJ, Departures Rd, Carolina, 00979, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 6:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Wednesday: 6:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Thursday: 6:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Friday: 6:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Saturday: 6:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Address Components: CXQW+7FJ (plus_code); Departures Road (route); Cangrejo Arriba (sublocality_level_1); Carolina (locality); Cangrejo Arriba (administrative_area_level_2); Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00979 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Global lounge, San Juan, Puerto Rico
This lounge and I now have an intimate relationship. Thanks to #jetblue we’ve been stuck here for two days. Lost nearly a $1000 in accommodation and transfer fees and very upset with the airline.
But anyway, yesterday we came here thinking we’d only be an hour or two, but it was 6 hours until they closed the doors and chucked everyone out. Which is a pain when at midnight you realise your flight is cancelled and they have to put you up in a hotel. Dehydrated and hungry for a real meal, we were very angry.
The lounge is small. I mean, very small. In one area, there are lovely club chairs but only 10 of them plus a half dozen side tables and a tv which seems to be preprogrammed to mainstream sport or game shows.
There is an area for business with desk space and another seating area which were closed off on our second visit.
The food is blah. Caesar salad the size of a serving for a child or pasta salad, again, not even a half cup full. The beans rice and meatballs were heated in a microwave, which melted the cling wrap onto the meal. Tossed it.
The bar is minimal. The usual drinks but don’t expect a sangria or pina colada. I settled for a gin and tonic or red wine.
Coffee machine looks good and there are plenty of soft drinks or beer.
Only one of the 4 small spaces have a departure board. Frustrating when your delays are coming in every half hour!
Staff aren’t inspired by their job but are generous with the vodka in a Bloody Mary. Woo hoo. Had to stop drinking.
No toilets here which means a 500m walk to the toilets between A2 a A3. Now that is crazy stupid!
Yesterday was crazy busy with so many Jet Blue flights cancelled. No seats and parents with little kids or those in a wheelchair were turned away to suffer at the boarding gate that they’d never get to use.
Abandoned by the lounge, and after four hours being told our flight was cancelled, we gave up.
Will never fly Jet Blue again.
Take me back to the #qantaslounge in Australia please.

#thewanderingreviewer #sanjuanpuertorico #globalloubgepuertorico #globalloungesanjuan #airportlounges; This was a complete mess, starting from the reception desk. I'm not used to this level of service at Priority Pass or any airline lounges. Totally worst lounge I have ever been in. In Europe, this couldn't be called a lounge. The space is furnished with Ikea furniture etc. and everything is a bit messy. Their food was served from pre-packaged meals that looked - well, really anemic. The open side of the airport (accessible to everyone) is cleaner and more comfortable than this.; Access thru AMEX PLAT/priority pass, located right after duty free on the way to international gates.
Very small lounge, was packed when we visited and very uncomfortable tall chairs in a very tight space.
Food and beverages were not self serve, 1/3 servers was very nice and hospitable, the other 2 almost made a face everytime you asked for anything.
Better than waiting at your gate tho ;); This is a very bad lounge. The staff is very nice and professional but the facility itself is too small  and the food selection is small. There are no bathrooms. This is a place to grab a quick bite of you don’t have any restrictions. Not relaxing. Only snack is seasoned peanuts. No crackers chips fruit or cheese. I noticed that they are due to open another location at the other terminal. I hope it gets better; Worst Lounge I have been in the US (territories).  Theres should be a better defined criteria for these lounges.  Service is obviously not free, you pay for it when you travel Business class, First or have access via Priority Pass.  The service was bad, almost nothing to eat and they kicked people out at 20:00.  Cleaning starts before so for the last 30 mins they closed the restrooms.  I had to complaint to get in just because if they close at 20:00 services should be available until 20:00.  I do NOT recommend it.  Unfortunately it seems in SJU you do not have any other option.  If you have limited accesses, save on this one.

Name: ROSADO Coffee
Address: Calle Cuba Libre, Toa Alta, 00953, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:30 AM – 3:00 PM; Tuesday: 8:30 AM – 3:00 PM; Wednesday: 8:30 AM – 3:00 PM; Thursday: 8:30 AM – 3:00 PM; Friday: 8:30 AM – 3:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM; Sunday: 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM
Address Components: Calle Cuba Libre (route); Toa Alta (locality); Contorno (administrative_area_level_2); Toa Alta (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00953 (postal_code)
Reviews:
We came all the way from NYC TO PR just to visit this Amazing place in San Juan. New place trendy and Great atmosphere.  We had such a great experience. We met the owner super nice  place and welcoming. The waitress was super nice. We loved the decor and the food was ALL AMAZINGGGGG…

The menu isnt extensive but the food is delicious and reasonable prices.

The Toa Alta location is also amazing I visited in august 2023.

Cant wait to go back.; Keep in mind that the last few reviews placed by people within the last year showing pictures of this particular place... ARE FAKE and from an entire different location!!!

I got here and is a hole in the wall, shared with a psychiatrist's office... really?!?!.
Is supper small compared to the pictures shared by those called "reviewers."
Please be honest... unless you work here or know someone who does.

My family ordered everything pink on the menu, and to be different looking for protein, I ordered an omelets with meet which cost $17... although this was smaller than my cell phone (when measured from end to end) and about an inch thick. (I got robbed).
Is it acceptable that there's lots of food coloring in every meal and drink, but they should not be cheap on the food.

Those placing fake pictures of this place just to add customer traffic should be reported... this isn't right, and you all know it.

I'll post some Real pics of this place for clarity, transparency, and complete Honesty .

UPDATE:
I paid $120.11 for 2 adults and 2 kids.
For this amount of money, there are lots of better choices out there.

Don't get tricked with fake postings!!!; Quite the interesting little place they got there. Very small, but cozy. I hope you like the color pink, because that is the theme of the place... and the menu. With the exception of the eggs, everything on the menu is pink (or close to it): pancakes, waffles, toast, lattes, etc. Their service is very good and the prices are adequate. So, if you're in the area and breakfast hunting, by all means, give them a try.; The food is good, the service is awesome and the atmosphere is very relaxing. The place is really cute, and have a few beautiful spots for pictures.; LOVED LOVED LOVED this brunch spot! I would recommend putting a reservation PRIOR to going because the place is cozy! But everything about it is SO cute! I loved the food, the staff was super friendly and I was able to get SO many cute pics and videos for my reel. Follow me @ThisLatinaTravels for more details! I shall be back!

Attempted to eat at this location. Arrived and asked if they were serving food as the restaurant side only had 1 couple with baby eating. However, the male staff replied yes, went into the kitchen, started snacking, and never came back out. We waited around 10 minutes, and no one greeted us. Staff was not attentive, nor did they provide any customer service. Was very disappointed with poor service as we were staying within the vicinity and were attempting to get a quick bite. They lost 2 customers. I do not recommend it.; Clean Restrooms Great Service.  Air conditioning.  And Hipódromo There. You can place your bets for the horse races, and watch the TV there as well. They have television's everywhere.  Ice Cold Beers And Drinks. Service is Really Good.  People There Are Very Friendly. The Employees Are Very Attentive And Polite ☺
Have gone there 3 times now since arriving in PR. Definitely Us A Freat Soot To Hang, chill, and have a great time.  With your Other Half, and with family and friends.
Thank you for the Great Service ☺ ♥; Sunday afternoon they have live music (Trios) not for youngsters. Friendly ambiance; Place is ok, have music and karaoke, long wait time if you want to sing a song,  no good customer service, drinks are reasonable.; Nice place. Name: Morena Bistro Bar
Address: 123 Av. Isla Verde Suite 2, Carolina, 00979, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: Closed; Wednesday: Closed; Thursday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Friday: 9:00 AM – 5:00 AM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 12:00 – 5:00 AM, 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM
Address Components: Suite 2 (subpremise); 123 (street_number); Avenida Isla Verde (route); Cangrejo Arriba (sublocality_level_1); Carolina (locality); Cangrejo Arriba (administrative_area_level_2); Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00979 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Excellent dinner. Ample parking in their free lot out front, we were seated immediately. Server was young and professional. Smoked Bourbon Old Fashioned was perfect. As was my wife’s salmon and my Dorado. Nice vegetable side as well. Food was served without much delay. Atmosphere is very pleasant, with nice artwork on the walls. Nice bar as well. Reasonably priced. Clean bathrooms. Music in the background is at the proper volume. People on their phone on speaker were extremely annoying, but that’s on them. Really nice place.; So we booked Bistro Cafe originally but when we saw the wait and the line outside we decided to try Morena Bistro and it is a 10 out of 10 great service really nice space good AC food was great they have the same menu as Any other Bistro. So come here because it’s a ten outta ten and no long lines; Very cool laid back restaurant. I went for brunch. There wasn't anyone else in the restaurant when we arrived so I was a little skeptical about the food. The service was very slow, I understand the culture is laid back, but for us to be the only ones in the restaurant it took a very long time for our coffee to come out and the waiter also forgot one.

The food was delicious! Large portion sizes and lots of flavor. I really enjoyed the pumpkin pancakes! Sweet enough to enjoy without syrup. The French toast was also delicious!!!!!; Today, I had the pleasure of finding Morena Bistro Bar. The food was very good, the drinks, ( both lattes and Mimosas) were amazing!!! The atmosphere was very nice and the service was awesome. Our server, Jahira, was awesome!!! She was very friendly and helpful. She gave us tips on several places to go see during our visit. She even took pics for us in front of the awesome hand painted murals on the wall before we left. I would definitely recommend Morena Bistro Bar to any and everyone. Check it out, you won't be disappointed!!!!; Such a gem! Our server Yahaira was absolutely lovely, and so was our meal. I got the Frutti Nutti (waffles with fruit + nutella + whipped cream), side of bacon and the lavender latte. All soooo yum!! I'm a picky eater and loved everything. Great location with beautiful murals and a convenient full-body mirror by the bathrooms. Large, colorful space with clean bathrooms. Me and my girlfriends loved this spot!

Address: 6471 Av. Isla Verde, Carolina, 00979, Puerto Rico

Address Components: 6471 (street_number); Avenida Isla Verde (route); Cangrejo Arriba (sublocality_level_1); Carolina (locality); Cangrejo Arriba (administrative_area_level_2); Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00979 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Holy F#?!. I’ve been to some bad pool halls but, this was next level. A total cluster f#?!,the felt has never been brushed. There is no full set of billiard balls. The white ball is larger than the set. The balls are super chipped. This is not for serious players. This is a kids place. I don’t recommend this place at all. Sad; Some of the best Mexican food I ever had!!; Great place, but with unpredictable hours.

Update your hours to reflect true hours of operation.

If you're going to serve alcohol, advertise it correctly. NO ONE wants to pay for a taxi just to end up at a closed bar....

Place is not open till 8am; this place looks really cool...however, it is a MAJOR joke. Only 1 (out of like 8 tables) ACTUALLY works. By that, I mean you actually get the RIGHT set of balls. This is not a concern of theirs. When expressing to the sole employee in the place that my table dispensed (2) 6-balls and (2) 13-balls...I was told that this is completely normal, and that the only table with the correct amount of balls was (1) green felt table that they charge $8 an hour to play on. This would be a great place for kids to practice...ya know...if it wasn't also an expensive bar. Why even have them there if they don't function properly? I understand them being reluctant on putting a sign outside that says "ATTN CUSTOMERS: Our tables do not work properly"   If you actually want to play a legitimate game of pool...go to some bar in  Old San Juan. At least their tables actually work.; Great to hang with friends, but the pool tables often more than not have issues. Nonetheless, there's always someone to fix the situation. There's no 'chalk'. There's a bar. Competitive people~ (not so good when youre just trying to have fun, and mess up).

They have at least 9+ pool tables(a $1 per play). Opens till late~ if you're hungry there's a lot of local diners at walking distance!

Parking is a bit meh, but not hard to find!

Reviews: Pool bar in the old Intercontinental, new Royal Sonesta hotel. Sit at the bar, or tables near the bar, or swim up to the bar from the pool and sit on the submerged stools (this is the seating your kids will love). Employees have to work fast but are pretty friendly. Drinks and food are very good, priced high as expected. Sports displayed on the two televisions behind the bar. Charge it all to your room or directly to your credit card. Enjoyable place, especially when a rainstorm passes through (you will be covered..); If you are staying at the Royal Sonesta, this is the hotel swim-up bar. You swim up, they give you a cocktail, and you bill it it to your room. It is exactly as advertised, no more no less.; Drinks are great and the service was quick.; I loved the rich and clean environment. Attentive employees. Relaxing, friendly and comfortable;

Name: Land Shark Bar & Grill
Address: CXQW+6JM, Departures Rd, Carolina, 00979, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM; Tuesday: 11:00 AM – 9:30 PM; Wednesday: 11:00 AM – 9:30 PM; Thursday: 11:00 AM – 9:30 PM; Friday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Saturday: 11:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Sunday: 11:00 AM – 8:00 PM
Address Components: CXQW+6JM (plus_code); Departures Road (route); Cangrejo Arriba (sublocality_level_1); Carolina (locality); Cangrejo Arriba (administrative_area_level_2); Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00979 (postal_code)
Reviews:
It's airport food. Not a lot of options.
While the portions are big it's not the most tasty of meals.
It's pricey because it's in the airport and you are stuck in that terminal.
All other options around are kinda awful too.
Idk the airport just need better options. You'll find people complaining about every place, but at least this place did NOT make me sick so 🤷🏽; Outrageously priced. Just paid $43 including a $5 tip for a cheeseburger meal as shown on the receipt. The quality of the burger is very low quality. The bread was hard and the fries were overcooked. Basically felt like I just got taking advantage of and got robbed..

Now that I'm leaving this review I should have read the reviews before entering but with the rush of the airport he was a little hard. You can tell that the owners or franchise owner or managers do not care about the reviews. There's no answer to any of the bad reviews; We had a 4+ hour layover at SJU and tried a few restaurants here. During our initial attempt to eat here, the dining area was very crowded. We ate at another restaurant and returned here an hour or so later for dessert. The hostess who seated the us was not courteous, nevertheless we ventured in. We ordered the key lime pie and chocolate lava cake. The chocolate lava was paired with vanilla ice cream drizzled with chocolate sauce. My husband did not find the key lime pie appetizing. It’s a great place to have a drink, watch the planes or sports/games on the tv monitor while passing time.; We decided to grab a quick bite at Land Shark, conveniently located within the airport. The ambiance was welcoming and, to our delight, we were seated promptly. Our server, Dariana, was a ray of sunshine - attentive and genuinely friendly, which set a pleasant tone for our meal.

We started with drinks, opting for a rum-based frozen concoction that initially impressed us with its delicious blend. To accompany our drinks, we chose chips with queso and salsa. While the chips were a hit or miss in terms of seasoning, the dips, unfortunately, didn’t live up to our expectations. The salsa was reminiscent of a standard jar variety, and the queso was notably thick and bland.

For our mains, my husband tried the mushroom burger. While the burger’s overall quality was decent, it lacked the essential burst of flavors one would expect; the meat seemed unseasoned, making it rather plain. The fries, however, were a redeeming feature. I went for the Jumbo Crispy Coconut Shrimp, which was a delight. Crusted perfectly with coconut and fried to a golden hue, the shrimp was the highlight of our meal. The fries accompanying it were equally delicious. A minor hiccup occurred with the dipping sauces, as they were out of both sweet pineapple and cocktail sauces, offering ranch instead.

We decided to round off with another round of drinks. Unfortunately, the second experience didn’t match the first. My repeat order felt runny and less flavorful, while the hubby’s new choice was also underwhelming.

While the prices seemed a tad high, we chalked it up to the airport location. Despite the culinary missteps, the excellent service made our experience worthwhile. We would consider returning to Land Shark, perhaps giving other menu items a chance, and hoping for a more consistent experience with the drinks.; I wouldn’t usually care enough about an airport “restaurant” if the food was half decent but I feel compelled to warn people about this place.
I had the greasiest and rankest chips which I wasn’t able to finish as I started to feel sick. I had no time or willingness to confront the waiter about it before my flight so I ate a few and left.
Speaking of the waiter; he was the reason for me to actually write a bad review as he was the most dismissive, inattentive and unkind (borderline rude) person I’ve had to deal with during my stay in beautiful Puerto Rico.
He acted as if he did not want to be there and by extension, made me feel incredibly unwelcomed, had a terrible attitude from the moment I arrived to the hostess stand, to seating me, to me ordering and even paying the bill. I regret having left a tip now.

Every local, regardless of them being in the service industry or not have been the friendliest and loveliest people I have encountered in my many travels, so this being the last interaction I had with a Puertorican before leaving the island leaves a bad taste to what had been an incredible journey so far.

I can’t speak for the rest of the menu as my options were limited so the rest of the dishes may be great but I wouldn’t visit an establishment where I’m treated like this even if it had Michelin stars.

It was AFTER all of this happened that I saw all the other bad reviews so I guess I need to read up before choosing where to eat in the future.

Although I could identify the gentleman by name I have decided not to as I don’t want to potentially have a negative impact on the life of a person who may have just been having a bad day, but I doubt this is the case so I suggest the establishment to have a talk with all of their staff and give them an attitude check.

Best of luck

Reviews: Played a round before boarding a cruise. The course is very nice for a municipal course but also very challenging as the fairways tend to be narrow and water is always around, so play conservatively if you’re a higher handicap like me. The facilities are very good and they have everything a golfer would want. When originally booking, I couldn’t find a course near San Juan that had tee times available before noon on weekends, so I emailed the Pro Shop and they replied promptly with a morning tee time so I could make my evening cruise boarding.; A fairly well-maintained public golf course, the restaurant areas, the activity lounges, and the gazebo are spectacular.; Beautiful view at night, great food and cocktails. Perfect for parties and reunions.; Golf course is in rough shape. Great views of the highway and massive power lines. Rude starter that won’t let you tee off at your tee time unless you are paired so we had to wait for someone to arrive. Way too expensive for what it is. 2 players with rental clubs was $250. Don’t mind paying that for a nice course but laughable for this one.; The food is good, at least for lunch. The prices are reasonable and service is ok. Local food with the expected taste.

Address: M3 Mall 226 Ave. Boundary Urb, Bayamón, 00958, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Tuesday: 5:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Wednesday: 5:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Thursday: 5:00 AM – 10:00 PM; Friday: 5:00 AM – 9:00 PM; Saturday: 9:00 AM – 4:00 PM; Sunday: Closed

Address Components: Juan Sánchez, Bayamón, Puerto Rico (sublocality_level_1); Bayamón (locality); Juan Sánchez (administrative_area_level_2); Bayamón (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00958 (postal_code)
Reviews:
Previously known as World Fitness Club. They have great membership offers that give you access to three complexes (San Juan, Bayamón, Caguas), which for me Bayamón is the best. The customer service is great and the trainers help you when they see you in doubt. Regardless of that, there are multiple reasons why I don’t rate them a 4 or 5 star. First of all, I don’t like their machines. The machines are old and moldy, I struggle every time I try to adjust them and that doesn’t motivate me to go to gym if I’m being honest. The bathrooms in Bayamón don’t have air conditioning so they smell awful every time and the shower water is always cold. In San Juan, parking is always a pain. Never been to Caguas so I can’t comment about it. Overall not a bad gym but it’s not the best. For the membership cost, I’ll say it’s a good deal but again, not the best. It does offer classes but I’ll say they aren’t for beginners. I come from a gym that the ambience felt like family (it closed so that’s why I enrolled in WFC) and I sadly didn’t found that ambience here.; great place to train. the staff is very helpful and have alot of knowledge.; I have been trying to cancel my membership for a year now.
I was a deployed soldier and went to the facility a couple days before departure, but they couldn’t cancel the membership because the manager was not there.
While deployed, I called trying to cancel and they said I could only cancel membership in person
Now that I’m back, I went to the gym but “the manager doesn’t work weekends”
Finally during my last two tries, “the manager is not here right now, come later”

Really easy to sign up and charge your bank account, but horrible options for when you want to cancel.; Nice gym, friendly family environment here.; Having fun here. People are friendly helpful and very professional

Name: J.F. Montalvo
Address: 93HF+33Q, Carretera 3, Carolina, 00987, Puerto Rico
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Tuesday: 5:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Wednesday: 5:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Thursday: 5:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Friday: 5:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Saturday: 5:00 AM – 7:00 PM; Sunday: 6:00 AM – 5:00 PM
Address Components: 93HF+33Q (plus_code); Carretera 3 (route); Carolina (locality); Canovanillas (administrative_area_level_2); Carolina (administrative_area_level_1); Puerto Rico (country); 00987 (postal_code)
Reviews:
First time in one of these stores. I could see myself buying one or two things here like vinegar beer or soy sauce in bulk. Prices are good for some things and average on others. Didn’t expert them to have groceries such as meat, cheese and veggies which was a nice thing. Just make sure you look at the dates and check everything. Saw a pack of salami that was gray brown and definitely not edible anymore.; A very Good variety of products for Stores and home use. So affordable prices. Some employees have to change their mind to customer service.; Decent prices, I did but some items that were in the markdown basket and had the marked down price but they would not honor it so I ended up buy less and paying full price. Other than that is was a decent place to shop you do not need a membership.; This is a bit of a mixed bag situation. I frequent here consistently for work, but my experience is never the same.

There's always one or another product they're missing, service is sometimes great and speedy and other times painfully slow.

As an example, the last time I went the cashier spent more time looking for the price of a single product than actually scanning the rest of the items I was purchasing. The crazy part? This isn't the first time I have the same issue with the exact same product.

Their system seems to rely on each employee having a notebook were they write down the code of items without barcodes (happens a lot if you buy large boxes of things) but if that employee doesn't have it written down they have to ask another, and if that employee doesn't... Well you can see where this goes.

What this ends up creating is a situation where you can be in and out in minutes and others you can be in and out in double that time.

I would honestly rate it higher if they had a better system for handling these situations. The employees are usually very speedy and helpful when not faced with these obstacles, but an antiquated point of sales system won't allow them to provide a more consistent experience.; Think a small Sam's or Costco store. Montalvo has a good variety of products in bulk, and awesome prices. You'll find goods ranging from spices, candies, canned goods, beers and spirits and tons of restaurant style containers.
They also have a meat section, if you want to buy in bulk (although they do offer some loose items).
It's great for making your hurricane prep purchases.

Reviews: Were being coming for almost 2 decades, our kids are big but still we come and have fun. Delicious pizza and drink with refill. Great atmosphere, secure for kids. Traffic on the Main Avenue can be a little hectic during weekdays during rush hour.; Great tasting pizza with unlimited fountain drinks. Lots of games for every age for just one token.; It's dirty broken down bad prizes too expensive at this point just go to D&B; I have been here for 8 years and I have never had problems. The staff is friendly and my daughter always has a great time. Pizza is delicious, my favorite is bacon. There are games for all ages. If there is a problem with a machine such as tokens or tickets, just report them and the employees will help you very kindly. I really recommend it. Children love it and have fun.
